div0.head: *q
div0.entryFree:
*qq, qh=ta, to/, indecl., ninth (later eighth) letter of the Gr. alphabet: as numeral q' = e)nne/a, e)/natos, but q' = 9,000: abbreviation for qa/natos (or a)pe/qane, te/qnhke, qanatwte/on) found in certain Ptolemaic Mss. of Hp., acc. to Gal.17(1).612, cf. Pers.4.13, Mart.7.37, Wessely
Schrifttaf. zur ält.lat.Paläogr.No.8 (ii A.D.), PFay.105 iii 26 (ii A.D.), Dessau Inscr.Lat.Sel.5140, etc.; v. qh=ta.
h)=x-qa, insep. affix in adverbial forms, e.g. e)/nqa.

qa^a/ssw, Ep. form of qa/ssw, used only in pres. and impf.,
sit, lipw\n e(/dos e)/nqa qa/assen Il.9.194, cf. 15.124; ou)de\ e)/oike . . e)n daiti\ qaasse/men Od.3.336, cf. h.Merc.172; met' a)qana/toisi qaa/sseis ib.468.
qabako/n (i.e. qa/vakon）: qako\n h)\ o(moro/n (fort. qa=kon h)\ qro/non), Hsch.
qa/eo [a_], imper. of *qa/omai.
qa_e/omai, Dor. for qhe/omai (Ion. form of qea/omai), Pi.P.8.45: aor. 1 qah/sato Lyr.Adesp.40; imper. qa/hsai Epigr. ap. Phan.Hist.12; cf. ast;qa/omai.

qazo/s, h/, o/n,
seated, Cyr.: qa/zw,
to be seated, Id.
qa/hma [qa_], atos, to/, Dor. for qe/ama （qh/hma）, ai)poliko\n qa/hma Theoc. 1.56, cf. Aus.Ep.10.33.
qa_hto/s, h/, o/n, Dor. for qhhto/s (q. v.).

qairai=os, a, on,
for axles, cu/la Poll.1.253.

qairodu/ths [u^], ou, o(, pl.,
rings through which the reins pass, Hsch.

qairo/s, o(,
pivot of a door or
gate, r(h=ce d' a)p' a)mfote/rous qairou/s Il. 12.459, cf. Q.S.3.27, Agath.1.10.
axle of a chariot, S.Fr. 596. (Perh. for qva^r-
yos, cf. qu/ra.)

qai/+s, i/+dos, h(, a kind of
bandage, Gal.18(1).792.

qa_kaqalpa/s, a/dos, h(,
sitting hen, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.4.22 (fort. qakoq-).

qa_k-ei=on, to/,
seat, IG22.1672.145 (iv B.C.).
qa_k-eu/w, = a)popatw=, Plu.Lyc.20, Artem.1.2.

qa_k-e/w, Ion. and Dor. qwke/w, impf. e)qa/kei Cratin.239: Dor. fut. qwkhsw= Epich.99.1:—
sit, e)n qro/nw| qwke/wn Hdt. 2.173; qwkei=te Sophr.60; a)nwte/rw qakw=n . . *zeu/s A.Pr.315; h(/suxos qakei= S.Aj.325<*> ko/rai qa/koun (impf.) . . h)/|noun te (Herm. qa/kous . . h)/|noun, om. te) E.Hec.1153: c. acc. cogn., qakou=nti pagkratei=s e(/dras
sitting on imperial throne, A.Pr.391; of suppliants, S.OT20, Aj.1173; bw/mios qakei=s E.Heracl.239.

qa_/k-hma, atos, to/,
sitting, esp. as a suppliant, S.OC1160, 1179.
seat, *pano\s -h/mata E.Ion492 (lyr.).

qa_/k-hsis, ews, h(,
means of sitting, seat, prob. in S.OC9.

qa=kos, Ion. and Ep. qw=kos, Ep. also qo/wkos, o(,
seat, chair, *numfe/wn kaloi\ xoroi\ h)de\ qo/wkoi Od.12.318; qew=n d' e)ci/keto qw/kous Il.8.439; qw=koi a)mpausth/rioi
seats for resting, Hdt.1.181, cf. 9.94; kraipno/sutos qa=kos, of the winged car of the Oceanids, A.Pr.282 (anap.); qa=kos *dio/s, of Dodona, ib.831; semnoi\ q., of the palace, Id.Ag.519; ei)s palaio\n qa=kon o)rniqosko/pon i(/zwn, of Teiresias, S.Ant.999; nekroi=si gei/tonas qa/kous e)/xwn E.HF1097; qa/kous qa/ssein Id.Tr.138 (anap.); tw=n q. toi=s presbute/rois u(pani/stasqai Ar.Nu.993; e)kaqh/meqa e)pi\ tw=n q. Aeschin.Socr.2.
chair of office, to\n qa=kon to\n e)mo\n para/dos *sofoklei= threi=n Ar.Ra.1515.
privy, Hp.Epid.7.47,84 (in form qw=kos), Thphr.Char.14.5, Mnesith. ap. Orib.8.38.11. in Hom.,
sitting in council, a council, like boulh/, ou)/te . . a)gorh\ ge/net' ou)/te qo/wkos Od.2.26; e)s qw=kon pro/molon dh/moio/ te fh=min 15.468; qw=ko/nde kaqi/zanon 5.3; e)n qw/kw| kath/menos sitting in
council, Hdt.6.63. (Cf. qa/bakos, qa/ssw.)

qa^la^m-ai=os, on,
shut up, kept at home, gunh/ Ph.2.297.
qa^/la^m-ac, a_kos, o(,= qala^mi/ths, Ar.Ra.1074.
qa^la^/m-euma, atos, to/, = qala/mh, qa/lamos 11, *kourh/twn E.Ba.120 (lyr.), Supp.Epigr.2.461 (pl., i B.C.).

qa^la^m-euto/s, h/, o/n,
hidden in a qa/lamos, qhsauro\s *mousa=n Tim.Pers.245.

qa^la^m-eu/tria, h(,= numfeu/tria,
bridesmaid, Poll.3.41.

qa^la^m-eu/w,
lead into the qa/lamos, i.e.
take to wife, Hld.4.6:—Pass., of women,
to be shut up, kept at home, Aristaenet.2.5;
to be taken to wife, Ph.1.323.

qa^la^/m-h, h(,
lurkingplace, den, lair, poulu/podos qala/mhs e)celkome/noio Od.5.432, cf.Arist.HA 599b15, Numen. ap. Ath.7.315b; of the swlh/n and polypus, Arist.HA 535a17, 549b32; of the
nest of the fish fwli/s, ib.621b9; of the Theban dragon's
den, E.Ph.931 (pl.); of the
cave of Trophonius, Id.Ion 394 (pl.); of the
grave, Id.Supp.980 (anap., pl.); of the
hive or
nest of bees, in pl., AP6.239 (Apollonid.), 9.404 (Antiphil.); cj. in E.Ba.561 (v. qa/lamos 11). of
cavities in the body, Hp.de Arte 10(pl.);
ventricle of the heart, Arist.Somn.Vig.458a17; of
the pores of sponges, Id.HA548a28;
the nostrils, Poll.2.79; au(/th tw=n koiliw=n h( oi(=on q. of the (Galenic) optic
thalamus, Gal.UP16.3; of
recesses in the cranial bones, ib.11.3; of the eye-
socket, Steph.in Hp.1.93D. = qa/lamos 111, Luc. Nav.2.

qa^la^m-hgo/s, o/n, (a)/gw)
carrying qa/lamoi: as Subst., q., o(,
Egyptian house-boat or
barge, Str.17.1.15 (also ploi=on q. POxy.1650.20 (i/ii A.D.); and qalamhgo/s (sc. nau=s), h(, ib.1738.2 (iii A.D.));
state-barge, Callix.1, D.S.1.85; qalamhgo/n, to/, App.Prooem.10.

qa^la^m-hi+a/dhs, ou, o(,
son of the qala/mh or
hole, comic patron. of the tunny, Matro Conv.53.

qa^la^m-h/i+os, h, on （-os, on, A.R.4.1130),
of or
belonging to a qa/lamos,
fit for building one, dou=ra Hes.Op.807.
bridal, eu)nh/ A.R.l.c.; u(/mnos Epigr. ap. Luc.Symp.41.

qa^la^mhpol-e/w,
to be a qalamhpo/los, Sch.Lyc.132.
put to the stud, of animals, Opp.C.1.393.

qa^la^mh/pol-os, h(, (parox.)
attendant in a lady's chamber, waiting-maid, Od.7.8, 23.293; but, = tami/h (cf. qa/lamos 1.2 b), A.Th.359 (lyr.). q., o(, in later Gr.,
eunuch of the bedchamber, Plu.Alex.30, Agath.1.7; of the Galli or
eunuch-priests of Cybele, AP6.220 (Diosc.); but also h(,
a priestess of Cybele, Rhian.67.1. rarely,
bridegroom, S.OT1210 (lyr.). Adj.,
bridal, o)/rfnh Musae.231; epith. of Aphrodite, APl.4.177 (Phil.).
qa^la^m-i/as, ou, o(,= qalami/ths, App.BC5.107, Them.Or.15.195b.

qa^la^m-io/s, a/, o/n (oxyt., Arc.40.13),
of or
belonging to the qa/lamos: an Subst., qalamio/s, o(,= qalami/ths, Th.4.32 (gen. pl., perh. fr. qalami/as), S.Fr.1052 (dub.). qalamia/, Ion. -ih/ (sc. kw/ph), h(,
the oar of the qalami/ths, Ar.Ach.553 (pl.): pl., IG22.1604.55. (sc. o)ph/)
the hole in the ship's side, through which this oar worked, dia\ qalamih=s dielei=n tina to place a man so that his upper half projected through
this hole, Hdt.5.33: metaph., Ar.Pax1232.
qa^la^m-i/s, i/dos, h(, = qalamhpo/los, An.Ox.2.376.

qa^la^m-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, （qa/lamos 111)
one of the rowers on the lowest bench of a trireme, who had the shortest oars and the least pay, Sch.Ar.Ra.1106.

qa^la^m-o/nde, Adv.
to the bed-chamber, Od. 21.8, 22.109,161.

qa^la^mopoio/s, o/n,
preparing the bed-chamber: *qalamopoioi/, name of a play of Aeschylus, Poll.7.122.

qa/la^mos [qa^], o(,
an inner room or
chamber, surrounded by other buildings: freq. in Hom., generally,
women's apartment, inner part of the house, like muxo/s, Il.3.142,174, Od.4.121, etc.: in pl., Il.18.492; e)k tw=n a)ndrew/nwn . . e)s tou\s q. Hdt.1.34.
a special chamber in this part of the house,
bedroom, esp. of the lady of the house, Il.3.423, al., Hdt.1.12, 3.78, Plu.Alc.23; esp.
bride-chamber, Il.11.227, Pi.P.2.33 (pl.), S.Tr.913, E.Hipp.540 (lyr., pl.); also,
bedroom of an unmarried son, Od.1.425, 19.48.
store-room, esp. for valuables, Il.24.191, Od.21.8, X.Oec.9.3, etc.; o)/lbou dioi/gwn qa/lamon E.Fr.285.8. generally,
chamber, room, Od.23.192, POxy. 1144.2 (i/ii A.D.).
house, mansion (not in Hom.), Pi.O.5.13 (pl.), 6.1; basilikoi\ q. E.Ion 486 (lyr.). metaph., o( pagkoi/tas q., of
the grave, S.Ant.804 (anap.); tumbh/rhs q., of the prison of Danae, ib.947 (lyr.); qa/lamoi u(po\ gh=s the
realms below, A.Pers.624; ga=s qa/lamoi E.HF807 (lyr.); q. *persefonei/as Id.Supp.1022 (lyr.); q. *)amfitri/tas, of the sea, S.OT195 (lyr.); polude/ndressin *)olu/mpou qala/mois E.Ba.561 (lyr., qala/mais cj. Barnes); a)rnw=n q.
folds or
pens, Id.Cyc. 57 (lyr.).
the lowest, darkest part of the ship, the hold, Timae. 114, Poll.1.87; cf. qala/mh 11. used of
certain mystic shrines or
chapels, sacred to Apis, Ael.NA11.10, cf. Plin.HN8.185;
the innermost shrine, Luc.Syr.D.31.

qa/lassa [qa^], Att.qa^/la^m-tta IG12.57 (but qa/lassa 22.236（338/7 B.C.)), h(: —
sea, Il.2.294, etc.: freq. of the Mediterranean
sea, h(/de h( q. Hdt.1.1, 185, 4.39, etc.; h( par' h(mi=n q. Pl.Phd.113a; h( q. h( kaq' h(ma=s Plb.1.3.9; h( e)nto\s kai\ k. h(. legome/nh q. Str.2.5.18; h( e)/sw q. Arist.Mu.393b29; h( e)/cw q., of the Ocean, Id.Mete.350a22; h( *)atlantikh\ q. Id.Mu.392b22; h( mega/lh q. Plu.Alex.73; of a
salt lake, Arist.Mete.351a9; e)s qa/lassan th\n tou= *eu)cei/nou po/ntou Hdt.2.33; pe/lagos qala/sshs A.R.2.608; kata\ qa/lassan by
sea, opp. pezh=|, Hdt.5.63; opp. kata\ gh=s, Th.7.28 codd.; kata/ te gh=n kai\ kata\ q. Pl.Mx.241a; xe/rson kai\ q. e)kperw=n A.Eu.240; th=s q. a)nqekte/a e)sti/ one must engage in
maritime affairs, Th.1.93; oi( peri\ th\n q.
sea-faring men, Arist.HA598b24, cf. Pol.1291b20; q. kai\ pu=r kai\ gunh\—tri/ton kako/n Men.Mon.231, cf.264: metaph., kakw=n q
a sea of troubles, A.Th.758 (lyr.); o( *krh\s th\n q. (sc. a)gnoei=), of pretended ignorance, Suid.
sea-water, e)/stw e)n xalkw=| h( q. Hp.Coac.427, cf. Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.3.121d, Moschio ib.5.208a, Plb.16.5.4, Dsc.2.83.
well of salt water, said to be produced by a stroke of
Poseidon's trident, in the Acropolis at Athens, Hdt.8.55; q. *)erexqhi/+s Apollod.3.14.1.
channel, LXX 3 Ki.18.32. xalkh= q.
laver, ib.2 Ki.8.8. q. koi/lh wooden
theatre, Paus.Gr.Fr.208 (= Com.Adesp.864).—For the Lacon. form sa/lassa, v. qalassome/dwn.

qa^lass-ai/glh, h(,
bhang, Cannabis sativa, Plin.HN24.164.

qa^lass-ai=os, a, on, = qala/ssios, di=nai Simon.57.4, cf. Pi.P.2.50: qala/sseios, qea/ Trag. or Com.Adesp. in PLit.Lond.84.16; dub. in Orib.14.62.1.
dyed purple, Tryph.345.

qa^lass-ero/s, o(, a kind of
eyesalve, Gal.12.781, etc.

qa^lass-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
fisherman, Hsch.

qa^lass-eu/w,
to be at sea, nh=es tosou=ton xro/non h)/dh qalasseu/ousai Th.7.12, cf. App.BC1.62; ta\ qalatteu/onta th=s new\s me/rh the parts
under water, Plu.Luc.3.
use nautical expressions, Heraclit.All.5.
qa^lass-i/a, h(, = a)ndro/sakes, Ps.-Dsc.3.133.

qa^lassi/gonos [i^], on,
sea-born, Nonn.D.13.458 (v.l. qalasso-).
qa^lass-i/dios, a, on, = qala/ssios, xw=roi Hdt.4.199.

qa^lass-i/zw,
resemble sea-water, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.3.92a, Dem.Ophth. ap. Aët.7.53; th\n geu=sin Xenocr.60.
wash in sea-water, PHolm.17.2.

qa^la/ss-ios, later Att. qa^la/ss-ttios, a, on, also os, on E.IT236: (qa/lassa):—
of, in, on, or
from the sea, ou)/ sfi q. e)/rga memh/gei Il.2.614; korw=nai ei)na/liai, th=|si/n te q. e)/rga me/mhlen Od.5.67; q. bi/os Archil.51; xe/lus Alc.51; q. a)ne/mwn r(ipai/, klu/dwn, Pi.N.3.59, E.Med.28; *xa/rites Lyr.Adesp.85.11; o( q. [*poseidw=n] Ar.Pl.396; of animals, opp. xersai=a, Hdt.2.123, cf. Pl. Euthd.298d, Arist.HA487a26; pezoi/ te kai\ q. landsmen and
seamen, A.Pers.558 (lyr.); q. e)kri=yai/ tina to thro wone
into the sea, S.OT1411; q. nekro/s, of one drowned, Thgn.1229; ploi=on q.
sea-going vessel, POxy.1288.6 (iv A.D.).
skilled in the sea, nautical, Hdt.7.144; gewrgoi\ kai\ ou) q. Th.1.142.
like the sea, in colour, th=| xro/a| Plu.2.395b; = a(lourgh/s, strw/mata D.S.34/5.2.35. qala/ssiai, ai(, name of certain priestesses at Cyzicus, CIG3657.4.

qa^lass-i/ths [i_] oi)=nos, o(, wine
sunk in the sea, to ripen it, Plin.HN14.78.

qa^lasso-ba^fe/w,
dye purple, Ph.Byz.Mir.2.4 (Pass.).
qa^lasso-ba^fh/s, e/s, gloss on a(lipo/rfuros, Sch.Od.6.53.

qa^lasso-bi/wtos [i^], on,
living on or
by the sea, App.Pun.89:—also qa^lasso/-bi^os, on, Sch.Opp.H.2.1.

qa^lasso-bra^xh/s, e/s,
soaked in brine, Antyll. ap. Orib.8.12.3.

qa^lasso-genh/s, e/s, (gene/sqai)
sea-born, kh/rukes Archestr.Fr.56.7.

qa^lasso-gra/fos [gra^], on,
describing the sea, Tz.H.1.843.

qa^lass-odo-me/trhs, ou, o(,
ship's log, Tz.H.12.977.

qa^lasso-eidh/s, e/s,
like the sea, sea-green, Hp.Vid.Ac.1, Democr. Eph.1, Str.17.1.35; xrw=ma HeroAut.30.6.

qa^lasso/-klustos, on,
dashed by the sea, Sch.Barocc.S.Aj.696 ( = 704 ed. T.Johnson, Oxon. 1705).

qa^lasso-kope/w, (ko/ptw)
strike the sea with the oar, make a splash, metaph.in Ar.Eq.830, Lib.Decl.26.18.

qa^lasso-kra/mbh, h(,
sea-kale, Gp.12.1.1, Gal.6.354.

qa^lasso-kra^te/w,
to be master of the sea, Hdt.3.122, Th.7.48, Plb.1.7.6, Phylarch.1 J.:—Pass.,
to be beaten at sea, Demetr.Com. Vet.2.

qa^lasso-kra^ti/a, h(,
empire of the sea, h( *mi/nw q. Str.1.3.2.

qa^lasso-kra/twr [kra^], oros, o(, h(,
master of the sea, Hdt.5.83, Th.8.63, X.HG1.6.2.

qa^lasso-ma^xe/w,
fight by sea, Vett.Val.354.26.

qa^lasso-ma/xos [ma^], on,
fighting by sea, A.D.Adv.188.26, Vett.Val.18.35.

qa^lasso-me/dwn, ontos, o(,
lord of the sea, Nonn.D.21.95: Lacon. fem. salassome/doisa Alcm. 84.

qa^lasso/-meli, itos, to/,
drink of brine and honey, Dsc.5.12.

qa^lasso-mi^gh/s, e/s,
mixed with sea-water, Hsch. s.v. a(liki/anes.

qa^lasso/-moqos, on,
fighting with the sea, Nonn.D.39.370.

qa^lasso-no/mos,, on,
dwelling in the sea, Emp. 76.1, Nonn.D.37.265.

qa^lasso/-pais, paidos, o(, h(,
child of the sea, Lyc. 892.

qa^lasso/-plagktos, on, (pla/zw)
made to wander o'er the sea, seatost, of ships, A.Pr.467; of a corpse, E.Hec.782:—also qa^lasso-pla/nhtos [pla^], on, Sch.Opp.H.4.582.

qa^lasso/-plhktos, on, (plh/ssw)
sea-beaten, nh=sos A.Pers.307.
qa^lasso/-ploos, on, contr. qa^lasso/-plous, oun, gloss on pontopo/ros, Hsch.

qa^lasso-poio/s, o/n,
sea-making, [du/namis] Porph. ap. Eus. PE3.11.

qa^lasso-pore/w,
traverse the sea, Call.Epigr.59.

qa^lasso-po/ros, on,
sea-faring, AP6.27.7 (Theaet.), 9.376; u(me/naioi Musae.2.
qa^lasso-po/rfu^ros, on, = a(lipo/rfuros, Suid. s.v. a(lourga/, AB379.

qa^lasso/-pra^son, to/,
sea-weed, Ath.Mech.18.5.

qa^lasso/-shmos, on, = qalassopo/rfuros,
Tab. Defix.Aud.41 A1 (Megara, i A.D.).
qa^lasso-tei/xistos, on, gloss on a(lierkh/s, Sch.Pi.O.8.34.

qa^lasso/-tokos, on,
sea-born, Nonn.D.39.341.

qa^lassourg-e/w,
to be busy with the sea, Plb.6.52.1, Str.6.1.1, Max. Tyr.22.3, etc.

qa^lassourg-i/a, h(,
business on the sea, fishing, etc., Hp.Vict. 3.68 (pl.), Them.Or.24.305d.

qa^lassourg-o/s, o(,
one who works on the sea, a fisherman or
sailor, Charon 10, X.Oec.16.7, Plb.10.8.5: as Adj., q. e)/qnos Philostr.VA4.32.

qa^lass-o/w, Att. qa^lass-tto/w,
make or
changeinto sea, h)pei/rous Arist.Mu. 400a27; *nei=los q. th\n *ai)/gupton Hld.2.28.
purify with sea-water, Hsch. (Pass.). Pass., nau=s qalattou=tai she
leaks, Plb.16.15.2. of wine,
to be mixed with sea-water, Thphr.CP6.7.6; oi)=noi teqalasswme/noi Ath.1.32d, cf. Gal. 13.247 (sg.), POxy.468 (iii A.D.). Med.,
to be a sea-faring man, Luc.Ner.1.
qa^lass-w/dhs, es, = qalassoeidh/s, li/mnh Hanno Peripl.14; gloss on oi)dmato/eis, Sch. Opp.H.5.273.

qa^la/ss-wsis, ews, h(,
inundation, submergence, Thphr.Fr. 30.3, Ph.2.174.
qa/latta, qa^lass-tteu/w, qa^la/ss-ttios, etc., Att. for qa/lassa, etc.

qa/lea [a^], Lacon. sa/l- (v. infr.), ta/,
good cheer, happy thoughts, of the sleeping Astyanax, qale/wn e)mplhsa/menos kh=r Il.22.504; e)n sa/lessi polloi=s h(/menos Alcm.10; qale/essin a)natre/fein tina/ Call.
Fr. anon.31.—In form and accent pl. of qa/los, in meaning closer to qa/leia, qali/a.

qa^le/qw, poet. for qa/llw (cf. qa^le/w),
bloom, thrive, used by Hom. only in part., qa/mnos e)lai/hs . . qale/qwn Od.23.191, cf. Ibyc.1.6, A.R. 2.843; bi/ou qale/qontos Emp.20.3; of men, h)i/+qeoi qale/qontes Od.6.63; qale/qonta to/kon IG14.1363; qale/qeskes e)n ei)/ari AP11.374 (Maced.); ai)ei\ qale/qonti bi/w| Lyr.Adesp.98 (= Trag.Adesp.373); su/es qale/qontes a)loifh=|
swelling, wantoning in fat, Il.9.467, cf. 23.32: c. acc., poi/hn leimw=nes qale/qousin Theoc.25.16.

qa/leia [qa^], h(,
rich, plentiful,: in Ep. always of banquets, qew=n e)n daiti\ qalei/h| Od.8.76, Hes.Op.742; qeou= e)s dai=ta qa/leian Od. 3.420, cf. 8.99, Il.7.475; so later, Pherecr.152; pi/nein e)n daiti\ q. Hermipp.82.11; q. e(orth\n a)ga/gwmen Anacr.54; *dai\s q., presbi/sth qew=n S.Fr.605; moi=ran qa/leian
a goodly portion, Pi.N.10.53; q. h(/ba
bloom of youth, B.3.89; without dai/s, dub. cj. for qala/sshs in Alex. Aet.3.15: in form and accent (cf. e)la/xeia, li/geia and Eust.742.36) a fem. Adj., as if from qalu/s: masc. qalei/ois ste/fesin Emp.112.6. as Subst., = qali/a 1, in pl., Pl.R.573d (nisi hoc legend.). v. qalli/a 11. as pr. n., *qa/leia, h(, one of the Muses, Hes.Th.77; later, the Muse of Comedy, *qali/h AP9.505, cf. Plu.2.744f,746c. one of the Graces,
patroness of festive meetings, ib.778d; *qali/h in Hes.Th.909. Pythag. name for
six, Theol.Ar.38.

qa^lero/mma^tos, on,
bright-eyed, ai)qh/r Orph.H.80.5.

qa^leropoio/s, on,
making full of bloom, Sch.Hes.Th.138.

qa^lero/s, a/, o/n, (qa/llw, qa^lei=n)
stout, sturdy, buxom, in Hom. of persons, q. ai)zhoi/, po/sis, parakoi/ths, Il.3.26, 8.190, 6.430, cf. Pi.N. 1.71; go/nos h.Ven.104; tokeu/s Hes.Th.138.
blooming, fresh, q. ga/mos the marriage
of a youthful pair, Od.6.66, 20.74; *)oi+klh=os q. le/xos ei)sanaba=sa Hes.Cat.Oxy.2075.25; qalero\s h(/bhs xro/nos E.El. 20; prwqh/bhs e)/aros qalerw/teros Alex.Aet.3.7; of plants, a)ma/rakos Chaerem.14.16; a)/nqeon IG12(7).410.17 (Amorgos). of parts of the body,
stout, sturdy, mhrw/ Il.15.113; xai/th
luxuriant mane, 17.439; q. a)loifh/
rich fat, Od.8.476: hence generally, q. kata\ da/kru xe/ousa shedding
big tears, Il.6.496, cf. 24.9, 794, etc.; q. de/ oi( e)/kpese da/kru 2.266; qalerw/tera da/krua Mosch.4.56 (so qalerw/teron e)/klaen Theoc.14.32); q. go/os the
thick and frequent sob, Od.10.457; q. fwnh/
strong voice, Il.17.696, al.; mu=qoi
impassioned, torrential, A.R.4.1072; qalerw/teron pneu=ma a
more genial wind, dub. in A.Th.707 (lyr.); qalero\n pneu=ma
thick, i.e.
laboured or
rapid, breathing, v.l. for qolero\n pn. in Hp.Prorrh.1.39, cf. Gal.16.596; q. u(/pnos
deep sleep, E.Ba. 692. later q. pro/swpon, glossed by eu)ektiko\n kai\ eu)/xroun, Gal. 16.596; to\ sw=ma tou= zw/|ou, me/xri me\n e)/mpnoun e)sti\ kai\ q. Plu.2.955c, cf. E.Supp.62 (lyr.).
qa^lerw=pis, idos, h(, （w)/y） = qalero/mmatos, *)hrige/neia AP7.204 (Agath.).
qa_le/w, Dor. for qhle/w (q.v.).
qa^le/w, = qale/qw, Q.S.11.96 codd., Nonn.D.16.78; qale/wn Hp. Insomn.90; qale/eske v.l. for qale/qeske in Mosch.2.67.

*qa^lh=s, o(, gen. *qa/lew, dat. *qalh=|, acc. *qalh=n; gen. also *qalou= Str. 1.1.11; and in Poets *qa/lhtos, acc. *qa/lhta, Call.Fr.94, 96, Epigr. ap. D.L.1.34, 39:—Thales of Miletus, Hdt.1.74, etc.

qa^li/a, Ion. -ih, h(, (qa/llw)
abundance, good cheer, tre/fetai qali/h| e)/ni pollh=| Il.9.143,285: in pl.,
festivities, met' a)qana/toisi qeoi=si te/rpetai e)n qali/h|s Od.11.603, cf.h.Merc.56, Hes.Op.115, Archil.9, Xenoph. 1.12 (sg.), Pi.O.7.94, Trag.Adesp.397 (anap.), Ar.Nu.309, Pax780 (both lyr.), Av.733 (anap.); ei)=nai e)n qali/h|si Hdt.3.27; q. kissofo/roi E.Ba.384 (lyr.); of a
funeral-feast, a)mf' o(si/h| qali/h| . . a)/naktos Orac. ap.Plu.Arat.53. v. qalli/a 11. as pr. n., v. qa/leia 111.

qa^lia/zw,
enjoy oneself, make merry, Plu.2.746f, al. (qaleia/zw ib. 357e); e(orth\n q. Polyaen.4.15.

qa/liktron, to/, prob.
Thalictrum minus, meadow-rue, Dsc.4.97 (sed fort. qali/htron: qali/hktron Gal.11.884).

qaliopoioi/, oi(,
leather-covered-box-makers, Hsch. (Cf. sali/a, qoli/a.)

qalli/a, h(, = ka/pparis, Dsc.2.173.
foliage, leaf-buds or
twigs, esp. of the olive, Thphr.CP5.1.3 (cod. Urb.), Ath.11.459, Dsc. 5.75 (v.l. in 2.70), Antyll. ap. Orib.10.23.20, Aët.6.29: pl., Thphr. CP1.20.3 (qalli/as cod. Urb., qalei/as vulg. as in 3.5.1 (sg.), Porph. Antr.33); in codd. sts. qali/a, as Thphr.HP2.2.12, 2.3.3, v.l. in CP 5.1.3; ba/tou qali/a Sor.2.41.

qa/lli^nos, h, on, (qallo/s)
of or
for young shoots, ste/fanos IG12(1).162.3 (Rhodes); a)ggei=a Sch.Ar.Av.799: qalli^nw/dhs, es,
covered with shoots, of the Wooden Horse, Cyr.

qalli/on, to/, in pl.,
presents (cf. qallo/s 111), POxy.1481.7 (ii A.D.): pl. written qa/leia, Wilcken Chr.323.20 (ii A.D.).

qallo/s, o(, (qa/llw)
young shoot, young branch, Od.17.224, S.El. 422, Theoc.4.45, etc.: generally,
branch, Gp.11.10.3; esp. of the olive (cf. Tim.Lex. s.v. qallo/s）, e)stefanw=sqai e)lai/hs qallw=| Hdt.7.19; e)lai/as q. E.IT1101 (lyr.); and freq. without e)lai/as, A.Ch.1035, S. OC474, etc.; i(kth\r q. E.Supp.10, cf. A.Ch.1035; q. xrusou=s IG12.287.200; stefanw=sai qallou= stefa/nw| as a mark of distinction, Aeschin. 3.187, cf. IG22.207, 229, Phld.Ind.Sto.68, etc.; ste/fanos qallou= xrusou=s IG22.1388.33; ste/fanos to\ nikhth/rion qallou= Pl.Lg.943c; prov., qallo\n prosei/ontes a)/gousi they entice, as one does cattle, by holding out
a green bough, Id.Phdr.23od; qallw=| prodeixqe/nti a)kolouqei=n Luc. Herm.68, cf. Lib.Ep.212.3. qalloi/, oi(,
palm-leaves, which were plaited into baskets, Gp.10.6.2.
gift (prob. at first a branch, later in other forms) given to a landlord by one whose bid for a lease was accepted, UPZ112 iii 15 (ii B.C.); repeated annually, qallw=n kat' e)/tos a)/rtwn h(miart abi/ou kai\ a)le/ktoros PRyl.167.16 (i A.D.), etc.; esp. at festivals, PAmh.2.93.11 (ii A.D.);
gratuity additional to wages, PCair.Preis.31.21 (ii A.D.); any
gift given annually at a festival, Ps.-Callisth.1.32.

qallo-fa^ge/w,
eat young olive-shoots, Ath.11.587a.

qallo-fore/w,
carry olive-shoots, Cratin.31, Pherecr.57, Dicaearch.Hist.46.

qallo-fo/ros, on,
carrying young olive-shoots, as the old men did at the Panathenaea,
Ar.V.544 (lyr.), X.Smp.4.17; as a name of Heracles, IG 14.904.

qa/llw, Hes.Op.173, h.Cer.402, etc.: aor.1 e)/qhla （a)n-) Ael.NA2.25, 9.21: aor. 2 qa/le h.Hom.19.33; a)n-e/qalon LXX Wi.4.4, Ep.Phil. 4.10: pf. te/qhla, in Hom. only part. in pres. sense teqhlw/s, Ep. fem. teqa^lui=a, and 3sg. plpf. teqh/lei Od.5.69; 3sg. ind. te/qhle Hes. Op.227, Emp.77, S.Ph.259; Aeol. and Dor. te/qa_la Sapph.Supp.25.12, Pi.Fr.129.5, B.9.40, IG3.171; subj. teqh/lh| Epigr. ap. Pl.Phdr. 264d; inf. teqhle/nai Id.Cra.414a; part. teqa_lw/s prob. in A.Supp. 107(lyr.):—Pass., fut. qa^lh/somai （a)na-) AP7.281 (Heraclid.): (cf. qhle/w):—
sprout, grow, thrive, esp. of fruit-trees, e)rineo\s . . fu/lloisi teqhlw/s Od.12.103; teqh/lei de\ stafulh=|si, of a vine, 5.69; a)/nqesi gai=a qa/llei h.Cer.l.c.; <de/ndrea> te/qhle karpw=n a)fqoni/h|si Emp.77; w)= xruse/a| ko/ma| qa/llwn *loci/a Pi.I.7(6).49; pw/gwni qa/llwn S.Ichn.358: abs., karpo\n tri\s e)/teos qa/llonta Hes.Op.173; qa/llei kat' h)=mar ai)ei\ na/rkissos S.OC681 (lyr.), etc.: freq. in pf. part., as Adj.,
luxuriant, teqalui=a/ t' o)pw/rh Od.11.192; teqalui=a/ t' a)lwh/ 6.293: also, c. acc. cogn., ou) de/ndre' e)/qallen xw=ros the place
grew no trees, Pi.O.3.23, cf. AP9.78 (s.v.l., Leon.); e)n fu/lloisi qallou/shs bi/on canqh=s e)lai/as (Dind. i)/son) A.Pers.616; simply,
bloom, Thphr.HP1.1.2; but of si/kuoi, etc., h( a)po\ tou= u(/datos a)tmi\s oi(=on qa/llontas pare/xei Id.CP5.6.5. of other natural objects, teqalui=a/ t' e)e/rsh
copious dew, Od. 13.245; r(a/xin teqalui=an a)loifh=|
rich with fat, Il.9.208, cf. Od.13.410; ei)lapi/nh| teqalui/h| at a
sumptuous feast, 11.415. of persons, states or conditions,
bloom, q. a(palo\n xro/a Archil.100;
thrive, flourish, *ei)rh/nh teqalui=a Hes.Th.902; qa/lloisa eu)daimoni/a, a)reta/, Pi.P. 7.19, I.5(4).17; patro\s qa/llontos S.Ant.703, cf. Ph.420, etc.; zw=n kai\ qa/llwn alive and
prosperous, Id.Tr.235; zh=| kai\ qa/llei [h( pai/deusis] Antipho Soph.60; qa/le po/qos h.Hom.19.33; *)/erws e)pi\ *xalkide/wn qa/llei po/lesin Carm.Pop.44; *)/erws to/te me\n q. te kai\ zh=|, o(/tan eu)porh/sh|, to/te de\ a)poqnh/|skei Pl.Smp.203e; q. kai\ eu)daimonei= xw/ra kai\ po/lis Id.Lg.945d: c. dat. modi, qa/llousin d' a)gaqoi=si Hes.Op.236; a)glai/+h| teqalui=ai [dmw|ai/] Id.Sc.276; toi=si (sc. a)ndra/si） te/qhle po/lis Id.Op. 227; po/lis e)leuqeri/a| teqalui=a Simon.102; q. a)retai=s Pi.O.9.16; e)lpi/di B.9.40; eu)genei= te/knwn spora=| S.Ant.1164; parrhsi/a| E.Hipp. 422; dai/mwn a)fqi/tw| q. bi/w| Critias25.17D.; q. e)pi\ gumna/dos e)/rgois Epigr.Gr.233 (Chios). of disease and the like , in bad sense,
to be fresh, active, h( d' e)mh\ no/sos a)ei\ te/qhle S.Ph.259; ph/mata . . a)ei\ qa/llonta ma=llon h)\ katafqi/nonta
waxing, Id.El.260; e)/ris qa/llei E.Ph.812 (lyr.): c. dat., a)frosu/nais qa/llous' *(/ubris B.14.58. toi=si au)toi=sin o(/ te splh\n qa/llei kai\ to\ sw=ma fqi/nei the spleen
becomes swollen, Hp. Loc.Hom.24; also teqhlo/s (in neutral sense) of the liver, Id.VM22.
*qallw/, ou=s, h(, one of the *(=wrai, a divinity of increase, Jusj. ap. Lycurg.77, Paus.9.35.2.

qa/los [a^], eos, to/, prop. = qallo/s, but only nom. and acc. in metaph. sense of
scion, child, fi/lon q. Il.22.87; leusso/ntwn toio/nde q. Od.6.157; glukero/n, ne/on q., h.Cer.66, 187; semno\n q. *)alkai+da=n Pi.O. 6.68, cf. 2.45, E.El.15, etc.—For the pl., v. qa/lea, ta/.
qalp-eino/s, h/, o/n,= qalpno/s, but as gloss on i)sxno/n, EM479.22.
qalp-ei/w, Ep. for qa/lpw, ib.620.46.

qalp-ia/w, (qa/lpw)
to be or
become warm, eu)= qalpio/wn right
warm and comfortable, Od.19.319, cf. Arat. 1073.

qalp-no/s, h/, o/n,
warming, fostering, qalpno/teron a)/stron Pi.O. 1.6.

qa/lp-os, eos, to/,
warmth, heat, esp.
summer-heat, opp. xeimw/n, A.Ag.565, 969; e)n meshmbri/as q. Id.Supp.747; q. qeou= the sun's
heat, S.Tr.145, etc.; meshmbrinoi=si qa/lpesin A.Th.431,446; in Prose, qa/lpos, opp. yu=xos, Hp.Aph.3.4: pl., r(i/gh kai\ qa/lph, yu/xh kai\ q., X.Oec.7.23, Cyr.1.2.10. metaph.,
sting, smart, [toceuma/twn] S.Ant.1086; of love, AP6.207 (Arch.).

qalp-te/on,
one must warm, Aët.5.68, Hippiatr.1.

qalp-th/rion,
fomentum, fomes, Gloss.

qalp-th/rios, on,
warming, sa/ndala . . podw=n q. AP6.206.1 (Antip. Sid.).

qa/lp-w, fut. -yw Orph.Fr.258, Alciphr.2.4: fut. Med. in pass. sense qa/lyomai Id.3.42:—
heat, soften by heat, Od.21.179, al.:—Pass., e)th/keto kassi/teros w(\s . . qalfqei/s Hes.Th.864, cf. S.Tr.697: metaph.,
to be softened, deceived, ai)/ ke mh\ qalfqh=| lo/gois Ar.Eq.210.
heat, warm, without any notion of
softening, kau=m' e)/qalpe (sc. h(ma=s) S. Ant.417; qermh\ h(ma=s a)kti\s q. Ar.Av.1092;
keep warm, xlanidi/wn e)reipi/ois qa/lpousa kai\ yu/xousa Trag.Adesp.7: prov., q. to\n di/fron, of an idle life, Herod.1.37; q. ta\s koxw/nas Id.7.48; th\n bai/thn qa/lpousan eu)= ib.129:—Pass., Hp.Aff.4; qa/lpesqai tou= qe/rous
to be warm in summer, X.Cyr.5.1.11; tw=| puri\ qa/lyomai Alciphr.3.42: metaph., e)/ti a(li/w| qa/lpesqai
to be alive, Pi.N.4.14.
warm at the fire, dry, qa/lpetai r(a/kh S.Ph.38, cf. E.Hel.183 (lyr.).
hatch, w)|a/ Gp.14.1.4: so abs.,
sit, ib.3; q. e)pi\ tw=n nossw=n, e)pi\ tw=n w)|w=n, LXXDe. 22.6. metaph., of passion,
heat, inflame, h(\ *dio\s qa/lpei ke/ar e)/rwti A.Pr.590, cf. S.Fr.474 (Pass.); e)/qalyen a)/ths spasmo/s Id.Tr. 1082:—Pass., i(me/rou be/lei teqa/lfqai pro/s tinos A.Pr.650; qa/lph| (2sg.) a)nhke/stw| puri/ S.El.888; ei)/ seu qa/lpetai/ ti tw=n e)/ndon Herod. 2.81.
comfort, u(/pnos . . qa/lpei ke/ar B.Fr.3.11, cf. Fr.16.2, Com.Adesp.5.16D.;
cherish, foster, a)/llon qa/lpe fi/lon Theoc.14.38; w(s e)a\n trofo\s qa/lph| ta\ e(auth=s te/kna 1 Ep.Thess.2.7; th\n e(autou= sa/rka Ep.Eph.5.29; to\ a)sqenou=n Alciphr.2.4; q. kai\ tre/fein PMasp.6B132 (vi A.D.); th\n po/lin q.
tend it
with fostering care, OGI194.5 (Egypt, i B.C.). e)me\ ou)de\n q. h( do/ca I
care nothing for glory, Alciphr.2.2; e)me\ ou)de\n q. ke/rdos Aristaenet.1.24. intr.,
to be full of heat, vigorous, Arist.Pr.879a33; qa/lyai trei=s poi/as
to live three summers, AP7.731 (Leon.).

qalp-wrh/, h(,
warming: metaph.,
comfort, consolation, ou) ga\r e)/t' a)/llh qalpwrh/ Il.6.412, cf. Od.1.167; a)nti\ de\ qalpwra=n [qh=ka goneu=si go/ous] IG4.623 (Argos): pl., Tryph.128.—In late Prose, Jul.Or.8.243c.

qa^lukro/s, a/, o/n,
hot, glowing, a(pa/nth| pa/nta q. e)gw/ Call.
Fr.anon. 69; q. ke/ntron e)rwmani/hs AP5.219 (Agath.):—hence qalukre/omai, = yeu/domai, Hsch.
qal-u/nw, = qa/llein poiw=, Hsch.
qal-u/ptw, = qa/lpw, aor. 1 inf. qalu/yai, Id.; cf. a)kroqa/luptos.

qa^lu/sia [u_], ta/, （qa/los)
offerings of first-fruits, made to Artemis, Il.9.534; later to Demeter, Theoc.7.3; to Demeter and Dionysus, Men.Rh.p.391S. qalu/sios [a)/rtos] bread
made from the first-fruits, Ath.3.114a.

qa^lu_sia/s, a/dos, fem.Adj., kou/rh q. a priestess of Demeter (cf.foreg.), Nonn.D.12.103; q. o(do/s a journey
to the qalu/sia, Theoc.7.31.
qalu/ssw, = qa/lpw, Hsch. (Pass.):— also qalu/esqai (dub.l.), Id.

qa/lyis, ews, h(, ( qa/lpw)
warming, fomenting, Hp.Acut.21, S.E. M.7.354, Ruf.Sat.Gon.47. opp. yu=cis, of seasons, Hp.Aph. 3.1;
heat, heating property, Gal.18(1).228.
cherishing, PLond. 5.1727.10 (vi A.D.).

qa^ma/ (oxyt., A.D.Adv.153.5, Hdn.Gr.2.141), Adv.
often, Il.16.207, Od.16.27, Pi.O.1.17, B.12.193, S.El.524, Ar.Eq.990 (lyr.), Pl. 1166, Pl.Phd.72e, X.Mem.2.1.22; q. th=s h(me/ras POxy.1158.4 (iii A.D.). (Orig. 'thickly', cf. qame/es, qa/mnos.)
qama/khs: su/mbios, Cyr.
qa^ma/ki^s, Adv. = qama/, Pi.I.1.28, N.10.38.
qamatroxei=: ou)x h(suxa/zei, Hsch.

qamb-ai/nw, = qambe/w,
to be astonished at, Pi.O.3.32, v.l. for qaumai/nw in h.Ven.84.

qamb-a^le/os, a, on,
astonished, Nonn.D.1.126. = qaumasto/s, fobero/s, Hsch.

qamb-euth/s, ou=, o(,
terrifying person, Aq. Ze.3.4.

qamb-eu/w,
terrify, Id.Ge.49.4.

qamb-e/w,
to be astounded, oi( de\ i)do/ntes qa/mbhsan Il.8.77, cf.B.5.84; oi( d' a)na\ qumo\n e)qa/mbeon Od.4.638, etc.; kau)to\s teqa/mbhk' S.Ant.1246; e)qa/mbhsen de\ pa=s . . o(/milos E.Ion 1205. c. acc.,
to be astonished at, qa/mbhsan d' o)/rniqas Od.2.155, cf. 16.178; to\n e)qa/mbeon *)/artemi/s te kai\ *)aqa/na Pi.N.3.50; te/ras d' e)qa/mboun A.Supp.570 (lyr.): in late Prose, Plu.Aem.34. later also causal,
alarm, LXX 2 Ki.22.5; tou\s o)fqalmou/s tinos PMag.Par. 1.237:—Pass.,
to be astounded, Ev.Marc.1.27, POxy.654.7,
PMag. Leid.W.11.39; teqambhme/nos
astounded, Plu.Brut.20; dia/ tinos Id.Caes.[45].

qa/mb-hma, atos, to/,
alarm, terror, Man.4.559.

qa/mb-hsis, ews, h(,= foreg., Aq.Ps.30(31).23, Man.4.365.
haste, Aq.De.16.3, Is.52.12.

qamb-h/teira, h(,
the fearful one, of the Furies, Orph.A.973 (pl.).

qamb-hto/s, h/, o/n,
astonishing, Lyc.552, Maiist.1.

qamb-o/omai,
to be terrified, pf. part. teqambwme/nos, Aët.16.66 (s.v.l.).

qa/mb-os, eos, to/, also o( Simon.237, LXX Ec.12.5 (pl.): (te/qhpa):—
amazement, q. d' e)/xen ei)soro/wntas Il.4.79; q. d' e(/le pa/ntas i)do/ntas Od.3.372; qa/mbei dusfo/rw| terpnw=| te mixqei/s Pi.N.1.55; qa/mbei e)kplage/ntes E.Rh.291, cf. Ar.Av.781 (lyr.), Th.6.31, Pl.Phdr.254c: pl., Onos.41.2. in objective sense, qa/mboi
terrors in the way, LXX l.c.;
object of wonder, Epigr.Gr.1068 (Gerasa).

qamb-o/s, h/, o/n,
astonished, Eust.906.53.

qa^m-i/zw, (qama/)
come often, pa)ros ge me\n ou)/ ti qami/zeis Il.18.386, al.; a(/ma nhi\+ poluklhi+=di qami/zwn
plying, Od.8.161; q. ei)s tou/sde tou\s to/pous Pl.Hp.Ma.281b; e)f' h(ma=s X.Cyr.7.3.2; kei=se A.R.2.451; e)n dona/kessi q.
to haunt them, Nic.Al.578; e)n tai=s pompai=s Corn.ND30; toi=s maxome/nois Chor.in Hermes 17.227; sofi/hs e)p' a)/kroisi qami/zein v.l. for qoa/zein in Emp.4.8.
to be accustomed: c.part., ou)/ ti komizo/meno/s ge qa/mizen he
was not
wont to be so cared for, Od.8.451; ou) de\ qami/zeis h(mi=n kat abai/nwn we do not
often see you coming down, Pl.R.328c; minu/retai qami/zousa ma/list' a)hdw/n mourns
constantly, S.OC672 (lyr.): abs., dia\ to\ qami/zein by dint of
repetition, Pl.Lg.843b. Med.,= Act., th=|de （tw=|de codd.) S.Fr.503.
qa^mi^na/kis, Adv. = qama/kis, qama/, Hp.Mul.2.203.

qa^mi^no/s and qami_no/s (h.Merc.44, Call.Aet.3.1.36, Nic.Th.239 (v.l.); qameino/s Choerob. in An.Ox.2.180), h/, o/n,
crowded, close-set, Call.Cer. 65, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.7.14: usu. neut. pl. qamina/, as Adv. = qama/, Pi. O.1.53, Pae.6.16, Ar.Pl.292 (lyr.), X.Mem.3.11.15, An.4.1.16 (v.l. qameina/): sg., qamino/n A.R.3.1266: Sup. -w/tatos Suid. Adv. -nw=s Hsch.: Comp. -w/teron Parth.Fr.29.
qa/mic: a)lw/phc, Hsch.

qa/mna, h(,
wine from pressed grapes, a local term, Gp.6.13.2; so prob. th\n prokukli/hn qa/mnhn Herod.6.90.
qamn-a/s, a/dos, h(, （qa/mnos） = r(i/za, EM442.23.
qamn-i/skos, o(, Dim. of qa/mnos, Dsc.4.108, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.8.4.6, Gal.2.355.
qa/mnison: a)poka/luyon, Hsch.

qamni=tis, idos, h(,
shrubby, r(a/mnos Nic.Th.883.

qamno-eidh/s, e/s,
shrubby, Thphr.HP3.17.3, Crateuas ap.Dsc.2.127.

entryFree.sense:
a long stick
cut from a bush, Ion Trag.40.

div0.entryFree:
qa/mnos, o(, also h( D.S.2.49: (cf. qame/es):—
bush, shrub, katapth/cas u(po\ qa/mnw| Il.22.191; qa/mnw| u(p' a)mfiko/mw| 17.677; qa/mnois e)n pukinoi=si in the thick
copse, Od.5.471; q. druo/s Pi.Pae.4.52; q. e)lai/hs a
bushy olive, Od.23.190, cf. Archil.6.1, A.Ag.1316, E.Ba.722, S.El.55, Ar. Pax1298 (hex.), Pl.R.432b, etc.; q. to\ a)po\ r(i/zhs polu/kladon Thphr. HP1.3.1.

qamnofa/gos [a^], on,
eating shrubs, S.E.P.1.56.
qamnw/dhs, es,= qamnoeidh/s, Thphr.HP3.12.1 (Comp.), CP5.12.5.

qa^mu^ri/zw,
assemble, Hsch.;
take part in a meeting, qamuriddo/ntwn [tw=n dei=na] BCH50.401 (Thespiae); qa/mu^ris, h(,
assembly, Hsch.

*qa/mu^ris [a^], o(, dat. *qamu/ridi Paus.10.30.8, *qamu/ri v.l. in Poll.4.75; acc. *qa/murin Il.2.595, E.Rh.925:—Thamyris, a Thracian bard, Il.cc., Str.7 Fr.35:—Att. *qamu/ras (cf.Cyr.) S.Fr.245 (lyr.), Pl.R.620a, etc.

qa^mu^ro/s, a/, o/n,
frequented, o(do/s Hsch.
qamu/s, v. qame/es.

qa^na/si^mos [na^], on, （qa/natos)
deadly, fatal, Hp.Aph.2.1, Pl.R.610e, etc.; tu/xai A.Ag.1276; pe/shma S.Aj.1033; xei/rwma Id.OT560; pe/plos Id.Tr.758; fa/rmaka E.Ion616, Ph.Bel.103.31, cf. Metrod.53, etc.; qhri/a q., of
poisonous reptiles, Plb.1.56.4: qana/sima, ta/,
poisons, Ev.Marc. 16.18, Dsc.4.108, Gal.14.154. Adv. -mws, tu/ptein to strike
with deadly blow, Antipho 4.3.4: neut. pl. as Adv., a)spi/des -ma da/knousai D.S.1.87.
belonging to death, q. ai(=ma the
life-blood, A. Ag.1019 (lyr.); me/lyasa q. go/on having sung her
death-song, ib.1445; q. e)kpnoai/ E.Hipp.1438. of persons,
near death, S.Ph.819; q. h)/dh o)/nta Pl.R.408b;
liable to the death-penalty, Abh.Berl.Akad. 1925(5).21 (Cyrene).
dead, S.Aj.517; q. bebhko/ta Id.OT959.

qa^na^t-a/w, Desiderat. of qanei=n,
desire to die, Pl.Phd.64b, Ax.366c, Alex.211, J.BJ3.7.18, Gal.8.190, Max.Tyr.26.9, Philostr.VA7.31.
to be moribund, Ph.2.505, Lyd.Mag.3.40, v.l. in 45.

qa^na^t-hgo/s, o/n,
death-bringing, epith. of Hecate, PMag.Par.1.2865; f.l. for qa/rghlos, Timocl.7.
qa^na^t-h/rios, on, v. qanath/sios.
qa^na^t-h/simos, v. sq.

qa^na^t-h/sios, on,= qana/simos, rejected by Poll.5.132 (cod.C; -h/simos cett.), but found in Afric.Cest.14,16,17 (Math.Vett.p.294 Thévenot); cf. qanath/sion, ou) qana/simon le/gousin, Phot.; qanath/rion a)ciou=sin ou) qana/simon le/gein AB99 (quoting Pl.R.Bk.ii, E.Med.).

qa^na^t-hro/s, a/, o/n,
poisonous, bota/nh Eust.1336.20; gh= Sch.rec.S.OT181.

qa^na^thfor-i/a, h(,
a causing of death, AP5.113 (Maec.).

qa^na^th/for-os, on,
death-bringing, ai)=sa A.Ch.369 (lyr.); peri/odos q. cycle
of mortality, Pl.R.617d; of hurts or accidents, Hp.Art.48; of a surgical operation, Antyll. ap. Orib.45.17.6; r(i/za e)n *ai)qiopi/a, of arrow-poison,
Acokanthera Schimperi, Thphr.HP9.15.2; o)du/nai Arist.PA672a36; ge/neqla . . q. kei=tai
causing death by contagion, S.OT181 (lyr.); pa=sai metabolai\ politeiw=n q. X.HG2.3.32; a(marti/a LXXNu.18.22; di/kai
capital trials, Not.Arch.4.19 (Cyrene, Aug.); e)pistolh/ Hdn.4.12.8; perista/seis Vett.Val.225.7. Adv. -rws, nosei=n Phld.Rh.2.148S.: neut. sg. as Adv., e)plh/gh ou)xi\ -fo/ron Aen.Tact.27.9; but -fo/ron a)/|dein to sing
a death song, AP11.186 (Nicarch.).
qa^na^t-ia/w, = qanata/w 11, Luc.Peregr.32, S.E.M.9.153.

qa^na^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
deadly, q. e)gklh/mata
capital charges, D.S.37.5; no/moi, zhmi/a, J.BJ3.5.7, AJ15.11.5; di/kh q. trial
on a capital charge, Plu.Per.10, Alex.42; of planetary influences, Vett. Val.129.4. Medic.,
fatal, sundromh/ Gal.16.545. Adv. -kw=s, le/gesqai, as expl. of dushlegh/s, Eust.321.40.

qa^na^t-o/eis, essa, en,
deadly, a(marth/mata S. Ant.1262 (lyr.); mo/ros E.IA1288 (lyr.).

qa^na^topoio/s, o/n,
causing death, Sch.S.Tr.858.

qa/na^tos [qa^], o(, （qnh/|skw)
death, whether natural or violent, Hom., etc.; tw=n u(paleua/menos qa/naton
the death threatened by them, Od.15.275; w(\s qa/non oi)kti/stw| qana/tw| 11.412; qa/nato/nde
to death, Il.16.693, 22.297; qana/tou te/los, moi=ra, A.Th.906 (lyr.), Pers.917 (anap.), etc.; qana/tou pe/ri kai\ zwa=s for life and
death, Pi.N.9.29; q. h)\ bi/on fe/rei S. Aj.802; qa/natos me\n ta/d' a)kou/ein Id.OC529; qana/tw| i)/son pa/qos Id.Aj. 215; e)n a)gxo/nais qa/naton labei=n E.Hel.201; po/lew/s e)sti q., a)na/staton gene/sqai it is its
death, Lycurg.61; gh=ras zw=n q. Secund.Sent.12; qa/naton a)poqnh/|skein, teleuta=n, Plu.Crass.25, D.H.4.76. in Law,
death-penalty, qa/naton katagnw=nai/ tinos to pass
sentence of death on one, Th.3.81; qana/tou di/kh| kri/nesqai ib.57; qana/tou kri/nein X.Cyr.1.2.14, Plb.6.14.6; peri\ qana/tou diw/kein X.HG7.3.6; pro\s tou\s e)xqrou\s . . a)gwni/sasqai peri\ q. D.4.47; q. th=s zhmi/as e)pikeime/nhs the penalty is
death, Isoc.8.50; ellipt., paidi/on kekos mhme/non th\n e)pi\ qana/tw| (sc. stolh/n) Hdt.1.109; th\n e)pi\ q. prosagagei=n tina Luc.Alex.44; but dh=sai/ tina th\n e)pi\ qana/tw| (sc. de/sin) Hdt.3.119; th\n e)pi\ qana/tw| e)/codon poiei=sqai to go to
execution, Id.7.223; e)pi\ qa/naton a)/gesqai Id.3.14; toi=s *)aqhnai/ois e)pitre/yai peri\ sfw=n au)tw=n plh\n qana/tou for any penalty short of
death, Th.4.54; eu)qu/nas ei)=nai plh\n fugh=s kai\ qana/tou kai\ a)timi/as IG12.39.73; ei)rgo/menon qana/tou kai\ tou= a)na/phron poih=sai short
of death or maiming, Aeschin.1.183. pl., qa/natoi
kinds of death, Od.12.341;
the deaths of several persons, S.OT1200, E.Heracl.628 (both lyr.); poet., of one person, A.Ch.53, S.OT496, El.206 (all lyr.); ou)x e(no/s, ou)de\ duoi=n a)/cia qana/toin Pl.Lg.908e; pollw=n q., ou)x e(no\s a)/cios D.21.21, cf.19.16, Ar.Pl.483, D.H.4.24; deu/teros q.
*apoc. 2.11, cf. Plu.2.942f; esp. of
violent death, q. au)qe/ntai A.Ag.1572 (lyr.), cf. Th.879 (lyr.); ei)s qana/tous i)e/nai Pl.R.399b. as pr. n., *qa/natos Death, *(/upnw| . . kasignh/tw| *qana/toio Il.14.231, cf. S.Aj.854, Ph.797, etc.; mo/nos qew=n ga\r *q. ou) dw/rwn e)ra=| A.Fr.161; o(\n [i)o\n] te/keto *q. S.Tr. 834; character in E.Alc.
corpse, q. a)tu/mbeutos AP9.439 (Crin.).

qa^na^tou/sia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
a feast of the dead, Luc.VH2.22.
qa^na^tofo/ros, on,= qanathfo/ros, pa/qh A.Ag.1176 (lyr.).

qa^na^t-o/w, fut. -w/sw A.Pr.1053 (anap.), etc.: pf. teqana/twka Phld. Rh.1.359S.:—Pass., fut. -wqh/somai LXX 1 Ki.14.45: fut. Med. in pass.sense qanatw/soito X.Cyr.7.5.31: aor.1 e)qanatw/qhn Id.An.2.6.4, Pl.Lg.865d: pf. teqana/twmai Plb.23.4.14:—
put to death, tina Hdt.1.113, A.Pr.l.c.; esp. of the public executioner, Pl.Lg.872c, etc.: metaph., teqanatwke/nai ta\s *)aqh/nas (sc. tou\s r(h/toras) Phld.l.c.:— Pass.,
to be made dead, Ep.Rom.7.4; o( -wqei/s the
murdered man, Pl. Lg.865d. Pass., of flesh,
to be mortified, Hp.Fract.26:—metaph. in Act.,
mortify, ta\s pra/ceis tou= sw/matos Ep.Rom.8.13.
condemn to death by sentence of law, Antipho 3.3.11, Ev.Matt.26.60:— Pass., X.An.2.6.4; oi( teqanatwme/noi those
condemned to death, Plb. l.c.
to be fatal, cause death, o)/feis -ou=ntes LXXNu.21.6; mui=ai -ou=sai ib.Ec.10.1; no/sos Ph.2.247 (-w=san, -w/sasan codd.).

qa^na^t-w/dhs, es,
indicating death, shmei=on Hp.Prog.2.
deadly, fatal, au)xmoi/ Id.Aph.3.15; h)=r ib.9; spasmoi/ Ael.NA7.5.

qa^na^/t-wsis, ews, h(,
putting to death, Th.5.9; katadi/kai kai\ -seis politw=n Plu.2.291c.
qa=cai: mequ/sai, and teqagme/noi: memequsme/noi, and qaxmh=nai (cod., leg. qaxqh=men）: qwrhxqh=nai (Dor.), Hsch.; cf. *qw/ssw.

*qa/omai, a form needlessly invented to expl. the foll. Dor. forms of qa_e/omai (q.v.), in which qa_- is contr. fr. qa_e（o)- and qa_h-: 1pl. qa/meqa Sophr.85: 2pl. qa=sqe (Megar.) Ar.Ach.770; imper. qa/eo APl.4.306, AP6.354 (Nossis); part. qa/menos, tai\ qa/menai ta\ *)/isqmia, title of mime by Sophron, Arg.Theoc.15; qasei=sqe Call.Cer.3: fut.part. qaso/menos Theoc.15.23: aor. imper. qa=sai Epich.114, Theoc.1.149, 3.12; inf. qa/sasqai Id.2.72; part. qasa/menos Tab.Heracl.1.118. Act. only in part., qa/onta: dida/skonta, qewrou=nta, Hsch., and Lacon. 1pl. impf. e)/sa_men (i.e. e)/qa_men),= e)qewrou=men, Id.
qa/pos, to/, dialectic form of ta/fos (B), qa/mbos, Eust.468.28: qa/pan: fo/bon, Hsch. qa/pta: mui=a (Cret.), Id.

qapte/on,
one must bury, tina S.Aj.1140.

qapth/rion,
sepultorium, Gloss.

qa/ptw, fut. qa/yw Is.8.21:—Pass., fut. ta^fh/somai E.Alc.632, Lys. 13.45, also teqa/yomai S.Aj.577, 1141, E.IT1464: aor. 1 e)qa/fqhn Simon.167 (cj.), Hdt.2.81,7.228; more freq.aor. 2 e)ta/fhn [a^] Id.3.10, 55, and alwaysin Att., as Ar.Pl.556; part. e)n-qafei/s CIG2839 (Aphrodisias): pf. te/qammai, Ion.3pl. teta/fatai v.l. teqa/fatai Hdt.6.103; imper. teqa/fqw Luc.DMar.9.1; inf. teqa/fqai A.Ch.366 (lyr., prob.l.), Lycurg.113: plpf. Pass. e)te/qapto Od.11.52, Hdt.1.113:—
honour with funeral rites, o(/te min qa/ptwsin *)axaioi/ Il.21.323, cf. Hes.Sc.472; esp. by burial, ou) ga/r pw e)te/qapto u(po\ xqono/s Od.11.52 (but freq. used later with ref. to cremation, D.S.3.55, App.Hann.35, Philostr.Her. 10.11, etc.; puri\ qa/ptein Plu.2.286f, Philostr.VS2.20.3); qa/ptein . . gh=s fi/lais kataskafai=s A.Th.1013, cf. E.Supp.545 (Pass.); q. e)s xw=ron Hdt.2.41; ou(= e)bou/lonto Th.8.84; q. e)c oi)ki/as
to carry out to burial from a house, Is.8.21; katalei/yei mhde\ tafh=nai not even his
burial expenses, Ar.Pl.556; tw=| d' ei)=nai mhde\ tafh=nai Id.Ec.592.

qa^ra^p-euth/s, = qerap-,
Annuaire des Etudes Grecques 7.95 (Aenos).
qa^ra^p-eu/w, = qerapeu/w, IG3.1296, Schwyzer 200 (Crete, ii B.C.).
qa^ra^/p-hna, h(, Boeot.,= qera/paina, ib.503a.5 (iii/ii B.C.).

*qargh/lia (sc. i(era/), wn, ta/, a festival of Apollo and Artemis held at Athens in the month Thargelion, Hippon.37, Archil.113, Lex ap.D. 21.10, IG22.1138, etc.:—also *targ-, SIG57.20 (Milet., v B.C.), Schwyzer 721.8 (Theb. ad Mycalen, iv B.C.): *qarghliw/n, w=nos, o(, name of month at Athens, Antipho 6.42; also at Amorgos, IG12(7).62; and Andros, ib.135:—written *targ- at Delos, BCH5.26 (but *qarg- IG 11(2).287A19 (iii B.C.)): *qargh/lios and *targh/lios as pr. n., both in GDI5515 (Iasos); *targ- in Anacr.40.
qa/rghlos a)/rtos, o(,= qalu/sios, Crates Gr. ap. Ath.3.114a, dub. in IG 12.840; qa/rghlos xu/tra prob. for qanathgo\s x. in Timocl.7.
qarneu/ei: o)xeu/ei, spei/rei, futeu/ei, and qa/rnusqai: o)xeu/ein, kui/+skesqai, Hsch. (Cf. qo/rnumai.)
qarra^le/os, qarre/w, qarrhtiko/s, qa/rros, qarru/nw, Att. for qars-.

qarsa^l-e/os, Att. qarra^le/os, a, on, (qa/rsos)
daring, polemisth/s Il. 21.589, etc.; h)=tor 19.169; fwna/ Pi.N.9.49; e)lpi/des q.
confident, A.Pr. 536 (lyr.): c. inf., a)po\ tw=n i(/ppwn polemei=n qarr. Pl.Prt.350a; q. peri/ ti Arist.Rh.1383a15: Comp. -w/teros Id.PA667a16, Pl.Prt.l.c.; to\ qarsale/on
confidence, e)n tw=| qarsale/w| ei)=nai Th.2.51, cf. Lys.21.25: so in Adv., qarrale/ws e)/xein to be
of good courage, pro\s qa/naton Pl.Ap.34e; pro\s tou\s polemi/ous X.An.2.6.14: Comp. -w/teron Isoc.Ep.7.3. in bad sense,
overbold, audacious, q. kai\ a)naidh/s Od.17.449; qarsale/h, ku/on a)dee/s 19.91; q. kai\ qrasei=s Pl.Lg.649c. Adv., yeudh= le/gein qarrale/ws Is.10.1.
that which may be ventured on, ta\ q., opp. ta\ deina/, Pl.Prt.359c,La.195c, al.; ta)lhqh= . . le/gein a)sfale\s kai\ q. Id.R.450e.

qarsa^l-eo/ths, Att. qarra^l-, htos, h(,
boldness, confidence, Andronic.Rhod.p.578M., Plu.Aem.36,2.443d, Jul.Or.3.107b, Them. Or.2.30b; opp. qrasu/ths, Ph.1.476.

qars-e/w, Att. qarre/w (cf. pr. n. *qarri/as IG12.847), Aeol. part. qe/rseisa (v.l. qars-) Theoc.28.3: (qa/rsos):—
to be of good courage, teqarsh/kasi laoi/ Il.9.420, etc.; a)/neu nou=, su\n nw=|, Pl.Men.88b; in bad sense,
to be over-bold, u(/brei q. Th.2.65: ma/thn q. Pl.Tht.189d:— Constr.: abs., Il.l.c., etc.; qa/rsei
fear not! 4.184, A.Supp.732, etc.; qarsei=te ib.600,910; qa/rsei, qume/ Sopat.14; qa/rrei Ar.Pl.328, al.:—in Epitaphs, qa/rsei . . ou)dei\s a)qa/natos CIG5200b (Ptolemais), etc.: part. in an adverb. sense, qarsh/sas ma/la ei)pe/
with good courage, Il.1.85, cf. A.Ch.666; ko/mpason qarsw=n Id.Ag.1671, cf. Pr.916, S.OC 491; qarse/ontes plou/tou pe/ri e)ri/zete Hdt.5.49; pi=qi qarrw=n Alex. 232; le/ge toi/nun qarrw=n Pl.Phdr.243e; qarrw=n plei/ona e)/quen h)\ o)knw=n hu)/xeto X.Ages.11.2; to\ teqarrhko/s
confidence, Plu.Fab.26; to\ qarrou=n th=s o)/yews Id.Cat.Mi.44: in aor.,
pluck up courage, kai\ to/te dh\ qa/rshse Il.1.92. c.acc., qa/rsei to/nde g' a)/eqlon
fear not about this contest, Od.8.197; later,
feelconfidence against, have no fear of, pa/nta Hdt.7.50; q. ge/rontos xei=ra E.Andr.993, cf. S.OC649; qa/naton Pl.Phd.88b; to\ toiou=ton sw=ma . . oi( me\n e)xqroi\ qarrou=sin . . Id.Phdr.239d; q. to\ a)pokri/nasqai Id.Euthd.275c; ou)/te *fi/lippos e)qa/rrei tou/tous ou)/te ou(=toi *fi/lippon D.3.7; xwri/on Philostr.Her.1.3: c.acc. cogn., h)li/qion qa/rros q. Pl.Phd.95c; ai)sxra\ qa/rrh q. Id.Prt.360b; tau)ta/ tisi q. kai\ fobei=sqai X.HG2.4.9;
venture, q. ta\s ma/xas Id.An.3.2.20:—Pass.,
to be risked, Philostr.Im.1.17. c. acc. pers., also,
to have confidence in, tina X.Cyr.5.5.42, D.C.51.11. q. tini/ ti
entrust to . . , Marin.Procl.
9. c. dat.,
have confidence in, teqarshko/tes toi=si o)/rnisi Hdt.3.76; e(autw=| Plu.2.69c (s.v.l.); toi=s xrh/masi PGoodsp.Cair.15.19 (iv A.D.). with Preps., q. peri/ . .
to be confident about . . , S.Aj. 793, Pl.R.574b; u(pe\r e(autw=n ib.566b; dia/ ti Isoc.3.55; e)pi/ tini Id.6.60; pro/s ti Pl.Prt.350b; pro\s e)mauto/n in myself, Ar.Ec.1060. c. inf.,
believe confidently that . . , S.Ant.668; also q. o(/ti . . Th.1.81, etc.; q. to\ e)cele/gcein D.19.3. c. inf.,
make bold, venture,X.Cyr. 8.8.6, Plu.Per.22, Ant.Lib.19.2. trans.,
inspire with confidence, [lo/goi] oi(/ me qarsoi=en J.AJ19.1.9.
qars-h/eis, essa, en,= qarsale/os, Call.Hec.1.1.5, Nonn.D.13.562.

qars-hro/s, a/, o/n,= foreg.,
Cat.Cod. Astr.7.218.

qa/rs-hsis, ews, h(,
confidence in a thing, tai=s nausi/ f.l. in Th.7.49.

qars-hte/on,
one must have confidence in, a)reth=| Iamb.Protr. 2.

qars-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
courageous, Arist.Pr.947b26.

qarsopoio/s, o/n,
making confident, Eust.1344.12.

qa/rsos, Att. qa/rros, Aeol. qe/rsos (q.v.), eos, to/, (qrasu/s)
courage, Il.6.126; q. tino/s
courage to do a thing, A.Ch.91, S.OC48: c. gen.,
courage against . . , polemi/wn Pl.Lg.647b; pro\s tou\s polemi/ous X.Cyr. 4.2.15; q. i)/sxe take
courage! S.Ph.807; q. e)/xein peri/ tinos Id.El.412; fresi\ q. a)e/cein Hes.Sc.96; ai)/rein pro/s ti E.IA1598; labei=n Act.Ap. 28.15; but q. e)/labe/ tinas Th.2.92; q. e)mpne/ein Od.9.381; e)ni\ fresi\ qei=nai 3.76; tw=| d' e)ni\ qumw=| qh=ke . . q. 1.321; e)n kradi/h| ba/llein Il.21.547; parasxei=n, e)mpoiei=n tini, Th.6.68, X.An.6.5.17; q. e)ggi/gnetai, e)mpi/ptei tini/, Id.Cyr.4.2.15, HG7.1.31; e)mfu/setai Id.Cyr.5.2.32; ou)/t' e)lpi/dos ga\r ou)/te tou do/chs o(rw= q. par' h(mi=n w(s . . E.Hec.371: pl., fo/boi kai\ qa/rrh Arist.EN1107a33, cf. Pl.Prt.360b.
that which gives courage, o)lolugmo/n . . , qa/rsos fi/lois A.Th.270, cf. 184: pl., qa/rsh
grounds of confidence, E.IT1281 (lyr.). rarely in bad sense, = qra/sos,
audacity, qa/rsos a)/hton e)/xousa Il.21.395; mui/hs qa/rsos e)ni\ sth/qessin e)nh=ken the
reckless persistence of a fly, 17.570.—On the diff. of qa/rsos and qra/sos, v. qra/sos.

qarsou/ntws, Att. qarr-, Adv. from gen. pres. part. of qarse/w,
boldly, X.Smp.2.11, Phld.Rh.1.325S., Jul.Or.2.83a; q. e)/xein D.C. 53.3.

qa/rsu^nos, on,= qarsale/os, Il.16.70: c. dat.,
relying on a thing, oi)wnw=| 13.823.

qarsu/nw [u_], Att. qarru/nw, causal of qarse/w,
encourage, embolden, qa/rsunon (aor. imper.) de/ oi( h)=tor Il.16.242; qarsu/neske parista/menos e)pe/essin 4.233; q. mu/qw| 10.190; q. lo/gois, opp. fobei=n, A.Pers.216 (troch.); e)/rgw| kai\ lo/gw| X.Cyr.6.3.27, cf.Hdt.2.141, Th.2.59, etc. intr.,= qarse/w, a)ll', w)= fi/lh, qa/rsune S.El.916.—Cf. qrasu/nw.
*qarsw/, ou=s, h(, name of Athena, Sch.Il.5.2.
qa=sai, qa=sqe, v. *qa/omai.

*qa/sios [a^], a, on,
of or
from Thasos, *qa/sios (sc. oi)=nos)
Thasian wine, Hermipp.82.3, Ar.Fr.317, etc.; *qa/sion oi)/nou stamni/on Id.Lys.196, cf. Ec.1119; *qa/sia ka/rua
almonds, Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath.14.647f, Aët.12.37; so *qa/sia alone, Plu.2.1097d, Dsc.4.188, Gp.10.57 tit.: in sg., ib.76.6: h( *qasi/a a(/lmh
pickled sea-fish, Cratin.6; and without a(/lmh, a)nakuka=n *qasi/an to make
this pickle, Ar.Ach.671. *qa/sios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Temnos, Wiener Denkschr.53.96 (prob.). *qa/sion, to/, a measure in Egypt, PCair.Zen.12.19 (iii B.C.), al.
qa=sson, Att. qa=tton, v. taxu/s. qa/ssousa: speu/dousa, Hsch.

qa/ssw, Ep. qa^a/ssw (q.v.),
sit, sit idle, strato\s de\ qa/ssei E.Supp. 391; h(/suxos q. Id.Ba.622 (troch.); a)mfi\ bwmo/n Id.Rh.509; e)p' a)ktai=s Id.Hec.36; tri/podi e)n xruse/w| Id.IT1253 (lyr.); pro\s ba/qrois Id.HF 715: c. acc. sedis, qa/ssein qro/non S.OT161 (lyr.); q. tri/poda E.Ion91 (anap.); q. da/pedon Id.Andr.117 (lyr.): c. acc. cogn., q. dusth/nous e(/dras
to sit in wretched posture, Id.HF1214, cf. Ar.Th.889. (qa_ssw contr. fr. qaa/ssw （qa^va^kyw, cf. qa/bakos): v. qa=kos, qoa/zw.)
qa/sswn, Att. qa/ttwn, v. taxu/s. qa/tas: qh=tas （qu/tas cod.), tou\s dou/lous (Cypr.), Hsch. qate/ra|, qa/teron, v. e(/teros.

qa_te/rws, Adv.
in the other way, Simp.in Ph.210.10.

qa_th/r, h=ros, o(, Dor. for *qa_hth/r,= *qeath/r,= qeath/s, B.9.23, Hsch. qa_tu/s, u/os, h(, Dor. for *qahtu/s,= *qeatu/s,= qewri/a, Id. s.v. e)s qatu/n. qaulaki/zein, = qulak-, Id. qaule/a: ou)ra/, ke/rkos, Id. qau/lia, ta/, a festival, Id.:—also qauli/zein, Id.: prob. connected with *qau/lios, epith. of Zeus at Pharsalus, Hermes 46.154, 286. (Possibly =
throttler, cf. *kan-dau/lhs = *kuna/gxhs (q.v.).)

qau=ma, atos, to/, Ion. qw=ma (cf. qauma/zw): (v. qea/omai): of objects,
wonder, marvel, in Ep. always in sg., Il.13.99, etc.; qau=m' e)te/tukto pelw/rion, of Polyphemus, Od.9.190; qau=ma brotoi=si, of a beautiful woman, 11.287; a)/speto/n ti q., of Hercules, S.Tr.961 (lyr.), etc.: freq. c. inf., q. i)de/sqai
a wonder to behold, Il.5.725, etc.; q. i)dei=n h.Ven.205, Hes.Sc.318; q. i)dei=n eu)kosmi/as E.Ba.693; q. a)kou=sai Pi.P. 1.26; q. a)ne/lpiston maqei=n S.Tr.673, etc.; qau=m' o(/ti . .
strange that . . , Theoc.15.2; ou) qau=ma/ [e)sti] no
wonder, Pi.N.10.50; so kai\ q. g' ou)de/n and no
wonder, Ar.Pl.99; to\ mh\ pei/qesqai q. ou)de/n Pl.R.498d, etc.; ti/ tou=to q.; E.Hipp.439; h)= ma/la q. ku/wn o(/de kei=tai Od.17.306; qw=ma poiei=sqai/ ti Hdt.1.68; ti/ tinos Id.9.58; tinos Id.7.99; peri/ tinos Id.3.23: after Hom. in pl., qau/mat' e)moi\ klu/ein A.Ag.1166 (v.l. qrau/mat'） qau/mat' a)nqrw/pois o(ra=n E.Ion1142; qauma/twn krei/ssona or pe/ra things more than
wondrous, Id.Ba.667, Hec.714. in pl., also,
puppetshow, toy theatre, q. deiknu/nai, e)pideiknu/nai, Pl.R.514b, Lg.658c; e)n q. Thphr.Char.6.4, cf. 27.7, Ph.1.28;
mountebank-gambols, X.Smp. 2.1, cf. 7.3 (sg.); e)n toi=s q. u(pekri/neto mi/mous in the
jugglers' booths, Ath.10.452f; of menageries, Isoc.15.213; of mechanical devices, Arist.Mech.848a11: metaph., e)/nioi q. poiou=sin e)n filosofi/a| Phld.Rh. 1.99S.: sg.,
puppet, Pl.Lg.644d;
trick, to\ th=s sofistikh=s duna/mews q. Id.Sph.233a.
wonder, astonishment, q. m' e)/xei w(s . . Od.10.326, etc.; e)/sxon q. S.El.897; q. d' o)/mmasin pa/ra A.Eu.407; q. m' u(pe/rxetai S.El.928; m' e)la/mbane q. Ar.Av.511; qau/matos a)/cios worthy of
wonder, E.Hipp.906, etc.; e)n qw/mati ei)=nai to be
astonished, Hdt.1.68, cf. Th.8.14; e)n qw/mati e)/xesqai, e)ne/xesqai, Hdt.8.135,7.128; e)n q. e)ne/xesqai/ tinos
at a thing, Id.9.37; e)n qau/mati poiei=sqai Plu.Pomp.14; dia\ qau/matos sxei=n Hdn.2.2.7: pl., qauma/twn e)pa/cia E.Ba.716, cf. Pl. Lg.967a.

qaum-a/zw, Ion. qwm-, Att. fut. qauma/somai A.Pr.476, E.Alc.157, Pl.Prm.129c, Ep. qauma/ssomai Il.18.467; also qauma/sw Hp.Nat.Puer. 29, Plu.2.823f, etc. (in X.Cyr.5.2.12 qauma/zousi is restored for -sousi, qauma/sete is v.l. for -saite, Id.HG5.1.14): aor. e)qau/masa A.Th.772 (lyr.), etc., Ep. qau/masa h.Merc.414: pf. teqau/maka X.Mem.1.4.2, etc.:—Med., Gal.Med.Phil.2 (v.l.), Ael.VH12.30: aor. 1 e)qaumasa/mhn v.l. in Aesop.92; ou)k a)\n qaumas w/meqa (leg. -sai/meqa) Procl.in Prm.p.750S.; qauma/saito v.l. in J.BJ3.5.1:—Pass., fut. -asqh/somai Isoc.6.105, Th.2.41: aor. e)qauma/sqhn Id.6.12: pf. teqau/masmai Plb.4.82.1. abs.,
wonder, marvel, Il.24.394, Pl.Hp.Ma.282e, etc. c. acc.,
marvel at, Il.24.631, etc.; pto/lemo/n te ma/xhn te 13.11; tu/xh qauma/sai me\n a)ci/a S.OT777, cf. OC1152, El.393:—Pass., w(s te/ras q. Hdt.4.28; mh\ parw\n -a/zetai I
wonder why he is not present, S.OT 289.
honour, admire, worship, once in Hom. (but cf. qaumai/nw）, ou)/te ti qauma/zein . . ou)/t' a)ga/asqai Od.16.203; freq. later, as Hdt.3.80, A.Th.772 (lyr.), S.Aj.1093, etc.; q. tu/mbon patro/s E.El.519; mhde\ to\n plou=ton mhde\ th\n do/can th\n tou/twn qauma/zete, a)ll' u(ma=s au)tou/s D. 21.210; mhde\n q., Lat.
nil admirari, Plu.2.44b; technically, of the
attendance of small birds on the owl, Arist.HA609a15; q. pro/swpon
to show respect to a person, i.e.
comply with their request, LXX Ge. 19.21; q. tina/ tinos
for a thing, Th.6.36; q. tina\ e)pi\ sofi/a| Pl.Tht. 161c, X.Mem.1.4.2; a)po\ tou= sw/matos to\n neani/skon Plu.Rom.7:— Pass.,
to be admired, Hdt.7.204; u(po/ tinos Id.3.82; e)/n tini Th.2.39; tw=n progegenhme/nwn ma=llon -qhso/meqa Isoc.6.105; tou\s o(moi/ws teqaumasme/nous [poihta/s] Phld.Po.5.31; dia/ ti Isoc.4.59: c. gen., th=s r(w/mhs Philostr.VA7.42; xa/ris d' a)f' h(mw=n o)lome/nwn -a/zetai A. Th.703; ta\ ei)ko/ta q.
to receive proper
marks of respect, Th.1.38; q. tini/ Id.7.63.
say with astonishment, i(/na mhdei\s . . "ei)=ta to/t' ou)k e)/leges tau=ta . . ;" qauma/zh| D.19.25. c. gen.,
wonder at, marvel at, tou/tou (cj. for tou=to) Lys.7.23: c. part., o(\ d' e)qau/masa/ sou le/gontos Pl.Prt.329c, cf. Cri.50c; q. tw=n proqe/ntwn au)=qis le/gein Th.3.38; q. ti/ tinos
to wonder at a thing in a person, E.Hipp.1041; o(\ q. tou= e(tai/rou Pl.Tht.161b, cf. R.376a: c. dupl. gen., q. tou/tou th=s dianoi/as Lys.3.44:—these phrases are used in Att. as a civil mode of expressing dissent. rarely c. dat. rei,
to wonder at, Th.4.85. folld. by Preps., ta\ -o/mena peri/ tinos Pl.Ti.80c; q. peri/ tinos ti/ th=| te/xnh| sumba/lletai Sosip.1.37; e)pi/ sou qauma/zw, pw=s du/nh| . . Plb.23.5.12; qauma/sontai e)p' au)th=| LXXLe.26.32. freq. folld. by an interrog. sentence, qauma/zomen oi(=on e)tu/xqh Il.2.320; q. o(/stis e)/stai o( a)nterw=n Th.3.38; qauma/zontes ti/ e)/soito h( politei/a X. HG2.3.17; q. w(s ou)/pw pa/reisin Th.1.90, cf. X.Cyr.1.4.20, etc.; q. o(/ti I
wonder at the fact that . . , Pl.R.489a; polla/kis teqau/maka o(/pws . . Com.Adesp.22.46D.; but more commonly, q. ei) . . I
wonder if . . , as a more polite way of saying I
wonder that . . , Hdt.1.155, S. OC1140, Pl.Phd.97a; e)a\n . . le/gw, mhde\n qauma/sh|s Id.Smp.215a; o(\ kai\ qauma/zw, ei) . . D.19.86; qau/mazon a)kou/wn, ei) su\ mh\ ei)/hs . . , Lat.
mirum ni . . , Ar.Pax1292 (hex.).—This construction is freq. combined with one or other of the foregoing. c. acc., qau/maz' *)axilh=a, o(/ssos e)/hn oi(=o/s te Il.24.629; *thle/maxon qau/mazon, o(\ qarsale/ws a)go/reue they
marvelled at Telemachus, that he spake so boldly, Od. 1.382; to\ de\ qauma/zeskon (Ion. impf.), w(s . . 19.229; q. sou= glw=ssan, w(s qrasu/stomos A.Ag.1399, etc.: sts. without a connective, a)lla\ to\ qauma/zw: i)/don . . Od.4.655; sou= . . qauma/sas e)/xw to/de: xrh=n ga\r . . S. Ph.1362: sts. c. inf., qauma/zomen *(/ektora di=on, ai)xmhth\n e)/menai Il.5.601. c. gen., q. tino/s, h(/ntina gnw/mhn e)/xwn ktl. Antipho 1.5; q. tw=n . . e)xo/ntwn o(/pws ou) le/gousin Isoc.3.3; q. au)tou= ti/ tolmh/sei le/gein D.24.66; qauma/zw tino\s o(/ti . . Isoc.4.1; q. tw=n dunasteuo/ntwn ei) h(gou=ntai I
wonder at men in power supposing, ib.170; u(mw=n q. ei) mh\ bohqh/sete X.HG2.3.53; also q. au)tou= . . tou=to, w(s . . Pl.Phd.89a. c. acc. et inf., penqei=n ou)/ se q. E.Med.268, cf. Alc.1130: after a gen., qauma/zw de/ sou . . kurei=n le/gousan A.Ag.1199.

qaum-ai/nw, Ep. fut. qauma^ne/w,= qauma/zw 2,
admire, gaze upon, a)e/qlia qaumane/ontes Od.8.108; de/ndrea qau/maine (v.l. qa/mbaine) Pi.O.3.32, cf. Id.(?)Parth.ap. Sch.Il.Oxy.221 vii 11:—Pass., qaumai/nontai kai\ file/ontai Callicrat. ap. Stob.4.28.17, cf. Diotog. ap. eund.4.7.62. abs.,
wonder, ou)de\n dei= qaumai/nen (Dor. inf.), ei) . . Archyt. ap. eund.3.1.114.

qau/m-aktron, to/,
money paid to see conjurers' tricks, Sophr.120.

qaum-a^le/os, a, on,
wondrous, Hsch.
*qau/mas, antos, o(, the father of Iris, Hes.Th.265; allegorized by Pl.Tht.155d.

qauma/si-os [a^], a, on, Ion. qwm-, rarely os, on Luc.Im.19: (v. qau=ma ):—
wonderful, marvellous, o)/ssa h.Merc.443; xa/ris Hes.Th.584 (nisi neut. pl.); [o(do\s] qwmasiwte/rh Hdt.2.21; qwma/sia
wonders, marvels, ib.35: Sup. -w/tata Id.6.47; qauma/sia e)rga/zesqai Pl.Smp.220a; h(=tton qaumasta/, kai/per o)/nta qauma/sia less
admired, though
admirable, Plu.2.974d: c. inf., te/ras q. proside/sqai Pi.P.1.26; ou) q. [e)sti] c. inf., Ar.Th.468; e)/stin de\ . . tou=to . . q., o(/pws . . Id.Pl.340; q. tou= ka/llous
marvellous for beauty, X.An.2.3.9; pro\s th\n to/lman -w/tate Aeschin.3.152: with interrog., qauma/sion o(/son
exceedingly, Pl.Smp. 217a; qauma/si' h(li/ka D.19.24; to\ -w/taton what is
most wonderful, D.S.1.63. Adv. -i/ws
wonderfully, i.e.
exceedingly, Ar.Nu.
1240: freq. with w(s, q. w(s a)/qlios
marvellously wretched, Pl.Grg.471a; q. a)\n w(s hu)labou/mhn I should be
wonderfully cautious, D.29.1.
disposed to wonder, in Adv., w(=n ou) -i/ws g' e)/xousi Hp.Morb.Sacr. 1.
admirable, excellent, with slight irony, Pl.Phdr.242a, D. 19.113: freq. w)= qauma/sie Pl.R.435c, al.; w)= -w/tate a)/nqrwpe, in scorn, X.An.3.1.27. q. kai\ a)/logon
strange and absurd, Pl.Grg. 496a; qauma/sia . . e)rgazome/nous behaving
in an extraordinary manner, Id.Ap.35a.

qaumasi-o/ths, htos, h(,
disposition to wonder, Hp.Morb.Sacr.1, Arist.Top.126b15.
marvellous nature or
quality, o(/sa e)/xei -o/thta/ tina Clearch.69. as a title, h( sh\ q. your Excellency, CIG 3467.10(Sardes, v A.D.).
qaumasi-ourge/w, v.l. for qaumatourge/w, X. Smp.7.2:

qaumasi-ourgi/a, h(,
jugglery. Philostr.VA6.10: metaph., le/cews q.
wizardry of language, Phld.Rh.2.94 S.

qaum-asmo/s, o(,
marvelling, Phld.Rh.2.57 S., Corn.ND2, Dius ap. Stob.4.21.16, S.E.M.9.17, Plu.Aem.39, etc.

qaum-aste/os, a, on,
to be wondered at, e)kei=no q., w(s . . Pl.Plt.302a. neut. qaumaste/on
one must wonder, ei) . . E.Hel.85, cf. 499, Phld.Rh.2.27 S., etc.

qaum-asth/s, Ion. qwm-, ou=, o(,
admirer, Ps.-Hdt.Vit.Hom.5 (qwum- codd.), Arist. Rh.1384b37, al., Plu.Cat.Mi.25, Ph.Byz.Mir.4.2; e(autou= Phld.Vit. p.14J.

qaum-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to wonder or
admire, Arist.EN 1125a2, Stoic.2.62, Plu.2.41a; tinos Str.2.3.4.
expressing astonishment, [e)pirrh/mata] D.T.642.8. Adv. -kw=s, ei)pei=n Ph.1.648; e)/xein, diakei=sqai, Id.2.95, J.AJ8.6.5, cf. Phld.Mus.p.36 K.

qaum-astopoio/s,
mirificus, Gloss.

qaum-asto/s, Ion. qwm-, h/, o/n,
wonderful, marvellous, first in neut. as Adv., qaumasto
 gano/wnta h.Cer.10; e)/rga mega/la kai\ q. Hdt. 1 Prooem.; q. karpo/s Id.9.122; q. lo/xos gunaikw=n, of the Furies, A.Eu.46; ou)de
 tou/twn qaumasto
 e)moi/ S.Ph.191, etc.; o(\ pa/ntwn -o/taton Pl.Smp.220a; q. ple/gma, Medic., the
rete mirabile, Gal.5.196: c. acc., qaumasth\ to\ ka/llos Pl.Phd.110c; pa=san a)reth/n Id.Lg.945e: c. gen., th=s eu)staqei/as Plu.Publ.14; th=s e)pieikei/as Id.Per.39: c. dat., plh/qei Id.Caes.6; ple/osi e)so/meqa qwmasto/teroi Hdt. 9.122; pro/s ti Plu.2.980d: folld. by an interrog., ei), etc., qaumasto
 o(/son . . , Lat.
mirum quantum, Pl.Tht.150d, etc.; qaumasto
 h(li/kon D.24.122; qaumasta/ g', ei) . . X.Smp.4.3; ou)de
 q., ei) . . , Pl.Phdr.279a, R.390a; ou) dh\ q., ei) . . D.2.23. Adv. -tw=s Pl.Lg.633b; qaumastw=s w(s sfo/dra Id.R.331a: neut. pl. as Adv., Id.Smp.192b; qaumasta\ w(s S.Fr.960, E.IA943.
admirable, excellent, path/r, ui(o/s, o)/lbos, Pi.P.3.71,4.241, N.9.45; a(nh ga ou) stenakto\s . . , a)ll' ei)/ tis brotw=n q. S.OC1665; iron., pra/cas me
 eu)= q. a)
 ge/noit' a)nh/r A.Pers.212;
strange, absurd, q. kai\ geloi=a Pl.Tht.154b; qaumasta\ drw=ntes ib.151a; qaumasta\ e)rga/zetai behaves in
an extraordinary way, Id.Smp.213d, cf. qauma/sios 111; qaumasto
 poiei=s, o(/s . . X.Mem.2.7.13; w)= qaumaste/ Pl. Plt.265a; w)= qaumasto/tatoi X.An.7.7.10.
to be worshipped, ou)dei/s m' a)re/skei nukti\ qaumasto\s qew=n E.Hipp.106.

qaum-asto/w,
magnify, LXX
Ps.4.4, al., EM443.37:—Pass.,
to be regarded as a marvel, u(po/ tinwn Arist.HA633a8, cf. Plu.Per.28.

qauma^t-i/zomai,
marvel much, Hsch.
qauma^t-o/eis, essa, en, = qaumasto/s, Man.6.402.

qauma^topoi-e/w,
do wonders, play jugglers' tricks, Luc.Peregr.17, 21: metaph., q. toi=s o)no/masin Phld.Po.5.24, cf. Jul.Or.3.127c: c. acc., q. parapai/gnion Porph.Chr.27.

qauma^topoi-i/a, h(,
conjuring, juggling, Pl.R.602d, lamb.Myst.3.29. of orators,
a straining after the marvellous, Isoc.10.7(pl.).
marvellous achievement, D.C.57.21.

qauma^topoi-iko/s, h/, o/n,
juggling: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),= foreg., Pl.Sph. 224a; to\q. mo/rion ib.268d.

qauma^to/s, h/, o/n, poet. for qaumasto/s, Pi.O.1.28, P.10.30; esp. in Ep. phrase, q. e)/rga h.Merc.80, 440, h.Bacch.34, Hes.Sc.165. (qaum
ṇto/s fr. qaumai/nw （qaum
ṇ-yw) as a)kh/ratos fr. khrai/nw.)

qauma^tourg-e/w, = qaumatopoie/w, X.Smp.7.2;
work wonders or
miracles, Ph.2.18,185; but ta\ peri/geia q. 'play tricks with', of Xerxes, Id.1.674; ta\ teqaumatourghme/na
wonderful phenomena, Pl.Ti. 80c.

qauma^tou/rg-hma, atos, to/,
wonder-work, Ph.2.93(pl.), Hld.10.39.
qauma^tourg-i/a, h(, = qaumatopoii/a, Pl.Lg.670a, Iamb.Myst.3.29; tou= qeou= Just.Nou. 40.1.1(pl.).

qauma^tourg-o/s, o/n, = qaumatopoio/s, gunai=kes
acrobats, Ath.4.129d.
puppet-maker or
-showman, Hero Aut.1.7(pl.).
qau=non: qhri/on, Hsch. qaush/kri: qewrei=on, prob. f.l. for qatu/s: i)kri/on, q., Id. qaxqh=men, v. qa=cai.

qayi/a, h(,
deadly carrot, Thapsia garganica, Arist.Pr.864a5, Thphr. HP9.9.1,6, Dsc.4.153, Plin.HN13.124.

qa/yi^nos, h, on,
yellow-coloured, yellow, sallow, gunh/ Ar.V.1413; kro/kh IG12.330.17; xrw=ma Plu.Phoc.28; xitw/n Callix.2.

qa/yos, h(,
fustic, Rhus Cotinus, used for dyeing yellow, brought from the island of Thapsos, Theoc.2.88, Nic.Al.570: qayi/a r(i/za Thphr. Fr.170.
*qa/w, v. qa/omai.
qauma^/tourg-qe, inseparable suffix, v. -qen.

qea/, h(, in later Ep. qeh/ Call.Dian.119, dat. qeh=| A.R.3.549 codd. (Hom. has dat. pl. qeh=s, qeh=|si, Il.3.158, 8.305), Lacon. sia/ Ar.Lys. 1263(lyr.): fem. of qeo/s (q.v.) in Ep., Trag.(with imitations in Com., as Antiph.81, Eub.64), Att. in set phrases (v. infr.) and later Prose: —
goddess, opp. gunh/, Il.14.315: with another Subst., q. mh/thr 1.280; qeai\ nu/mfai 24.615; *palla\s q. S.Ant.1184; qeoi\ qeai/ te A.Th.87(lyr.); ma\ qeou/s, ma\ qea/s Pl.Smp.219c; ma\ tou\s qeou\s kai\ ta\s qea/s D.19.67; toi=s dw/deka qeoi=s kai\ tai=s semnai=s qeai=s IG22.112.9, cf. Antiph.206.2, Anaxandr.2; tw=| qew=| kai\ th=| qea=| IG12.76.39: in dual, of Demeter and Persephone, mega/la qea/ S.OC683 (in earlier Att. tw\ qew/, v. qeo/s）; ai( qeai/ IG22.661.28 (iii B.C.); ai( semnai\ q. the Erinyes, S.OC458, etc.; deinai/, a)nw/numoi q., E.El.1270, IT944. name of third to/pos, Vett. Val.69.12, Paul.Al.L.3, cf. Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).144. [^-, but sts. monosyll. in Trag., as E.Andr.978.]

qe/a_, Ion. qe/h, h(, (qea/omai)
seeing, looking at, qe/hs a)/cios, = a)cioqe/htos, Hdt.1.25, cf. X.HG6.2.34; qe/an labei=n to take or get
a view, S. Ph.536, 656; e)s qe/an [tino\s] e)/rxesqai, e)pi\ qe/an ta)ndro\s e)lqei=n, to go
to see, E.IA427, Pl.La.179e; kata\ qe/an a)nabai/nein tou= xwri/ou Th. 5.7, cf. 9, 6.31; h)griwme/nos e)pi\ th=| qe/a| tino/s at the
sight of . . , X. Cyr.1.4.24; badi/zein e)pi\ kwmw|dw=n qe/an Id.Oec.3.7. of the mind,
contemplation, h( tou= o)/ntos q. Pl.R.582c, cf. Arist.Ph.209b20, etc.
aspect, diapreph\s th\n q. E.IA1588; ai)sxra\n q. pare/xein X.Eq.7.2; a)po\ th=s q. ei)ka/zein Luc.VH1.11; u(podu=sa qe/an a)nqrw/pou having assumed the
appearance of a human being, Palaeph.48.
that which is seen, sight, *zhni\ duskleh\s q. A.Pr.243; ma/l' a)/zhlos q. S.El.1455; w(s i)/dw pikra\n q. E.Hipp.809; a)tarbh\s th=s q. without fear
of the sight, S.Tr.23: pl., qe/ai a)mh/xanoi to\ ka/llos Pl.R.615a.
spectacle, performance, in a theatre or elsewhere, Thphr.Char.5.7, etc.; e)n tai=s q. kai\ e)n tai=s pompai=s CIG3068 A 22 (Teos), cf. Plu.Caes. 55, Brut.21, Hdn.1.15.1(pl.); mega/lai q.,=
Ludi Magni, Plu.Cam. 5.
place for seeing from, seat in the theatre (cf. ai)/geiros）, qe/an ei)s ta\ *dionu/sia katanei=mai toi=s pre/sbesi Aeschin.2.55, cf. D.18.28; qe/an katalamba/nein to occupy one, Id.21.178; prokat alamba/nein Luc.Herm.39; e)/xein e)n tw=| qea/trw| Plu.Flam.19, etc.
auditorium, IG22.1176. ai)/dessai/ me qe/as u(/per revere me
by thy countenance, dub. in h.Cer.64 codd. (prob. qea\n su/ per).

qeaggeleu/s, e/ws, o(,
one who proclaims a festival, Hsch.:—fem. qea/ggelis, idos, name of an intoxicating herb, used by the Magi, Plin. HN24.164.
qeagenh/s: o(/sios, qeosebh/s, Hsch. qea/gissa, v. qeago/s.
qe/agon,= qei=on (A) (at Salamis in Cyprus), Hsch.

qea_go/s, o(, (qeo/s, a)/gw)
priest who carried images of the gods in Egypt, PPetr.3P.239 (iii B.C.), PTeb.61（
b).59 (ii B.C.), PRyl.196.14 (ii A.D.), etc.:—fem. qea/gissa, h(, PSI9.1039.45 (iii A.D.), al.

qea^gwg-e/w,
evoke gods, Iamb.Myst.3.6:—hence qea^gwg-i/a, h(, ib.2.10:— Adj. qea^gwg-o/s, o/n, lo/gos PMag.Par.1.975,985.

qea/zw,
to be divine, Democr.21.

qe/aina^, h(, Ep. for qea/,
goddess, in Hom. mostly in phrase pa/ntes te qeoi\ pa=sai/ te qe/ainai Il.8.5, cf. Od.8.341, al.; qew=n te kai\ qeainw=n Antiph.81.3: in later Ep., Call.Dian.29.

qeai/thtos, on,
obtained from God, trans. of Samuel, J.AJ5.10.3: as pr. n. in Plato, etc.

qe/-a_ma, Ion. qe/hma, atos, to/, (qea/omai)
sight, spectacle, Semon.7.67, A.Pr.306, E.Supp.783, Ar.Av.1716, etc.; ei)/ tis o)rxoi=t' eu)=, qe/am' h)=n Pl.Com.130; opp. ma/qhma, Th.2.39; freq. of a sight which gives pleasure, qea/mata kai\ a)kroa/mata h(/dista pare/xeis X.Smp.2.2, cf. 7.5; o)rxh/seis kai\ qea/mata Phld.Mus.p.26 K.; e)mplh/sqhte tou= kalou= q. Pl. R.440a; but also q. dusqe/aton A.Pr.69, cf. S.Aj.992; e(pta\ q. the seven
wonders of the world, Str.14.2.5, Plu.2.983e: sg., of a marvellously engraved ring, Gal.UP17.1.

qe-a/mwn [a_], Ion. qeh/mwn, gen. onos, o(, h(,
spectator, APl.5.365.
qeanh\ nh=sos, f.l. for qei/a no/sos (v. qei=os A), S.Fr.650.
qeanw=stai: oi( custh=res (Thess.), Hsch.

qea/omai, Ep. and Ion. qhe/omai (v. infr.), Dor. qa_e/omai, *qa/omai (qq. v.), imper. qew= Ar.Ach.262; opt. qhoi=o (for Att. qew=|o) Il.24.418; part. qheu/menos Hdt.7.146: Ion. impf. e)qhei=to, e)qheu=nto, Id.1.10, 3.136; Ep. qhei=to Od.5.75, etc., qheu=nto Il.7.444, al., e)qheu/mesqa Od.9.218, e)qeh=to Hp.Nat.Puer.13, qhe/sketo Poet. ap. Parth.21.2: fut. qea/somai [a_], Ion. -h/somai: aor. e)qea_sa/mhn, Ep. opt. qhh/saio, qhh/saito, Od.17.315, 5.74; 3pl. e)qhh/santo Euph.51.15; Ion. inf. qeh/sasqai (v.l. qea/s-) Hdt.1.8: Att. pf. teqe/amai X.Cyr.7.5.7: codd. of Hdt. vary betw. qeh- and qhh-: a rare Ion. contr. of qhh- to qh- is found in qhsai/at' Od.18.191, qhsa/menos IG12.826:—
gaze at, behold, mostly with a sense of
wonder, qheu=nto me/ga e)/rgon Il.7.444, cf. Od.2.13; laoi\ d' au)= qheu=nto/ te qa/mbhsa/n te Il.23.728, cf. Hdt.1.8,11, etc.; q. ta\ kala/ Democr.194; pa/ntes w(/sper a)/galma e)qew=nto au)to/n Pl.Chrm. 154c; q. o)/mmasi E.Ion232 (lyr.); zhtei= to\ kako\n teqea=sqai Ar.Th.797 codd.; e)qea=to . . th\n qe/sin th=s po/lews . . , w(s e)/xoi
reconnoitred it, Th.5.7; q. ku/klw| th\n po/lin X.Cyr.4.5.7: abs., qea=|;
do you see? Men.Epit. 564. of the mind,
contemplate, to\ a)lhqe/s Pl.Phd.84b, al.
see clearly, i(/n' i)/dhte kai\ qea/shsqe o(/ti . . D.4.3, cf. Pl.Prt.352a; with relat. clause, o(/sh deino/ths h)=n e)n tw=| *fili/ppw| qea/sesqe D.18.144.
view as spectators, esp. in the theatre, Isoc.4.44; oi( qew/menoi
the spectators, Ar.Ra.2, cf.Nu.518, al. (but also,
onlookers, bystanders, Antipho 3.3.7): metaph., q. to\n po/lemon
to be spectators of the war, Hdt. 8.116. q. to\ stra/teuma
to review it, X.Cyr.5.5.1. Act. qea/w, late, Baillet
Tombeaux des rois à Thèbes 1080: elsewh. in imper. qe/a Them.Or.3.44b, Jul.Ep.89b, Hsch.: aor. e)qea/qhn in pass. sense, Ps. -Callisth.2.42, Ev.Marc.16.11, Ap.Ty.Ep.49, Just.Nov.133.3.1: pres. qew=ntai Philostr.Her.2.9. (Orig. prob. qa_v e/omai and qa_va/omai, cf. qau=-ma.)

qea/restos [a^], on,
pleasing to God, Eustr.in EN35.34. Adv. -tws Sch.Iamb.Protr.13.

qea/rion [a_], to/, Dor. for qew/rion (q.v.),
meeting-place of qewroi/, Pi. N.3.70. qea/rios, o(, Doric epith. of Apollo as god of oracles, IG4.748.16 (Troezen, iv B.C.), Paus.2.31.6.

qea_ri/s, i/dos, fem. Adj.
of or
for the qewroi/, o(do/s IGRom.4.360.23 (Pergam., ii A.D.).
qea_rodo/kos, qe-doki/a, Dor. for qewp- (q.v.).
qea_ro/s, o(, Dor. for qewro/s (q.v.): *qearoi/, oi(, title of poem by Epich., Ath.9.408d.

qe/a_sis, ews, h(,
contemplation, Porph.Abst.4.6.
insight, Gal. 1.52.
qeastiko/s, h/, o/n, （qea/zw） = e)nqousiastiko/s, bh=ma Mim.Oxy.413.91.

qea_t-e/on,
one must see, Pl.Phd.66e, R.390d.

qea_t-h/s, Ion. qehth/s, ou=, o(, (qea/omai)
one who sees or
goes to see, th=s xw/rhs Hdt.3.139, cf. E. Ion301; in the theatre,
spectator, Ar.Nu.575, al.; q. sofistw=n Th. 3.38;
one who contemplates, ta)lhqou=s Arist.EN1098a31.

qea_t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
for seeing, du/namis q. tinw=n Arr.Epict.1.6.3.

qea_t-o/s, h/, o/n,
to be seen, S.Aj.915; q. sofoi=s [*)/erws] Pl.Smp.197d, cf. Isoc.2.49; mo/nw| nw=| Pl.Phdr.247c; cf. qahto/s.
qea_tr-ei=on, to/,= qe/atron, Suid.
qea_/tr-ia, h(, fem. of qeath/s, Com. ap.Poll.2.56.
qea_tr-i/dion, to/, Dim.of qe/atron, Varro RR3.5.13.

qea_tr-i/zw,
to be or
play on the stage, Suid. Pass.,
to be made a show of, held up to shame, Ep.Hebr.10.33.

qea_tr-iko/s, Ion. qehtriko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the theatre, theatrical, mousikh/ Arist.Pol.1342a18; o)/yis Plu.Alex. 19: -ka/, ta/,
properties, etc., OGI510.7(Ephesus, ii A.D.): -koi/, oi(,
actors, BCH44.88 (Lagina). Adv. -kw=s, ei)pei=n Plu.2.1076c.
pretentious, Hp.Medic.4; q. me/n . . a)ni/atron de/ Antyll. ap. Orib.10.23.24; to\ q. Plu.2.7a,15e. Adv. -kw=s, polemei=n, strathgei=n, Id.Luc. 11,Lys.21. po/des q. dub. sens. in IG11(2).203 B13 (Delos, iii B.C.), cf. Inscr.Délos291b30.

qea_tr-ismo/s, o(,
theatrical exhibition, Vett.Val.18.1 (pl.), cf. Thom.Mag.p.283R.

qea_tr-isth/s, ou=, o(,
stageplayer, Hsch., Suid. s.v. h)qolo/gos.

qea_tro-ko/pos, on,
courting applause, Ptol.Tetr.165:

qea_tro-kopi/a, h(,
courting of applause, in pl., Artem.2.70.
qea_tro-korasi/a (sic),= o)xlokorasi/a (sic), EM444.16 (better qea_tro-krasi/a in both words, Suid.; cf. sq.).

qea_tro-kra^ti/a, h(,
rule exercised by the spectators in a theatre, Pl.Lg.701a.

qea_tro-ku^nhge/sion, to/, in pl.,
beast-hunts in the amphitheatre, Ausonia6.9* (Gortyn), Just.Nov.105.1:—also qea_tro-ku^nh/gion, to/, ibid.

qea_tro-ma^ne/w,
to be mad after stage-plays, Man.4.277, Ph.2.167.

qea_tro/-morfos, on,= qeatroeidh/s,
theatre-shaped, Lyc.600.

qe/a_tron, Ion. qe/htron, to/, (qea/omai)
place for seeing, esp.
for dramatic representation, theatre, Hdt.6.67, IG22.1176, al.; as
a place of assembly, Th.8.93, Lys.13.32, SIG976.4 (Samos, ii B.C.), Posidon.36 J., Act.Ap.19.20, etc.; q. kunhgetiko/n, of the Roman
amphitheatre, D.C. 43.22; ei)s to\ q. ei)sfe/rein to bring upon
the stage, Isoc.12.122; to\ kalo\n tou= q. a good place in the
theatre, Ael.VH2.13, cf. Alciphr.3.20. collective for oi( qeatai/,
the spectators, 'the house', Hdt.6.21, Ar.Eq.233, al., Pl.Smp.194b, Com.Adesp.3D.: metaph., e)ka/qhnto qe/atron au)tw=| Lib.Ep.722.4. = qe/ama,
spectacle, q. e)genh/qhmen tw=| ko/smw| 1 Ep.Cor.4.9. metaph., of
life, touti\ to\ q. u(pekri/qhmen Porph.Marc.2.

qea_tro-poio/s, o/n,
making a theatre, Anaxandr.34.9 (s.v.l.).

qea_tro-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
one who sells seats in a theatre, Ar.Fr.562.

qea_tro-toru/nh [u_], h(,= toru/nh qea/trou,
stage-pounder, epith. of Melissa, who was a clumsy dancer, Ath.4.157a.

qeatr-w/dhs, es,
theatrical, in a bad sense, of persons, Vett.Val.14.27.

qeatr-w/nhs, ou, o(,
lessee of a theatre, Thphr.Char.30.6.

qea/fion, to/,= qei=on (A),
sulphur, Hsch.: qe/afos, o(, Eust.1935.22.
qea/w, v. qea/omai. *qedai/sios, v. *qeodai/sia 11.
qeeidh/s, e/s, （qeo/s） = qeoeidh/s, [a)/nqrwpos] pa/ntwn qhri/wn qeeide/staton Antipho Soph.48 (prob. l.).

qe/einos, h, on,
sulphur-coloured, PTeb.405.13 (iii A.D.).
qe/eion, qeeio/w, Ep. for qei=on (A), qeio/w (q.v.):—also qe/eios, for qei=os (A): qeei/w: qauma/zw, Suid.
qeh-genh/s, e/s, poet. for qeogenh/s, Orph.A.1347, Q.S.6.9.

qeh-gore/w,
discourse of God, Olymp.Alch.p.84 B.

qeh-go/ros, o(,
one who discourses of God, Id.p.83 B.; but,
inspired by God, Hld.2.4; mu=qos
spoken by a goddess, Orph.A.541.
qeh-do/xos, on, poet. for qeodo/xos, Nonn.D. 13.96.

qeh/i+os, h, on, Ion. for qe/eios, qei=os (A),
divine, BionFr.15.9.

qehkol-e/w,
to be a qehko/los, IG22.1364 (i A.D.), prob. in Inscr.Olymp.468 (iii A.D.); pai=das a)oidopo/lous *zhni\ -e/ontas BCH50.529 (ii A.D.).

qehkol-ew/n, w=nos, o(,
dwelling of a qehko/los, Paus.5.15.8.
qehko/ros, o(,= -ko/los, Ap.Ty.Ep.26tit.

qehl-a^si/a, h(,
visitation of God, Sch.S.Tr.1235 (h)lasi/a cod.).

qehl-a^te/omai,
to be visited by God, Hld.8.10.
complain of God's visitations, Id.6.8.

qeh/l-a^tos, on, (e)lau/nw)
driven by a god, qehla/tou boo\s di/khn A.Ag.1297; q. dai/mones Plu.2.830f.
sent or
caused by a god, of things evil in themselves or in their consequences, fqorh/ Hdt.7.18; e)/rgon, pra=gma, ma/nteuma, S.Ant.278, OT255,992; no/sous d' a)na/gkh ta\s q. fe/rein Id.Fr.680; e)/k tinos qehla/tou from some
destiny, E.Ion1392.
built for the gods, e(/drai ib.1306.
qe/hma, atos, to/, Ion. for qe/ama, Semon.7.67.
qehma/xos [a^], on, poet. for qeom-, AP9.769 (Agath.); fu=la *giga/ntwn Procl.H.7.8.

qehmosu/nh, h(,
contemplation: a problem, AP11.352.10 (Agath.).
qeh/mwn, onos, o(, h(, Ion. for qea/mwn, APl.5.365.
qehpole/w, poet. for qeop-, Phot., Suid.
qehth/s, qe/htron, Ion. for qea_th/s, qe/a_tron.
qe/qmion, to/,= qe/smion, v. qe/smios 11:—also qeqmo/s, o(, Dor.,= qesmo/s (q.v.): and qeqtmo/s, Schwyzer 411 (Elis).

qei/a, h(,
one's father's or
mother's sister, aunt, POxy.274.5 (i A.D.), Ammon.Diff.p.130 V., etc. (Late formation fr. qei=os (B), replacing thqi/s.)

qei-a/zw, (qei=os A)
to be inspired, frenzied, o(po/soi au)tou\s qeia/santes e)ph/lpisan as many as made them hope
by divinations, Th.8.1; q. kai\ qeoforei=tai
is divinely inspired, Ph.1.479; o(po/soi teletai=s e)qei/azon
obtained inspiration through ritual, Philostr.Her.5.3.
prophesy, o(/ti stratopedeu/soito D.C.Fr.57.48:—Pass., [lo/gos] e)pi\ th=| teleuth=| tou= *)aleca/ndrou e)qeia/sqh Arr.An.7.18.6; lo/gion u(po\ tou= o(mi/lou qeiasqe/n D.C.62.18.
worship as divine, Id.59.27; *puqago/ran kai\ *pla/twna Dam.Isid.36:—Pass., Max.Tyr.8.9.

qei-asmo/s, o(,
superstition, a)/gan qeiasmw=| proskei/menos, of Nicias, Th.7.50.
inspiration, frenzy, qeiasmoi=s ka/toxoi gunai=kes D.H.7.68; qeiasmou= [e)pirrh/mata], such as eu)oi(/, D.T.642.17.

qei-asth/s, ou=, o(,
worshipper, Tz.H.8.347.

qei-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
like one inspired. Adv. -kw=s Poll.1.16.

qeia/fion, to/,
sulphur, Tz.H.12.743.

*qei/ba_qen, Adv., Boeot. for *qh/bhqen,
from Thebes, Ar.Ach.862:— *qei/ba_qi,
at Thebes, ib.868 codd. (*qei/ba_qe
from Thebes, Elmsl.).
qei/kelos, dub. l. in Ar.Lys.1252 codd. (sioei/keloi Mein., suei/keloi Wilam.).
qei+ko/s, h/, o/n, late form for qei=os (A), qrhskei/a Cat.Cod.Astr.1.116; sofi/a MAMA1.228 (Laodicea Combusta).

qeilo-pedeu/w,
dry in the sun, stafulh/n Dsc.5.6 (Pass.).

qeilo/-pedon, to/,
sunny spot in the vineyard where grapes were dried, Od.7.123, AP6.169, 9.586 (Comet.), Sch.E.Or.1492; qeilope/dou tro/pon Dsc.1.32; v. ei(lo/pedon.
*qeilou/qios, o( (sc. mh/n), month in Boeotia, IG7.2861, al.: written *qhlou/qios ib.3326, al.
qei=men, for qei/hmen, 1pl. aor. 2 opt. Act. of ti/qhmi.
qeimwniai/: oi( swroi\ tw=n dragma/twn, Hsch. (Boeot. for qhm-).
qei=nai, aor. 2 inf. Act. of ti/qhmi.
qeini/on, v. qini/on.
qei+no/s, h/, o/n,= qi=nos (q.v.), GDI4940.26 (Crete).

qei/nw, Ep. inf. qeine/menai Od.22.443: impf. e)/qeinon A.Pers.418, etc.: fut. qenw= Ar.Ach.564: aor. 1 part. qei/nas Il.20.481 (e)/qeine in 21.491 may be impf.); other moods from an aor. 2 e)/qenon (which does not occur in ind.); imper. qe/ne E.Rh.676, Ar.Av.54; subj. qe/nw E.Rh.687 (troch.), Ar.Lys.821 (lyr.), cj. in Theoc.22.66; inf. qenei=n E.Heracl. 271; part. qenw/n Id.Cyc.7, Ar.Eq.640,V.1384,Av.1613,Ra.855 (these forms were freq. incorrectly written qe/nein, qe/nwn, as if from a pres. *qe/nw):—Pass., only in pres. and impf.:—poet. word,
strike, tina Od. 18.63; ci/fesi 22.443; fasga/nw| au)xe/na qei/nas Il.20.481; ma/stigi . . qei/nwn 17.430; [to/coisi] e)/qeine par' ou)/ata 21.491:—Pass., 1.588; qeino/menai bouplh=gi 6.135; a)/ori 10.484; qeinome/nou . . pro\s ou)/dei+
dashed to earth, Od.9.459; later ska/ptw| qenw/n tina Pi.O.7.28; r(aisth=ri A. Pr.56, cf. 76; tina\ di' a)spi/dos E.Heracl.738; i)te/an ei)s me/shn Id.Cyc.7; tw=| ske/lei qe/ne th\n pe/t ran Ar.Av.54; tw=| prwktw=| qenw\n th\n kigkli/d' Id.Eq.640; possi\ q. ske/los, of a wrestler, Theoc.22.66: abs., qei/nete v.l. in E.Or.1303 (lyr.); qei=n', a)nte/reide Id.Supp.702; qe/ne, qe/ne Id.Rh.676 (lyr.):—Pass., A.Pers.303, Ch.388 (lyr.). metaph., qei/nei d' o)nei/dei ma/ntin Id.Th.382. intr., of corpses, q. e)p' a)kta=s Id.Pers.966. to the same Verb, but only with the meaning
slay, belong the foll. forms formerly referred to a pres. *fe/nw, viz.: aor. 2 e)/pefnon Il.21.55, Pi.P.10.46, B.17.19, S.OT1497; Ep. and Lyr. pe/fnon Il.13.363, B.8.13; subj. pe/fnh|s, h|, Od.22.346, Il.20.172; inf. pefne/men 6.180; part. pefnw/n 16.827 (parox. acc. to Aristarch., as if from a pres. pe/fnw, which is found in late Ep., Opp.H.2.133): from the short form fa^ (for f
ṇ) come pf. Pass. 3sg. pe/fatai Il.15.140, al.; 3pl. pe/fantai 5.531; inf. pefa/sqai 13.447: fut. Pass. pefh/seai ib.829, Od.22.217; h)\ pe/fat' h)\ . . pefh/setai Il.15.140; later, part. pefasme/nos Lyc.269, 1374, Opp.H.5.122: Gramm. also give aor. 1 fa/sai Hsch. s.v. fa/sganon, Phot. s.v. prosfatos, Sch.Pi.N. 1.69: aor. 2 part. pafw/n Hsch.: aor. 2 Med. a)p-e/fato,= a)pe/qanen, Id. Hence also fa^to/s
slain, Id., found in compds. *)arei/-fatos, mulh/-fatos, o)dunh/-fatos, puri/-fatos. (I.-E.
g[uglide]hen- cf. Skt.
hánti, pl.
ghnánti, Hittite
kuenzi, pl.
kunanzi 'strike', 'kill';
g[uglide]hon- in Gr. fo/nos;
g[uglide]hn- in Skt.
ghn-ánti, Gr. e)/-pe-fn-on (redupl.);
g[uglide]hṇ- in Skt.
-hata-, Gr. -fato-, pe/fatai, etc.)
qeio-genh/s, e/s,= qeo-, Gloss.

qeio-da/mh [a^], h(, （dama/w)
she who tames the gods, Suid.:—Adj. qeio/-da^mos, a)na/gkai Orac. ap. Porph. ap. Eus. PE5.8.
qeio/-dmhtos, on,= qeo/-, AP9.157 (v.l. qeodhlh/tou).

qeio/-domos, on,
built by gods, tei=xos ib.7.138 (Acerat.), cf. 9.104 (Alph.).

qeio/qen, Adv., (cf. qei=os (A) 1.4)
from the Emperor, Just.Nov.82.9.
qeiolo/gos, o(, poet. for qeolo/gos, IG3.770 (i A.D.).
qei/omen, Ep. for qe/wmen, qw=men, 1pl. aor. 2 subj. Act. of ti/qhmi.

qei=on (A), Ep. qe/eion (in Od.22.493 qh/i+on), to/,
brimstone, used to fumigate and purify, de/pas . . e)ka/qhre qeei/w| Il.16.228; oi)=se qe/eion . . , kakw=n a)/kos Od.22.481; deinh\ de\ qeei/ou gi/gnetai o)dmh/, from a thunderbolt, Il.14.415; e)n de\ qeei/ou plh=to, of a ship struck by lightning, Od. 12.417; e)mbalo/ntes pu=r cu\n q. Th.2.77, cf. 4.100; *ku/rios e)/brecen e)pi\ *so/doma kai\ *go/morra q. kai\ pu=r LXX Ge.19.24; as a natural product, Hp.
Aër.7, Ph.2.21,143, Ti.Locr.99c; q. a)/puron Gal.12.903; opp. pepurwme/non, Dsc.5.107; cf. qea/fion, qe/afos. (Perh. cogn. with qu/w, qumia/w, Lat.
suffire.）

qei=on (B), to/,
the Divinity, v. qei=os (A) 11.

qeio-pa^gh/s, e/s,
god-made, i(sto/s Orac. ap. Phleg.Mir.10; cf. qeiofanh/s.

qeio-po/los, o(,
ministrant, Maiist.43.
qeio-pro/pos, o(, poet. for qeopro/pos, IG12(5).893.6 (Tenos, ii/iii A.D.); e)/ggone qeiopro/pwn, = qeopropi/dhs, Orac. ap. Porph.Abst.2.9.

qei=os (A), a, on: late Ep. qe/eios Procl.H.2.16; qeh/i+os Bion Fr.15.9; late Aeol. qh/i+os Epigr.Gr.989.4 (Balbilla); Lacon. sei=os (v. infr. 1.3): Comp. and Sup. qeio/teros, -o/tatos, freq. in Pl., Phdr.279a, Mx. 244d, al.: (qeo/s):
of or
