from the gods, divine, ge/nos Il.6.180; o)mfh/ 2.41; *)/oneiros ib.22; e)pipnoi/ais A.Supp.577, cf. Pl.R.499c; ma/stic A. Pr.682; mani/a S.Aj.611 (lyr.); no/sos ib.185 (lyr.) (but q. no/sos, of a dust-storm, Id.Ant.421); ki/ndunoi And.1.139; q. tini\ moi/ra| by
divine intervention, X.HG7.5.10; q. tu/xh| gegonw/s Hdt.1.126; q. tu/xh| xrew/menos Id.3.139; q. ka)po/nw| tu/xh|, of an easy death, S.OC1585; e)k q. tu/xhs Id.Ph.1326; e)/maqe w(s q. ei)/h to\ prh=gma Hdt.6.69; o( q. no/mos Th.3.82; fu/sis q. SIG1125.8 (Eleusis), cf. 2 Ep.Pet.1.4;
appointed of God, basilh=es Od.4.691; skh=ptron
given by God, S.Ph.139 (lyr.); v. infr. 2.
belonging or
sacred to a god, holy, a)gw/n, xoro/s, Il.7.298, Od. 8.264;
under divine protection, pu/rgos, do/mos, Il.21.526, Od.4.43; of heralds and bards, Il.4.192, Od.4.17, al.; so perh., of kings, ib. 691.
morethan human, of heroes, *)odusseu/s Il.2.335, al., Cratin. 144.4 (lyr.); q. a)nh/r Pi.P.6.38, A.Ag.1548 (lyr.), Pl.R.331e, Men.99d (esp. at Sparta (Lacon. sei=os), Arist.EN1145a29; w)= qei=e (in the mouth of a Spartan) Pl.Lg.626c); meta\ sou= th=s qei/as kefalh=s Id.Phdr.234d, cf. Them.Or.9.128a, Lib.Or.19.66. of things,
excellent, qei=on poto/n Od.2.341, 9.205; a(lo\s qei/oio Il.9.214; q. prh/gmata
marvellous things, Hdt.2.66; e)n toi=si qeio/taton Id.7.137. = Lat.
divinus (or
sacer), Imperial, diata/ceis prob. in BGU473.5（200 A.D.), etc.; qhsauroi/ PLips.62ii14 (iv A.D.); q. o(/rkos oath
by the Emperor, POxy.83.6 (iv A.D.), etc.; qeio/tatos, of living Emperors, Inscr.Prien.105.22 (9 B.C.), etc. = Lat.
divus, of deified Emperors, q. *sebasto/s Edict.Claud. ap.J.AJ19.5.3, cf.Inscr.Perg.283 (iii A.D.), Lyd.Mag.2.3. as Subst., qei=on, to/,
the Divinity, Hdt.1.32,3.108, al., A.Ch.958 (lyr.); tou= q. xa/rin Th.5.70; h(marthko/ta ei)s to\ q. Pl.Phdr.242c. in an abstract sense,
divinity, kekoinw/nhke . . tou= q. ib.246d; h)\ mo/non mete/xei tou= q . . . , h)\ ma/lista [a)/nqrwpos] Arist.PA656a8, etc.; kata\ qei=on or kata/ ti q., Aen.Gaz.Thphr.p.37 B., p.4 B. qei=a, ta/,
the acts of the gods, course of providence, S.Ph.452, etc.; ta\ q. qnhtou\s o)/ntas eu)petw=s fe/rein S.Fr.585; ta\ q. mh\ fau/lws fe/rein Ar.Av.961.
matters of religion, e)/rrei ta\ q.
religion is no more, S.OT910 (lyr.), cf. OC1537, X.Cyr.8.8.2, etc.
inquiries concerning the divine, Pl.Sph.232c; ta\ fanera\ tw=n qei/wn, i.e. the heavenly bodies, Arist.Metaph.1026a18, cf. GA731b24, Ph.196a33 (Sup.), EN1141b1. Adv. qei/ws
by divine providence, q. pws X.Cyr.4.2.1, etc.; qeiote/rws
by special providence, Hdt.1.122; ma=llo/n ti kai\ -o/teron ib.174.
divinely, excellently, eu)= ge kai\ q. Pl.Tht.154d; qei/ws ei)rh=sqai Arist.Metaph.1074b9.

qei=os (B), o(,
one's father's or
mother's brother, uncle, E.IT930, Ar. Nu.124, And.1.18,117, Pl.Chrm.154b, Men.5 D., etc.; o( pro\s mhtro\s q. Is.5.10; pro\s patro/s Ph.2.172. (Cf.th/qh.)
qeio/-steptos, -telh/s, v. qeo-.

qeio/ths, htos, h(,
divine nature, divinity, LXX Wi.18.9,Ep.Rom.1.20, SIG867.31 (Ephesus, ii A.D.), Plu.2.665a, etc. f.l.for o(sio/ths, Isoc.11.26, Plu.2.857a, and so prob. in Id.Sull.6. as title of Roman Emperors, Orib.1.1.1, SIG900.23 (Panamara, iv A.D.), etc.

qeiofa^nh/s, e/s,
manifested by the gods, Alex.162.14 (anap., v.l. -page/s).

qeio/xroos, on, contr. qeio/-xrous, oun,
brimstone-coloured, Dsc.5.101.

qeio/w, Ep. qeeio/w, (qei=on A)
fumigate with brimstone, o)/fra qeeiw/sw me/garon Od.22.482; qeiw/sas ta\s a)llotri/as e)pinoi/as, metaph., from the clothes-cleaner, who used sulphur, Lysipp.4:—Med., dw-ma qeeiou=tai he
fumigates his house, Od.23.50.
purify, hallow, qei/ou . . qesmo\n ai)qe/ros muxw=n dub. in E.Hel.866.
smear with sulphur, Gal.1.658 (Pass.); e)/rion teqeiwme/non
sulphurated, Orib.Fr. 35, Paul.Aeg.3.33. in Alchemy,
sulphurate, Ps.-Democr. ap. Zos.Alch.p.153B. (qei=os A)
hallow, consecrate, Pl.Lg.771b, Ph.1.374.

qei/w, Ep. for qe/w,
run. Ep. for qw=, 1sg. subj. aor. 2 of ti/qhmi.

qeiw/dhs (A), es, (qei=on A)
sulphureous, of waters, etc., Anon.Lond. 24.45, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.2.3, Archig. ap. Aët.3.167, Phlp.in Mete.7.5; o)dmh/ Str.1.3.18. of colour,
yellow, qw/rakes Apoc.9.17.

qeiw/dhs (B), es, (qei=os A)
divine. Adv. -dws
by Imperial decree, PMasp.451.42,56 (vi A.D.).
qe/kleon: qaumasto/n, Hsch. (fort. qe/skelon).

qelgesi/mu_qos [i^], on,
soft-speaking, AP9.525.9.

qe/lghtron, to/, (qe/lgw)
charm, spell, in pl., Hld.7.9: more usu. metaph., w)= fi/lon u(/pnou q. E.Or.211; po/qwn qe/lghtra Ath.5.22of; of music, Luc.Im.14; of a city, Id.Scyth.5; cf. qe/lktron.

*qelgi=nes, = *telxi=nes (q.v.),
wizards, hsch., Eust.1391.12.
qe/lgma, atos, to/,= qe/lghtron, Sch.Pi.P.1.21; glossed by qau=ma, Hsch.

qe/lgw, Ion. impf. qe/lgesken Od.3.264: fut. qe/lcw 16.298,A.Pr.865, Dor. -cw= Theoc.Ep.5.3: aor. e)/qelca Il. (v. infr.):—Med., Alc.Supp. 11.7:—Pass., fut. qelxqh/somai Luc.Salt.85: aor. e)qe/lxqhn Od.10.326, Ep. 3pl. -xqen 18.212:—poet. Verb (used by Pl.Smp.197e, and in late Prose, as Phld.Mus.p.72K., Jul.Or.4.150c, etc.),
enchant, be witch, [*(ermh=s] a)ndrw=n o)/mmata qe/lgei Od.5.47, al.; to\n . . *poseida/wn e)da/masse qe/lcas o)/sse faeina/ Il.13.435; [*ki/rkh] ou)d' w(\s qe/lcai se dunh/setai Od.10.291, cf. 326 (Pass.); [*seirh=nes] pa/ntas a)nqrw/pous qe/lgousin, o(/tis sfe/as ei)safi/khtai 12.40; [qu/ella] qe/lge no/on
spell-bound their senses, Il.12.255.
cheat, cozen, Od.16.195,298, S.Tr.710: c. dat. modi, mh/te ti/ moi yeu/dessi xari/zeo mh/te ti qe/lge Od.14.387; malakoi=si kai\ ai(muli/oisi lo/goisi 1.57; yeu/dessi, do/lw|, Il.21.276,604; e)/pessin Od.3.264. metaph.,
charm, beguile, 17.521; oi( e)lpi\s e)/qelge no/on h.Cer.37, cf. Pi.P.1.12, D.Chr.45.5; kai/ m' ou)/ti meliglw/ssois peiqou=s e)paoidai=sin qe/lcei A.Pr.174: su\ de\ qe/lgois a)\n a)/qelkton Id.Supp.1055; qe/lgei e)/rws E.Hipp.1274 (lyr.); w)|dh=s . . , h(\n a)/|dei qe/lgwn . . no/hma Pl.Smp.197e:—Pass., mh/q' u(/pnw| qelxqh=|s E.IA142 (lyr.); ta\ d' ou)/ti qe/lgetai A.Ch.420 (lyr.); e)/rw| d' a)/ra qumo\n e)/qelxqen Od.18.212; *mou/saisin . . th\n fre/na qelgome/nh (which may be Med.) IG14.1960. c. inf., i(/meros qe/lcei to\ mh\ ktei=nai
will persuade her not to kill, A.Pr. 865; e)/rws de/ nin . . qe/lceien ai)xma/sai ta/de S.Tr.355; e(/pesqai q. Ael. NA10.14.
produce by spells, a)oidai\ qe/lcan nin (sc. eu)frosu/nan) Pi.N.4.3; [*galh/nh] q. a)nhnemi/hn AP9.544 (Adaeus). (Perh. cf. Lith.
žuelgiù 'look', 'glance'.)
qelemo/s, o/n, epith. of pw=ma, A.Supp.1027 (lyr.): glossed by oi)ktro/n, h(/suxon, Hsch.; but,= qelhmo/s, acc. to Hdn.Gr.1.171, cf. EM103.48. Adv. -mw=s Hsch.

qe/l-eos, on,
willing, q. a)qe/leos, Lat.
nolens volens, A.Supp.862 (lyr.).

qe/l-hma, atos, to/, (qe/lw)
will, Antipho Soph.58 (pl.), Aen.Tact. 18.19, LXX Es.1.8, al., Ev.Matt.7.21, POxy.924.8 (iv A.D.). e)/stin moi q. e)/n tini
pleasure in . . , LXX Ec.12.1, cf. 5.3:—also qel-h/mh, h(, Theognost.Can.112.

qel-hmatiko/s, h/, o/n,
optional, voluntary, superfluous. Adv. -kw=s Eust.920.19.

qel-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of qe/lhma, e)/sxaton q. last
will and testament, PLond.1.77.12 (vi A.D.).

qel-hmo/s, o/n,
willing, Emp.35.6.
kindly, a)/lsos B.16.85; glossed by h(/suxos, Phot.
qel-hmosu/nh, h(,= qe/lhsis, PMag.Par.1.2921 (pl.).

qel-h/mwn, on, gen. onos,
voluntary, ei)resi/h A.R.2.557.

qe/l-hsis, ews, h(,
a willing, will, Stoic.3.41, LXX To.12.18,al., Phld.Rh.2.297 S., Ep.Hebr, 2.4; condemned by Poll.5.165: in Dor. pl. qelh/sies,
wishes, Meliss. Ep.
goodwill, favour, LXX Pr.8.35.

qel-hth/s, ou=, o(,
one who wills, e)le/ous ib.Mi.7.18, cf. Hsch.
wizard (by confusion of Hebr. '
ōbh 'necromancer' with '
ōbheh 'wishing'), LXX 4 Ki.21.6; = e)ggast ri/muqos, Cyr.

qel-hto/s, h/, o/n,
wished for, desired, LXX 1 Ki. 15.22,Ma.3.12.
qe/lk-tar, to/,= qe/lghtron, Hsch. (qe/rkal cod.).

qelk-th/r, h=ros, o(,
soother, charmer, qelkth\r o)duna/wn, of Asclepius, h.Hom.16.4; cf. qe/lktwr.

qelk-th/rion, to/,
charm, spell, of the girdle of Aphrodite, e)/nqa te/ oi( q. pa/nta te/tukto Il.14.215; of heroic lays, brotw=n qelkth/ria Od.1.337; qew=n q. 8.509; po/nwn qelkth/ria
means of lightening toil, A.Ch.670 (s. v.l.); glw/sshs e)mh=s mei/ligma kai\ q. Id.Eu.886; nekroi=s qelkth/ria, of offerings to the Manes, E.IT166 (lyr.); yuxh=s q. Men. 559.

qelk-th/rios, on,
enchanting, soothing, mu=qoi, lo/goi, A.Eu.81, E. Hipp.478; o)/mmatos q. to/ceuma the eye's
magic shaft, A.Supp.1004: c. gen., fi/ltra q. e)/rwtos E.Hipp.509; mu/qou mu=qos q. speech
that heals speech, A.Supp.447: in late Prose, q. a)gwni/smata, of poems, Agath. Praef.
qelk-tiko/s, h/, o/n,= foreg., du/namis Sch.E.Or.211.
qe/lk-tron, to/,= qelkth/rion, S.Tr.585, prob. in A.R.1.515 (nisi leg. qelktu/n).
qe/lk-twr, = qelkth/r, A.Supp.1040 (lyr., qea/kt- cod. M), cf. Suid. (qelktw/ codd.).

qelci^-eph/s, e/s,
speaking winning words, ga=rus B.14.48.

qelci^/-mbrotos, on,
charming men, *ku/pris Id.5.175; w)|dh/ Orph.L.320.

qelci^-melh/s, e/s,
charming with music, [fo/rmigc] IG3.400.

qelci^/-noos, on, contr. qelci^/-nous, oun,
charming the heart, fi/ltra AP6.88 (Antiphan.); e)/ar ib.10.15 (Paul. Sil.); *)/erwtes Musae.147.

qelci^/-pikros, on,
sweetly painful, knhsmonai/ App.Anth.3.158.

qe/lcis, ews, h(,
an enchanting, Ael.NA8.24, Plu.2.662a.
qelci/frwn, on, gen. onos,= qelci/noos, *)/erwtes E.Ba.404 (lyr.); palmo/s AP9.505.17; of Apollo, ib.525.9.
qelonth/s, ou=, o(,= e)qelonth/s (q.v.), Hierocl.p.56A., v.l. in Hdt. 6.92.

qe/lumna, wn, ta/,= qe/meqla,
foundations or
elements of things, q. te kai\ sterewpa/ cj. for qelhmna/, qelhma/, Emp.21.6. (Cf. proqe/lumnos, tetraqe/lumnos.)
qe/lw, v. e)qe/lw and add o(/stis a)\n qe/lh| IG12.49.12; e)a\n de/ tis qe/lh| ib.6.106; e)a/n tis mh\ qe/lh| ib.40.27.

qe/ma, atos, to/, (ti/qhmi)
that which is placed or
laid down:
money deposited, deposit, Ceb.31, PCair.Zen.22.11 (iii B.C.), SIG742.58 (Ephesus, i B.C.), Plu.2.116a,b; also, of grain, PRyl.199.12 (i A.D.); e)n qe/mati e)/xein para/ tinos PTeb.120.125 (i B.C.);
treasure, LXX To.4.9.
pile, of loaves, ib.Le.24.6,7; q. brwma/twn parakei/mena e)pi\ ta/fw| ib.Si.30.18. = qh/kh,
coffer, ib.1 Ki.6.8.
position, situation, of land, IG14.217 (Acrae). Astrol.,
nativity, 'horoscope' (in mod. sense), Suet.Aug.94, Vett.Val.194.20,al., Man. 1.278. either
common burial-place or
common land, Michel995 B 50 (pl.);
private burial-ground, h( soro\s kai\ to\ baqriko\n kai\ to\ u(pokei/menon q. Judeich
Altertümervon Hierapolis 208, cf. 124,al.; qe/ma: e(/cis, to/pos, sta/sis, mnh=ma, Hsch.
something proposed as a prize, IG 9(1).12 (Ambryssus), SIG867.67 (Ephesus, ii A.D.), Sammelb.6222.27 (iii A.D.).
case proposed for discussion, theme of an argument, Quint.4.2.28, D.L.7.78.
proposition, premiss, q. o(mologou/mena Longin.32.8.
case, in Law, Just.Nov.2.3Intr., 4.2 (pl.), dub. in IG4.364 (cf. Supp.Epigr.1.64).
arbitrary determination, opp. fu/sis, o( kata\ qe/ma kalo\s lo/gos Phld.Rh.1.151 S.; no/mois kai\ qe/masin diafe/rein ib.259 S., cf. Po.5.22. in Gramm.,
primary (non-derivative)
element or
form, A.D.Pron.11.21, al., cf. Synt.47.22; of the present tense, to\ q., a)mu/ssw: o( me/llwn, a)mu/cw EM88.13. in Stoic Logic,
mode of reduction of an irregular syllogism, Stoic.2.77,83,al.

qema^t-i/zw,
deposit, e)pi\ tra/pezan BGU1127.30 (i B.C.); pro\s tou\s trapezi/tas SIG742.56 (Ephesus, i B.C.).
place in order, A.D. Synt.11.8:—Pass., kata\ tu/xhn teqemati/sqai ib.1.
lay down, posit, assume, Phld.Rh.1.152 S.:—Pass.,
to be arbitrarily assumed,
ib.259S., cf. 124S. Gramm.,
assign arbitrarily a meaning to a word, S.E.M.8.202;
determine arbitrarily a gender, etc., ib.1.149, 152.

qema^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a qe/ma:
that in which a valuable prize is proposed, a)gw\n q., opp. stefani/ths and fulli/ths, Poll.3.153, cf. IG3.128.20, IGRom.4.1432.20, 1442.8 (Smyrna), LW894.17 (Delph.); tro/pos q. a style
calculated for effect, Plu.2.1135c; cf. qemati/ths.
arbitrarily fixed, traditional, parathrh/seis Phld. Rh.1.195S.: -ko/n, to/, ib.151S. Gramm.,
primary, not derivative, e.g. a)/mfw, which has no sg., EM91.33: qematika/, ta/,
elements, ib.232.21: Comp., qematikw/tera <me/rh> tou= lo/gou o)no/mata/ e)sti kai\ r(h/mata
principal parts, A.D.Adv.121.5; -w/terai ai( prwto/tupoi e)n toi=s ge/nesin the personal pronouns
form their genders
from different qe/mata, Id.Pron.110.24. Adv. Comp. -w/teron, kliqh=nai
by means of different qe/mata, e.g. e)gw/, e)mou=, Id.Synt.102.4.
qema^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of qe/ma 1.5, Antig.Nic. ap. Heph.Astr.2.18.

qema^t-ismo/s, o(,
laying down: hence,
conventional arrangement, Vitr.1.2.5. Gramm.,
arbitrary determination, S.E.M.1.149.

qema^t-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
depositor, SIG742.59 (Ephesus, i B.C.). q. a)gw/n, o(,= qematiko\s a)gw/n, IG14.1102.33.

qema^topoie/w,
make into a qe/ma 111.3, Sch.Od.4.807 (Pass.).

qe/meqla, ta/, (ti/qhmi)
foundations, lowest part, o)fqalmoi=o q.
roots of the eye, Il.14.493; stoma/xoio q. 17.47; *)wkeanoi=o q. Hes.Th.816; *)/ammwnos q.
the place where Ammon
stands, i.e. his temple, Pi.P.4.16; *paggai/ou q.
the roots of Mt. Pangaeus, ib.180; q. di/khs Sol.4.14; e)k qeme/qlwn, Lat.
funditus, Simm.25.4: dub. in sg., Call.Dian.248 (leg. qe/meilon).

qemei/lia, ta/,= qe/meqla, qemei/lia . . ta\ qe/san moge/ontes *)axaioi/ Il. 12.28; q. te proba/lonto 23.255; die/qhke q. h.Ap.254; q. kartera\ ph/cas AP9.808 (Cyrus), cf. Call.Del.260, Opp.H.5.680: qe/meila, Epigr.Gr.1078.3 (Adana): sg. qe/meilon, AP9.649 (Maced.), 14.115.

qemeli^-a^ko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the foundation, Sch.Lyc.615.

qemeli^-o/qen, = Lat.
funditus, Dosith.p.412 K., Gloss.

qeme/li^-os, on,
of or
for the foundation, li/qoi Ar.Av.1137; oi)ko/peda D.S.5.66: abs., qeme/lios (sc. li/qos), o(,
foundation-stone, Arist.Ph.237b13, Metaph.1013a5: metaph., th=s te/xnhs q. Macho ap.Ath.8.346a; q. a)gnoi/as Ph.1.266; oi( q. e)k pantoi/wn li/qwn u(po/keintai the
foundations, Th.1.93; tou\s q. e)k tw=n li/qwn oi)kodomei=sqai Arist.PA668a19: metaph., prolipei=ntou\s progonikou\s q. SIG888.70(Scaptopara, iii A.D.): also neut. qeme/lion Arist. APo.95b37(s.v.l.),PPetr.3p.121 (iii B.C.), al.: pl., ta\ q.Arist.Ph.200a4, PCair.Zen.176.71 (iii B.C.),al., Paus.8.32.1: metaph., ta\ u(poblhqe/nta q., of the
foundations of the world, Epicur.Ep.2p.38U.: gender indeterminate, mh\ u(pokeime/nwn . . q. X.Eq.1.2; e)k tw=n q. from the
foundations, Th.3.68 (also sg., e)ne/prhsan [oi)ki/an] e)k qemeli/ou BGU 909.17(iv A.D.)): metaph., e)kq. e)sfalme/noi Plb.5.93.2, etc.; a)/rdhn kai\ e)k q. a)po/llusqai Hdn.8.3.2; also a)nekti/sqh to\ tei=xos e)k qemelei/wn (sic) Supp.Epigr.2.480(Kuban, iv A.D.). qeme/lia, ta/,
buildingsites, Ptol.Tetr.174, cf. Vett.Val.82.24,al. Subst.,
the fourth to/pos,= a)ntimesoura/nhma, Herm.Trism. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(3).101, cf. 8(4).241.

qemeli^-ou=xos, on, (e)/xw)
upholding the foundations, *poseidw=n Inscr.Délos 290.116(iii B.C.), Corn.ND22; o( q. (sc. li/qos) Heraclit. All.48.

qemeli^-o/w,
to lay the foundation of, found firmly, pu/rgous . . foi/nici qemeliw/sas X.Cyr.7.5.11, cf. IG12(2).11.26 (Mytil.), LXXJo.6.25 (26), Ep.Hebr.1.10, etc.:—Pass.,
have the foundations laid, IG22.1343.15 (i B.C.); e)pi\ th\n pe/tran Ev.Matt.7.25: metaph., basilei/a kalw=s qemeliwqei=sa D.S.11.68; h(gemoni/a ka/llista teqemeliwme/nh Id.15.1; e)n a)ga/ph| teq. Ep.Eph.3.18; th=| pi/stei Ep.Col.1.23.
destroy utterly, in Pass., -wqe/nta （qemeilwq- cod.): e)k r(izw=n a)rqe/nta, Hsch.

qemeli^-wth/s, ou=, o(,
founder, Gloss.
qe/men, qe/menai, v. ti/qhmi.
qe/meros, a, on,= be/baios, semno/s, eu)staqh/s, Hsch.; qemerw/tera IG 14.1018.3 (iv A.D.).

qemero/frwn, on, gen. onos,
of grave and serious mind, Hsch.
qemeru/nomai (qemar- cod.),= semnu/nomai, Hsch. s.v. qe/meron; also, = trufw=, Com.Adesp.1017 (v.l.).

qemerw=pis, idos, h(,
grave and sedate of look, *(armoni/h Emp.122.2; q. ai)dw/s A.Pr.134 (lyr.).
qe/mhsis: dikaiosu/nh, para\ *puti/a|, Hsch. (Fort. qe/misis, cf. sq.).

qemi/zw, (qe/mis)
judge, punish, imper. qemize/tw,= mastigou/tw, nomoqetei/tw (Cret.), Hsch.; qemisse/tw Paus.Gr.Fr.202:—Med., aor. part. qemissa/menoi o)rga/s
controlling our wills, Pi.P.4.141.
qeminh/sasa: praktikh/, a)nusi/mh, a)potelesi/mh, Hsch.(post qemisto/s).

qemi/-cenos, on,
just to strangers, a)reta/ Pi.Pae.6.131.

qemi/-plektos, on, (ple/kw)
rightly plaited, q. ste/fanos a
well-earned crown (or, as Sch.,
twined with due ceremony), Pi.N.9.52.

qe/mis, h(, old Ep. gen. qe/mistos (in Hom. the only declension): acc. qe/mista Il.5.761, qe/min A.Ag.1431, etc.: gen. pl. qemiste/wn Hes. Th.235: pr. n. *qe/mis, *qe/mistos Od.2.68, *qe/mista Il.20.4; dat. *qe/misti 15.87; but *qe/mitos Pi.O.13.8, *qe/midos A.Pr.18, etc., *qe/mios (v.l. -idos) Hdt.2.50, *qe/min Hes.Th.16, IG22.1611.71: voc. *qe/mi Il.15.93, E.Med.160(anap.):
that which is laid down or
established, law (not as fixed by statute, but)
as established by custom, q. e)sti/ 'tis
meet and right, c. dat. pers. et inf., ou)/ moi q. e)sti\ cei=non a)timh=sai Od.14.56; a(/ te cei/nois q. e)sti\n [paraqei=nai] Il.11.779; o(/ oi( *dio/qen q. h)=en [e)ktele/sai] Hes.Sc.22; gunaiki\ ou) q. SIG1024.9(Myconos,iii/ii B.C.): without dat., Il.16.796, 23.44; ou) q. e)n moisopo/lwn oi)ki/a| qrh=non e)/mmen' Sapph.136; o(/ti dunato\n kai\ q. ai)nei=n A.Ag.98, cf. S.Ant.880(lyr.), Ph.346, E.Med. 678, Pl.Phdr.250b, Isoc.4.92, etc.; h( ga\r q. for so 'tis
right [to do], Od.24.286; freq. h(\ q. e)sti/ as
the custom is, Il.2.73: c. dat. (= loc.), h(\ q. e)sti/n . . a)gorh=| 9.33: c. gen., h(\ q. a)nqrw/pwn pe/lei ib.134; h(\ q. e)sti\ gunaiko/s Od.14.130; also h(=| q. a)nqrw/pois kata\ h)/qea Hes.Op.137; qu/ein tou\s gewrgou\s . . h(=| (with i） qe/mis IG22.1364 (i A.D.); but h(=| qe/mis e)sti/ is rejected for Hom. by Hdn.Gr.2.516, cf. A.D.Adv.148.28: indecl., po/tera kat' e)/xqran h)\ to\ mh\ qe/mis le/geis; A.Supp.336; w(/ste mh\ . . qe/mis se/ g' ei)=nai kei=non a)ntidra=n kakw=s S.OC1191; ou)de\ . . fasi\ qe/mis ei)=nai Pl. Grg.505c, cf.X.Oec.11.11, Ael.NA1.60.
justice, right, S.Tr.810; o(/sa tei/nei pro\s qe/min Pl.Smp.188d;
penalty, e)kti/nein o(moii/+an q. A.Supp. 436 (lyr.);
sanctity, o(rki/wn e)mw=n q. Id.Ag.1431. = a)gw\n qemati/ths, IGRom.3.319 (Pisid.); nikh/sas qe/min a)ndrw=n ib.437 (Termessus). pl. qe/mistes,
decrees of the gods,
oracles, *dio\s q. Od. 16.403; qe/missin
by oracles, Pi.P.4.54, cf. O.10(11).24.
dooms, customary
laws, ordinances, dikaspo/loi, oi(/ te qe/mistas pro\s *dio\s ei)ru/atai Il.1.238, cf. Hes.Th.235; toi=sin d' (i.e. the Cyclopes) ou)/t' a)gorai\ boulhfo/roi ou)/te qe/mistes Od.9.112; ou)/te di/kas eu)= ei)do/ta ou)/te qe/mistas neither rights nor
laws, ib.215: in sg., o(\s ou)/ tina oi)=de qe/mista Il.5.761; i(/na sf' a)gorh/ te qe/mis te 11.807.
judgements, decisions given by the kings or judges, oi(\ . . skolia\s kri/nwsi qe/mistas 16.387; skolih=|s de\ di/kh|s kri/nwsi q. Hes.Op.221; diakri/nonta q. i)qei/h|si di/kh|sin Id.Th. 85.
tribute, dues, lipara\s tele/ousi qe/mistas Il.9.156. pr. n., Themis, h(/ t' a)ndrw=n a)gora\s h)me\n lu/ei h)de\ kaqi/zei 2.68, cf. Il.15.87, 20.4, Hes.Th.16, A.Pr.18, etc.

qemisko/pos, on,
seeing to law and justice, Pi.N.7.47.

qemiskre/wn, ontos, o(,
reigning by right, Pi.P.5.29.
qe/mista, qe/mistas, v. qe/mis.

qemist-ei/a, h(,
a giving of oracles, Str.17.1.43.

qemist-ei=os, a, on,
of law and right, q. ska=pton the sceptre
of righteous judgement, Pi.O. 1.12.

qemist-euto/s, h/, o/n,
ordered by law or
custom, Hsch.

qemist-eu/w,
declare law and right, c. dat., *mi/nwa i)/don . . qemisteu/onta ne/kussin Od. 11.569: c. gen.,
govern, q. de\ e(/kastos pai/dwn h)d' a)lo/xwn 9.114.
give by way of answer or
oracle, nhmerte/a boulh\n pa=si q. h.Ap.253, cf. Lys.Fr.23S.: abs.,
deliver oracles, E.Ion371, D.S.5.67, Plu.Alex. 14; tina Orac. ap. Ael.VH3.43; cf. qemiteu/w.

qemi/st-ios, o(,
patron of right, of Zeus, Plu.2.1065e. name of month in Thessaly, etc., IG9(1).689, etc.

qemistopo/los, on,
ministering law and right, epith. of kings and judges, h.Cer.103.
oracular, shkoi/, of Delphi, Klio15.48 (Delph., iii B.C.).

qemist-o/s, h/, o/n,= qemito/s, A.Th.694 (lyr.). Adv.-tw=s cj. in Id.Ch. 645(lyr.).
oracular, u(/mnoi Pi.Fr.192; cf. qe/mis 111.1.
qemist-osu/nh, h(, in pl., poet. for qe/mistes, Orph.H.79.6.

qemist-ou=xos, on, (e)/xw)
upholding right, basilh=es A.R.4.347.

qemi/stwr, oros, o(,
knowing right, Hsch.

qemi^t-eu/w,= qemisteu/w, o)/rgia qemiteu/wn
keeping lawful orgies, E. Ba.79 (lyr., metri gr.).

qemi^t-o/s, h/, o/n, (qe/mis)
allowed by the laws of God and men, righteous, ou) qemito/n [e)sti],= ou) qe/mis, c. inf., ou) q. oi( e)/faske pi/nein oi)=non h.Cer.207, cf. Pi.P.9.42, S.OT993, OC1758 (anap.), E.Or.97, Theoc.5.136, etc.: in Prose, Hdt.3.37,5.72, Pl.Ap.30d, IG 2.1059.16, 14.1390; mhde\ qemito\n . . mhd' o(/sion D.21.148: in pl., ta\ mh\ qemi/t' h)=n [i)dei=n] dub. l. in Call.Lav.Pall.78. Adv. -tw=s Phot., Suid.

qemi^t-w/dhs, es,
oracular, Orac. ap. Eus.PE5.16.

qemo/w, only in phrase [nh=a] qe/mwse . . xe/rson i(ke/sqai
drove the ship
ashore, stranded her, Od.9.486; but in ib.542,
drove her landwards, i.e. towards her destination: cf. qemou/s: diaqe/seis, paraine/seis, Hsch., who also has qemw=n: qelh/mwn.

qe/mi^t-qen, old termin. of the gen., as in e)me/qen, *dio/qen, etc.: freq. with Ablatival sense, denoting
motion from a place, as in *lesbo/qen, *)abudo/qen, a)/lloqen, oi)/koqen, etc.: so with Preps., a)po\ *troi/hqen Od.9.38; e)c ou)rano/qen Il.8.19, cf. A.D.Adv.184.12 sq.: most of the forms in -oqen were parox., exc. oi)/koqen, a)/lloqen, pa/ntoqen (sts. panto/qen）, e)/ktoqen, e)/ndoqen, ib.191.27 sq. (other exceptions in Hdn.Gr.1.500).

qe/na^r, a^ros, to/,
palm of the hand, prumno\n u(/per qe/naros, i.e. just below the wrist, Il.5.339; xeiro\s to\ e)nto\s qe/nar Arist.HA493b32, cf. Poll.2.143. pl.,
the two muscles forming the borders of the palm, Gal.UP2.3.
ball of the thumb, Ruf.Onom.87, Gal.18 (2).864.
flat of the foot, Hp.Mul.2.116(pl.), Arat.718. metaph., q. bwmoi=o
hollow in the top of the altar, on which the offerings are laid, Pi.P.4.206; a(lo\s q.
hollow bed of the sea, Id.I.4(3).56. (Cf. OHG.
tenar 'palm of the hand'.)
qenari/zei: tu/ptei, Hsch. qe/nioi: oi( prosh/kontes, Id.
qe/nw, v. qei/nw. qe/o, Ep. for qou=, v. ti/qhmi.

qeobla/b-eia [bla^], h(,
infatuation sent by the gods, madness, Aeschin. 3.133, D.H.1.24, D.C.44.8（-i/a codd.).

qeoblab-e/w,
to be qeoblabh/s, A.Pers.831, Them.Or.4.56c.

qeoblab-h/s, e/s,
stricken of God, infatuated, Hdt.1.127,8.137, Ant.Lib.22.4. Adv. -bw=s Poll.1.22.
qeo/-boulos, on,= qeo/mhtis, Phot., Suid.:—fem. qeo-bou/lh, of the Sibyl, Lact.Inst.1.6.7.
qeo-bro/tion, to/,= a)ei/zwn to\ mikro/n, Ps.-Dsc. 4.89.

qeo-ga^mi/a, h(,
marriage of gods, Ph.2.205 (v.l. -maxi/a): in pl., title of poem by Pisander, Suid., Zos.5.29.
qeo-ga/mia [ga^], ta/, name of festival in Sicily, Poll.1.37; at Athens, Plu.in Hes.85; at Nysa, GDI3661.11, HeadHist.Num.2654,al.
qeo-ge/naios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month in Egypt, BGU713.3(i A.D.).

qeo-genh/s, e/s,
born of God, Sch.rec.A.Pr.351, Gloss.

qeo-gennh/s, e/s,
begotten of a god, S. Ant.834 (anap.).

qeo/-glwssos, on,
with the tongue of a god, gunai=kes, of poetesses, AP9.26 (Antip. Thess.).

qeo-gnwsi/a, h(,
the knowledge of God, Hierocl.in CA20p.463M., Heph.Astr.1.1.

qeo/-gnwstos, on,
known of God, ibid., Gloss.: as a complimentary term, h( q. sou mnh/mh POxy. 237 vi 29(ii A.D.).

qeo-goni/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
genealogy of the gods, title of Hesiod's poem; cf. Hdt.1.132, 2.53, Procl.in Ti.3.107 D.
generation or
birth of gods, Pl.Lg.886c, Ph.2.205, 264, D.L.Praef.3.

qeo/-gonos, on,
born of God, divine, E.Or.346.

qeo-dai/mwn, onos, o(,
inferior divinity, BCH22.350 (Amphipolis).

qeodai/sia, ta/, Cret. name for the *dionu/sia, Call.Aet.Oxy.2080.88, GDI5075.43 (Crete), cf. Hsch.; also, at Rhodes, SIG1035c. *qeodai/sios, o(, epith. of Dionysus, Hsch.; also, (sc. mh/n) name of month found in various forms: Cret. qiodai/sios GDI5149; in Cos, Rhodes, etc., qeudai/sios ib.3593, al., etc.; at Mytilene, qedai/sios IG11(4).1064a2 (Delos).

qeo-de/gmwn, on, gen. onos, = qehdo/xos, qw=kos AP7.363;
divine, phgh/ Archestr.Fr.13.8.
qeo-de/ktwr, oros, o(, h(, = qehdo/xos, Hsch.

qeo-dh/lhtos, on,
by which the gods are injured, miaifoni/h v.l. in AP9.157.

qeo-di/daktos [i^], on,
taught of God, 1 Ep.Thess.4.9.
qeo-dmh/s, dat. -dmh=ti: qeo/froni Cyr. (fort. qeo/mhti).

qeo/-dmhtos, Dor. qeo/-dma_tos, on, also a, on Pi.O.6.59, Fr.87.1: (de/mw):—
god-built, founded by the gods, pu/rgoi Il.8.519; *da=los Pi. ll.cc.; pu/lai B.Fr.7 Bgk. (cf. p.437 Jebb); *)aqh=nai S.El.707; bwmo/s E.Hec.23: metaph., q. xre/os, a)retai/, Pi.O.3.7, I.6(5).11.
qeo-do/nion or qeo-dw/nion, to/, = glukusi/dh, dub. in Ps.-Dsc.3.140.

qeo-dosi/a, h(,
a gift or
offering to the gods, Str.17.1.37 (pl.).

qeo-do/sios, on,
given by God, Hsch.; f.l. in Aristeas 229.

qeo-do/tia, ta/, name of various eyesalves, Gal. 12.784, Aët.7.118;
collyrium Theodoti, Cels.6.6.6.

qeo/-dotos, on, = qeo/sdotos, e)/rga Pi.I.5(4).23; eu)xai/ B.7.50. qeo/doton, to/,
remedy for coughs, Alex.Trall.5.4.

qeo-drome/w,
walk in God's ways, Phot., Suid.
qeo/-duta: i(ero/quta, Hsch. (leg. qeo/quta).

qeo-dw/rhtos, on,
given by God, Iamb.VP2.6, 15.67, Asp.in EN25.28. q. li/qos, of the a)labastri/ths li/qos, Zos.Alch.p.114B. h( q.
a purgative, Aët.13.112, Alex.Trall.1.15.

qeo-ei/deia, h(,
godlike appearance, fusikh/ Iamb.VP2.10.

qeo-eidh/s, e/s,
godlike, in Hom. of form, *pri/amos Il.24.217, al.; *)ale/candros, *thle/maxos, 3.16, Od.14.173, al.; *ou)rani/h Hes.Th.350; q. pro/swpon Pl.Phdr.251a; oi( poihtai\ tou\s kalou\s qeoeidei=s o)noma/zousin Plu.2.988d, cf. Pl.R.501b. generally,
godlike, qeoeide/s ti/ e)stin h( yuxh/ Id.Phd.95c, cf. Muson.Fr.17p.91H.; of things, li/qous, bota/nas, zw=|a, a)rw/mata Iamb.Myst.5.23: Comp. -e/steros Pl.Epin.980d: Sup. -e/statos Eus.Mynd.33; ko/smos e)pw=n Phalar.Ep.147.2: also irreg. qeeid- (q.v.). Adv. -dw=s Herm.in Phdr.p.178A., Suid.

qeo-ei/kelos, on,
godlike, of Achilles, Il.1.131, al.; of Telemachus, Od.3.416; of Hector and Andromache, Sapph.Supp.20c.6: in Prose, Pl.R.501b, Them.Or.6.79a.
qeo-eph/s, e/s, （e)/pos） = qespe/sios, Hsch.
qeo-exqri/a, v. qeoisexqri/a.

qeo/qen, Adv.
from the gods, q. d' ou)k e)/st' a)le/asqai (sc. qa/naton) death
at the hands of the gods, Od.16.447, cf. Pl.Com.173.14 (hex.); ei)/ tis a)/lla q. a)nqrw/poisi te/ryis
given by God to man, IG3.171.
by the will or
favour of the gods, Pi.O.12.8, P.11.50, A.Th.324, Pers.101 (both lyr.), etc.;
by the gods, oi(=s a)\n seisqh=| q. do/mos S.Ant.584.

qeo-qre/mmwn, on, gen. onos,
maintained by God, sigh/ Orae. ap. Procl. in Alc.p.56C.
qeo/-qreptos, on, = foreg., Sch.A.Pers.905.

qeo/-qu^tos, on, (qu/w)
offered to the gods: qeo/quton, to/,
a victim, Cratin.417 (pl.), cf. Poll.1.29 (pl.).
qeoi/nia (sc. i(era/), ta/, an Attic feast of Dionysus, Jusj. ap. D.59.78, Lycurg.Fr.56: qeoi/nion, to/, his temple, Phot.

qe/oinos, o(,
god of wine, pa/ter qe/oine A.Fr.382, cf. Lyc.1247.

qeoisexqri/a, h(,
hatefulness to the gods, villainy, D.22.59 (written qeoi=s e)xqri/an), prob. in Ar.V.418 (required by Cretic metre), in Archipp.35 (where the first two syll. coalesce), and in Luc.Lex.11: in the last three places codd. have qeosexqri/a or qeo\s e)xqri/a （qeosexqra v.l. Archipp. l.c.): qeoexqri/a is found in Sch.Ar.Ra.557, v.l. in Luc.Lex.l.c.; cf. qeoi=s e)xqro/s in D.19.95, 24.195.

qeo-kata/ra_tos [a^r], on,
accursed of God, Zos.Alch. ap. Olymp.Alch. p.101 B.

qeo-kataskeu/astos, on,
made by God, u(/mnos Sch.Pi.O.3.11; gloss on qeo/teukton, Hsch.

qeo-ke/leustos, on,
ordered by God, gloss on qe/skela, Id.

qeo-kh=ruc, u_kos, o(,
divine herald: in pl., name of a family at Eleutherae
claiming descent from Talthybius, Id.

qeo-ki/nhtos [i_], on,
roused by the gods, gloss on qe/ortos, Sch.Pi.O.2.67.
qeo-klhte/w, f.l. for -klu^te/w, Eust.805.36.

qeo/-klhtos, on,
sung by gods, Nonn.D.5.92.

qeo-klu^te/w,
call on the gods, A.Pers. 500, Plu.Sull.29, Ael.Fr.46, Porph.Abst.2.26, D.C.74.13: c. acc. pers., q. *qe/min E.Med.208; *kuri=non Plu.Rom.28; also, c. acc. rei,
ask in prayer, Id.Arist.18. Pass.,
to be inspired, Id.2.592c:— so in Act., Hld.3.17.

qeo-klu/thsis [u^], ews, h(,
calling on the gods, invocation, Plb.23.10.7 (pl.).

qeo/-klu^tos, on,
calling on the gods, q. litai/ A. Th.143 (lyr.). Pass.,
heard by God, expl. of Ishmael, J.AJ1.10.4.

qeo/-kmhtos, on,
wrought by a god, be/lemna, pu/rgoi, Q.S.3.419, Tryph.40（v.l. qeodm-).

qeo-ko/los, o(, = qehko/los,
servant of a god, priest, SIG684.1 (Dyme, ii B.C.), 1021.3 (Olympia, i B.C.):—hence qeo-kole/w,
serve as a priest, q. *)asklapiw=| IG9(1).1066 (Amphissa):—also qeo-koleu/w, ib.417 (Aetol.):
qeo-koli/a, h(, SIG531.32 (pl., Dyme).

qeo/-krantos, on,
accomplished or
wrought by the gods, A.Ag.1488.

qeo-kra_si/a, h(, (kra=sis)
mingling with God, Iamb.VP33.240, Dam.Isid.5.
Divine Mingling, title of work by Pherecydes of Syros, Suid.

qeo-kra^ti/a, h(, (kra/tos)
rule of God, theocracy, J.Ap.2.16.

qeo-krh/pi_s, i_dos, h(,
founded by a god, of Athens, Nonn.D.24.96.

qeo/-kri^tos, o(,
judge of gods, of Paris, Dosiad.Ara10.

qeo/-kthtos, on,
acquired by God, tri/podes Aristonous 1.9.

qeo/-ktistos, on (also -h, Dor. a, -on Trag.Adesp. 85),
created, established, or
founded by God, flo/c l.c., cf. Limen. 36; po/lis OGI168.4 (Egypt, ii B.C., v. corrigenda); nomoqesi/a LXX 2 Ma.6.23. name of an eyesalve, Dessau Inscr.Lat.Sel. 8738.
qeo/-kti^tos, on, = foreg. 1, Sol.36.6; gai=a Epigr.Gr.223.5.
qeo-kunei=: do/can qei/an e)/xousan, Hsch. (fort. qeo-kudh=).

qeolhpt-e/omai, Pass.,
to be inspired, Ph.1.143.

qeolhpt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to one possessed or
inspired: h( qeolhptikh/ (sc. mantei/a) = qeolhyi/a, S.E.M.9.132.

qeo/lhpt-os, on,
possessed, inspired, Arist.EE 1214a23, S.E.P.2.52, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).148; gnw/mh App.Hann.42, cf. Sallust.3, etc.; q. ei)s a)reth/n Plu.2.1117a. in bad sense, = qeoblabh/s, Man.4.80, Vett.Val.114.12.
superstitious, Plu.2.855b.

qeolhyi/a, h(,
inspiration, Plu.2.763a.
superstition, ib.56e.
frenzy, madness, Vett.Val.210.4 (pl.).

qeolog-ei=on, to/, in the theatre,
a place above the stage where gods appeared, Poll.4.130.

qeolog-e/w,
discourse on the gods and cosmology, Arist. Metaph.983b29; peri/ tinwn Id.Mu.391b4, cf. Plu.2.614d, etc.; *di/a au)to\n [to\n *fae/qonta] zwogo/non qeologou=si
call him *zeu/s z. Antig.Mir. 10b:—Pass., ta\ qeologou/mena
discourses about the gods, Plu.2.421e (v.l.), S.E.M.9.55; title of work by Asclepiades of Mendes, Suet. Aug.94; trei=s ai( *moi=rai qeologou=ntai Theol.Ar.16.
refer to a divine influence, tou\s to/kous Sch.Ptol.Tetr.103.

qeolo/g-ia, ta/,=
dei proverbia, Gloss.

qeolog-i/a, h(,
science of things divine, Pl.R.379a, Phld. Piet.72, Porph.Marc.15, Iamb.Myst.1.1, etc.; title of an Orphic work, Dam.Pr.124: in pl., Arist.Mete.353a35.
oration in praise of a god, SIG1109.115.
incantation, invocation of a god, PMag.Par.1.1037.

qeolog-iko/s, h/, o/n,
theological, filosofi/a q., i.e. metaphysics, Arist.Metaph.1026a19, cf. 1064b3; ge/nos Str.10.3.23; pragmatei/a D.H.4.62; [mu=qoi] Sallust.4; to\ q. Cleanth.Stoic.1.108; oi( q. Olymp.in Mete.129.19: Comp. -w/teros Dam.Pr.135. Adv. -kw=s, opp. tragikw=s, a)pofai/nesqai Plu.2.568d, cf. lamb.Myst.1.2.

qeo/log-os, o(, (le/gw)
one who discourses of the gods, of poets such as Hesiod and Orpheus, Arist.Metaph.1000a9, S.E.M.2.31; of cosmologists (like the Orphics), Arist.Metaph.1071b27, al., Cic.ND3.21.53; qeolo/goi kai\ poihtai/ Phld.Piet.48; of diviners and prophets, q. kai\ ma/nties Philol.14; oi( *delfw=n q. Plu.2.417f, cf. Luc.Alex.19, BMus.Inscr.4.481*.295 (Ephesus, ii A.D.), IGRom.4.1431 (Smyrna): fem., CIG 3199,3200 (ibid.).
theologian: o( q.,= Moses, Ph.2.152, 416.

qeolwbh/ths, ou, o(,
blasphemer, Man.4.234.

qeoma^n-e/w,
to be qeomanh/s, Poll.1.19.

qeoma^n-h/s, e/s,
maddened by the gods, A.Th.653, E.Ion1402; lu/ssa q. madness
caused by the gods, Id.Or.845; po/tmos ib.79.

qeoma^n-i/a, h(,
madness caused by God, inspiration, cj. in Ph.1.571 (e)nqeomani/a, e)nqe/w| mani/a codd.).

qeomant-ei/a, h(,
spirit of prophecy, D.C.62.18.

qeomant-ei=on, to/,
spell for evoking a divine revelation, PMag.Leid.V.5.13.

qeo/mant-is, ews, o(,
one who has a spirit of prophecy, an inspired person, Pl.Ap.22c, Men. 99c, Aristid.2.18J., Gal.15.442.

qeoma^x-e/w,
fight against God or
the gods, E.Ba.45, al., IA1408; mh\ qeoma/xei Men.187, cf. Hp.Ep.14, LXX 2 Ma.7.19, Plu.2.168c, Arr. Epict.3.24.24.

qeoma^x-i/a, h(,
battle of the gods, Pl.R.378d (pl.), cf. Il.20. tit.
fighting against God, Arr.Epict.3.24.24.

qeo/ma^x-os, on,
fighting against God, *gi/gantes Scymn.637, cf. Act.Ap.5.39, Luc.JTr. 45, Vett.Val.331.12.

qeo-mhni/a, h(,
wrath of God, Pall.in Hp.2.142D., Steph.in Hp.1.72 D., Eust.891.24.

qeo-mh/stwr, oros, o(,
like the gods in counsel, A. Pers.655 (lyr.), IG14.1868. Pass.,
devised by God, qeomh/storos ei)ko/na ko/smou Alex.Eph. ap. Theo Sm p.141H. (-mh/toros codd., em. Meineke); ko/smon Man.4.7 (-mh/tora edd. vett.).

qeo-mhte/w,
to be divinely wise, Hsch.

qeo/-mhtis, idos, h(,
divinely wise, di/kh Maiist.54, cf. Suid.

qeo-mh/twr, oros, h(,
mother of a god, of Olympias, mother of Alexander, Anon.Hist. (FGrH153) p.826J.

qeo/-mi_mos, on,
imitating God, q. pra=gma basilh/|a Diotog. ap. Stob.4.7.62.

qeo-mi_sh/s, e/s,
hated by the gods, opp. qeofilh/s, Pl.Euthphr.7a, R.612e, Them.Or.16.21ca: Sup. -e/statos Pl.Lg.917a, Ph.1.653. Adv. -sw=s Poll.1.22. Act.,
hating God, Ar.Av.1548 (ubi v. Sch.), Ph.2.597, Suid. (qeomi/shs v.l. in Ar.l.c.).
qeo-mi_shti/a, h(,= qeoisexqri/a, Sch.Ar.V.416.
qeo-mi/shtos [i_], on,= qeomi_sh/s 1, Arist.(?) in PLit.Lond.112, Ph.2.202.

qeo-moiri/a, h(, the
god's portion of a sacrifice, SIG1026.20 (Cos).

qeo/-moiros, on,
partaking of the divine nature, Ecphant. ap. Stob.4.6.22; fu/sis Dam.Isid.191.

qeo-mo/rios, a, on, Ep. qeum-, collat. form of sq., qeumori/h nou=sos, a)/th, A.R.3.676,974. qeumori/h, h(,
destiny, Call.Epigr.32.4, AP7.367 (Antip.). = qeou= moi=ra, but also,
priest's share of the sacrifice, Hsch.:—hence qeumoria/zw, Id.

qeo/-moros, on,
destined by the gods, imparted by them, a)oidai/ Pi.O.3.10; ga/mou qeo/moron ge/ras Id.I.8(7).42.
blessed by the gods, Id.P.5.5.

qeo/-morfos, on,
of form divine, AP12.196 (Strat.).

qeo-mu_qi/a, h(,
divine lore, mythology, Procl.Theol.Plat.1.4: in pl., Herm.in Phdr. p.73A., Marin.Procl.27.

qeo-mu^sh/s, e/s,
abominable before the gods, A.Eu.40.

qeo-ce/nios, o(, epith. of Apollo at Pellene, Paus.7.27.4: name of a month at Delphi, GDI1709, al. qeoce/nia, ta/,
festival in honour of Apollo at Pellene, Paus. l.c., Sch.Pi.O.9.146; at Delphi, Michel995D9, Polemo ap.Ath.9.372a, Plu.2.557f; and,
of the Dioscuri at Agrigentum, Pi.O.3.tit.; also at Paros, IG12(5).129.61 (ii B.C.); gloss on *qeodai/sia, Sch.Call.Aet.Oxy.2080.88:—hence qeoceniastai/, oi(,
the persons who celebrated such a festival, IG12(5).872.114 (ii B.C.).

qeo-pai/gmwn, onos, o(, h(,
sporting with the gods, Nonn. D.30.210.

qeo/-pais, paidos, o(, h(,
child of the gods, *)/erws AP12.56 (Mel.); *babulw/n Herodic. ap. Ath.5.222a; la/brac Archestr.Fr.45.2; *tu/ros AP7.419 (Mel.).

qeo/-paistos, on,
struck by a god, kiqa/ra Hsch.

qeo-para/dotos, on,
delivered by God, Procl. in Cra.p.59 P.; lo/gia Marin. Procl.26; sofi/a Dam.Pr.311.

qeo-pa/twr [a^], oros, o(,
son of God, title of Parthian kings,
BMus.Cat.Coins Parthia p.16, al.

qeo-peiqh/s, e/s,
obedient to God, u(pakoh/ Hierocl.in CA 24p.473M.

qeo/-pemptos, on,
sent by the gods, Arist.EN1099b15, Plb.32.15.14, D.H.1.14; o)/neiroi Ph.1.620, cf. Artem.1.6; a)tuxi/a D.S.15.24; a)gaqo/n D.H.4.62.
superhuman, extraordinary, Longus 3.18.

qeo/-pistos, on,
faithful to God, PMasp.151.196 (vi A.D.).

qeo-pla/sths, ou, o(,
maker of gods, i.e.
of their images, Ar.Fr. 787.
the divine Creator, Ph.2.490.
qeo-plhgh/s, e/s, v. -plh/c.

qeo/-plhktos, on,
stricken of God, Hsch. (in Dor. form -plaktos).
qeo-plh/c, h=gos, o(, h(, to/,= qeo/plhktos, qeoplh/gessin e)oiko/tas ei)dw/loisin Maiist.60 (unless -plhge/ssin from qeo-plhgh/s, e/s).
qeo-plhci/a, h(,= qeobla/beia, Oenom. ap. Eus.PE5.36.
qeo/-plokos, on,= pro\s qeou\s prospleko/menos, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).166.

qeo/-pneu-stos, on,
inspired of God, sofi/h Ps.-Phoc.129; o)/neiroi Plu.2.904f; pa=sa grafh/ 2 Ep.Ti.3.16; dhmiou/rghma Vett.Val.330.19.
qeo/-pnoos, on, contr. qeo/-ous, oun,= foreg., q. geno/menos Corp.Herm.1.30; q. u(/dwr Numen. ap. Porph.Antr.10; pro/swpon, of the Sphinx, Epigr.Gr.1016.

qeopoi-e/w,
make into gods, deify, ta\ qnhta/ D.H.2.56, cf. Luc.Scyth. 1; *puqago/ran S.E.M.7.94.
make divine, a)/nqrwpon q. ai( e)pisth=mai Hierocl.
inCA Praef.p.417M.

qeopoi-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to make gods: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh)
the art of making statues of gods, Poll.1.13.

qeopoi/-htos, on,
made by the gods, or
by God, Isoc.7.62.

qeopoi-i/+a, h(,
making of gods, Porph.Abst.4.9;
of their statutes, Poll.1.13.
being made divine, i(/na kata\ a)fai/resin tou= brotou= h( q. h(mw=n noh=tai Hierocl. in CA27p.483M.

qeopoi-o/s, o/n,
making gods, Ar.Fr.786; a( q. te/xna, = qeopoihtikh/, AP9.774 (Glauc.); ou) q. tis a)ll' a)nqrwpopoio\s w)/n Luc.Philops.20.
making into gods, deifying, Dam.(?)ap.Suid. s.v. a)poklh/rwsis; paragge/lmata Hierocl.
inCA19p.462M.

qeo-pole/w,
minister in things divine, Pl.Lg.909d.

qeo-po/los, o(, h(,
priest; v. qehpo/los.
qeo-pompei=n: e)nqousia=n, Hsch. (Fort. -propei=n.)

qeo/-pompos, on,= qeo/pemptos, timai/ Pi.P.4.69; tu/xa B.16.132 (_ _ ^); po/ma, as pr. n., Aët.11.11. pr. n. *qeo/pompos :hence, Adj. *qeopo/mpeion (sc. me/tron), to/, Cretic pentameter used by Theopomp.Com., Heph.13.5.

qeo-po/nhtos, on,
prepared by the gods, le/xh, of Helen, E.Tr.953,Hel.584.

qeopre/p-eia, h(,
divine majesty, th=s proso/yews D.S.5.43, cf. 11.89.
qeo/prep-tos, on,= foreg., v.l. in A.Pers.905 (lyr.).

qeo-prope/w,
prophesy, but only in part. masc., qeoprope/wn a)goreu/eis Il.1.109, cf. Od.2.184, Pi.P.4.190, A.R.2.922.
to be a qeopro/pos 11, in Boeot. form qiopr-, IG7.3207 (Orchom.).

qeo-propi/a, h(,
prophecy, oracle, Il.1.87, Od.1.415, etc.
qeo-pro/pion, to/,= foreg., Il.1.85; qeopropi/wn e)u/+ ei)dw/s 6.438: in Prose, e)k qeopropi/ou Hdt.1.7, 165, al.; kata\ to\ q. ib.68, cf. Heraclid.Lemb.Oxy.1367.39, Ph.1.514 (pl.).

qeo-pro/pos, on,
prophetic, oi)wnisth/s Il.13.70; e)/pos S.Tr.822 (lyr.); h)=tor Q.S.12.534. Subst.,
seer, prophet, Il.12.228, Od.1.416; of Moses, Ph.1.199. qeopro/pon, to/,= qeopropi/a, Call.Lav. Pall.125(pl.).
public messenger sent to inquire of an oracle, Ion. for qewro/s, Hdt.1.48, al., A.Pr.659, IG12(5).141.9 (Paros, iii B.C.), SIG548.2 (Delph., iii B.C.), Plu.Cim.18: pl., as pr. n. of a family (= *qeopropi/dai, cf. D.L.2.125), Porph.Abst.2.9. (-propo- assim. fr. -proko-, cf. Lat.
procus, precor.）

qeo-pro/splokos, on,
very religious, as gloss on i(eropro/spolos, Procl.Par.Ptol.224.
qeo-pro/spolos,= foreg., Ptol.Tetr.71, 155 (where Procl. renders prospleko/menoi pro\s to\ qei=on （pro\s qeou/s)).

qeo/pt-hs, ou, o(, (o(ra/w, o)/yomai)
seeing God, of Moses, Ph.1.579 (s. v.l.).

qeopt-i/a, h(,
divine vision, Hsch.

qeopt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a qeo/pths: h( q. du/namis the power
of seeing God, Herm. ap. Stob.1.3.52, 3.11.31; h( q. yuxh/ Iamb.Myst.8.6.

qeo/-ptustos, on,
detested by the gods, ge/nos A.Th.604.

qeo/-pu^ros, on, (pu=r)
kindled by the gods, flo/c E.El.732 (lyr.).

qeo/-raktos, on, (r(a/ssw)
struck, i.e.
maddened, by God, nickname of *qeo/mnastos, Cic. Verr.4.66.148.
qeo/rghtos, on,= qeomanh/s, Sch.A.Th.653. qeore/w, v. qewre/w.

qeo/-rrhtos, on,
spoken of God, me/tron AP9.505; eu)epi/ai Epic. in BKT5(1)p.118. *qeo/rrhton, to/, name of a building at Delos, IG11(2).199 A 103 (iii B.C.), Inscr.Délos312.1; elsewh. to\n oi)=kon to\n *q-ou IG11(2).163 Ba6 (iii B.C.), al.

qeo/-rru^tos, on,
flowing from the gods, lu/qros Opp.H.5.9.

qe/ortos, on, (o)/rnumai)
sprung from the gods, o)/lbos Pi.O.2.36; qe/orton h)\ bro/teion A.Pr.765.

qeo/s, o(, Boeot. qio/s, Lacon. sio/s (v. infr.), Cypr., Cret. qio/s Inscr.Cypr.135.27 H., Leg.Gort.1.1, Dor. also qeu/s Call.Cer.58; acc. qeu=n v.l. ib.130; voc. (only late) qeo/s, also qee/ LXXDe.3.24, Ev.Matt. 27.46, PMag.Lond.121.529, etc.; but classical in compd. names, *)amfi/qee, *timo/qee:—
God, the Deity, in general sense, both sg. and pl. (ei) kai\ e)pi\ qeou\s kai\ e)/ti ma=llon e)pi\ qeo
 a(rmo/zei metafe/rein Plot.6.8.1), q. de\ to\ me
 dw/sei to\ d' e)a/sei God will grant . . , Od.14.444; ou)de/ ken a)/llws ou)de\ q. teu/ceie 8.177, cf. 3.231, Il.13.730 (also qeo\s *zeu/s Od.4.236, 14.327); q. kai\ a)gaqh\ tu/xh Pl.Lg.757e, cf. Timocl.3 D.; su
 qew=| Il.9.49, S.Aj.765, etc. (less freq. cu
 tw=| q. ib.383); su
 q. ei)rhm<*> non Hdt.1.86, cf. 3.153; su
 q. ei)pei=n Pl.Prt.317b: so in pl., su/n ge qeoi=sin Il.24.430; ou)/ toi a)/neu qeou= Od.2.372; ou) qew=n a)/ter pi.P.5.76; e)k qeo/fi Il.17.101; u(pe qeo/n
against his will, 17.327; a)
 q. qe/lh| Alex. 231; q. qe/lontos Men.Mon.671: in pl., a)
 qeoi\ qe/lwsin Alex.247; qew=n suneqelo/ntwn, boulome/nwn, X.Eq.Mag.9.8, Luc.Macr.29; ei) o)rqw=s h)\ mh/, q. oi)=de Pl.Phdr.266b, cf.R.517b, etc.; in oaths, q. i)/stw S.OC522 (lyr.), etc.; pro\s qew=n Hdt.5.49, D.1.15, etc.: tou\s qeou/s soi
bless you! good heavens! for heaven's sake! M.Ant.7.17, Arr.Epict.2.19.15, al.; to
 q. soi ib.3.7.19, al.: qualified by tis, Od.9.142, etc.; ou)k a)/neu qew=n tinos A.Pers.164 (troch.), E.Ba.764; kata\ qeo/n tina Id.IA411, Pl. Euthd.272e; kata\ qeo/n pws ei)rhme/na Id.Lg.682a: doubled in poets, qeo
 qeo/n tis a)glai+ze/tw B.3.21, cf. Diagor.1; qeoi\ qeoi\ tw=n a)di/kwn me/lousi E.HF772, cf. Paus.Gr.Fr.203; qeoi/ (Cret. qioi/) as an opening formula in Inscrr. (sc. tu/xhn a)gaqh
 didoi=en), Leg.Gort.1.1, IG 12.52, etc.: sg., q. tu/xh ib.5(2).1, etc.: in Prose also with the Art., o( q. pa/ntwn a)
 ei)/h ai)/tios Pl.R.379c, cf. Lg.716c, etc.; ta\ pro\s tou\s q., ta\ para\ tw=n q., X.Mem.1.3.1, 2.6.8. qeoi/, opp. a)/ndres, path a)ndrw=n te qew=n te Il.1.544; o(
 *ca/nqon kale/ousi q., a)/ndres de\ *ska/mandron 20.74: in Comparisons, qeoi=sin i)=s' e)/qele frone/ein 5.440; qeoi=s e)nali/gkia mh/dea Od.13.89; also in sg., qew=| e)nali/gkios au)dh/n Il.19.250; qeo\s w(/s 5.78; w(/s te qeo/s 3.381: prov., qeo\s pro\s a)nqrw/pous, of an 'angel's visit', Herod.1.9. of special divinities, ne/rteroi q. A.Pers.622, S.Ant.602 (lyr.); e)ne/rteroi q. Il.15.225; oi( ka/twqen q. S.Ant.1070; q. ou)ra/nioi h.Cer.55, A.Ag.90 (anap.); oi( dw/deka q. Ar.Eq.235, X.Eq.Mag.3.2, IG22.30, etc.; ma\ tou\s dw/deka q. Men.Sam.91; in dual, tw\ siw/ (Lacon.), of Castor and Pollux, nai\ tw\ s. X.An.6.6.34, HG4.4.10, Ar.Lys.81: so in Boeot., of Amphion and Zethus, nei\ tw\ siw/ (leg. qiw/) Id.Ach.905. o( q., of natural phenomena, o( q. u(/ei (sc. *zeu/s) Hdt.2.13; o( q. e)ne/skhye be/los Id.4.79; e)/seisen o( q. (sc. *poseidw=n) X.HG4.7.4; of the sun, Hdt.2.24, A.Pers. 502, E.Alc.722; du/nontos tou= q. App.BC4.79; the
weather, ti/ dokei= ta\ tou= qeou=; Thphr.Char.25.2. Astrol., qeoi/,= a)ste/res, Jul. Laod.in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).252. qeo/s (sc. *(/hlios), name of the 9th to/pos, Rhetor.ib.163, etc. metaph., of abstract things, to\ d' eu)tuxei=n to/d' e)n brotoi=s qeo/s te kai\ qeou= ple/on A.Ch.60; h( fro/nhsis a(gaqh\ q. me/gas S.Fr.922; q. ga kai\ to\ gignw/skein fi/lous E.Hel.<*>60; o( plou=tos toi=s sofoi=s q. Id.Cyc.316; fqo/nos ka/kistos q. Hippothoon 2. as title of rulers, qew=n a)delfw=n (sc. Ptolemy Il and Arsinoe), Herod.1.30, etc.; *ptolemai=os u(pa/rxwn qeo\s e)k qeou= kai\ qea=s OGI90.10(Rosetta, ii B.C.); *)anti/oxos o(/tw| qeo\s e)pw/numon gi/gnetai App.Syr.65; qeo\s e)k qeou=, of Augustus, OGI655.2 (Egypt, 24 B.C.); q. h(mw=n kai\ despo/ths IPE4.71 (Cherson., ii A.D.). = Lat.
Divus, Mon.Anc.Gr.10.4, Str.4.1.1, etc.; oi( e)n qeoi=s au)tokra/tores,=
divi Imperatores, IG12(1).786 (Rhodes). generally of the dead, kai\ zw=nto/s sou kai\ ei)s qeou\s a)pelqo/ntos PPetr.2p.45 (iii B.C.); qeoi=s xqoni/ois,= Lat.
Dis Manibus, IG14.30,al.
one set in authority, judge, to\ krith/rion tou= q., e)nw/pion tou= q., LXXEx.21.6, 22.8; qeou\s ou) kakologh/seis ib.22.28(27). qeo/s fem.,
goddess, mh/te qh/leia qeo/s, mh/te tis a)/rshn Il.8.7, cf. Hdt.2.35, al.; toi=s qeoi=s eu)/xomai pa=si kai\ pa/sais D.18.1, cf. 141, Orac.ib.21.52; esp. at Athens, of Athena, Decr. ap. And.1.77, Pl.Ti.21a, etc.; a( *dio\s qeo/s, *zhno\s h( q., S.Aj.401 (lyr.), 952 (h( *dio\s qea/ ib.450); of other goddesses, ponti/a qeo/s Pi.I. 8(7).36; h( nerte/ra q.,= *persefo/nh, S.OC1548, etc.; of Thetis, Pl. Ap.28c; of Niobe, S.El.150 (lyr.), Ant.834 (anap.): in dual, of Demeter and Persephone, ta\ toi=n qeoi=n yhfi/smata Ar.V.378 (lyr.); ou)d' e)/deise tw\ qew/ And.1.125; freq. in oaths, nh\ tw\ qew/ Ar.Lys.112; ma\ tw\ qew/ Id.Ec.155,532. as Adj. in Comp. qew/teros,
divine, qu/rai q., opp. kataibatai\ a)nqrw/poisin, Od.13.111; xoro\s q. Call.Ap. 93, cf.Dian.249, D.P.257. (Derived by Hdt.2.52 fr. ti/qhmi （ko/smw| qe/ntes ta\ prh/gmata), by Pl.Cra.397d fr. qei=n. Etym. dub.) [In Ep. (twice in Hom.) and Trag. (E.Ba.47, 1347, al., not in Com.), as monosyll. by synizesis, qeoi/ Il.1.18, Thgn.142; qew=n h.Cer.55, 259; qeoi=s Thgn.171; qeoi=sin Od.14.251; qeou/s h.Cer.325: even in nom. qeo/s before a vowel, E.Or.399 (cf. Pors. ad loc.), HF347; in Pi.P. 1.56 apptly. a short monosyll.]

qeo/s-dotos, on, poet. and later Prose for qeo/dotos,
given by the gods, Hes.Op.320; du/namis Pi.P.5.13; eu)daimoni/a Arist.EN1099b12; a)reth/ Max.Tyr.38.4.
qeo/s-dwros, on, poet. for qeodw/rhtos, a fiction of Tz. ad Lyc.47.

qeose/b-eia, h(,
service or
fear of God, religiousness, X.An.2.6.26, Pl.Epin.985c, 990a, Plu.in Hes.46, Iamb.Protr.20.

qeoseb-e/w,
serve God, Plu.
Fr.inc.22, D.C.54.30; to\ q. SIG708.18(Istropolis, ii B.C.).

qeoseb-h/s, e/s,
fearing God, religious, Hdt.1.86, 2.37, S.OC260 (Sup.), Pl.Cra. 394d, al.; q. me/los Ar.Av.897 (lyr.); to\ qeosebe/s Pl.Epin.977e. Adv. -bw=s X.Cyr.3.3.58.
qeose/ptwr, oros, o(,= qeosebh/s, E.Hipp.1364 (anap.).
qeosexqri/a, h(, v. qeoisexqri/a; cf. qeoexqri/a.

qeoshmei/a, h(,
a sign from the gods, Suid.:—also qeoshmi/a, h(, Hsch. s.v. eu)ameri/a.
qeosknei=: qeou\s tima=|, Hsch.; cf. quoske/w.

qeosof-e/w,
have knowledge of things divine, Porph.Abst.4.17.

qeosof-i/a, h(,
knowledge of things divine, PMag.Leid.W.6.17; h( a)/gan q. Porph.Abst.4.9; *(ellhnikh/, *xaldai+kh\ q., Procl.Theol.Plat.5.35, Dam. Pr.350.

qeo/sof-os, on,
wise in the things of God, Porph.Abst.2.35, Iamb.Myst.7.1: pl., of the *gumnosofistai/, Porph.Abst.4.17.

qeo/-sporos, on,
sown by a god, divine, ku=ma E.Fr.106.
qeo/-ssu^tos, v. qeo/sutos.

qeo/sta^sis, ews, h(,
base or
pedestal for statues of gods, CIL2.1724 (Gades).

qeo-sth/riktos, on,
supported by God, skh=ptra AP15.15 (Const. Rhod.).

qeo-sti^bh/s, e/s,
trodden by God, deira/s Limen.21; pulew=nes
Procl.H.7.7.

qeo-stu^gh/s, e/s,
hated of the gods, E.Tr.1213, Cyc.602, Poll.1.21;
hated of God, Ep.Rom.1.30 (where some take it Act.,
hating God).
qeo-stu/ghtos [u^], on, = foreg. 1, a)/gos A.Ch.635 (lyr.).

qeo-su/lhs [u_], on, o(, （su_la/w)
robbing God, sacrilegious, Ael. VH5.16, Fr.124, Ph. ap. Eus.PE8.14.

qeo-su_li/a, h(,
sacrilege, Ael. NA10.28: in pl., interpol. in Id.VH6.8.

qeosu/ndetos, on,
united by God, Hierocl.in CA26p.478M.

qeo/su^tos, on,
sent by the gods, q. h)\ bro/teios; A.Pr.116; no/sos ib. 596 (lyr.):—also qeo/ssutos xeimw/n ib.643.
qeo-tarpe/<e>s: qeo\n te/rpontes, Hsch.

qeo/-tauros, o(,
god-bull, a name for Zeus, Mosch.2.135.

qeo-tei/xhs, es,
walled by gods, of Troy, Epigr. ap. Certamen 311.

qeo-te/ra^tos, on,
with divine portents, pla/nai q., of Io's wanderings, dithyrambic phrase in Demetr.Eloc.91 codd. qeo-terph/s, e/s, of a dish,
fit for the gods, Philox.2.9;
pleasing to God, bioth/ AP9.197 (Marin.); cf. qeotarpe/es.

qeo/-teuktos, on,
made by God, pu/rgoi Simm. 25, cf. Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr.1.1.

qeo/ths, htos, h(,
divinity, divine nature, Ep.Col.2.9, Plu.2.359d, Luc. Icar.9, etc.; dia\ qeo/thta
for religious reasons, Heliod. ap. Orib.50.7.1.

qeo-ti/mhtos [i], Dor. qeo/-a_tos, on, B.8.98:—
honoured by the gods, qeotimh/tous basilh=as Tyrt.4.3, cf. A.Ag.1337 (anap.); po/lis B. l.c.
qeo/-ti_mos, on, = foreg., a)/stu Id.10.12 (trisyll.), cf. Pi.I.6(5).13, Orph.H.27.1.

qeo-to/kos, h(,
mother of God, of the Virgin, Cod.Just.1.1.5.1, Just.Nov.3.1, SIG910B (vi A.D.).

qeo/-treptos, on,
turned by the gods, qeo/trepta ta/d' au)= qe/romen these
divine changes of fortune, A.Pers.905 (-prepta cod. M).

qeo-trefh/s, e/s,
feeding the gods, a)mbrosi/h AP9.577 (Ptol.), cf. Nonn.D.9.101.

qeou/deia, h(,
fear of God, qeoudei/h| t' e)ke/kasto A.R.3.586; cf. sq.

qeoudh/s, e/s,
fearing God, Hom. only in Od., kai/ sfin no/os e)sti\ qeoudh/s 6.121, 8.576, 9.176; qeoude/a qumo\n e)/xonta 19.364; basilh=os . . o(/s te qeoudh/s . . eu)diki/as a)ne/xh|si 19.109, cf. MAMA1.171 (Laodicea Combusta), etc. Adv. -dw=s Orph.Fr.169. (qeo-dvh/s contr. fr. qeo-dveh/s, compd. of qeo/s and de/os: but taken as if = qeoeidh/s by late Poets, as Q.S.1.65, 3.775.)

qeourg-i/a, h(,
divine work, Jul.Or.7.219a.
sacramental rite, 'mystery', Porph. ap. Aug.Civ.D.10.9; i(eratikh\ q. Iamb.Myst.9.6; oi( peri\ qeourgi/an deinoi/ Procl.in Alc.p.92C.
qeourg-i/asma, atos, to/, = foreg. 11, Dam.Isid.56.

qeourg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a qeourgo/s, teletai/ Porph. ap. Aug.Civ.D.10.9; koinwni/a Iamb.Myst.1.8; te/xnh ib.2.11. Adv. qeourg-kw=s Procl.in Cra.p.32P.; opp. texnikw=s, Iamb.Myst.3.28: Comp. -w/teron ib.2.11.

qeourg-o/s, o(,
divine worker, of the dhmiourgo/s, Dam.Pr.341.
performer of sacramental rites, Jul.Or.5.173a, Procl.in Alc.p.150C., Iamb. Myst.3.18. as Adj., h( q. e)ne/rgeia ib.20.

qeofa/n-eia, h(,
vision of God, Notiz.Arch.4.236 (Cyrene).

qeofa/n-ia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
festival at Delphi, at which the statues of Apollo and other gods were shown to the people, Hdt.1.51, cf. Poll.1.34; at Chios, SIG1064.3 (Halic., i B.C.): generally, q. a)/gein tini/ Philostr.VA4.31; q. qu/ein Ael.NA11.10.

qeo/-fantos, on,
revealed by God or
revealing God, o)/rgia Metrod. 38.

qeo-fa/ntwr, oros, o(,
a revealer of God, a priest, Suid. s.v. *dionu/sios o( *)arewpagi/ths.
qeo/-fa^tos, qeo-fa^ti/ze, = qe/sfatos, qesfati/zw, Hsch.

qeo/-fhmos, on,
declaring God's will, a)strolo/goi Man.1.293, 4.128.

qeo/-fqegktos, on,
uttered by God, Eust.1381.2.
qeofi/l-eia [fi^], h(,= qeofili/a, Marin.Procl.32.

qeofil-h/s, e/s, (file/w)
dear to the gods, highly favoured, of persons, Hdt.1.87, Democr.217, Pl.R.382e, Phlb.39e, etc.; of Moses, Ph.2.218 (Sup.); as honorary epith. in Egypt, Sammelb.421 (Sup.), al.; also, of places, etc., po/lis Pi.I.6(5).66; *)/argos B.10.60; po/lin . . qeofilesta/thn Eup.307; xw/ra A.Eu.869 (Sup.); tu/xai Id.Fr.350.3; e(orth/ Ar.Ra.446; moi=ra X. Ap.32; e)pith/deuma lsoc.8.35 (Comp.), cf. Pl.Euthphr.7a; qeofile/s [e)stin] ei) . . ' tis
a mark of divine favour, if . . , Plu.2.30f. Adv. -lw=s, pra/ttein to act
as the gods will, Pl.Alc.1.134d: Comp. -e/steron, diabebiwke/nai Isoc.9.70. Act.,
loving God, Ph.2.415, Luc. JTr.47 (Sup.), Agath.3.13, Cod.Just.1.1.5.4 (Sup.). Adv. h( po/lis ou) mo/non -lw=s a)lla\ kai\ filanqrw/pws e)/sxen Isoc.4.29, cf. Poll.1.22.

qeofi/l-htos, h, on,
loved by the gods, Phint. ap. Stob.4.23.61a (hyperdor. -a_tos).

qeofil-i/a, h(,
the favour of God, Oenom. ap. Eus.PE5.34, Sch.S.OT40.

qeofi/l-ion, to/,
eyesalve invented by Theophilus, Aët.7.115, Alex.Trall.2.
qeo/fil-os, on, = qeofi/lhtos, epith. of a city, BGU924.1 (iii A.D.).

qeofil-o/ths, htos, h(,
a being loved by God, Men.Rh.pp.361,362S.
qeo/fin, Ep. gen. and dat., sg. and pl., of qeo/s.

qeo/-fobos, on,
fearing God, Porph.Abst.1.1, Hsch.

qeo/-foitos, on,
driven by divine frenzy, of Cassandra, Tryph.374.

qeofor-e/w,
deify, to\ pu=r S.E.M.9.32. Pass.,
to be possessed by a god, inspired, Longin.13.2, Ph.2.146, al., Luc.Philops.38, S.E.P. 1.101; *qeoforoume/nh, name of a play of Menander, Ath.11.504a, cf. Arg.Men.Oxy.1235.46.

qeofo/r-hsis, ews, h(,
divine possession, ecstasy, in pl., D.H.2.19, Plu.2.278c.

qeofo/r-htos, on,
possessed by a god, inspired, A.Ag.1140 (lyr.), Str.12.2.3, Sor.1.88, Plu.2.54c; *q., name of a play by Alexis. Adv. -tws Plu.2.45f. Act.,
carrying a god or
goddess, Luc.Asin.37.
qeofor-i/a, h(,= qeofo/rhsis, Phld.Mus.p.25K., lamb. Myst.3.5,al.: pl., Phld.Mus.p.49K., Str.12.3.32, 16.2.36:—sg. in poet. form qeufori/h AP6.220.4 (Diosc.).

qeo/for-os (-fo/r-), on, (fe/rw)
bearing or
carrying a god, po/des A.Fr.225. qeo/foros, on,
possessed by a god, inspired, q. du/ai the pains
of inspiration, Id.Ag. 1150 (lyr.), cf. Phld.D.1.4. q. o)no/mata names
derived from a god, as *dio/dwros, Ath.10.448e.

qeofra^d-h/s, e/s, (fra/zw)
speaking from God, prophetic, *mousai=os Orph.Fr.271. Pass.,
indicated by God, ke/leuqoi Procl.H.6.8.

qeofra^d-i/a, h(,
a divine saying, oracle, Hsch.
qeofra^/d-mwn, on, gen. onos, = qeofradh/s 1, Ph.1.516, 2.176.
qeo-frone/w,= qei=a frone/w, Hld.2.11.

qeo-frosu/nh, h(,
godliness, Hsch.

qeo/-frouros, on,
guarded by (or perh.
guarding)
the gods, IG12(5).241 (Paros, i B.C.).

qeo/-qrwn, on, gen. onos, (frh/n)
godlyminded, holy, *ka/dmos ThebaïsFr.2.3, cf. Pi.O.6.41.

qeo-fu/lac [u^], akos, o(,
guardian of a god, gloss on qewro/s, Sch.Pi.N.3.122.

qeo-xolwsi/a, h(,
the wrath of God, Lyd.Ost.37, Sch.Od.8.232:—also qeo-xolwsu/nh, Sch.Luc.Lex.10.

qeo-xo/lwtos, on,
under God's wrath, Arr.Epict.2.8.14,3.1.37, Vett. Val.67.19.

qeo/-xrhstos, on,
delivered by God, lo/gia q., of the Mosaic Law, Ph.2.577.

qeo/w,
make into God, deify, Oenom. ap. Eus.PE5.34:—Pass., e)/nnoiai qewqei=sai Iamb.VP23.103.
become divine, gui=a qewqei/s Call. Dian.159; kaq' o(/son pa/nta teqe/wtai Procl.in Prm.p.490S., ct. Jul. Or.5.178b. = qeio/w 1, Arar.12.

qe/ptanos: a(pto/menos, Hsch. (perh. cogn. with Skt.
dáhati, Lith.
degù 'burn', Lith.
degtìnė 'brandy').

qera/pain-a [ra^], h(, fem. of qera/pwn,
handmaid or
female slave, Hdt.3.134, Pherecyd.Syr.2, And.1.64, X.Cyr.6.4.11, Men.141, etc.
qerapain-i/dion, to/, Dim. of sq., Men.Sam.36, Parth.26.2, Plu.Ant. 29, Luc.Pisc.17, etc.
qerapain-i/s, i/dos, h(, = qera/paina, Pl.Lg.808a, Men. 142, Parth.10.2.

qera^p-ei/a, Ion. qera^p-hi/+h (qera^p-ei/h Hp.Art.80,al.), h(,
service, attendance: of persons, q. tw=n qew=n
service paid to the gods, Pl. Euthphr.13d, cf. E.El.744 (lyr.); qew=n kai\ h(rw/wn qerapei=ai Pl.R.427b, etc.; h( peri\ tou\s qeou\s q. Isoc.11.24; a)guia/tides q.
worship of Apollo Agyieus, E.Ion187; th\n q. a)podido/nai toi=s qeoi=s Arist.Pol.1329a32; q. th=s mh/nidos Jul.Or.5.159b: abs., pa=san q. w(s i)so/qeos qerapeuo/menos Pl.Phdr.255a, cf. Antipho 4.2.4; of parents, gone/wn qerapei/as kai\ tima/s Pl.Lg.886c, cf. Gorg.Fr.6 D.; of children,
nurture, care, mikrou\s pai=das qerapei/as deome/nous Lys.13.45; q. kai\ e)sqh/s X.Mem.3.11.4; q. sw/matos, yuxh=s, Pl.Grg.464b, La.185e.
service done to gain favour, paying court, q. tou= koinou= kai\ tw=n ai)ei\ proestw/twn Th.3.11; e)n qerapei/a| e)/xein pollh=| Id.1.55; pa/sh| qerapei/a| qerapeu/ein tina/ X.HG 2.3.14; qerapei/ais prosagage/sqai Isoc.3.22; th=| q. yuxagwgou/menos D.59.55.
medical or
surgical treatment or
cure, xeiro/s, podo/s, Hp.l.c.; ai( u(po\ tw=n i)atrw=n q. ai( dia\ kau/sewn gigno/menai
cures by cautery, Pl.Prt.354a; h( e)k tw=n gramma/twn q.
treatment secundum artem, Arist.Pol.1287a40, cf. Gal.1.400, etc.; tw=n kamno/ntwn Pl.Prt. 345a, cf. Th.2.51, Phld.Ir.p.21 W.; tou= sw/matos Id.Lib.p.19 O., Vit.Philonid.p.9 C.;
healing, qerapei/as e)pituxw/n Sammelb.1537b: in pl.,
cures, i)atro\s poiei= -ei/as POxy.1r.13. of animals,
care, tendance, Pl.Euthphr.13a, Arist.HA578a7 (pl.). of plants,
cultivation, Pl.Tht.149e, Thphr.HP2.2.12.
maintenance or
repairs of temples, SIG1106.49 (Cos, iv/iii B.C.), 1102.8 (ii B.C.).
preparation of fat for medical use, Dsc.2.76. in collective sense,
body of attendants, retinue, Hdt.1.199, 5.21, 7.184, LXXGe. 45.16; su\n i(ppikh=| q. X.Cyr.4.6.1; o( e)pi\ th=s q. tetagme/nos Plb.4.87.5.

qera^/p-euma, atos, to/,
a service done to another: q. qeou= divine
worship, Pl.Def.415a.
service paid to a person, cenika\ q. Id.Lg.718b, cf. Plu.2.1117c.
care of the body, Pl.Grg.524b (pl.); of a child, E.Hyps.Fr.3(1) ii 12 (lyr., pl.).
surgical treatment, Hp.Mochl.40(pl.), Arist.EN1181b3 (pl.); *)asklapiou= IG4.952.96 (Epid.), etc. concrete,
preparations, drugs, Hp.Morb.4.34.
qera^p-eusi/a, h(, rarer form for qerapei/a 11, Hsch.

qera^/p-eusis, ews, h(,
treatment, attention, Phld.Lib.p.20O.

qera^p-eute/on,
one must do service to, tou\s qeou/s X.Mem.2.1.28.
one must court, flatter, tou\s a)kou/ontas e)pai/nw| Arist.Rh.Al.1436b32.
one must cultivate, th\n gh=n X.l.c.
one must treat medically, Pl.R.408b, Dsc.Eup.1.101.
one must prepare fat, Id.2.76. Adj. qerapeute/os, a, on,
to be courted, Luc.Merc.Cond.38.

qera^p-euth/r, h=ros, o(,
attendant, Aristox.Fr. Hist.15, Plu.Lyc.11, Charito4.1; o( peri\ to\ sw=ma q. X.Cyr.7.5.65; tou= a)/ntrou Max.Tyr.14.2 (pl.).

qera^p-euth/s, ou=, o(
one who serves the gods, worshipper, q. *)/arews, qew=n, Pl.Phdr.252c, Lg.740c; o(si/wn te kai\ i(erw=n ib.878a; tou= kalou= Ph.1.261; oi( q. worshippers of Sarapis or Isis, UPZ8.19 (ii B.C.), IG11(4).1226 (Delos, ii B.C.); title of play by Diphilus, ib.2.992ii9; name of certain ascetics, Ph.2.471; q. o(sio/thtos, of the followers of Moses, ib.177.
one who serves a great man,
courtier, oi( a)mfi\ to\n pa/ppon q. X.Cyr.1.3.7.
one who attends to anything, c. gen., sw/matos Pl.Grg.517e; tw=n peri\ to\ sw=ma Id.R. 369d.
medical attendant, tw=n kamno/ntwn ib.341c.

qera^p-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to serve, c. gen., tw=n fi/lwn X.Ages.8.1; eu)se/beia du/namis q. qew=n Pl.Def.412e; qeou= Ph.1.202 (but to\ q. ge/nos, = qerapeutai/, Id.2.473);
inclined to court, tw=n dunatw=n, tou= plh/qous, Plu.Lys.2,
Comp.Lyc. Num.2; to\ q. th=s o(mili/as Id.Lys.4. abs.,
courteous, obsequious, in good and bad sense, X.HG3.1.28 (Comp.), Plu.Luc.16; q.parrhsi/a Id.2.74a. Adv. -kw=s Id.Art.4; q. e)/xein tino/s Ph.1.186, cf. Str.6.4.2.
inclined to take care of, careful of, lo/gou dub. l. in Men.402.15. esp. of medical treatment, e(/cis q. a
valetudinarian habit of body, Arist.Pol.1335b7; h( -kh/, = qerapei/a, Pl.Plt.282a; also to\ -ko/n
therapeutics, Dsc. Ther.Praef. (but also to\ peri\ paqw=n q., title of a work on
moral remedies by Chrysippus, Phld.Ir.p.17 W.); peri\ q. meqo/dou, title of work by Galen.

qera^p-euto/s, o/n,
that may be fostered or
cultivated, Pl.Prt.325b.
curable, Paul.Aeg.4.5.
qera^p-eu/tria, h(, fem. of qerapeuth/s EM47.45.
qera^p-eutri/s, i/dos, h(,= foreg., Ph.1.261, 655: pl., as title of certain female ascetics, Id.2.471.

qera^p-eu/w, later also qa^ra^peu/w (q.v.), fut. -eu/sw Th.2.51, etc.:—Med., fut. -eu/somai h.Ap.390: aor. e)qerapeusa/mhn Nicostr. ap. Stob.4.23.65
codd., Gal.11.295:—Pass., fut. -euqh/somai Id.10.617: fut. Med. in pass. sense, Antipho4.2.4, Pl.Alc.1.135e: aor. e)qerapeu/qhn Id.Chrm.157b, etc.:—
to be an attendant, do service, once in Hom., Od. 13.265:—Med., h.Ap.390.
do service to the gods, a)qana/tous, qeou\s q., Hes.Op.135, Hdt.2.37, X.Mem.1.4.13, etc.; dai/mona Pi.P.3.109; *dio/nuson, *mou/sas, E.Ba.82 (lyr.), IT1105(lyr.); q. *foi/bou naou/s
serve them, Id.Ion111 (anap.): abs.,
worship, Lys.6.51;
do service or
honour to one's parents, E.Ion183 (lyr.), Pl.R.467a, Men.91a;
serve, wait upon a master, Id.Euthphr.13d, cf. Ar.Eq.59, 1261, etc.; q. ta\s qh/kas
reverence men's graves, Pl.R.469a. in Prose,
pay court to, [tina] Hdt.3.80, etc.; in bad sense,
flatter, wheedle, Th.3.12; q. to\ plh=qos, tou\s pollou/s, Id.1.9, Plu.Per.34;
conciliate, tina\ xrhma/twn do/sei Th.1.137, cf. Hdn.2.2.8; to\ qerapeu=on,= oi( qerapeu/ontes, Th.3.39; q. gunai=ka
pay her
attention, X.Cyr.5.1.18; also ta\s qu/ras tino\s q.
wait at a man's door, ib.8.1.6; au)la\s q. kai\ satra/pas Men.897; au)la\s basilika\s q. D.L.9.63. of things,
consult, attend to, to\ cumfe/ron Th.3.56; h(donh\n q.
indulge one's love of pleasure, X.Cyr.5.5.41; q. to\ paro/n
look to, provide for the present, S.Ph.149(anap.); to\ nautiko/n Th.2.65; th\n a)/noicin tw=n pulw=n Id.4.67; q. tou\s kairou/s D.18.307: c. inf.,
take care that . . , q. to\ mh\ qorubei=n, mh\ lei/pesqai, Th.6.61,7.70; q. o(/pws politeu/sousi Id.1.19; q. w(s . . Longus 4.1. q. to\ sw=ma
take care of one's person, Pl.Grg.513d; q. au(tou/s Plu.Eum.9; q. ta\s tri/xas Longus4.4; mu/rois xai/thn q. Archestr. Fr.62.3; q. tou\s po/das LXX 2 Ki.19.24: c. acc. et inf., q. ko/mhn fai/nesqai lipara/n Plu.Lyc.22.
foster, th\n yuxh/n, th\n dia/noian, Pl.Cra.440c, R.403d; q. ka/dea
brood over sorrows, Pi.I.8(7).8. q. h(me/rhn
observe a day,
keep it
as a feast, Hdt.3.79; i(era\ -o/mena Th.4.98.
treat medically, Hp.VM9, Th.2.47,51; tou\s tetrwme/nous X.Cyr.3.2.12; trau/mata Phld.Piet.89; mh\ qerapeu/ein be/ltion: qerapeuo/menoi ga\r a)po/lluntai taxe/ws Hp.Aph.6.38; tau/thn th\n qerapei/an qerapeu/sesqai Antipho 4.2.4; q. no/shma Isoc.19.28; sw/mata -o/mena Pl.Lg.684c; o)fqalmou/s Arist.EN1102a19: abs., oi( qerapeu/ontes Phld.Ir.p.29 W.: metaph., o( koino\s i)atro/s se qerapeu/sei xro/nos Philippid.32; lu/phn . . oi)=de qerapeu/ein lo/gos Men.591; ta\ ponou=nta me/rh th=s new/s D.S.4.41; ta\s u(poyi/as
allayed, Plu.Luc.22; u(po/noian Phlp.
in de An.408.3; dustuxi/an
assuage it, Luc.Ind.6. of animals,
train, i(/ppous Pl.Grg.516e. of land,
cultivate, X.Oec.5.12; of trees,
train, Hdt.1.193; ste/lexos Thphr.HP2.7.3.
prepare, dress, food or drugs, Archestr.Fr.13.4, al., Dsc.2.76 (Pass.).
mend garments, PGiss.79iv3 (Pass., ii A.D.).
qera^p-hi/+h, h(, Ion. for qerapei/a (q.v.):—also qeraphi/+as: bwmoloxi/as, Hsch.
qera^p-h/i+os, a, on, Ion. and poet. for qerapeutiko/s, in neut. pl. -h/i+a, nou/swn AP7.158.8:— fem. qeraphi/+s, i/+dos, Orac. ap. Jul.Ep.88b.

qera^p-i/dion, to/,
means of cure, Sch.Luc.Alex.21.
qera^/p-ion, to/, Dim. of qe/ray, Hyp.Fr.99.

qera^p-i/s, i/dos, h(,
paying court to, favouring, po/lis tou= h(/ttonos q. Pl.Mx.244e.

qera^/p-nh, h(, poet.,= qera/paina,
handmaid, *(ekathbele/tao q. h.Ap.157; *eu)rw/pas q. E.Hec.482 (lyr.), cf. A.R.1.786.
dwelling, abode, E.Tr. 211 (lyr.), Ba.1043 (pl.), HF370(lyr.), Nic.Th.486 (unless it be pr. n. in these places). as pr. n. *qera/pnh, a Laconian city, Pi.P. 11.63, Hdt.6.61, etc.; Lacon. *sera/pna Alcm.4: in pl. *qera/pnai Isoc. 10.63.
qera^/p-nion, to/, Dim. of foreg. 1, Hsch.
qera^p-ni/s, i/dos, h(, poet., = qerapaini/s, AP9.603 (Antip.).
qera^p-o/ntion, to/, Dim. of qera/pwn, D.L.4.59.

qera^p-onti/s, i/dos, h(,
of a waiting-maid, q. fernh/ A.Supp. 979 (anap.).
qera^p-ousi/a, h(,= qerapei/a IV, condemned by Poll.3.75.

qera^/p-wn, ontos, o(, dat. pl. qerapo/ntessi Pi.P.4.41; Aeol. qera/pwn Sapph.74, gen. qerra/ponos Choerob.in
An Ox.2.242 (qera/ponos cod., cf. Hdn.Gr.2.302):—
henchman, attendant, Od.16.253, etc.;
companion in arms, squire, 4.23, etc.; h(ni/oxos q. Il.5.580, 8.119; tw/ oi( e)/san kh/ruke . . kai\ qera/ponte 1.321; qera/ponte *dio/s Od. 11.255; qera/pontes *)/arhos Il.2.110, etc.; *mousa/wn qera/pontes h.Hom. 32.20, cf. Hes.Th.100, Thgn.769, Ar.Av.909 (lyr.); *)/erws *)afrodi/ths q. Pl.Smp.203c, cf. Sapph. l.c.;
worshipper, *)apo/llwnos Pi.O. 3.16, cf. Pl.Phd.85a; *)/areos BMus.Inscr.971 (Cypr., v B.C.): c. dat., oi)=kos ce/noisi qera/pwn
devoted to the service of its guests, Pi.O.13.3; lwto\s . . *mousa=n q. E.El.717(lyr.): c. gen.,
attending upon, tw=n a)di/kws dustuxou/ntwn Gorg.Fr.6 D.
servant, Hdt.1.30, 5.105, Ar.Pl.3,5, And.1.12, Lys.7.34, etc.; at Chios,
slave, Eust. ad D.P. 533.

qe/ray, a^pos, o(, poet.,= qera/pwn, rare in sg., Epigr.Gr.415.3 (Alexandria): acc., *bakxiako\n qe/rapa (of Anacreon) APl.4.306.10（Leon.), cf.IGRom.4.1655（Notium): usu. in nom. pl., qe/rapes E.Ion94(anap.), Supp.762, Ion Eleg.2.2, Maiist.14, AP12.229 (Strato): acc. pl. qe/rapas in late Prose, Ant.Lib.13.4, 20.5.

qerei/a, h(,
summer; v. qe/reios.

qerei/-aulos, on, prob.
living in villeggiatura, Theognost.Can. 96.

qerei/-botos, on, (bo/skw)
serving for a summer-pasture, Eust.222.20.

qerei-genh/s, e/s,
growing in summer, Nic.Th.601.
hot, u(/data Nonn.D.26.229.

qerei-lexh/s, e/s,
for sleeping under in summer, pla/tanos Nic.Th.584.

qerei-no/mos, on,
feeding in summer, q. po/a
summer-pasture, D.H.2.2.

qe/reios, a, on, also os, on Ael. (v. infr.): (qe/ros):—
of summer, in summer, au)xmo\s q.
summer-drought, Emp.111.7; dre/panon Orph.H. 40.11; karpoi/ ib.18; qe/reios w(/ra Ael.NA2.25. qerei/a, Ion. -ei/h (sc. w(/ra), h(,= qe/ros,
summer-time, summer, Hdt.1.189, Arist. Mir.841a25, Plb.5.1.3, al., PTeb.27.60 (ii B.C.), D.S.19.58 (qeri/a|）; qerei/hs
in summer, Nic.Fr.81; mesou/shs q. D.H.1.63; u(po\ th\n qerei/an D.S.3.24: pl., qerei/ais Pi.I.2.41. Sup. qerei/tatos, h, on,
very hot, Arat.149, Nic.Th.460.—In Prose qerino/s is the more common form.

qerei/potos, on, (pi/nw)
watered in summer, gu/ai Lyc.847.
qerei/w, later poet. form of qe/rw, in Med., Nic.Th.124, Al.567.
qere/simon: qeristiko/n, Hsch.

qe/retron, to/, (qe/ros)
summer-abode, dub. in Hp.Epid.1.20, cf. Gal. 17(1).197.

qerh/ga^non, contr. qe/rhgnon, to/, (qe/ros)
wicker body of the harvestcart, Hsch., EM447.14; perh. to be read in E.Fr.781.1.

qeriako/s, h/, o/n,
for summer, i(ma/tia POxy.1901.37 (vi A.D.).

qeri/dion, to/,
summer residence, Jul.Ep.4.

qeri/zw, Boeot. inf. qeri/ddein Ar.Ach.947(lyr.): fut. Att. -iw= Arist. HA601b17: aor. e)qe/risa S.Aj.239(anap.), syncop. e)/qrisa A.Ag.536 (cf. a)poqri/zw); poet. e)qe/rissa AP9.451; later (subj.) e)kqeri/cw Anacreont. 9.7:—Med.(v. infr.):—Pass., aor. e)qeri/sqhn: pf. teqe/rismai (v. infr.): (qe/ros):—
do summer-work, mow, reap, si=ton, kriqa/s, Hdt.4.42, Ar.Av.506, etc.: abs.,
harvest, Phld.Mus.p.71 K.: freq. metaph., joined with spei/rw, ai)sxrw=s me\n e)/speiras kakw=s de\ e)qe/risas Gorg.Fr. 16 D., cf. Plu.2.394e; h( r(htorikh\ karpo\n w(=n e)/speire qeri/zei Pl.Phdr. 260d; ou)k e)/sti mh\ spei/ranta qeri/sai ka/rpima Epigr.Gr.1039.15:— Med., karpo\n *dhou=s qeri/sasqai Ar.Pl.515:—Pass., a(\ [dra/gmata] e)/tuxen . . teqerisme/na X.HG7.2.8. metaph.,
mow down, *)/arh to\n . . qeri/zonta brotou/s A.Supp.637(lyr.), cf.Ag.536; bi/on q. w(/ste ka/rpimon sta/xun E.Hyps.Fr.34(60).94; q. *)asi/an
to plunder it, Plu.2.182a.
cut off, kefalh\n kai\ glw=ssan a)/kran S.Aj.239; kune/as E.Supp.717; glw=ssan AP9.451: metaph., seli/dos nearh=s q. sta/xun ib.4.2.3（Phil.): —Pass., h(/tis [pw=los] . . qe/ros qerisqh=| canqo\n au)xe/nwn a)/po who
had her crop of yellow mane
cut off, S.Fr.659.4. metaph.,
reap a good harvest, Ar.Ach.947 (lyr.); of bribes, Lib.Or.47.26. o( qeri/zwn (with or without lo/gos), a logical fallacy, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.94, D.L.7.25: pl., ib.44. intr.,
pass the summer, X.An.3.5.15; q. e)n toi=s yuxroi=s, xeima/zousi d' e)n toi=s a)leeinoi=s Arist.HA596b26, cf. 598a25.
qeri/kleion: poth/rion, ko/ndu, Hsch. (i.e. *qhri/kleion).

qeri^no/s, h/, o/n,= qe/reios, Pi.P.3.50: the usu. form in Prose, a)natolh/ Hp.
Aër.4, cf. Aph.2.25, Plb.3.37.4; q. du/seis, a)natolai/, Cleom. 1.9; q. zw/|dia ib.6; meshmbri/a X.Cyn.6.26; h(/lios Pl.Lg.915d; q. tropai/ or troph/, the summer solstice, ib.767c, Arist.Mete.364b2; trope/wn tw=n qerine/wn Hdt.2.19; q. ku/klos, Tropic of Cancer, Ph.1.27; q. tropiko/s (sc. ku/klos) Euc.Phaen.p.34 M., Cleom.1.7, Gem.5.39, al.; qerino\n u(phxei=n to echo
summer-like, Pl.Phdr.230c; qerina/ the
summer-haunts of the sun, Id.Lg.683c; o)/mbroi q. Arist.HA601b24; q. a)/nesis kai\ a)po/lausis D.S.4.84; q. w(/ra Oenopid.ib.1.41;
for summer use, i(ma/tion PCair.Zen.148 (iii B.C.); nomai/, opp. xeimerinai/, PLond.3.842.12 (ii A.D.).

qer-ismo/s, o(,
mowing, reaping, X.Oec.18.3, PHib.1.90.5 (iii B.C.), PFlor.101.4 (i A.D.).
reaping-time, harvest, Eup.202, Plb.5.95.5, Ev.Matt.13.30, al.
harvest, crop, LXXLe.19.9, Ev.Matt. 9.37.

qer-isth/r, h=ros, o(,
mower, reaper, Lyc.840.

qer-isth/rion, to/,
reaping-hook, LXX 1 Ki.13.20（v.l. qe/ristron), Max.Tyr.30.6.
qer-isth/s, ou=, o(,= qeristh/r, X.Hier.6.10, D.18.51, Arist.HA580b20, PCair.Zen. 292.486 (iii B.C.): qeristai/, oi(, a satyric play of Euripides, Arg.E. Med.

qer-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for reaping, dre/panon PMagd.8.6 (iii B.C.); u(/mnos Suid. s.v. *litue/rshs: as Subst. q., to/,
crop, Str.17.3.11.

qer-isto/s, h/, o/n, to\ q. a kind of
balsam, Dsc.1.19 codd. (eu)qe/riston Wellm.).
qe/ristos and qeristo/s, o(, v. qe/ritos.

qe/ristra, ta/,
cost of reaping, POxy.277.8(i B.C.).
qeri/stria, h(, fem. of qeristh/r, Ar.Fr.788.

qeri/strion, to/,
light summer garment, Theoc.15.69, Aristaenet. 1.27.

qe/ristron, to/,= foreg., LXXGe.24.65, al., PPetr.1p.37 (iii B.C.), AP6.254（Myrin.), Ph.1.666.
sickle, LXX 1 Ki.13.20(v.l.).

qe/ritos, o(,
harvest, and qerito/s, o(,
harvest-time, Tz.ad Hes.Op.571 (qe/ristos and qeristo/s cj. Spohn ad Niceph. Blemm.p.40).

qeri/tropos, on,
turning in summer, of the solstice, Tz.ad Hes.Op. 596.

qe/rma^, qe/rma^n, alternative nom. and acc. sg. forms for qe/rmh, qe/rmhn, Men.Georg.51, Ar.Fr.690, dub. in Pl.Tht.178c (qerma/ codd., but Tim.Lex. and Phryn. perh. read qe/rmh). pl. qe/rmata, v. qre/mma.
qerma/zw,= sq., Ep. aor. 1 opt. Med. qerma/ssaio Nic.Al.587.

qermai/nw, aor. e)qe/rmhna Il.14.7, etc., later e)qe/rma_na Arist.GA730a16: pf. teqe/rmagka Hsch. s.v. kexli/agka: pf. Pass. teqe/rmasmai Apollod.Poliorc.147.4, Eust.1573.47, (dia-) Hp.Vict.2.64: (qermo/s): —
warm, heat, ei)s o(/ ke qerma\ loetra\ . . *(ekamh/dh qermh/nh| Il.14.7; h(/lios qermai/nwn xqo/na E.Ba.679, cf. A.Pers.505; to\ xalki/on qe/rmaine Eup. 108:—Med.,
cause to be warmed, th=| e)rwme/nh| xalki/a du/o u(/datos PSI 4.406.37 (iii B.C.):—Pass.,
to be heated, Od.9.376, Pl.Phd.63d; to\ qermai=non yu/xetai u(po\ tou= qermainome/nou Arist.GA768b18;
feel the sensation of heat, Pl.Tht.186d;
to be or
grow feverish, Hp.Epid.1.26.ib/;
to be parched, of roots, X.Oec.19.11. metaph., q. filo/tati no/on Pi.O.10(11).87; e(/ws e)qe/rmhn' au)to\n flo\c oi)/nou E.Alc.758; spla/gxn' e)qe/rmainon potw=| Id.Cyc.424; spla/gxna q. ko/tw| Ar.Ra.844; polla\ qermai/noi freni/ is prob. f.l. for p. q. fre/na, A.Ch.990(1004); ou) tou=to mh/ se qermh/nh| Herod.1.20:—Pass., kenai=sin e)lpi/sin qermai/netai
glows with hope, S.Aj.478; xara=| q. kardi/an
have one's heart
warm with joy, E.El.402.

qe/rman-sis, ews, h(,
heating, Arist.Metaph.1067b12, Gal.1.253, f.l. in Hp.Liqu.1.

qerman-te/on,
one must heat, Gal.10.104. Adj. qerman-te/os, a, on,
to be heated, Hp.Art.11.

qerman-th/r, h=ros, o(,
kettle or
pot for boiling water, Poll.6.89, 10.66.

qerman-th/rios, a, on,
promoting warmth,
fa/rmaka Hp.Loc.Hom.17. xalki/on q.,= qermanth/r, IG4.39 (Aegina), 22.1416, Gal.13.663.

qerman-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
capable of heating, calorific, to\ pu=r q. Arist.Int.22b38; o( oi)=nos Epicur.Fr.58, cf. 60; to\ q. pro\s to\ -to\n Arist.Metaph.1020b29, cf. Thphr.HP6.3.6: Sup., Arist.Cael.307a1, Dsc.1.19.4: c. gen., to\ th=s yuxh=s q. oi)=nos Pl.Ti. 60a.

qerman-to/s, h/, o/n,
capable of being heated, Arist.Ph.224a30.

qe/rmasma, atos, to/,
warm fomentation, Hp.Acut.16 (pl.), Gal.UP 4.8.
qe/rmassa, h(,= ka/minos, Hdn.Gr.1.267.
qerma/stion, to/,= qermastri/s 1, Aen.Tact.18.6, IG22.1425.379 (pl.).
qe/rmastis, idos, h(, perh. = qe/rmastris, parufh\n e)/xei qe/rmastin, of a garment, IG22.1514.29, 1515.21, 1516.8 (iv B.C.).

qerma/stra, h(,
oven, furnace, Call.Del.144 (-austrai codd.), Euph. 51.8 (pl.), Hsch. (nom. pl. proparox. cod. Hsch., codd. Call. vary in accent):—Adv. qermastrh=qen,
from the furnace, Hsch. (-sth=qen cod.).

qermastri/s or qe/rmastris (Hsch.), h(, IG22.1414.42; acc. qermastrin Roussel
Cultes Égyptiens 220 (Delos, ii B.C.); gen. qermastri/dos Arist.Mech.854a24: acc. pl. qerma/streis LXX 3 Ki.7.26(40),31(45): for forms with -austr- v. infr.:—
tongs used by smiths to take hold of hot metal, Hsch.: generally,
pincers, pliers, Arist.l.c. metaph.,
a violent dance, in which the legs were crossed
tong-fashion, Poll.4.102, Ath.14.630a, Hsch. (qermaustri/s codd. Poll., qauuastreis cod. A Ath., qe/rmastris Hsch.); cf. qermaustri/zw.
spike, clamp, Ath.Mech.34.4. = qermanth/r, ta\s qerma/streis LXX Il.cc.; qermaustri/s and qermastri/s Poll.10.66; acc. qe/rmaustrin (prob. in this signf.) Eup.228: in IG and Roussel Il. cc. the signf. may be 1.1 or 111. (In signf. 1 prob. fr. qermo/s, au)/w (A), cf. e)c-au/w: but the origin of signf. 111 and the form -astr- is not clear.)
qermau/stra, h(, f.l. for qerma/stra (q.v.).

qermaustri/zw,
dance the qermaustri/s (v. qermastri/s 1.2), Critias Fr. 36 D., Luc.Salt.34.

qermayi/s,
fornax, Gloss.

qe/rmh, also qe/rma^ (q.v.), h(,
heat, Hp.VM19, LXXSi.38.28, Act.Ap.28.3; th=s q.
when it is hot, Olymp.in Mete.98.20;
feverish heat, Pherecr.158, Pl.Tht.178c (qerma/ codd.), Arist.Pr.862a18: Pl., Hp. Epid.7.51, Th.2.49, Arr.An.2.4.8. qe/rmai, ai(,
hot springs, IG14.455 (Catana), cf. 1055: name of a town in Sicily, Plb.1.24.4.
hot baths, POxy.473.5 (ii A.D.), etc.

qerm-hgore/w,
speak warmly, hotly, Orac. ap.Luc.Peregr.30.

qerm-hmeri/ai, w=n, ai(,
hot season, summer-time, Hp.Nat.Hom.7, Arist. HA544b11, Thphr.HP7.1.7.

qermhro/s, a/, o/n,
for hot liquid, poth/rion Hsch.s.v. kele/bh: qermhro/n (and qe/rm-htron), expld. by
miliarium, Gloss.

qermi/zw,
fall ill with fever, IG12(9).1240.15 (Aedepsus).

qe/rmi^nos, h, on, (qe/rmos)
of lupines, a)/leura Dsc.2.110; panopli/a Luc.VH1.27.
qe/rmion, to/, Dim. of qe/rmos, Stud.Pal.22.75.11 (iii A.D.), Gloss., condemned by Thom.Mag.p.183 R.

qermo-ba^fh/s, e/s,
dyed hot, opp. yuxrobafh/s, Thphr.Od.22.

qermo/-boulos, on,
hot-tempered, rash, spla/gxnon E.Fr.858; parodied in Ar.Ach. 119; a)/nqrwpos Ael.NA8.17.

qermo-do/ths, ou, o(,
one who brought the hot water atbaths, Gloss.:—fem. qermo-do/tis, idos, h(,
female bath-attendant, AP 9.183 (Pall.):
qermo-dosi/a, h(, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.5.30.19.

qermo-eidh/s, e/s,
of warm nature, EM557.23.
qermo-ergo/s, on, f.l. in A.Eu.560.

qermo-koi/lios, on,
hot-stomached, Hp.Epid.6.4.19.

qermo-kra_si/a, h(,
mixing of hot drink, Aët.9.30.

qermo-ku/a^mos [u^], h(, a
leguminous plant, of a kind between the qe/rmos and the ku/amos, Diph.87.
*qermolai=os, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month in Crete, GDI5075B 3.

qermo-lousi/a, h(,
hot bathing, Hp.Insomn.93, Aret.CD1.3, Com.Adesp.56, Thphr.Sud.16, Ph.2.548, Agathin. ap. Orib.10.7 tit.

qermo-loute/w,
use hotbaths, Hermipp.76, Alex.75, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.10.39.6 (qermo-loutre/w is incorrect in Arist.Pr.863a4).

qermo-lou/ths, ou, o(,
one who uses hot baths, Agathin. ap. Orib.10.7.9.
qermo-louti/a, h(, f.l. for -lousi/h, Hp.Insomn.93.

qermo/-luxnon, to/,
lamp-oil, IG22.1368.151.

qermo-mi^gh/s, e/s,
half-hot, a)h/r Placit.2.20.13.

qermo/-nous, oun,
heated in mind, A.Ag.1172 (dub.).

qermopl-a/w,
have inflammation in the hoof, of horses, Hippiatr. 53:
qermo/pl-hsis, ews, h(, the disease itself, ibid.: qermo/pla is dub. in Hsch.

qermo-peri/pa^tos, o(,
sunny promenade, Rev.Arch.1907 ii 418 (Nicopolis ad Istrum).

qermo-poio/s, o/n,
producing heat, Olymp.in Mete. 136.1, 244.14.

qermo-posi/a, h(,
drinking of hot liquid, Sor.1.117.

qermo-po/ths, ou, o(,
one who drinks hot drinks, Ath.8.352b, Gal.10.828:—fem. po/tis, idos,
cup for such drinks, Pamphil. ap. Ath.11.475d, cf. Hsch. s.v. skambi/s.

qermo/-prwktos, on,
lascivious, Sch.Ar.V.1030.

qermo-pu/lai [u^], w=n, ai(,
Thermopylae, 'gate of hot springs', Hdt.7.176,201, Str.9.4.12.

qermo-pw/lion, to/,
cook-shop, in Lat. form
thermopolium, Plaut. Curc.292, Trin.1013, but qermopwlei=on is expld. by
lupinarium, Gloss.

qermo/s, h/, o/n (but qermo\s a)u+tmh/ h.Merc.110, Hes.Th.696): (qe/rw):—
hot, q. loetra/ Il.14.6, cf. Od.8.249; q. loutra/ Pi.O.12.19, S.Tr.634 (lyr.), Pl.Lg.761c, etc.; da/krua Od.19.362; of water, ib.388; of glowing wood, 9.388; q. kau/mata Hdt.3.104 (Sup.); h)=n a)/ra puro\s e(/tera -o/tera Ar.Eq.382: freq. in Att., of
hot meals or drinks, TeleclId.1.8,32, Pherecr.130.8, etc.; of blood, S.OC622,Aj.1411 (anap.); -ota/tan ai(ma/da Id.Ph.696; of fever, q. no/soi Pi.P.3.66; q. sw=ma
feverish, Th.2.49. metaph.,
hot-headed, hasty, freq. of persons, A.Th.603, Eu.560 (lyr.), Ar.V.918, etc.; q. kai\ a)ndrei=os Antipho 2.4.5; of actions, polla\ kai\ q. moxqh/sas S.Tr.1046; q. e)/rgon Ar.Pl. 415; dra=n ti neaniko\n kai\ q. Amphis 33.10; q. e)pi\ yuxroi=si kardi/an e)/xeis S.Ant.88; q. po/qos AP5.114 (Phld.); fa/rmakon Alciphr.1.37 (Comp.): c. inf., qermo/teros e)pixeirei=n Antipho 2.1.7: Sup., w)= qermo/tatai gunai=kes Ar.Th.735.
still warm, fresh, i)/xnh AP9.371; a)tuxh/mata Plu.2.798f; q. kaka/, opp. e(/wla, ib.517f; ga/moi q. kai\ i)/sws au)/rion Philostr. VA4.25. to\ q.,= qermo/ths,
heat, Hdt.1.142, Pl.Cra. 413c, etc. q. (sc. u(/dwr), to/,
hot water, qermw=| lou=sqai, ba/ptein, Ar.Nu.1044, Ec.216; qermw=| kekrame/nos oi)=nos Gal.11.56; also,
hot drink, Arr.Epict.1.13.2. qermo/n, to/,
grace, favour, q. eu(rei=n e)n e)rh/mw| LXXJe.38(31).2. ta\ q. (sc. xwri/a) Hdt.4.29; but (sc. loutra/),
hot springs, X.HG4.5.3; ta\ q. tou= *(hrakle/ous Str.9.4.2. Adv. -mw=s Pl.Euthd.284e: Comp. -o/teron, e)/xein Eub.7.1: neut. pl. as Adv., qerma\ qerma\ phdw=sai Herod.4.61.

qe/rmos, o(,
lupine, Lupinus albus, Alex.162.11, 266.2 (pl.), Timocl. 18.4 (pl.), Thphr.HP8.11.2, Dsc.2.109, PFlor.379.47 (ii A.D.), AP 11.413 (Ammian.); ei)s tou\s q. to the
lupine-market, Telesp.13 H.

qermospodia/, h(,
hot ashes, Dsc.2.170, Erot.s.v. mari/lhn, Archig. ap. Orib.8.2.30, Philum. ap. Aët.5.120.

qermo/ths, htos, h(, (qermo/s)
heat, Hp.VM16, Pl.R.335d, etc.: pl., Id.Cra.432c, Diocl.Fr.112. metaph.,
heat, passion, tou= *)axille/ws Philostr.Her.12b; e)n tw=| le/gein Ath.1.1b.

qermotra^ge/w,
eat lupines, Luc.Lex.5.

qermourg-i/a, h(,
hasty act, App.Mith.108.

qermourg-o/s, o/n,
doing hot and hasty acts, reckless, X.Mem.1.3.9 (Sup.), Luc.Tim.2.

qe/rmouqis, h(, Egyptian pr. n. applied to the
asp, PMag.Par.1.2387, PMag.Lond.121.782, Ael.NA10.31.

qermo-fo/ron, to/,
saucepan, Gloss.:

qermo-fo/ros, o(,
boiler, ib., POxy. 2145.15 (ii A.D.).
qermo/-frwn, = dah/mwn, Hsch.s.v. dai/mwn.

qermo-fu/lac [u^], akos, o(,
kettle, Gloss.

qermo-xu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
vessel for hot drinks, AP9.587 tit.
qermo/w, = qe/rmw, An.Ox.2.448 (Pass.); teqermw=sqai dub. l. in Ar. Lys.1079.

qe/rmudron, to/,
a place with hot springs, name of a harbour of Rhodes, Tz.H.2.385:—also qermo/-udra, ta/, St.Byz.; qermo-udrai/, ai(, Apollod. 2.5.11.

qe/rm-w, (qe/rw)
heat, make hot, only in pres. or impf. forms, qe/rmete d' u(/dwr Od.8.426, Ar.Ra.1339:—Pass.,
grow hot, qe/rmeto d' u(/dwr Od. 8.437, Il.18.348; pnoih=| . . meta/frenon eu)re/e t' w)/mw qe/rmet' 23.381; qe/rmeto de\ xqw/n Call.
Fr.anon.24; mh/ pou/ tis e)ni\ xroi\+ qe/rmet' (Ep. for qe/rmhtai） a)u+tmh/ Opp.H.3.522.

qerm-w/dhs, es,
lukewarm, Aret.CA 2.3.

qerm-wlh/, h(,
feverish heat, Hp.Loc.Hom.19,al.

qero/eis, essa, en,
of or
in summer, Nic.Al.570.

qe/ros, eos, to/, (qe/rw)
summer, xei/matos ou)de\ qe/reus Od.7.118; ou)/t' e)n qe/rei ou)/t' e)n o)pw/rh| 12.76; e)n qe/rei, opp. e)nyu/xei, S.Ph.18; qe/rei+ or qe/rei, Il.22.151, Hes.Op.640; to\ qe/ros
during the summer, Hdt.1.202; tou= qe/reos
in the course of it, Id.2.24; tou= qe/rous Ar.Fr.463; qe/reos or qe/rous (without the Art.), Hes.Op.462, Pl.Phdr.276b, al.; tou= parestw=tos qe/rous S.Ph.1340; tou= q. eu)qu\s a)rxome/nou Th.2.47; kata\ qe/rous a)kmh/n X.HG5.3.19; q. mesou=ntos
about mid
summer, Luc.Hist.Conscr.1; esp. in Th.,
campaigning-season, a(/ma h)=ri tou= e)pigignome/nou qe/rous 4.117, cf. 2.31, 6.8; tosau=ta me\n e)n tw=| q. e)ge/neto 2.68.
summerfruits, harvest, crop, q. a)llo/trion a)ma=n Ar.Eq.392, cf. D.53.21, AP11.365.3 (Agath.): pl., qe/rh
crops, PFlor.150.5 (iii A.D.); qe/rh staxu/wn the
ripe ears, Plu.Fab.2: metaph., pa/gklauton e)cama=| qe/ros A.Pers. 822, cf. Ag.1655; to\ ghgene\s dra/kontos . . q. E.Ba.1026; of a horse's mane, v. qeri/zw 1.3; of a youth's beard, Call.Del.298, AP10.19 (Apollonid.); also te/mnetai to\ i(ero\n kai\ a)po/rrhton q. tou= qeou= *ta/llou Jul.Or.5.168d. Astron., to\ me/ga q., o(/tan pa/ntes oi( pla/nhtes e)n qerinw=| zw|di/w| ge/nwntai Olymp.in Mete.111.30. metaph., in an epitaph for a
year of life, Supp.Epigr.2.874.4 (Egypt).

qersi^eph/s, e/s, (qe/rsos)
bold of speech, B.12.199:—so *qersi/ths, o(, as pr. n. in Hom.: pl., Ph.2.472.
qe/rsos, Aeol. for qa/rsos, Choerob.in Theod.1.166, EM447.24.
qerso/s, o(,= tarso/s 11.1, BGU350.2 (ii A.D.).
qerth/ria: e(orth/ tis, Hsch.

qe/rw,
