heat, make hot, qe/ron au)gai\ h)eli/ou *libu/hn A.R.4.1312; qe/rwn e(/lkos,= qerapeu/wn, Nic.Th.687:—elsewh. only in Pass. qe/romai, fut. Med. qe/rsomai Od.19.507: aor. 2 e)qe/rhn (in Ep. subj. qere/w 17.23): poet. and later Prose,
become hot or
warm, nh/hsan cu/la polla/, fo/ws e)/men h)de\ qe/resqai 19.64, cf. 507; e)pei/ ke puro\s qere/w
at the fire, 17.23; qe/rou
warm your self, Ar.Pl.953; o(po/tan . . tis . . pote\ r(igw=n qe/rhtai Pl. Phlb.46c; ei)=don [*(hra/kleiton] qero/menon pro\s tw=| i)pnw=| Arist.PA645a19: impf. e)qe/ronto Philostr.VA2.18, Alciphr.1.23; qe/resqai pro\s th\n ei(/lhn Luc.Lex.2: metaph., qe/resqai puri/, of love, Call.Epigr.27, cf. APl. 4.167 (Antip. Sid.). of things,
become warm, ta\ yuxra\ qe/retai Heraclit. 126, cf. Archel. ap. Plu.2.954f; mh\ . . a)/stu puro\s dhi/+oio qe/rhtai
be burnt by fire, Il.6.331, cf. 11.667;
melt, a( pe/tra qruptome/na qe/retai AP12.61. (
g[uglide]her-, cf. qermo/s, Lat.
formus and prob. Engl.
warm.）

qe/sis, ews, h(, (ti/qhmi)
setting, placing, e)pe/wn q.
setting of words in verse, Pi.O.3.8; pli/nqwn kai\ li/qwn Pl.R.333b, cf. IG7.3073.33 (Lebad.); q. no/mwn law
giving, X.Ath.3.2, Pl.Lg.690d: in pl., no/mwn qe/seis D.18.309, Arist.Pol.1289a22; q. o)no/matos
giving of a name,
Pl.Cra.390d; e)pi/ tinos
application of word to object, Demetr.Eloc. 145; q. a)gw/nwn
institution of games, D.S.4.53;
ordinance, disposition, S.Ichn.277 (only here in Trag.);
setting forth in legal form, a)sfaleiw=n POxy.1027.12 (i A.D.).
laying down, o(/plwn, opp. a)nai/resis, Pl.Lg.814a; of diggers,
plunging of the spade, opp. a)/rsis, Gp.2.45.5.
deposit of money, preparatory to a law-suit, Ar.Nu.1191 (pl.): generally,
sum deposited in a temple, Inscr.Délos 365.14 (iii B.C.), IG12(3).322 (pl., Thera).
pledging, giving as security, D.33.12, Lys.8.10.
payment, telw=n Pl.R.425d (pl.).
adoption of a child, kata\ qe/sin ui(wno/s Plb.18.35.9, cf. Ph.2.36, Philostr. VA6.11; *krinote/lhn *pinda/rou, qe/sei de\ *filoce/nou IG12(3).274 (Anaphe), cf. 12(7).50 (Amorgos);
adoption as a citizen of a foreign state, *(alecandreu\s qe/sei, *(aqhnai=os q. (opp. fu/sei), Suid. s.v. *)ari/starxos, *)aristofa/nhs *(po/dios.
situation, of a city, Hp.
Aër.6; po/lis au)ta/rkh q. keime/nh Th.1.37, cf. 5.7; h( q. th=s xw/ras pro\s ta\ pneu/mata Thphr.CP3.23.5; to/pwn q. Plb.1.41.7: Astron., q. tw=n a)/strwn Herm. in Phdr.p.149A.;
position, arrangement, legome/nwn kai\ grafome/nwn Pl.Tht.206a; tw=n merw=n qe/seis Id.Lg.668e, cf. Epicur.Ep.1p.11U., Fr.30 (pl.). Math.,
local position, Arist.GC322b33; e)/xein q. Id.APo.88a34; q. e)/xein pro\s a)/llhla to have a
local relation, Id.Cat.4b21, cf. Pl.R.586c; th=| q. me/son Arist.APr.25b36: Geom., qe/sei dedo/sqai or ei)=nai, to be given
in position, Archim.Sph.Cyl.2.3, Euc.Dat.4, Apollon.Perg.Con.2.46, al.; para\ qe/sei parallel to a straight line
given in position, [Euc.]Dat.Def.15; ei)s du/o qe/seis ta\s AB, AT to meet the two
straight lines AB, AT
given in position, Hero Metr.3.10; kata\ th\n q. th\n pro\s h(ma=s Arist.Ph.208b23, etc.; ou) th=| q. diafe/ronta mo/non, a)lla\ kai\ th=| duna/mei ib.22; so in Music, of notes in a scale, kata\ qe/sin, opp. kata\ du/namin, Ptol.Harm.2.5. Philos.,
thesis, position, assumed and requiring proof, Pl.R.335a, Arist.Top.104b19, APo.72a15; qe/sin diafula/ttein to maintain
a thesis, Id.EN1096a2; kinei=n to controvert it, Plu.2.687b, cf. 328a, etc.
general question, opp. u(po/qesis (
special case), Aphth.Prog.13, Theon Prog.12, cf. Cic.Top.21.79, Quint.3.5.5 (but q. includes u(po/qesis and o(rismo/s, Phlp.in APo.35.1; opp. a)ci/wma, ib.34.9).
arbitrary determination, esp. in dat. qe/sei, ta\ o)no/mata mh\ q. gene/sqai Epicur.Ep. 1p.27U.; opp. fu/sei, Chrysipp.Stoic.3.76, Str.2.3.7, etc.; ta\ q. di/kaia, no/mima, Ph.1.50, 112; shmai/nein q. S.E.P.2.256.
affirmation, opp. a)/rsis, ib.1.192, cf. 2.244, Plot.5.5.6, etc.
a setting down, opp. a)/rsis (
lifting), pa=sa porei/a e)c a)/rsews kai\ qe/sews suntelei=tai Arist.Pr.885b6: hence, in rhythm,
downward beat, opp. the
upward (a)/rsis), Aristid.Quint.1.13, Bacch.Harm.98, etc. in prosody, qe/sei makra\ sullabh/ long by
position, opp. fu/sei, D.T.632.30, Heph. 1.3: orig. prob. in signf. v.3, cf. Sch.D.T.p.206H. qe/seis, ai(, in punctuation,
stops, Donat.in Gramm.Lat.4.372 K. part of a horse's hoof, h( q. tou= podo/s Hippiatr.82.

qe/skelos, on, Ep. Adj. perh.
set in motion by God (ke/llw), and so
marvellous, wondrous, always of things, q. e)/rga deeds or works
of wonder, Il.3.130, Od.11.610; qe/skela ei)dw/s Call.
Fr.anon.385: neut. Adv., e)/i+kto de\ qe/skelon au)tw=| it was
wondrous like him, Il.23.107; prob. taken by later poets as,=
God-inspired (keleu/w）, q. *(ermh=s Coluth.126.

qe/smios, Dor. and Ep. te/qmios, on, or a, on, (qesmo/s)
fixed, settled, lawful, e(orta\ te/qmios Pi.N.11.27; te/qmiai w(=rai Call.Ap.87; qe/smia ta/de kai\ pa/tria Lex ap.Arist.Ath.16.10; qe/smion (sc. e)sti/) A.Ag.1564 (lyr.); qe/smio/n e)sti, = qe/mis e)sti/, A.R.2.12;
fitting, qhreuth=rsi sigh\ te/qmio/s e)sti Opp.C.1.450. qe/smion, Dor. and Ep. te/qmion, to/, esp. in pl.,
laws, customs, rites, Hdt.1.59, A.Eu.491 (lyr.), S.Aj.712 (lyr.); q. a)nagra/yai Arist.Ath.3.4; progo/nwn palaia\ q. E.Fr.360.45, cf. Call.Dian.174: sg. in Pi.I.6(5).20, E.Tr.267 (anap.):—in form qe/qmion IG9(1).334.46 (Locr., v B.C.).
agreement, tw= teqmi/w vi/stwr ib.7.3172.165 (Orchom. Boeot.). *qe/smios, title of Apollo, Paus.5.15.7; of Demeter, Id.8.15.4.

qesmo-do/ths, o(,
lawgiver, cj. for -qe/ths, Longin.9.9:—fem. qesmo-do/teira Orph.*eu)xh/ 25.

qesmo-qesi/a, h(,
office of qesmoqe/ths at Athens, IG 22.1368.133.
decree of fate, Plu.2.573f.

qesmoqet-ei=on, to/,
hall in which the qesmoqe/tai
met, Arist.Ath.3.5, Plu.2.613b (-qe/tion Suid.s.v. *prutanei=on):—also qesmoqe/sion, to/, Plu.2.714c, Sch.Pl.Prt.337d, Suid.s.v. a)/rxwn.

qesmoqet-e/w,
to be a qesmoqe/ths, Is.7.34, D.59.65.

qesmoqe/t-hs, on, o(, (ti/qhmi)
lawgiver, legislator, of Moses, Longin.9.9. esp. at Athens, qesmoqe/tai, oi(, the
six junior archons, IG12.39.75, al., Ar.V.775 (sg.), al., Antipho 6.35, Arist.Ath.3.4, al., Aeschin.3.38; also, title of magistrate in Amorgos, IG12(7).57.12 (iii B.C.).
qesmo/qet-is, idos, h(,= qesmofo/ros, title of Demeter, Corn.ND28; of Isis, Hymn.Is.20.

qesmo-poie/w,
make laws, E.Ph.1645.
qesmo-po/los, on, （pole/w） = qemistopo/los, AP5.292.3 (Paul. Sil.).

qesmo/s, Dor. teqmo/s (v. infr.), qeqmo/s IG5(2).159 (Tegea, v B.C.), Isyll.12, Locr. tetqmo/s Berl.Sitzb.1927.8 (v B.C.): o(: pl. qesmoi/, poet. qesma/ S.Fr.92: (ti/qhmi):—
that which is laid down, law, ordinance, once in Hom., le/ktroio palaiou= qesmo\n i(/konto Od.23.296; ei)rh/nhs qesmoi/
the order of peace, h.Hom.8.16; esp. of divine
laws, q. to\n moiro/kranton e)k qew=n A.Eu.391; i(/meros . . tw=n mega/lwn pa/redros q. S.Ant.800 (lyr.); oi( tw=n qew=n q. X.Cyr.1.6.6; q. *)adrastei/as, oi( th=s ei(marme/nhs q., Pl.Phdr.248c, Plu.2.111d; pare/bh q. a)rxai/ous Ar.Av.331 (lyr.). of human
law, oi( pa/trioi q. Hdt.3.31; at Athens, esp. of the laws of Draco, IG12.115.20, And.1.81, Decr. ib.83, Arist.Ath.4.1, etc., cf. Ael.VH8.10: used by Solon of his own laws, Sol.36.16, cf. 31.2, Plu.Sol.19; o( tau=ta a)pergazo/menos q. no/mos a)\n o)rqw=s ei)/h kei/menos Pl.Ep.355c; o( toi=s a)/llois tiqe/menos qesmou\s *dhmh/trios Duris 10J.; o(/d' o( teqmo\s pe\r tw=n e)ntofhi/+wn GDI2561C19 (Delph.): in later poetry, qesmoi/,=
law, jurisprudence, Epigr.Gr. 434.4, al.; qesmw=n tami/hs, pro/maxos, IG3.637, 638. generally,
rule, precept, rite, S.Tr.682; q. puro/s
the law of the beacon-fire, A.Ag.304; teqmo\s a)e/qlwn Pi.O.6.69; stefa/nwn t. the
appointed crowns, ib.13.29; q. o(/d' eu)/frwn the cheering
strain (cf. no/mos), A. Supp.1034 (lyr.); u(/mnou teqmo\n *)olumpioni/kan Pi.O.7.88; maka/rwn Id.Pae.4.47.
institution, as the
tribunal of the Areopagus, A. Eu.615; teqmo\s *(hrakle/os, *poteida=nos teqmoi/, the Olympian, Isthmian games, Pi.N.10.33, O.13.40. = qhsauro/s, Anacr.58. qesmoi/: ai( sunqe/seis tw=n cu/lwn, Hsch.

qesmosu/nh, Dor. qe/smo-na, h(,
justice, AP7.593 (Agath.).

qesmo-fo/ria, wn, ta/, women's festival at Athens and elsewhere, in honour of Demeter *qes mofo/ros (q.v.), Hdt.2.171, Ar.Av.1519, Th. 80, 182, al.; q. e(stia=n ta\s gunai=kas to furnish the women's feast
at the Th., Is.3.80; at Ephesus, Hdt.6.16.

qesmo-foria/zw,
keep the Thesmophoria, X.HG5.2.29, Gloss.Oxy.1802.35; *qesmoforia/zousai, name of a play by Aristophanes.

qesmo-fo/rion, to/,
temple of Demeter *qesmofo/ros, Ar.Th.278, 880, IG2.1059.12; at Delos, ib.11(2).159A17 (iii B.C.):— also qesmo-ei=on Theon Prog.5:
qesmo-fo/rion me/tron, a form of dactylic metre, Mar.Vict.6.145 K.:
qesmo-fo/rios, o(, demoticon at Memphis, Mitteis Chr. 29.5 (ii B.C.); at Alexandria, Supp.Epigr.2.866. (sc. mh/n) name of month at Rhodes, IG12(1).3.5; in Crete, GDI5149.58.
qesmo-foriw/n, w=nos, o(, name of month at Heraclea ad Latmum, SIG633.55 (ii B.C.); in Crete, Hemerolog.Flor.

qesmo-fo/ros, on,
law-giving, epith. of Demeter, Hdt.6.91, 134, IPE2.13 (Panticapaeum, iv B.C.), Call.Aet.Oxy. 2079.10, D.S.1.14, etc.; semnh\ *q. AP5.149 (Asclep.), cf. Luc.Tim.17; tw\ *qesmofo/rw Demeter and Persephone, Ar.Th.83, al.; ai( *qesmofo/roi App.BC2.70, Plu.Dio56, etc.; po/tnia *q., of Persephone, Pi.Fr.37; also, as a title of Dionysus, Orph.H.42.1.

qesmo-fu/lac [u^], akos, o(,
guardian of the law, of Moses, Ph.1.171:—usu. in pl. qesmo-fu/lakes, oi(, a magistracy at Elis, Th.5.47, cf. D.S.5.67; at Alexandria, PHal.1.239 (iii B.C.); in Ceos, IG12(5).595 B16 (iii/ii B.C.); at Ptolemais, PFay.22.11 (i A.D.); Boeot. teqmofou/lac IG7.3172.178 (Orchom.): —hence qesmo-fu^la/kion [a^], to/, their office, PHal.1.234 (iii B.C.):
qesmo-fu^la^ki<k>o/s, h/, o/n, no/mos Plu.2.292d.

qesmw|d-e/w,
deliver oracular precepts: ta\ qesmw|dou/mena
oracles, Ph. 1.650.

qesmw|d-o/s, o(,
giver of qesmoi/, Id. ap. Eus.PE8.7, BMus.Inscr.4.481*.457 (pl.).
qe/spalai: ai( *kw=|ai, para\ *filhta=|, kai\ ai( farmaki/des, Hsch. (prob. *qessalai/).
qespesianh/, h(, name of an antidote, Orib.Fr.82.

qespe/sios, a, on, also os, on E.Andr.296 (lyr.), Luc.Sacr.13: (perh. for qes-spe/sios, cf. qeo/s, e)/spon):—prop. of the voice,
divinely sounding, divinely sweet, a)oidh/ Il.2.600; *seirh=nes Od.12.158; e)/pea Pi.I.4(3).39; a)xe/tas Ar.Av.1095 (lyr.).
divinely uttered or
decreed, dat. sg. fem. qespesi/h| as Adv., Il.2.367.
oracular, ge/nos Pi.P.12.13 (of the Graiae); da/fna E. l.c.; q. o(do/s the way
of divination, of Cassandra, A.Ag.1154 (lyr.); eu)xai=s u(po\ q. with prayers
to the gods, Pi. I.6(5).44. = qei=os, bhlo/s Il.1.591; a)/ntron Od.13.363.
more than human: hence,
awful, of natural phenomena, q. ne/fos Il. 15.669; a)xlu/s Od.7.42; lai=lay 9.68;
marvellous, xa/ris 2.12; q. a)/wton, xalko/s, 9.434, Il.2.457; q. o)dmh/ a smell
divinely sweet, Od.9.211; o)smh\ q. Hermipp.82.9; of human affairs, q. fu/za, fo/bos, Il.9.2, 17.118; plou=tos 2.670; h)xh/ 8.159; boh/ Od.24.49; q. o(/milos Theoc. 15.66: also in Prose, te/xnh q. tis kai\ u(yhlh/ Pl.Euthd.289e; q. bi/os Id.R.365b; q. kai\ h(dei=a h( diagwgh/ ib.558a; sofoi\ kai\ q. a)/ndres Id.Tht.151b, cf. Philostr.Dial.1; fu/seis Id.VS2.9.2; q. th\n gnw/mhn Luc. Alex.4. Adv. -i/ws, q. e)fo/bhqen they trembled
unspeakably, Il.15.637: neut. qespe/sion as Adv., q. u(la=n Theoc.25.70; also a)po/zei q. w(s h(du/ Hdt.3.113; w)dw/dei q. oi(=on Plu.Alex.20; qespesi/hqen
divinely, a)rhro/ta Emp.96.4. —Chiefly Ep., once in Hdt., twice in Trag. (lyr.), once in Ar. (lyr.).
qespesio/ths, htos, h(,= qeio/ths, Eust.240.8.
qespi^-a^oido/s, o/n, (qe/spis) poet. for qespiw|do/s, Hsch.

qespi^-da^h/s, e/s, (dai/w A)
kindled by a god, q. pu=r
portentous fire, Il.12.177, 441, Od. 4.418, etc. (Ep. word.)

qespi^-e/peia, (e)/pos) fem. Adj.
oracular, prophetic, S.OT463 (lyr.).

qespi/zw, fut. -i/sw, Att. -i^w=, Ion. inf. qespie/ein v.l. in Hdt.8.135; Dor. aor. e)qe/spica Theoc.15.63: (qe/spis):—
prophesy, foretell, ti Hdt. 1.47, al.; tini/ ti A.Ag.1210, E.Andr.1161:—Pass., ti/ de\ teqe/spistai; S.OC388, cf. Parth.35.2. Pass., c. acc., [xrhsmoi/,] ou(\s e)qespi/sqh *mwush=s Ph.2.38. of the Emperors,= Lat.
sancire, decree, Jul.Ep.75b, Wilcken Chr.6.8 (v A.D.), OGI521.9 (Abydus), Cod.Just.1.12.3 Intr.

qespi^o/mantis, Adj.
oracular, e(/dra Aristonous 1.3.
qe/spios, on, = qespe/sios, Hes.Fr.197, Orac. ap. Ar.Av.977.
qespio/fhmon: paroimi/an tina/, Hsch.

qe/sp-is, ios, o(, h( (acc. qe/spida Nonn.D.25.452, dat. idi ib.45.133): (cf. qespe/sios):—
filled with the words of God, inspired, Hom. only in Od. in acc. qe/spin; a)oido/s 17.385; a)oidh/ 1.328, 8.498, E.Med.425 (lyr.); also qe/spin au)da/n S.Ichn.244 (lyr.). generally,
wondrous, awful, qe/spis a)/ella h.Ven.208. qe/spides: qusi/ai, qeose/beiai, Hsch.

qe/sp-isis, ews, h(,
oracular utterance, Sch.Ar.Pl. 11.

qe/sp-isma, atos, to/, mostly in pl.,
oracles, oracular sayings, Hdt. 2.29, A.Fr.86, S.OT971: sg., E.Ion405.
Imperial constitution, Wilcken Chr.6.12 (pl., v A.D.), Just.Nov.113.1.1.

qesp-isth/s, ou=, o(,
prophet, Man.6.378.

qespi^w|d-e/w,
to be a qespiw|do/s,
sing in prophetic strain, A.Ag.1161,
E.Ph.959, Ar.Pl.9, Pl.Ax.367d; xrhsmoi\ to\ kra/tos th=s oi)koume/nhs -w|dou=si Posidon.36J.
hold office of qespiw|do/s, i. e.
versifier of oracles, OGI530.6 (Amisus), IGRom.4.1588 (Claros), etc.

qespi^w|d-o/s, o/n,
singing in prophetic strain, of persons, S.Fr.456, E.Hel.145; also o)mfalo\s gh=s q. Id.Med.668; mantikh/ Philostr.VS1Praef.: Subst. qespiw|do/s, h(,= Lat. Carmenta, D.H.1.31. q. fo/bon
caused by prophecy, A.Ag.1134 (lyr., s.v.l.).
*qessa/l-eios [a^], v. *qessalo/s 11.
*qessal-i/a, h(, Thessaly, Hdt.3.96, etc.

*qessal-i^ke/ths, ou, o(, Att. *qett-,
serf in Thessaly, Philocr.Hist.1.

*qessal-iko/s, Att. *qett-, h/, o/n, Thessalian: *q. e(/dos, a sort of
chair or
couch, Hp.Art.7; o)/rea Hdt.7.128; di/fros Eup.58, cf. Poll.7.112; *q. e)/nqesis Hermipp. 41; *q. dei=pna Ar.Fr.492, cf. Antiph. 34.3. Adv. -kw=s Crates Com. 19.
of the Thessalian dialect, e)/qos A.D.Synt.214.6; diai/resis ib.50.9. Adv. -kw=s Id.Pron.109.1: Comp. -w/teron Id.Synt.159.9.
*qessal-iw=tis, idos, h(, one of the four districts of Thessaly, Hellanic. 52J., Hdt.1.57, Str.9.5.3.

*qessal-o/s, Att. *qett-, h/, o/n, Thessalian, Hdt. 5.63, etc.: prov., *q. so/fisma a Thessalian trick, E.Ph.1407; *q. no/misma, i.e. false money, Phot.; Thess. *petqalo/s IG9(2).258（Cierium), 517.14 (Larissa); Boeot. *fettalo/s (as pr. n.) ib.7.2430.8. pr. n. of a physician of the Methodic School:—hence Adj. *qessa/leios, a, on, Gal.15.763,al. fem. *qessali/s, i/dos, Thessalian, kunh= S.OC314: as Subst. *qettali/s, h(, a kind of
shoe, Lysipp.2.

qe/ssasqai, poet. aor.
pray for, c. acc. qessa/menos geneh/n Hes.Fr. 201; glukero\n no/ston Archil.11; pai/dwn ge/nos A.R.1.824, cf. Euph. 136: c. inf., ta/n pot' eu)/andron [ei)=nai] . . qe/ssanto
prayed that this land might be . . , Pi.N.5.10 (Hsch. also has qe/ssesqai, qesso/menos, qh/sw, qhso/menoi, qhsa/menoi):—hence Adj. qesto/s, only in compds. a)po/qestos, polu/qestos (q.v.), Boeot. pr. n. *qeo/feistos, Ion. *)ermo/qestos. (Perh.
g[uglide]hedh-, cf. po/qos (fr. fo/qos), OIr.
-guidiu, Welsh
gweddïo 'pray', Lith.
gedėti 'mourn'; qh/sw, qhso/menoi, qhsa/menoi seem to be analogical formations.)

qesfa^thlo/gos, on,
prophetic, A.Ag.1441.

qesfa^t-i/zw,
prophesy, Hsch.:—also qesfa^t-o/omai, Id.

qe/sfa^t-os, on, (qeo/s, fhmi/)
spoken by God, decreed, mo/ros A.Ag.1321; h(/kei q. bi/ou teleuth/ S.OC1472: mostly in phrase qe/sfato/n e)sti, it is
ordained, w(\s ga\r q. e)sti Il.8.477, cf. E.IA1556: c. dat. pers. et inf., soi\ d' ou) q. e)sti . . qane/ein Od.4.561, cf. 10.473, Pi.P.4.71, Orac.in Ar.Pax1073; so ei)/ ti q. patri\ . . i(knei=q', w(/ste pro\s pai/dwn qanei=n S.OC969. Subst. qe/sfata, ta/,
divine decrees, oracles, Od.11.151,297; palai/fata q. 13.172, cf. Pi.I.8(7).34: sg., E.IT121. generally,
wonderful, mighty, a)h/r Od.7.143.—Cf. qespe/sios, qe/skelos.
qeth/r, h=ros, o(, EM177.24;= tolmhth/s, pra/kths, Hsch.: pl., etym. of qeoi/, Corn.ND1.

qe/ths, ou, o(, (ti/qhmi)
one who places, o)noma/twn q. name-
giver, Pl. Cra.389d.
mortgagor, xwri/wn Is.10.24.
adoptive father of a child, Did. ap. Harp.

*qeti/deion [i^], to/,
temple of Thetis, E.Andr.20, Plb.18.20.6, Str.9.5.6.

qetiko/s, h/, o/n,
fit for placing, o)noma/twn q.
prompt at giving names, D.H.Comp.16, cf. Ph.2.101. Adv. -kw=s
appositely, D.H.Rh.3.5.
concerning adoption, no/moi Arist.Pol.1274b4.
belonging to a qe/sis,
disputable, u(po/qesis Philostr.VS2.6; ta\ q. tw=n xwri/wn ib.29; so ta\ q. alone, Phld.Rh.1.206S.; q. kefa/laion Theon Prog.2; th\n zh/thsin q. poiei=sqai to make the question
a matter of argument, Str.2.3.7; Lat.
genus instituendi qetikw/teron,
addressed to reason rather than feeling, Cic.QF3.3.4. Adv. Comp. -kw/teron Aps. p.333H.
positive, affirmative, opp.
negative (a)rnhtiko/s), Numen. ap. Eus.PE14.8. Adv. -kw=s
positively, affirmatively, D.L.9.75; ou) li/an q. not very
positively, Phld.Rh.1.371S. Gramm.,
positive, to\ qetiko/n the
positive degree, Sch.D Il.4.277.
expressing obligation, of verbals in -te/on, D.T.642.16; qetikw=s: to\ o)feilo/menon gene/sqai, Hsch.
arbitrary, xrh=sis tw=n o)noma/twn S.E.P.2.256. Adv. -kw=s ib.1.38.
*qe/tis, voc. *qe/ti_ Il.24.88, acc. *qe/tin, gen. idos 4.512, Dor. ios Pi.I. 8(7).30, dat. *qe/ti_ : h( :—Thetis, Hom., etc.

qeto/s, h/, o/n, (ti/qhmi)
placed, set, E.IA251 (lyr.);
having position, stigmh\ ou)si/a qeto/s Arist.APo.87a36.
taken as one's child, adopted, Pi.O.9.62, E.Fr.359, etc.; qeto\n pai=da poiei=sqai Hdt.6.57, cf. Pl.Lg.929c; qeto\s gene/sqai tini/ or u(po/ tinos, Plu.Thes.13, App.BC 1.5; qeto/s, o(,
adopted son, dub. in Is.3.69; qeth/
adopted daughter, Hsch.; also q. path/r
adoptive father, D.S.10.11.
*qetta^lo/s, *qettaliko/s, etc., Att. for *qess-.

*qetta^lo/tmhton kre/as a lump of meat
such as you would cut for a hungry Thessalian, Philetaer.10.
qeu=, Dor. and Ion. for qe/o, qou=, imper. aor. 2 Med. of ti/qhmi.
qeu-, Dor. and Ion. for qeo-, cf. *qeodai/sios, qeomori/a, qeo/moros:— hence qeu-erge/sia, ta/, festival of a qeo\s eu)erge/ths, Inscr.Délos363.53 (iii B.C.).
qeu-kole/w, = qeokole/w,IG9(1).421 (Aetolia).
qeu-ce/nia, = qeoce/nia, Hsch.
qeu-propi/a, h(,= qeopropi/a, B.9.41.
qeu-fori/a, h(,= qeofori/a, AP6.220.4 (Diosc.).
qeu/gesqai, Cret.,= qe/lg-, Hsch. qeuro/s, v. qewro/s.

qeu=sis, ews, h(,
running, coined as etym. of qeo/s, Corn.ND1.
qeu=tis, = teuqi/s, Hippon.115.

qe/w (A), Ep. also qei/w, Il.6.507, 10.437 (in Att. the syllables eo, eou, ew are not contr.); Ep. subj. qe/h|si 22.23; 3sg. impf. e)/qei Od.12.407 and later, e)/qee Il.1.483, Hdt.1.43 (and in later Prose, D.S.16.94); Ep. qe/e Il.20.275, Hes.Sc.224; Ion. impf. qe/eskon Il.20.229: fut. qeu/somai 23.623, Ar.Eq.485,Av.205, (u(po-) Pi.P.2.84, (a)nti-) Hdt. 5.22, (meta-) X.Cyn.6.22; qeu/sw Lyc.1119: aor. 1 e)/qeusa （di-) Vett.Val.345.35, part. qeu/sas IGRom.4.1740 (Cyme):—the other tenses are supplied by tre/xw and *dre/mw : (qev-, Skt.
dhávate):—
run, posi/, po/dessi, Od.8.247, Il.23.623; bh= de\ qe/ein 17.698; qe/h|si titaino/menos pedi/oio 22.23; poi=qei=s; Ar.V.854; qa=tton qana/tou qei= [h( ponhri/a] Pl.Ap.39b; o( brade/ws qe/wn Id.Hp.Mi.373d; of horses, Id.Cra. 423a; e)n *)olumpi/a| qeo/ntwn i(/ppwn Id.Lg.822b: in part. with another Verb, h)=lqe qe/wn, h)=lqe qe/ousa, came
running, Il.6.54,394, etc.; i(=ce qe/wn, of a person on ship-board, Od.3.288; qe/wn *ai)/anta ka/lesson
run and call him, Il.12.343, etc. peri\ tri/podos ga\r e)/mellon qeu/sesqai
to run for a tripod, 11.701: metaph. (cf. tre/xw 11.2), peri\ yuxh=s qe/on *(/ektoros they
were running for Hector's life, 22.161; q. peri\ u(me/wn au)tw=n Hdt.8.140.a/; q. <ton> peri\ tou= panto\s dro/mon ib.74; peri\ gunaikw=n kai\ pai/dwn Paus.6.18.3. metaph., q. e)s no/sous Pl.Lg.691c; q. e)ggu/tata o)le/qrou Id.R.417b; qei=n para\ to\n e)/sxaton ki/ndunon Plu. Fab.26. of other kinds of motion, as, of birds, qeu/sontai dro/mw| Ar.Av.205. of things,
run; of ships, h( d' e)/qeen kata\ ku=ma Il.1.483, cf. X.HG6.2.29; of a potter's wheel, Il.18.601; of a
rolling stone, 13.141; of a quoit, r(i/mfa qe/wn a)po\ xeiro/s
flying lightly . . , Od.8.193. metaph., du/namis qaumasth\ e)kei= qei= Plot.2.9.8, cf. 6.5.11. of things not actually in motion, [fle\y] a)na\ nw=ta qe/ousa diampere/s Il.13.547; a)/ntuc h(\ puma/th qe/en a)spi/dos 6.118; a)mfi\ de/ min ki/bisis qe/e Hes.Sc.224; grammh=s peri\ [shmei=on] qeou/shs Plot.6.5.11. c. acc. loci,
run over, ta\ o)/rh X.Cyn.4.6, cf. 5.17; me/ssa qe/wn pela/geus AP7.273 (Leon.), cf. 10.23 (Autom.); plwtw=n ge/nos u(gra\ qeo/ntwn Opp.H.3.183.—The simple Verb is used in Trag. only by E.Ion1217.

qe/w (B),
shine, gleam, o)do/ntwn leuka\ qeo/ntwn Hes.Sc.146 (leukaqeo/ntwn cj. Wackernagel); u(/lh| xlwra\ qeou/sh| cj. in Theoc.25.158; poi/hn . . xlwra\ qe/ousan IG14.1389ii 24; cf. qoo/s (B), *leukaqe/a, leukaqi/zw.

qew=, for qea/ou, imper. of qea/omai,
behold!
qew/mata: perikaqarth/ria, Hsch. (leg. qeiw/mata).

qewr-ei=on, to/,
place for seeing, Hsch.s.v. qaush/kri.

qewr-e/w:—Pass., fut. -hqh/somai S.E.M.8.280: fut. Med.in pass.sense, ib.1.70, Ael.VH 7.10: (qewro/s):—
to be a qewro/s 1 (q.v.), manteu/esqai kai\ q.Th.5.18; e)gw\ de\ teqew/rhka pw/pot' ou)damoi= plh\n e)s *pa/ron Ar.V.1188; of the states which sent qewroi/, oi( *)aqhnai=oi e)qew/roun e)s ta\ *)/isqmia Th.8.10.
to be sent to consult an oracle, Pl.Ep.315b. of spectators at games, ta\ *)olu/mpia Hdt.1.59; a)gw=na Id.8.26, X.An.1.2.10; q. tina/
to see him
act, Thphr.Char.11.3: abs., And.4.20, D.18.265;
to go as a spectator, e)s ta\ *)efe/sia Th.3.104; e)s *)olumpi/an Luc.Tim.50; v. sub o)bolo/s 1.
look at, behold, gh=n pollh/n Hdt.4.76; tu/xas tino/s A.Pr. 304; ta\ peri\ to\n po/lemon Pl.R.467c;
inspect, review soldiers, X.An. 1.2.16, HG4.5.6: abs.,
gaze, gape, e(sthkw\s q. Thphr.Char.4.5: Astrol., = e)piqewre/w 5, th\n selh/nhn Gal.19.542. of the mind,
contemplate, consider, au)th=| th=| yuxh=| au)th\n th\n yuxh\n q. Pl.Grg.523e; ta\ o)/nta h(=| o)/nta Arist.Metaph.1003b15, cf. D.1.12, Epicur.Nat.2.6, etc.: folld. by an interrog., tou=to q., ei) ta)lhqh= le/gw D.3.3; q. tina/, o(pote/rou tou= bi/ou e)sti/n Aeschin.3.168; po/sas e)/xousi diafora/s Arist.GA 761a11; q. ti/nas le/gomen tou\s froni/mous Id.EN1140a24; q. ti e)/k tinos
to judge of one thing by another, th\n e)/nnoian e)k tw=n e)/rgwn Is.1.13, cf. Aeschin.3.160; q. ti pro/s ti
compare one thing
with another, D.18.17; pro\s tou\s pro\ e)mautou= . . kri/nwmai kai\ qewrw=mai; ib.315; tou\s pre/sbeis q. pro\s to\n kairo\n kaq' o(\n e)pre/s beuon Aeschin.2.80; q. [ti tekmhri/ois] D. 21.199.
observe, q. ma=llon tou\s pe/las duna/meqa h)\ e(autou/s Arist. EN1169b33, cf. Pol.1263b25,al.; tau=ta e)mou= e)qewrh/sate, w(s . . poioume/nou Lycurg.28:—Pass., teqew/rhtai tou=to ma/lista e)pi\ tw=n peristerw=n Arist.HA562a23, cf. 540b19,al.; lo/gw| qewrei=sqai, of objects not accessible to sense, Phld.D.3.10: abs., w(s kai\ e)p' a)/llwn qewrei=tai ib.1.13.
perceive, c. inf., a)nagkai=on u(pa/rxein D.S.13.88. abs.,
speculate, theorize, a)kribw=s, fortikw=s, Arist.Pol.1280b28, Metaph. 1001b14; logikw=s, fusikw=s, Id.APo.88a19, Cael.304a25; peri/ tinos Id.Metaph.1004b1, 983a33 (Pass.); q. e)/k tinos
to conclude by observation from . . , ib.1029a26; dia/ tinos Id.Mete.353b18:—Pass., h( para\ toi=s *(/ellhsi teqewrhme/nh ma/qhsis Ael.Tact.Prooem. (qewrh/sasa is prob. corrupt for e)wr- in S.OC1084 (lyr.).)

qew/r-hma, atos, to/,
sight, spectacle, lo/goi kai\ qewrh/mata D.18.68; q. kai\ a)kroa/mata Aristox.Fr. Hist.15; q. kai\ a)kou/smata D.C.52.30: generally,
festival, o(/sa *mousw=n w)si\n e)/xetai qewrh/mata Pl.Lg.953a.
object of contemplation, to\ e)n h(mi=n fa/ntasma dei= u(polabei=n . . ei)=nai q. Arist.Mem.450b25;
vision, Id.Div.Somn.463b19;
intuition, q. koina/ Chrysipp.Stoic.3.72,al., cf. Phld.Po.5.25 (pl.). of the mind,
speculation, theory, Arist. Metaph.1083b18, Top.104b1; ta\ kata\ fusiologi/an q. Metrod.Herc.831.8;
speculative proposition, M.Ant.1.8.
datum or
rule of art, Cic.Fam.6.11 (pl.); te/xnhs q. Phld.Rh.2.94S.,al.(pl.), cf. Stoic.3.51; i)atrikh=s q. Corn.ND33 (pl.);
scheme, plan, Plb.6.26.10: pl., qewrh/mata, ta/,
arts and sciences, Id.10.47.12; ai( te/xnai e)k -hma/twn ei)si/n Gal.1.106. Math.,
theorem, Archim.Sph.Cyl.1Prooem., al., Papp.30.6, al., Procl.in Euc.p.201 F.; also a)stronomika\ q. Phlp.in Mete.104.19.
subject of investigation, Plb.1.2.1, D.H.Comp. 2.
investigation, Plu.2.1131c.

qewr-hma^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
to be interpreted as seen, o)/neiroi, opp. a)llhgorikoi/, Artem.4.1.
theoretic, a)reth/ Stoic.3.48, cf. lamb.Protr.21.lb/, D.L.3.49;
dogmatic, epith. of
Metrodorus, Id.2.113;
contemplative, bi/os Jul.
ad Them.265b; opp. praktiko/s, Id.Or.6.190a.
qewr-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of qew/rhma, Arr. Epict.2.21.17,3.5.15.

qewr-h/mwn, onos, o(, h(,
contemplative, Choerob. in An.Ox.2.220.

qew/r-hsis, ews, h(,
viewing, tragikai\ q. Pl.Phlb. 48a.

qewr-hte/on,
one must consider, investigate, ei)/te . . ei)/te . . Id.Lg.815b; ti/ni diafe/rei . . Arist.Ph.193b23, etc.

qewr-hth/rion, to/,
seat in a theatre, Plu.CG12 (pl.), CIG2782.20 (Aphrodisias).

qewr-hth/s, ou=, o(,
spectator, e)rga/tai tw=n kalw=n kai\ q. Phld.Oec.p.63J., cf. Hsch. s.v. qewrou/s.
overseer, director, Sch.Opp.H.3.257.

qewr-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to perceive, tou= peri\ ta\ sw/mata ka/llous Arist.Pol.1338b1; mh\ pa/ntwn q. a)lla\ e)ni/wn Phld.Rh.2.108S.; th=s a)frosu/nhs S.E.M.11.256. of the mind,
contemplative, speculative, o( peri\ th\n . . ou)si/an q. Arist.Metaph.1005a35; o( peri\ fu/sews q. Id.PA641a29: c. gen., mantikh\ e)pisth/mh q. tou= . . me/llontos Pl.Def.414b; e)pisth/mh q., dia/noia, opp. praktikh/, poihtikh/, Arist. Metaph.1064a17, 1025b25; nou=s Id.de An.415a11; q. bi/os
a contemplative or
speculative life (opp. a)polaustiko/s, politiko/s), Id.EN1095b19, cf. Plu.Cic.3; q. filo/sofos Id.Per.16: Comp. -w/teros Herm.in Phdr.p.59A. Adv. -kw=s Epicur. Nat.28.7, Poll.4.8, Iamb.Comm.Math.20. = qewriko/s, Cod.Just. 10.56.1.1.

qewr-hto/s, h/, o/n,
that may be seen, D.S.14.60; o)/yei q. Ael.NA9.4; q. kataskeu/asma Secund.Sent.1; of certain days in disease,
to be watched (cf. e)pi/dhlos 11.1), Hp.Aph.2.24. of the mind,
to be reached by contemplation, tou\s dia\ lo/gou q. xro/nous Epicur. Ep.1p.10U.; qeou\s lo/gw| q. Id.Fr.355, cf. Phld.Sign.37; opp. e)mfanh/s, Plu.2.722d; lo/gw| ib.876c. Adv. -tw=s Gal.18(1).363.

qew/r-htra, wn, ta/,
presents made by the bridegroom to the bride,
when she first unveiled herself, Eust.881.31, Harp.

qewr-i/a, Ion. -i/h, Dor. qea_ri/a (v. infr.), Boeot. qiawri/a *)ef.*)arx.1892.34: h(:—
sending of qewroi/ or
state-ambassadors to the oracles or games, or, collectively,
the qewroi/
themselves, embassy, mission, qewri/an a)pa/gein ei)s *dh=lon Pl.Phd.58b: pl., opp. stratei=ai, Id.R.556c; a)/gein tw=| *dii\ tw=| *nemei/w| th\n koinh\n u(pe\r th=s po/lews q. D.21.115, cf. X.Mem.4.8.2, Decr.Byz. ap. D.18.91 (qea_ri/a), Plb.28.19.4.
office of qewro/s,
discharge of that office, th=s *)olumpi/aze q. Th.6.16, cf. Isoc.19.10, etc.
being a spectator at the theatre or
games, S.OT1491; ou)/t' e)pi\ qewri/an pw/pote e)k th=s po/lews e)ch=lqes Pl.Cri.52b; personified in Ar.Pax523,al.
viewing, beholding, qewri/hs ei(/neken e)kdhmei=n to go abroad
to see the world, Hdt.1.30; kata\ qewri/hs pro/fasin ib.29; e)kpe/mpein tina\ kat' e)mpori/an kai\ kata\ qewri/an Isoc.17.4, cf. Arist.Ath.11.1, Th.6.24;
pilgrimage, E.Ba.1047. of the mind,
contemplation, consideration, Pl.Phlb.38b: pl., qei=ai q. Id.R.517d: c. gen., panto\s me\n xro/nou pa/shs de\ ou)si/as ib.486a; h( tw=n a)rxw=n, h( tw=n o(/lwn q., Epicur.Ep.2p.55U., Phld.Rh.1.288S.; q. poiei=sqai peri/ tinos Arist.Metaph.989b25; h( peri\ fu/sews q. Epicur.Ep.1p.3U., etc.: pl., ta\s saqra\s au)tou= q. Demetr. Lac.Herc.124.12.
theory, speculation, opp. practice, Plb. 1.5.3; h( peri\ ta\ strato/peda q. Id.6.42.6; ai( nukterinai\ kai\ h(merinai\ q.
theoretic reckoning of night and day, Id.9.14.6; h( maqhmatikh\ q. Plu. Rom.12. Pass.,
sight, spectacle, A.Pr.802, etc.; esp.
public spectacle at the theatre or
games, Ar.V.1005, X.Hier.1.12; h( tou= *dionu/sou q. the Dionysia, Pl.Lg.650a. Rhet.,
explanatory preface to a mele/th, Chor. in Hermes 17.208, etc.: so in Philos.,
continuous exposition, Olymp.in Mete.18.30, al.

qewr-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for qewri/a (signfs. 1 and 11), peplw/mat' ou) qewrika/ no
festal robes, E.Supp.97; q. skhnh/ the tent
used by the qewroi/, Henioch.5.8; q. o(do/s,= qewri/s 1.2, Poll.2.55. Adv. -kw=s Hsch. qewriko/n, to/ （qewriko/s, o(, seems to be an error in Phld.Rh.2.208 S.), at Athens,
fund for providing free seats at public spectacles, oi( e)pi\ to\ q. Arist.Ath.43.1, cf. 47.2, D.18.113, IG22.223C5; h( a)rxh\ h( e)pi\ tw=| q. Aeschin.3.24: pl. (sc. xrh/mata), D.3.11, Harp., etc., cf. Plu.Per.9: so elsewh. qewrika/, with or without xrh/mata,
fund for festivals, POxy.1333 (ii/iii A.D.), 473.4 (ii A.D.).

qew/r-ios, v. qea/rios. qew/rion, to/,
box at the amphitheatre, PSI8.953.62 (vi A.D.).

qewr-i/s, i/dos, h(, (with and without nau=s)
sacred ship, which carried the qewroi/ to their destination, Hdt.6.87, cf. Call.Del.314: metaph., a)/stolos q., of
Charon's bark, A.Th.858 (lyr.). (sc. o(do/s)
road by which the qewroi/
went, Hsch. pl.,= *ba/kxai, Id., cf. Plb.30.25.12; of attendants of Apollo, Nonn.D.9.261.

qewrodok-e/w,
act as qewrodo/kos, SIG562.50 (Paros, from Magn. Mae.).

qewrodok-i/a, h(,
office of qewrodo/kos, BCH49.91 (Delph., iii B.C.), SIG608.5,10 (ib., ii B.C.): Dor. qea_rodoki/a, tw=n *dhli/wn CIG2329 (Delos).

qewro/dok-os, Dor. and Arc. qea_rodo/kos, Thess. qeouro- Inscr.Magn.26, Corc. qia_ro- ib.44: o(:—
one who receives the qewroi/, IG 4.727 (Hermione, iv B.C.), 5(2).389（Lusi), SIG608.7 (Delph., ii B.C.), etc.
qewrosu/nh, h(, = qewri/a, Man.4.460.

qe/wsis, ews, h(, (qeo/w)
making divine, Dam.Pr.100 (pl.).
qew/teros, v. qeo/s 111.

*qhba_genh/s, e/s,
sprung from Thebes, Theban, Hes.Th.530: distd. fr. *qhbai=os, Ephor.21 J.:—also *qhbaigenh/s, E.Supp.136, D.P.623.

*qh=bai, w=n, ai(, Thebes, *q. *ai)gu/ptiai . . ai(\ e(kat o/mpuloi/ ei)si Il.9.381: also sg., *qh/bhs e(ptapu/loio (Boeotia) 4.406:—hence *qh/basde
to Thebes, 23.679; Att. *qh/baze Sch.Il.3.29, al.; *qh/bhsin
at Thebes, Il. 22.479, Arist.Rh.1398b2, *qh/bhsi Il.14.114: from the sg., *qh/bhqen
from Thebes, Ephipp.15.7; poet. qewro/dok-qe APl.4.185; Boeot. *qei/ba_qen
from Thebes, Ar.Ach.862, also -a_qe ( qewrodo/k-aqi codd.) ib.868:—Adj. *qhbaieu/s, e/ws, Ion. e/os, o(, epith. of Zeus, Theban, Hdt.1.182, etc.: *qhbai=os, a, on, Theban, Od.10.492, etc.; *qhbai/+as (metri gr.) S.Ant. 1135 (lyr.): *qhbai+ko/s, h/, o/n, Hdt.2.4, etc.

*qhba_i/+s, i/+dos, h(, Thebais, i.e. territory of Thebes (in Egypt), Hdt. 2.28; (in Boeotia), Id.9.65, Th.3.58:—hence *qhbai/+ths [i_], ou, o(,
dweller in the Egyptian Thebais, Str.17.1.40. Thebaid, a poem on the siege of Thebes, which formed a portion of the Epic cycle, Paus.8.25.8.

*qhba/nas, o(, a name for
the north-east wind (kaiki/as) in Lesbos, Arist.Vent.973a9:—also *qh/banis, o(, St.Byz.s.v. *)/adana (because it blew from Hypoplacian Thebes), Hdn.Gr.1.95.

*qhba/rxhs, ou, o(,
governor of the Thebaid, OGI139.6 (pl., Philae, ii B.C.), 190.7 (ibid., i B.C.).
qh=bos (i.e. qh=vos）: qau=ma, and qh/geia (i.e. qh/veia）: qaumasta/, yeudh=, Hsch.

qhga^le/os, a, on, (qh/gw)
pointed, sharp, sta/likes AP6.109 (Antip.); tru/fos ib.7.542 (Flacc.). Act.,
sharpening, c. gen. rei, ib.6.68 (Jul. Aegypt.):—also qhga/neos, Hsch.

qhga/n-h [a^], h(,
whetstone, A.Ag.1536 (lyr.), S.Aj.820: metaph., ai(mathra\s qhga/nas
incentives to bloodshed, A.Eu.859; q. la/lhs Luc. Lex.14:—also qh/ganon, to/, Hsch.

qhgan-i/ths [i_] li/qos, o(, a hard stone, used for
whetstones, gen. qhganei/ta, IG14.317 (Therm. Himer.).
qhga/n-w, = qh/gw, restored by Herm. in A.Ag.1535 from Hsch., cf. EM450.13.
qh/gh, h(, softer form of qh/kh, Hsch. (v. diaqigh/).

qhgo/s, h/, o/n,
sharp, Hsch.
qhe/omai, Ion. form of qea/omai. qh/h|s, v. ti/qhmi.

qhht-h/r, h=ros, o(, Ion. for qeath/s,
one who gazes at, an admirer, q. to/cwn Od.21.397; a)krasi/hs Perict. ap. Stob.4.28.19.
qhht-h/s: a)patew/n (cf. qhphth/s）, qewro/s, Hsch.

qhht-o/s, h/, o/n, Ion. for qeato/s, Dor. qa_hto/s,
gazed at, wondrous, admirable, Hes.Th.31, Tyrt.10.29, Call. Dian.141; q. a)gw/n, gui=a, Pi.O.3.36, P.4.80: in later Ion. Prose qehto/s Aret.CD1.4.

qh/i+on, to/, Ep. for qei=on (A),
brimstone, Od.22.493. qh/i+os, Ep. for qei=os (A); cf. qh=|os.

qhk-ai=os, a, on,
like a chest or
coffin, oi)/khma q.
burial vault, Hdt.2.86; perh. to be read in Plu.2.359a. Subst. qhkai=on, to/,= qh/kh, SIG1120 (pl., Cos).
qhk-a/rion, to/, Dim. of qh/kh, Sch.Opp.H. 2.356.
qhk-ei=on, to/,= qhki/on, IG5(1).813 (inc. loc.).

qh/k-h, h(, (ti/qhmi)
case, chest, xrusou= q. a money-
chest, Hdt.3.130, 9.83, E.Hec.1147, cf. X.Oec.8.17, etc.
grave, tomb, A.Pers.405, S.OC1763 (anap.); nekrw=n qh/kas a)noi/gein Hdt.1.187, cf. 67, al.; ai( q. tw=n teqnew/twn Th.1.8, 3.104; ei)s a)naisxu/ntous q. e)tra/ponto
modes of burial, Id.2.52, cf. Pl.R.427b; qh/khn o)ru/ttein X.Cyr.7.3.5. ci/fous q. sword-
sheath, Poll.10.144; to/cou bow-
case, EM333.41.
qhk-i/on, to/, Dim. of qh/kh, PFay.104.5 (iii A.D.), IG12(3).1238 (Melos, iii/iv A.D.), Hsch.

qhko-poie/w,
store up, BGU757.15 (i A.D.):—Pass., xo/rtos teqhkopoihme/nos PRyl.142.16 (i A.D.).

qhko-poio/s, o(,
scabbard-maker, Lyd. Mag.1.46.

qhko-fo/ros, o(,=
cistophorus, ib.3.8.

qhkto/s, h/, o/n, (qh/gw)
sharpened, whetted, A.Th.942 (lyr.), E.Med. 40, AP6.110 (Leon. or Mnasalc.), Pancrat.Oxy.1085.23.

qhla/zw, Dor. aor. 1 e)qh/laca Theoc.3.16 (v.l. -aze): (qhlh/): of the mother or nurse,
suckle, Phryn.Com.29, Lys.1.9, Arist.HA576b10: abs.,
give suck, oi( mastoi/, oi(\ ou)k e)qh/lasan Ev.Luc.23.29:—also in Med., e)pimelei=sqai, o(/pws me/trion xro/non qhla/sontai Pl.R.460d, cf. Arist.HA566b17; ou) sullamba/nousi qhlazo/menai Id.GA777a13, cf. IG5(2).514.12 (Lycosura):—Pass.,
to be sucked, o( delfi\s . . qhla/zetai u(po\ tw=n te/knwn Arist.HA504b25. of the young animal,
suck, Id.GA733b29, etc.; e)le/fantos o( sku/mnos q. tw=| sto/mati Id.HA578a22; qhla/zwn xoi=ros a
sucking pig, Theoc.14.15; seldom of an infant, Orph.Fr.49.87. c. acc., leai/nas masdo\n e)qh/lacen Theoc.3.16; e)a\n mh\ tu/xh| teqhlakw\s o( o)/nos i(/ppon Arist.HA577b16. (Written qela/sz- PSI4.368.19 (iii B.C.).)

qhla^mino/s, o(,
a suckling, Hsch. (nisi leg. qhlamo/nos).
qhla^mw/n, o/nos, h(,= qhla/stria, Sophr.43, Thespis4.2, Lyc.31; prob. for qhlona/s, Plu.2.278d.

qh/l-asma, atos, to/,
mother's nursing, suckling, PMasp.5.24 (vi A.D.), PLond.5.1708.82 (vi A.D.).

qhl-asmo/s, o(,
giving suck, suckling, Plu.Rom.4, Aem.14.

qhl-a/stria, h(,
one who suckles, wet-nurse, S.Fr.98, Cratin.418, Eup.417.
qh/lea, qh/leia, v. qh=lus. qhleogoni/a,= qhlugoni/a 11, Gloss.

qhle/w, Dor. qa_le/w, Ep. impf. qh/leon Od.5.73: fut. qhlh/sw （a)na-) Il.1.236: Dor. poet. aor. qa/lhsa Pi.N.4.88; part. qhlh/sas AP9.363 (Mel.): (teqhlhme/na is f.l. in Hp.Insomn.90):—poet. for qa/llw,
to be full of, abound in, c. gen., leimw=nes malakoi\ i)/ou h)de\ seli/nou qh/leon Od.l.c.: c. dat., qa/lhse seli/nois Pi.l.c.; nikofori/ais a)/stu qa/lhse ib. 10.42. abs.,
grow luxuriantly, flourish, A.R.3.221, APl.c.; of a child, IG14.1971; prob. for e)qa/lleon, Epigr. ap. Plu.2.110b. causal,
make to bloom, Alex.Aet.3.9.

qhlh/, h(, (qh=sai)
teat, nipple, E.Cyc.56 (lyr.), Hp.Epid.5.101, Pl. Cra.414a; tw=n mastw=n h( q., di' h(=s . . to\ ga/la dihqei=tai Arist.HA493a13; of animals, ib.500a24; q. pefilotexnhme/nai dumb
teats, Sor.1.115.
head of a pole, kontoi\ su\n qhlai=s sidhrai=s PLond.3.1164h9 (iii A.D.).

qhlhno/s, h/, o/n,
quiet, Cyr. qhlhth/r: kunhgo/s, Hsch.

qhloeidh/s, e/s,
nipple-shaped, Gloss.
qhlonh/, v. qhlamw/n.

qhlu^-genh/s, e/s,
of female sex, womanish, sto/los A.Supp.28, cf. E. Ba.1156; o)/xlos ib.117: Comp., Pl.Lg.802e. Adv. -nw=s Eust.10.27.

qhlu^/-glwssos, on,
with woman's tongue, *nossi/s AP9.26.7 (Antip. Thess.).

qhlu^-gone/w,
generate or
promote the generation of females, Thphr.HP9.18.5, Ph.1.262, Dsc.3.126.

qhlu^-goni/a, h(,
generation of females, opp. kourogoni/h, Hp.Genit.8; opp. a)rrenogoni/a, Arist.HA 585b11, GA765a30, S.E.M.5.7.
kin by the mother's side, Hdn. 1.7.4;= Lat.
cognatio, Just.Nov.115.3.14.

qhlu^-go/nos, on,
generating females, Hp.Steril.230; kai\ gunai=kes kai\ a)/ndres . . q. ei)si/n Arist.HA 585b13; of animals, ib.573b32, GA766b32. qhlugo/non, to/, a plant supposed
to promote the generation of females, dog-mercury, Mercurialis perennis, Thphr.HP9.18.5;
a variety of fu/llon, Dsc.3.125;= lino/zwstis qh/leia, Ps.-Dsc.4.189.

qhludri/-as, ou, Ion. qhludri-i/hs, ew, o(,
effeminate person, Hdt.7.153, Ph. 1.262, Luc.DDeor.5.3, S.E.P.3.217 (pl.), Lib.Or.64.83 (pl.); of animals, Arist.HA631b17:—hence qhludria/w, Gloss.

qhludri-w/dhs, es,
effeminate, me/los Ar.Th.131; lo/goi Sch.E.Andr.757. Adv. -dw=s Sch.D.T.p.247 H.
qhludri-w=tis, fem. Adj.,= foreg., r(a|stw/nh Prisc. p.332 D.

qhlu^ko/s, h/, o/n,
woman-like, a)/ndres Arist.GA747a1;
like the female, of male animals, Id.HA589b30: Comp., Id.Pr.961a6. of women,
womanish, ultra-feminine, opp. a)rrenwpo/s, Id.GA728a3. Gramm.,
feminine, ge/nos D.T.634.17, D.H.Amm.2.11; mo/rion ibid.; o)/noma Ph. 1.294. Adv. -kw=s Arist.Fr.499, Phld.Piet.12, Str.6.1.10, A.D.Synt. 222.6, Alex.Aphr.in Sens.151.1. = qh=lus,
female, PCair.Zen. 166.2 (iii B.C.), LXXNu.5.3, IG14.872 (Cumae), Sor.1.32. q. kenth/mata bites
of female vipers, Philum.Ven.16.3. Astrol., applied to certain planets or figures of the Zodiac, Ptol.Tetr.20,33.

qhlu-kra/neia [kra^],
the female kra/neia,
dogwood, Cornus sanguinea, Thphr.HP1.8.2, 3.3.1.

qhlu-kra^th/s, e/s,
swaying women, e)/rws A. Ch.599(lyr.).

qhlu-kto/nos, on,
slaying by woman's hand, *[root ]arhs q. Id.Pr.860.

qhlu^kw/dhs, es,
of effeminate nature, Procl.Par.Ptol.265.
qhlu/-la^los [u^], on,= qhlu/glwssos, Man.4.322.

qhlu-ma^ne/w,
to be mad after women, Ph.2.20, Man.4.164.

qhlu-ma^nh/s, e/s,
mad after women, AP5.18 (Rufin.); *po/qoi Id.9.16 (Mel.); of animals, i(/ppoi q. LXXJe.5.8. Act.,
maddening women, krota/lwn q. o)/toboi Antim.Eleg.17:—hence qhlu-ma^ni/a, h(, Sch.Opp.H.1.536, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.177.

qhlu-melh/s, e/s,
singing in soft strain, *)alkma=nos a)hdo/nes AP 9.184.

qhlu-mi/trhs, ou, o(,
with a woman's mi/tra,
in woman's clothes, Luc.DDeor.18.1: acc. -mi/trhn prob. cj. for -mhtrin, -mitrin, Id.Bacch. 3.

qhlu/-noos, on, contr. qhlu/-nous, oun,
of womanish mind, A.Pr.1003.

qhlu/-pa^qew [u^],
muliebria pati, prob. in Phld.Herc.312.4.

qhlu/-pais, paidos, h(,
having borne a girl, Lyc. 851.

qhlu-poio/s, o/n,
making weak, of the number 8, Nicom. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.144 B.

qhlu/-pous, podos, o(, h(, q. ba/sis the tread
of female foot, [E.]IA421.
qhlu/-pri_nos, h(, Arc. name for fello/s, Eust.302.30.

qhlu-pro/swpos, on,
with woman's face, Suid. s.v. *seirh=nas.

qhlu-pteri/s, i/dos, h(,
bracken, Pteris aquilina, Thphr.HP9.18.8, Dsc.4.185, Plin.HN27.78:—also qhlu-pte/rion, to/, Alex.Trall.Verm.p.597 P.

qh=lus, qh/leia, qh=lu: Ep. fem. qh/lea, acc. pl. -eas Il.5.269 (Hom. has regul. fem. qh/leia Il.8.7,al., but also qh=lus as fem., 10.216,al., as in other poets, v. infr.): Ion. fem. qh/lea, qh/lean, qhle/hs, qhle/h|, pl. qh/leai, qhle/as, qhle/wn, Hdt. and Hp.: gen. qh/ludos S.Fr.1054; acc. fem. qhlei/hn dub. l. in Nic.Al.42, neut. pl. qh/leia Arat.1068: Ep. also qhlu/teros indicating opposition rather than comparison (cf. a)rre/nteros）; qhlu/terai de\ gunai=kes Il.8.520; qhlu/terai de\ qeai/ Od.8.324; ma/te e)rsenaite/ran ma/te qhlute/ran Schwyzer 424 (Elis, iv B.C.); in late Prose qhlu/teros, -u/tatos occur as Comp. and Sup. (v. infr. 11): (qh- 'suckle', cf. qh=sai):—
female, qh/leia qeo/s a goddess, Il.8.7; *(/hrh qh=lus e)ou=sa being
female, 19.97, cf. A.Ag.1231, S.Tr.1062, E.IT621; qh/leiai i(/ppoi mares, Od.4.636, etc.; su/es qh/leiai sows, 14.16; o)/i+s qh=lus a ewe, Il.10.216; qh/leia mh=la Arat. 1068; qh/leia e)/lafos a hind, Pi.O. 3.29; qh/lea ka/mhlos Hdt.3.102; h( q. i(/ppos ib.86; q. o)/rnis S.Fr.477; zw=|a q. Pl.Criti.110c; a)/pais qh/leos go/nou without
female issue, Hdt.3.66; qh=lus spora/ E.Hec.659; qh/leiai gunai=kes Id.Or.1205; q. ko/rai Pl.Lg.764d: with masc. nouns, o( qh=lus o)reu/s the
she-mule, Arist.HA 577b22; a)/nqrwpos qh=lus Id.PA688b31: masc. pl., qh/leis xoroi/ Critias 1.8D.; but mh\ ei)=nai qeou\s a)/rrenas mhde\ qhlei/as Phld.Piet.12. h( qh/lea, Att. -eia,
the female, Hdt.3.109, X.Mem.2.1.4; a)le/ktwr w(/ste qhlei/as pe/las A.Ag.1671 (troch.). to\ q. ge/nos the
female sex,
woman-kind, E.Hec.885; to\ q. alone, Id.HF536, etc.; opp. to\ a)/rren, Pl.R.454d, Arist.Metaph.988a5; [h( dei=na] te/token qh=lu PTeb.422.18 (iii A.D.),al. of plants and trees, Thphr.HP3.9.1; q. ka/lamos Dsc.1.85; qh=lus foi=nic Ach.Tat.1.17; qh=lu bou/tomon Thphr.HP4.10.4.
of or
belonging to women, koura/wn qh=lus a)u+th/ Od.6.122; qh/lea nou=sos among the Scythians (cf. *)ena/rees), Hdt.1.105; no/mos A. Ch.821 (lyr.); fu/sis Pl.R.453a; xa/ris APl.4.<*>87 (Leont.); q. fo/nos murder
by women, E.Ba.796. metaph., of persons and things,
soft, gentle, qh=lus e)e/rsh Od.5.467, Hes.Sc.395; q. nu/c ( = u(/pombros) S.Fr.1053. u(/dwr q. kai\ malako/n Thphr.CP2.6.3; qhlute/ra o)smh/ ib.6.15.4; qhlu/taton pedi/on
most fruitful, Call.Fr. 296; qhlu/taton u(/dwr of the Nile, Id.Sos.vii 5.
tender, delicate, *foi/bou qh/leiai . . pareiai/ Id.Ap.37; qh=lus a)po\ xroih=s
delicate of skin, Theoc.16.49; of temper or character,
soft, yielding, weak, qh=lus hu(/rhmai ta/las S.Tr.1075; gunh\ de\ qh=lu ka)pi\ dakru/ois e)/fu E.Med.928; qh/leia frh/n Ar.Lys.708, cf. E.Andr.181; di/aita qhlute/ra h)\ kat' a)/ndra Plu.Mar.34; qhlu/tatos Luc.Im.13; pallakh\ -uta/th Philostr.VS2.21.2; to\ qh=lu th=s yuxh=s
effeminacy, Men.599. in mechanics, those parts were called female
into which others fitted, as the
female vertebra, Poll.2.180; gi/gglumos J.AJ3.6.3. Gramm.,
feminine, qh/lea [o)no/mata] Ar.Nu.682; qh/lea Arist.Po.1458a10. Pythag., of
even numbers, Plu.2.264a, 288d. Astrol., of planets, Ptol. Tetr.19; cf. qhluko/s 3c. qh/leiai, ai(, kind of cheese made in Crete, Seleuc. ap. Ath.14.650d.

qhlu/sporos, on,
of female kind, ge/nna, of the daughters of Danaus, A.Pr.855.

qhlustol-e/w,
wear women's clothes, Str.10.3.8, 11.13.9.

qhlustol-i/a, h(,
women's dress, Eust.782.47.

qhlu/stol-os, on,
clad in women's clothes: to\ q.
effeminacy, Id.10.24.

qhlu/teknos [u^], on,
producing female children, ga/moi TAM2(1).174Db.

qhlu/ths, htos, h(, (qh=lus)
womanhood, female nature, Arist.GA 775a16;
sexual characters of the female, Gal.4.570.
womanishness, delicacy, Corn.ND20, Plu.Crass.32; h( q. tou= ka/llous
the womanish nature of . . , ib. 24; also,
effeminacy, e)sqh/twn Id.Alc.16 (pl.).

qhlu^tok-e/w,
bear females, Hp.Genit. 7, Arist.HA574a1, GA765a24.

qhlu^tok-i/a, h(,
bearing of females, ib.767a35: pl., J.AJ3.11.5.

qhlu^/tok-os (parox.), on,
bearing females, Arist.GA723a27, Pol.1335a13, Theoc. 25.125.

qhlu/-tropos, on,
of womanish habit: metaph., of the planet Venus, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.136.

qhlu-fa^nh/s, e/s,
like a woman, neani/skoi Plu.Thes.23; pa/qos AP11.285 (Pall.).
qhlu-fqo/rion, to/,= a)bro/tonon, Ps.-Dsc.3.24.

qhlu-fo/nos, on,
killing women: qhlufo/non, to/,
leopard's bane, Aconitum Anthora, Thphr.HP9.18.2, Nic.Al.41, Plin.HN25.122, Dsc.4.76 (v.l. qhro-).

qhlu/-frwn, on, gen. onos,
effeminate, Ar. Ec.110 (= Trag.Adesp.51), Vett.Val.104.21.

qhlu/-fwnos, on,
with woman's voice, Ael.NA6.19; eu)genh\s filosofi/a feu/gousa to\ q. Eust. 10.22.

qhlu/-xeir, xeiros, o(, h(,
with woman's hand, Id.550.37.

qhlu-xi/twn [i^], wnos, o(, h(,
with woman's frock, AP6.219 (Antip.), Orac. ap. Luc. Alex.27.
qhlu-xoi/ra, h(,= u(/aina, Sch.Opp.H.5.31.

qhlu/-yu_xos, on,
of woman's spirit, Ptol.Tetr.162.

qhlw/, o/os, ou=s, h(,
wet-nurse, Hsch.;= Lat. Rumina, Plu.2.278d.

qh=ma, atos, to/, (ti/qhmi)
tomb, S.Fr.541. =
prooemium, Gloss.

qhmologe/w,
collect in a heap, shortd. from qhmwnologe/w (metri.gr.), yammi/thn do/rpon AP9.551 (Antiphil.).

qhmw/n, w=nos, o(, (ti/qhmi)
heap, h)i/+wn qhmw=na . . karfale/wn Od.5.368; q. a)xu/rwn Arist.Mete.344a26; qhmw=na nhh=sai Opp.H.4.496, cf. Ph. ap. Eus.PE8.7: pl., Ph.2.97.
qhmwnia/ (not qhmwni/a), h(,= foreg., q. a(/lwnos LXXJb.5.26; sunh/gagon au)tou\s qhmwnia\s qhmwnia/s ib.Ex.8.14(10), cf. Eust.1539.16:— also qeimwnei/ai and qhmoniai/, Hsch.

qhmwnoqete/w (qhmon- codd.),
put in a heap, Sch.Theoc.10.46.

qhn, enclit. Particle (A.D.Conj.257.9) chiefly Ep. and Dor., rare in Trag., A.Pr.928:—
in truth, I ween, freq. ironical, lei/yete/ q. ne/as Il. 13.620; w(/s q. kai\ so\n e)gw\ lu/sw me/nos 17.29, cf. 21.568; strengthd., h)= q.
in very truth, 11.365, 13.813; ou)/ q.
surely not, 2.276, Od.5.211; ou)/
q. dh/ 3.352; kai\ ga/r q. Il.21.568: coupled with ga, Epich.34, Sophr. 24: freq. in Theoc., 1.97, al.; once in Call., Aet.Oxy.2079.46.
qh/nion: ga/la, Hsch.

qh=cis, ews, h(, = r(oph/, stigmh/, ta/xos, Hsch.; qh/cei, = Lat.
momento, Gloss.; but kata\ qh=cin is f.l. for kata\ qi/cin in Archig. ap. Gal.12.577.
qhoi=o, Ep. for qew=|o, 2sg. pres. opt. o<*> qhe/omai.
qh=|os, a, on, Dor. for qei=os (A), Callicr. ap. Stob.4.28.17, Euryph. ap. eund.4.39.27.

qhpale/os: bwmolo/xos, Hsch. qhpe/w,
to be astonished, Id. qhphth/s, ou=, o(,
deceiver, Id. qhpo/n: kataqu/mion, qaumasto/n, Id. qh/pw,
deceive, Hippon.14.1; but also, = qauma/zw, Hsch.; cf. qhpe/w.

qh/r, qhro/s, Ep. dat. pl. qh/ressi, o(: later also h(, Ael.NA6.24, etc.: (v. sub fin.):—
beast of prey, esp. a lion (so used in Cephallenia, Sch. Il.15.324), Il.15.586, etc.; o( *ne/meios q. E.HF153: coupled with le/wn, ib.465, Epimenid.2: with le/aina, AP14.63.4 (Mesom.); of the wild boar, *)eruma/nqios q. S.Tr.1097; of Cerberus, Id.OC1569 (lyr.); o( q., of a hind, Id.El.572: pl., generally,
beasts, opp. birds and fishes, h)e/ pou e)n po/ntw| fa/gon i)squ/es, h)\ e)pi\ xe/rsou qhrsi\ kai\ oi)wnoi=sin e(/lwr ge/net' Od.24.291; i)xqu/si me\n kai\ qhrsi\ kai\ oi)wnoi=s petehnoi=s Hes.Op.277; e)n qhrsi/n, e)n brotoi=sin, e)n qeoi=s a)/nw S.Fr.941.12; e)n a)/grh| qhrw=n Hdt. 3.129; a)/foboi qh=res S.Aj.366: metaph., qh=res cifh/reis, of Orestes and Pylades, E.Or.1272, cf. Ph.1296 (lyr.); h( sfodro/ths . . qhro/s (sc. *)/erwtos) Alex.245.12: prov., e)/gnw qh\r qh=ra Arist.Rh.1371b16. of any
living creature, plwtoi\ qh=res, i.e. dolphins, Arion 1.5; of
vermin killed by birds, Ar.Av.1064 (lyr.); of gnats, AP5.150 (Mel.); of the
sacred animals in Egypt, a)rxistolisth\s qhrw=n Sammelb.4011.4. any fabulous
monster, as the Sphinx, A.Th.558 codd.; esp. of a centaur, S.Tr.556, 568 (cf. fh/r); of Satyrs, E.Cyc.624; ou) qew=n tis ou)d' a)/nqrwpos ou)de\ q. A.Eu.70.—Less freq. than qhri/on in Prose, but found in Hdt. l.c. (v.l. qhri/wn), X.Cyr.4.6.4, Pl.R.559d, Sph. 235a, Ael. l.c., etc.; a)/grioi qh=res Arist.EE1229a25. (I.-E.
ĝh[uglide]ēr-, cf. fh/r, Lith.
žvėrìs 'wild beast'.)

qh/ra, Ion. qh/rh, h(,
hunting of wild beasts, the chase, ba/n r(' i)/men e)s qh/rhn Od.19.429; ai(/mona qh/rhs Il.5.49; i)e/nai e)pi\ th\n qh/rhn Hdt.1.37, 4.114, cf. Ar.Fr.2 D.; zw=si a)po\ q. Hdt.4.22, cf. Arist.Pol.1256a35; e)poi/hse mega/lhn qh/ran X.Cyr.1.4.14; q. poiei=sqai Arist.HA541a20; ta\s q. tw=n o)rtu/gwn e)poiou=nto D.S.1.60; tou= pthnou= ge/nous q., = o)rniqeutikh/, Pl.Sph.220b; h( peri\ qa/lattan q.
fishing, Id.Lg.823d; kunhgesi/a kai\ h( a)/llh q. ib.763b: pl., pe/rdikes ei)s ta\s q. a)go/menai, of decoy birds, Arist.GA751a14, cf. Phld.Ir.p.42 W., Ant.Lib.41.2. in Ptolemaic Egypt, strathgo\s e)pi\ th\n q. tw=n e)lefa/ntwn OGI82, 86 (iii B.C.), cf. Str.16.4.5,7, Wilcken Chr.385.14 (iii B.C.), PPetr.3p.292 (iii B.C.), etc. metaph.,
eager pursuit of anything, qh/ran . . e)/xomen to/cwn, = qhrw=men ta\ to/ca, S.Ph.840; dusmenw=n qh/ran e)/xein Id.Aj.564; q. a)nqrw/pwn Pl.Sph.222b, 222c; tou= h(de/os Id.Grg.500d; e)pisthmw=n Id.Tht.198a, etc.
prey, game, ai)=ya d' e)/dwke qeo\s menoeike/a qh/rhn Od.9.158, cf. A.Ch.251, E.Ba.1144; pri\n kinei=sqai th\n q. X. Cyr.2.4.25; qh/ran kalh/n, of a prisoner, S.Ph.609: in pl., w)= ptanai\ qh=rai, of birds, ib.1146 (lyr.); th\n q. e)pi\ tou= me/sou throu=sa watching its
prey, of a spider, Arist.HA623a13.
hunting-ground, preserve, *(adrianou= qh=rai D.C.69.10. in Roman times,
the games of the Circus, Epigr.Gr.351.3 (Nicaea).

qhragr-e/ths, ou, o(,
hunter, E.Ba.1020 (lyr., s.v.l.), AP6.184 (Zos.).

qhragr-i/a, h(,
chase of wild beasts, Poll.5.12.

qh/ragr-os, on, (a)/gra)
for catching wild beasts or
game, pe/dh Ion Trag.40: name of a hound, dub. in AP7.304 (Pisand.).

*qhrai+ko/n or *qh/raion, to/, a dress worn in the Satyric drama at Athens,
invented in the island Thera, Thphr.Fr.119.

qh/r-a_ma, atos, to/, —qhra/w)
prey, spoil, E.Ba.869 (lyr., s.v.l.), Hel. 192 (lyr.), AP6.105 (pl., Apollonid.), Plu.Luc.17: metaph., a)reta\ . . , q. ka/lliston bi/w| Arist.Fr.675.

qh/r-arxos, o(,
commander of two elephants, Ascl.Tact.9, Ael.Tact.23:—hence qhr-arxi/a, h(,
his command, Ascl.Tact.9.

qhr-a/simos [a_], on,
to be hunted down, qhreu/ontes ou) qhrasi/mous ga/mous A.Pr.858.

qhr-a/teira [a_], fem. of qhrath/r,
huntress, Call.Del.230.

qhr-a_te/os, a, on,
to be pursued, sought eagerly, S.Ph.116, X.Mem.2.6.8. qhrate/on
one must pursue, Id.Cyr.2.4.10.
qhr-a_th/r, Ion. qhr-hth/r, h=ros, o(, poet. for qhrath/s, Il. 5.51, etc.; a)ndro\s qhrhth=ros 21.574; kou=roi q. 17.726.

qhr-a_th/rios, a, on, = qhratiko/s, c. gen., i)/ugga q. e)/rwtos S.Fr.474.1. Subst. -ath/rion, to/,
hunting implement, Hsch. s.v. a)/gkistron.

qhr-a_th/s, ou=, o(, (qhra/w)
hunter, Ael.NA13.12, PSI3.222.7 (iii A.D.): metaph., q. lo/gwn Ar.Nu.358; do/chs D.L.8.8; tw=n a)dh/lwn Philostr.Jun.Im. 1.

qhr-a_tiko/s, h/, o/n,= qhrentiko/s, sku/lakes Ph.1.628 (s.v.l.), cf. Gal.Protr.6; e)/rga Ael.NA14.5; q. shmei=a signals
given by the hunter, Plu.2.593b; q. fo/ros tax
for game-licence, dub. in PSI3.222 (iii A.D.).
fit for winning, ta\ q. tw=n fi/lwn
the arts for winning friends, X.Mem.2.6.33.
fond of hunting, Plu.2.0a, 965b.

qhr-a_to/s, h/, o/n,
to be caught: metaph.,
attainable, th\n e(/cin h(=| ta\ kala\ q. gi/gnetai toi=s a)nqrw/pois Plb.10.47.11; ou)d' o(/lws e)pisth/mh| q. o( kairo/s, a)lla\ do/ch| D.H.Comp.12; krith/rion ou)de\ stoxasmw=| q. Phld.Rh. 1.167S.

qh/r-a_tron, to/,
instrument of the chase, net, trap, etc., X.Mem. 2.1.4, 3.11.7, Plu.2.961c (pl.), Ael.NA1.21: pl., of spider's
webs, Max. Tyr.16.5: metaph., prob. in Lib.Decl.22.25.
qhr-a/twr [a_], Ion. qhr-h/twr, oros, o(,= qhrath/r, qhrh/toras a)/ndras Il.9.544; [ku/wn] qhra/twr Nic. Dam.56J.
qhr-a/fion [a_], to/, Dim. of qhri/on, of insects, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.91.

qhr-a/w, fut. -a/sw [a_] S.Ph.958, E.IT1426, X.An.4.5.24, etc.: aor. e)qh/ra_sa A.Pers.233, E.Ba.1215, X.Cyr.1.4.10: pf. teqh/ra_ka ib. 2.4.16; Thess. pf. part. pefeira/kontes IG9(2).536:—Med., fut. qhra/somai (which, acc. to Moer., is the true Att. fut.) E.Ba.228, IT1324: aor. e)qhra_sa/mhn S.Ph.1007, E.Hipp.919:—.,Pass., fut. -a_qh/somai Gp. 12.9.2: aor. e)qhra/qhn (v. infr. 111): (qh/r, qh/ra):—
hunt, chase, lagw/s, sfh=kas, X.An.l.c., HG4.2.12, etc.; kai/ m' ou(\s e)qh/rwn pro/sqe qhra/sousi nu=n S.Ph.958; of fishermen,
catch, Arist.Fr.76: metaph.,
catch or
capture, kai/ s' ei(=le qhrw=nq' h( tu/xh S.OC1026, cf.Ph.1007, X.An.5.1.9:
captivate, Id.Mem.2.6.28, 3.11.7; q. po/lin
seek to destroy it, A.Pers. 233. metaph.,
hunt after a thing,
pursue it
eagerly, turanni/da S.OT542; qhra=n ou) pre/pei ta)mh/xana Id.Ant.92; muri/ai ko/rai qhrw=si le/ktron tou)mo/n E.IA960; h(/marton h)\ qhrw= ti; have I missed or
do I hit the quarry? A.Ag.1194; ti/ xrh=ma qhrw=n; E.Supp.115;
reach, attain to, ti Pi.I.4(3).46 (s.v.l.). c. inf.,
seek, endeavour to do, qhra=| gamei=n me E.Hel.63; cf. 11.3. = e)kpra/ssw 111, qhrh/tw de\ a( qoinarmo/stria IG5(1).1498 (Messenia, ii B.C.). Med. like Act.,
hunt for, fish for, e)gxe/leis Ar.Eq.864: abs., oi( qhrw/menoi
hunters, X.Cyn.11.2. more freq. metaph.,
seek after, e)me/toisi qhrw/menoi th\n u(giei/hn Hdt.2.77; mastoi=s e)/leon q. E.Or.568; th\n th=s swfrosu/nhs do/can D. 61.21, etc.; q. puro\s phgh/n
find, discover it, A.Pr.109;
expect to derive, ti para/ tinwn Phld.Rh.1.263S. c. inf.,
seek, endeavour, o(/s me qhra=tai labei=n E.Hel.545; pei=ra/n tin' e)xqrw=n a(rpa/sai qhrw/menon S. Aj.2. Pass.,
to be hunted, pursued, pro\s a)/ths qhraqei=sai A. Pr.1072; u(p' a)ndrw=n E.Ba.732; *)alkibia/dhs dia\ ka/llos u(po\ gunaikw=n qhrw/menos X.Mem.1.2.24.—Cf. qhreu/w.

qhr-ei/a, h(,
hunting, Gloss.

qh/r-eios, on, also a, on v.l. in Pl.Phdr.248d, AP5.265 (Paul. Sil.): (qh/r):—
of wild beasts, de/rma q. le/ontos Panyas.1, cf. Hanno Peripl.9; me/lea Emp.101; qh/reion grafh/n the figures
of animals worked upon the cloak, A.Ch.232; q. da/kos,= qh/r, E.Cyc.325; q. bi/a, periphr. for o( qh/r,
the centaur, S.Tr.1059; q. kre/a
game, X.Cyr. 1.3.6; so qh/reia, ta/, Hp.Aff.52; q. fu/sis Pl. l.c.; q. au)lo/s （e)k vebrou= kw/lwn ei)rgasme/nos) Poll.4.75. q. sto/mata the entrance
of the Circus, IG4.365 (Corinth).

qhr-epw|do/s, o/n,
charming wild beasts, Suid. s.v. sofo/s.

qh/r-euma, atos, to/, (qhreu/w)
spoil, prey, S.Ichn.285, E.IA1162. pl.,
hunting, Pl.Lg.823b.

qh/r-eusis, ews, h(,
hunting, the chase, pezw=n ib.824a: metaph., o)noma/twn qhreu/seis Id.Tht.166c.

qhr-eute/on,
one must hunt after, Plb.1.35.8.
qhr-euth/r, h=ros, o(,= sq., Opp.C.1.449.

qhr-euth/s, ou=, o(,
hunter, used by Hom. (only in Il.) always as Adj., ku/nessi kai\ a)ndra/si qhreuth=|sin hounds and
huntsmen, Il.12.41; e)n kusi\ qhreuth=|si 11.325; so q. a)/ndres Hes.Sc.303, 388; ku/nes Thgn.1254, X.Ages.9.6: as Subst., Hdt.1.123, Satyr.Vit.Eur.Fr.39 XXi14; of
a fisher, Hdt.2.70; q. pe/rdic
a decoy partridge, Arist.HA614a10; q. i)co/s
birdlime, AP5.99. metaph., q. ne/wn kai\ plousi/wn Pl.Sph.231d, cf. Chor.p.67 B.; kalli/stwn o)noma/twn Ath.3.122c.

qhr-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of of
for hunting, ku/nes q.
hounds, Ar.Pl.157, X.Lac.6.3; bi/os q. the life
of hunters, Arist.Pol.1256b2: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh)
hunting, the chase, Pl.Plt.289a, cf. Sph.223b. c. gen.,
hunting after, th=s trofh=s Arist.HA488a19: metaph., q. te/xnh a)nqrw/pwn Pl.Euthd.290b.
qhr-euto/s, h/, o/n, = qhrato/s, Arist.Pol.1324b40.
qhr-eu/tria, fem. of qhreuth/r, bou=s PCair.Zen.292.298 (iii B.C.), cf. Hsch. s.v. qhro/tis; q. ku/nes Them. Or.18.220b.

qhr-eu/twr, oros, o(,
hunter, q. a)/ndres, of men engaged in Circus games, IG4.365 (Corinth).

qhr-eu/w, aor. 1 e)qh/reusa Pl. Euthd.290c: pf. teqh/reuka Id.Tht.200a:—Med., fut. -somai Id.Sph. 222a: aor. e)qhreusa/mhn Ar.Fr.51, Pl.Tht.197d:—Pass., pf. teqh/reumai Lysipp.Com.7: aor. e)qhreu/qhn Hdt.3.102, A.Ch.493, Pl.Sph. 221a: (cf. qhra/w):—
hunt, qhreu/onta
while hunting, Od.19.465, cf. Hdt.4.112; qhreu/ein dia\ kenh=s, of the motions of the hands of dying persons, Hp.Prog.4.
decoy, Arist.HA614a13. c. acc.,
hunt after, chase, catch, a)ttele/bous Hdt.4.172; qhri/a, o)/rniqas a)gri/as, mu=n, X.An.1.2.7, Pl.Tht.197c, PCair.Zen.300.7 (iii B.C.); i\xqu=s Arist. HA603a7; [e)le/fantas] OGI54.11 (Adule, iii B.C.); of men, Hdt. 4.183; q. a)nqrw/pous e)pi\ qoi/nhn h)/ qusi/an Arist.Pol.1324b39, cf. X.An. 1.2.13; *tituo\n be/los qh/reuse it
hit, struck him, Pi.P.4.90:—Med., Ar.Fr.51, Pl.Grg.464d, Euthd.290b:—Pass.,
to be hunted, Hdt.3.102;
to be preyed upon, ib.108;
to be caught, pe/dais A.Ch.493: metaph.,
to be captivated, Lysipp.Com.7. metaph.,
hunt, seek after, kerde/wn me/tron Pi.N.11.47; ga/mous A.Pr.858; a)reta/n E.IA568 (lyr.); q. ne/ous plousi/ous o)rfanou/s Aeschin.1.170; h(dona/s, e)pisth/mhn, Isoc.1.16, Pl.Tht.200a, al.; [eu)daimoni/an] Arist.Pol.1328b1; o)no/mata, r(h/mata, Pl.Grg.489b, And.1.9, cf. Antipho 6.18; ta\s a)rxa\s tw=n sullogismw=n Arist.APr.46a11; q. to\n plhsi/on, of an orator, Phld.Rh. 2.5 S., al.—Trag. preferred qhra/w, exc. where metre demanded qhreu/w.
qhrefo/nos, on,= qhrofo/nos, Hdn.Gr.2.260.
qh/rhma, qhrhth/r, qhr-h/teira, qhr-h/twr, Ion. for qh/ra_ma, etc.

qhri^-a/zomai, Pass.,
pass into a beast, of the soul, Corp.Herm.10.20.

qhri^-a^ko/s, h/, o/n, (qhri/on)
concerning venomous beasts, lo/gos Dsc. Ther.Praef.; *fili=nos<o(> q., the writer on this subject, Philum.Ven.6.1: h( -kh/ (sc. a)nti/dotos) and antidote
against a poisonous bite, Androm. ap.Gal.14.32, etc.; q. fa/rmaka Id.17(2).337; qhriaka/, title of Nicander's poem on such antidotes; of other works, Gal.14.7; q. a)/mpelos Gp.4.8.1, cf. Plin.HN14.117; q. [oi)=nos] Dsc.5.53.

qhri^-a/lwsis [a^], ews, h(,
capture of wild beasts, Sm.Ge.49.9.

qhri^-a/lwtos [a^], on,
caught by wild beasts, LXX Le.5.2, Ph.2.355.
qhri/ambos, coined as etym. of qri/ambos, Suid.

qhria/nqrwpos, on,
beast-man, e)/qnos Hdn.Epim.76.

qhri/dion, to/, Dim. of qhri/on, in pl.,
animalculae, Thphr.HP2.8.3, Arr.Epict.2.9.6, Gal.16.162, Gp.5.53.6.

*qhri/kleios, a, on, or os, on,
made by Thericles, a famous Corinthian potter (Eub.31,43), *q. ku/lic Alex.96, Thphr.HP5.3.2 (pl.), Cleanth.Stoic.1.133; krath/r Alex.119, cf.IG11(2).124.43, al. (Delos, iii B.C.); poth/ria Phalar.Ep.70; freq. *qhriklei/a (or -os) alone, Alex.5, Men. 226, 324; *q. h( mega/lh Diox.4; tw=n *qhriklei/wn eu)ku/klwton a)spi/da Aristopho 14; o(/sa d' e)sti\n ei)/dh *qhriklei/wn tw=n kalw=n Dionys.Com.5.1.
qhrio/-brwtos, on,= qhro/boros, D.S.18.36.

qhrio-dei=ktai, oi(,
exhibitors of wild beasts, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.7.118, 8(4).212.

qhrio/-dhgma, atos, to/,
bite of a serpent, Dsc.2.79.

qhrio-dh/kths,
marsus, Gloss.

qhrio/-dhktos, on,
bitten by a wild beast, esp.
by a serpent, Damocr. ap.Gal.14.122, Dsc.1.103, 4.24.

qhrio-eidh/s, e/s,
like a wild beast, Adam. 1.4.

qhrio-ko/mos, o(,
keeper of wild beasts, Procop.Arc.9.
qhrio-kto/nos, on,= qhrokto/nos, fa/rmakon Eust.1416.14.

qhrio-ma^xe/w,
fight with wild beasts, D.S.3.43, 1 Ep.Cor.15.32, Vett.Val.129.33, Ptol.Tetr.200, Artem.2.54.

qhrio-ma/xhs [a^], ou, o(,
one who fights with beasts, D.S. 36.10.

qhrio-ma^xi/a, h(,
fighting with wild beasts, in pl.,= Lat.
venationes, Str.2.5.33, Ph.1.602.

qhrio-ma/xos [a^], on,
fighting with wild beasts, M.Ant.10.8, Luc.Lex.19.

qhrio-mi^gh/s, e/s,
half man half beast, as Scylla, Tz.ad Lyc.45.

qhrio/-morfos, on, (morfh/)
in the form of a beast, kw/dwn Eust.1139.57, cf. Procl.Par.Ptol.278.

qhri/on, to/ (in form Dim. of qh/r),
wild animal, esp. of such as are hunted, ma/la ga\r me/ga qhri/on h)=en, of a stag, Od.10.171, 180 (never in Il.); in Trag. only in Satyric drama, S.Ichn.147 (dub. in A.Fr.26): used in Prose for qh/r, X.An.1.2.7, Isoc.12.163, etc.; of the spider's
prey, Arist.HA623a27; freq. of elephants, Plb.11.1.12, al.: pl.,
beasts, opp. men, birds, and fishes, h.Ven.4, Hdt.3.108. generally,
animal, Id.1.119; neno/mistai pu=r q. ei)=nai e)/myuxon Id.3.16; of men, a)/nqrwpos pa/ntwn q. qeeide/staton Antipho Soph.48; ei)s qhri/ou bi/on a)fiknei=sqai Pl.Phdr.249b; also q. u(/eion Id.R.535e; of the dog, Theoc.25.79; of fishes, Arist.HA598b1; of eels, Antiph.147.7; of leeches, IG4.951.101 (Epid.); of other small creatures, Arist.HA 552b11, 625b32, Hp. ap. Gal.19.103, Theoc.19.6; ou)k e)/stin ou)de\n q. tw=n i)xqu/wn a)tuxe/steron Antiph.161.1; opp. plants, Pl.Smp.188b: prov., h)\ qhri/on h)\ qeo/s, either above or below the nature of man, Arist. Pol.1253a29, cf. EN1145a25.
beast, esp. as hostile and odious to man, qhri/a te kai\ bota/
carnivora and graminivora, Pl.Mx.237d;
monster, creature, of sharks, etc., Hdt.6.44; of Typhon, etc., Pl. Phdr.230a, R.588e; of the Satyrs, S.Ichn. l.c.; tauti\ podapa\ ta\ q.; Ar.Nu.184, cf. Av.93.
poisonous animal, Dsc.1.75, Act.Ap. 28.4. Medic.,= qhri/wma, Hp.Coac.459, Loc.Hom.29, cf. Gal. l.c. as a term of reproach,
beast, creature, w)= deilo/taton su\ qhri/on Ar.Pl.439, cf. Eq.273; ko/laki, deinw=| qhri/w| Pl.Phdr.240b; *krh=tes, kaka\ q. Epimenid.1; dusnouqe/thton q., of poverty, Men. Georg.78; h( mousikh\ a)ei/ ti kaino\n qhri/on ti/ktei Anaxil.27, cf. Eup.132; ti/ de/, ei) au)tou= tou= qhri/ou h)kou/sate; said by Aeschines of Demosthenes, Plin.Ep.2.3.10; q. sunestiw/menon, of woman, Secund. Sent.8. Astron., the constellation Lupus, Eudox. ap. Hipparch. 1.2.20, Vett. Val.6.13.

qhrio-na/rkh, h(, a plant
that benumbs serpents, Nerium Oleander, Plin.HN24.163,25.113.

qhrio/-plhktos, on,
struck by a poisonous animal, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).150.

qhrio-poie/w,
make into wild beasts, Tz.ad Lyc.815.

qhrio/ths, htos, h(,
brutality, Arist.EN1145a17, Metop. ap. Stob.3.1.115.

qhriotrof-ei=on, to/,
park where wild beasts are kept, Hortens. in Varro RR3.13.2 (
thero- codd.).

qhriotrof-e/w,
train as a wild beast, Alciphr. Fr.5 (Pass.).

qhrio/trof-os, on, (parox.)
abounding in wild beasts, of a country, Str.2.5.33;
keeping wild beasts, Procl.Par.Ptol.250. proparox., qhrio/trofos, on, Pass.,
fed on reptiles, Gal.11.143.

qhrio/w,
make into a wild beast, tou\s pro\s au)th\n a)fiknoume/nous h( *ki/rkh qhrioi= Phld.Piet.144:—Pass., IG14.1291. Pass.,
come to the full size of a beast, pri\n qhriou=sqai to\n go/non Eub.107.14.
become brutal, qhriou/menos Pl.Lg.935a; pro/s tinas Phld.Lib.p.25O.; pro\s a)grio/thta Ph.2.53. of seeds,
to be infested with worms, Thphr. CP5.18.1. of places,
to be infested with reptiles, Paul.Aeg. 5.1. Medic.,
become malignant, e(/lkh e)a=sai qhriwqh=nai Thphr. Char.19.3; teqhriwme/non e(/lkos Dsc.3.9.
*qhri/tas, a, o(, Lacon. name of Ares, Paus.3.19.8, Hsch. (Lacon. for *qersi/ths).

qhri^-w/dhs, es,
full of wild beasts, infested by them, of countries, h( q. *aibu/h Hdt.4.181; o)/rea -e/stata Id.1.110; e)n th=| q. [xw/rh|] Id.4.174, cf. 2.32; -esta/ths e)ou/shs th=s qala/sshs tau/ths
full of ravenous fishes, Id.6.44. of beasts,
savage, Arist.PA663a13; e)pi\ to\ -e/steron Id.HA502b4; to\ q., of a colt, E.Tr.671. of men and manners,
brutal, di/aita Hp.VM3; [bi/otos] E.Supp.202, cf.SIG704E11 (Delph., ii B.C.); h(donh/ Pl.R.591c; bri/mwsis Phld.Ir.p.58W.; kata/stasis OGI424.3 (Palestine, i A.D.); o( q. e)n toi=s a)nqrw/pois spa/nios Arist.EN 1145a30; oi( *aa/kwnes . . qhriw/deis a)perga/zontai [tou\s pai=das] Id.Pol. 1338b12; h( q. e(/cis Id.EN1145a24: Comp. -e/steros, a)/nqrwpos Plb.30.12.3; to\ q.
brutality, Pl.Cra.394e, al. Adv. -wdw=s, diakei=sqai pro\s a\llh/lous Isoc.11.25, cf. Plb.15.20.3. zw/|dia q.,= qhrio/morfa, Ptol.Tetr.200. Medic.,
malignant, of ulcers, Phld.Ir.p.44W., Dsc.2.108, Plu.2.165e, Aret.SA2.8; also of intestinal worms, Hp. Epid.6.1.11, 6.2.11.
qhri^-wdi/a, h(,= qhrio/ths, v.l. in Arist.EN1145a24, cf. Sch.E.Or.518 (written qhri^-w/deia Asp.in EN130.7).

qhri^/-wma, atos, to/,
malignant ulcer (cf. qhri/on 11), Cels.5.28.3, Dsc.2.109, Erot. s.v. to\ qhriw=des, Gal.17(1).948.

qhri^-w/nu^mos, on,
named after a wild beast, Eust.ad D.P.976.

qhri^/-wsis, ews, h(,
turning into a beast, Luc. Salt.48.

qhro-bole/w,
slay wild beasts, S.Ph.165 (anap.), v.l. in AP6.186 (Diocl.).

qhro/-boros, on,
eaten or
torn by wild beasts, kre/as Ps.Phoc.147; q. qa/natos death
by wild beasts, Man.4.614.

qhro/-botos, on,
where wild beasts feed, e)rhmosu/nh AP9.4 (Cyllen.), cf. Phalar.Ep. 34.

qhro/-bromos, on,
heralded by the roar of wild beasts, epith. of Hecate, Orph.H.1.6.
qhro/-brwtos, on,= qhro/botos, Str.6.1.12 (v.l. qhriobr-).

qhro/-dhktos, on,
stung by a serpent, Sch.S.Ph.696.

qhro-di^daska^li/a, h(,
taming, training of wild beasts, Man.4.245.

qhro-di/wc [i^], wkos, o(,
hunter, Choerob. in Theod. 1.296, EM451.23.

qhro-eidh/s, e/s,
having the forms of wild beasts, Hsch.
qhro-zu^gokamyi^me/twpos, on, = o( qh=ras zugw=n kai\ ka/mptwn ta\ me/twpa, a word formed as part of a verse containing all the letters, AP9.538.

qhro-qh/ras, ou or a, o(,
hunter, Hsch.

qhro/-qu_mos, on,
with brutal mind, brutal, APl.3.25 (Phil.).

qhro-ko/mos, on,
keeping wild beasts or
camels, Hld.10.27.

qhro-kto/nos, on,
killing wild beasts, epith. of Heracles, IG5(2).91 (Tegea); of Artemis, E.IA1570, Corn.ND3, Porph.Abst.1.22; e)n fonai=s q. in the chase, E.Hel.154.

qhro-le/chs, ou, o(,
word-chaser, Hsch.

qhr-olete/w,
destroy wild beasts, Eust.561.3, Dosith.p.432 K.

qhr-ole/ths, ou, o(,
slayer of beasts, Hsch.; o)/zos o( q., of the club of Heracles, APl.4.104 (Phil.):—fem. qhr-ole/tis, idos, cj. for qhro/tis, Hsch.

qhro-ma^xi/a, h(,= Lat.
venatio, Mon.Anc.Gr.19.7, OGI533.48 (Ancyra), IGRom.3.631 (Xanthus).

qhro-mi^gh/s, e/s,
half-beast, fu=la q., of centaurs, Opp.C.2.6; q. tis w)rugh/ a cry
as of beasts, Plu.Mar. 20.
qhro/-miktos, on,= foreg., dai/mwn Lyc.963.

qhro-no/mos, on,
feeding or
tending wild beasts, of a mountain, AP6.111 (Antip.); of Pan, Castorio 2.
guiding them, ma/stic Nonn.D.11.122.

qhro/-peplos, on,
clad in the skins of beasts, Orph.H.69.7; q. mani/a the mad fancy
of wearing skins, Cerc.10, Stratonic. ap. Timae.80.

qhro-plaste/w,
to make beasts, Tz.ad Lyc.673.

qhro/-plastos, on,
changing into beasts, of Circe, Lyc.673.

qhro-sko/pos, on,
looking out for wild beasts, epith. of Artemis, h.Hom.27.11, B.10.107, AP6.240 (Phil.).

qhrosu/nh, Dor. qh/ro-na, h(,
the chase, Opp.C.4.43 (pl.), AP6.167 (Agath.).
qhro/tis: qhreu/tria, Hsch.

qhro-to/kos, on,
producing beasts, a)/gkea AP6.186 (Diocl.).
qhro-trofe/w, = qhriotrofe/w, Aristaenet.2.20.

qhro-tro/fos, on,
feeding wild beasts, a)nh/r IGRom.4.826 (Hierapolis); of places, E.Ba.556 (lyr.), A.R.4.1561, Longus 1.1; of Tethys, Orph.H.22.6. proparox., qhro/trofos, Pass.,
feeding on beasts, dra/kwn E.Ph.820 (hex.).

qhro/-tu^pos, on,
in the form of a beast, Orph.H.24.5,39.8.

qhro-fa^nh/s, e/s,
appearing like a beast, Procl.ad Hes.Op.151.

qhro-foneu/s, e/ws, o(,
slayer of beasts, Opp.C.1.538.

qhro-fone/w,
slay beasts, ib.4.24.

qhro-fo/nos, on, also h, on Thgn.11, prob. in Ar.Th.320:—
killing wild beasts, epith. of Artemis, Thgn. l.c., Ar. l.c.; qea/ E.HF378 (lyr.); of Apollo, AP9.525.9; qeo/s, i.e. Hadrian, Pancrat.Oxy.1085.31; ku/nes E.Hipp.216 (anap.). q., to/, v.l. for qhlufo/non, Dsc.4.76.

qhro-fo/ros, on,
producing game, prob. l. AP14.24.

qhro-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
huntsman, PPetr.3p.321 (iii B.C.), Sammelb.286.3.

qhro/-xlainos, on,
clad in the skins of beasts, Lyc.871.

qh/s, qhto/s, o(,
serf, bondsman, qh=te/s te dmw=e/s te Od.4.644; later,
hired labourer, qh=ta/ t' a)/oikon poiei=sqai Hes.Op.602; misqwtou\s kai\ qh=tas Pl.Plt.290a; ba/nausoi kai\ q. (opp. dou=loi) Arist.Pol.1278a13. at Athens, members of the fourth class in the constitution of Solon, IG12.45, Arist.Ath.7.3, Th.6.43, Poll.3.82. v. qa/tas. fem. qh=ssa, later Att. qh=tta, h(,
hired servant-girl, opp. e)pi/klhros, Posidipp.35; q. gunh/ A.R.1.193, cf. Ant.Lib.25.3. as Adj.,= qhtikh/, qh=ssa tra/peza
menial fare, E.Alc.2; q. e(sti/a Id.El.205 (lyr.).

qh=sai, aor. 1 inf. Act.,
suckle, Hsch.; elsewh. Med.,
suck; Hom. has pres. inf., a)ll' ai)ei\ pare/xousin e)phetano\n ga/la qh=sqai they give milk
to suck the year round, Od.4.89: aor. 1, qh/sato mazo/n he
sucked the breast, Il.24.58, cf. Call.Jov.48; part., qhsa/menos
having sucked, h.Cer.236; ga/la Call.Sos.vii.4; but,
suckle, *)apo/llwna qh/sato mh/thr h.Ap.123. (I.-E.
dhē- 'suck', cf. qhlh/, qh=lus, Lett.
dēt 'suck', Skt.
dháyati, Goth.
daddjan 'suckle', Lat.
fēlare, filius.）

qhsaur-i/zw,
store, treasure up, e)n a)sfalei/h| ta\ xrh/mata q. Hdt.2.121.a/; q. to\n nekro\n e)n oi)kh/mati
to lay it
by, ib.86; fa/rmaka, si=ta q. par' au(tw=|, X.Cyr.8.2.24, etc.; of fruits,
lay up in store, preserve, pickle, [kaulou\s] e)n a(/lmh| Thphr.HP6.4.10; to\ e)/laion q. [ta\s o)sma/s]
preserves its smell, Id.CP6.19.3:—Pass., r(a\c eu)= teqhsaurisme/nh S.Fr. 398.2; [h( e)be/nh] th\n xro/an ou) -ome/nh lamba/nei th\n eu)/xroun a)ll' eu)qu\s th=| fu/sei Thphr.HP4.4.6, cf. 3.12.5; h( teqhsaurisme/nh tw=n a)rwma/twn a)po/lausis Agatharch.97; to\ qhsaurisqe/n IG14.423 ii 37 (Tauromenium). abs.,
hoard, lay up treasure, Phld.Oec.p.71J., Ep.Jac. 5.3; e(autw=| Ev.Luc.12.21. metaph., q. seautw=| o)rgh/n Ep.Rom. 2.5; q. qhsaurou\s e)n ou)ranw=| Ev.Matt.6.20; q. eu)tuxi/an
lay up a store of . . , App.Sam.4.3:—Med.,
store up for oneself, e(autw=| u(pomnh/mata Pl.Phdr.276d, cf. Isoc.15.229:—Pass., teqhsaurisme/nos kata/ tinos fqo/nos D.S.20.36; xa/ritas -isqhsome/nas Id.1.90;
to be reserved, puri/ 2 Ep.Pet.3.7.

qhsaur-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of the public granary, me/tron PLips.97v7 (iv A.D.). qhsauriko/n, to/,
charge for use of granary, PRyl.213.3 (ii A.D.), al. v. qhsauristiko/s.

qhsau/r-isma, atos, to/,
store, treasure, S.Ph.37, E.El.497, Ion1394, Vett.Val.352.5: metaph., q. kakw=n Democr.149.

qhsaur-iste/on,
one must store up, to\ pleona/zon tou= karpou= Ph.2.57.

qhsaur-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who lays up in store, Poll.3.115.

qhsaur-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
accustomed to lay up in store, [zw=|a] trofh=s qhsauristika/ Arist. HA488a20; prob.l. for qhsauriko/s (=
miserly), Ptol.Tetr.158.

qhsauro-poie/w,
make stores, Poll.3.116.

qhsauro-poio/s, o/n,
laying up in store, Pl.R.554a.

qhsauro/s, o(,
store, treasure, Ar.Av.599, etc.; q. xqono/s, of the silvermines of Laureion, A.Pers.238 (troch.); q. eu(rei=n Arist.Pol.1303b35; a)/nqrakes o( q., prov., 'apples of Sodom', freq. in Luc.Zeux.2, al.; spodo\s oi( q. genh/sontai Alciphr.2.3.13: metaph., q. glw/sshs feidwlh=s Hes.Op.719; q. u(/mnwn Pi.P.6.8; kakw=n E.Ion923, cf. Hp.Lex; ko/mas . . , i(kth/rion q. S.Aj.1175; *dio\s q., of a tomb marking the fall of a thunderbolt, E.Supp.1010; oi)wnoi=s gluku\n q., of a dead body, S.Ant. 30; of learning, q., ou(\s kate/lipon e)n bibli/ois X.Mem.1.6.14; sofi/as q. Pl.Phlb.15e, Ep.Col.2.3; xrhma/twn kai\ timw=n Pl.Mx.247b; kalo\s q. par' a)ndri\ spoudai/w| xa/ris Isoc.1.29; e)k tou= a)gaqou= q. th=s kardi/as Ev.Luc.6.45.
strong-room, magazine, Hdt.2.150, SIG419.17 (Delph., iii B.C.), LXXDe.32.34, etc.; esp. of the
treasuries built at Delphi by Greek cities, SIG8 (vi B.C.), Hdt.1.14, al., X.An.5.3.5, Str.4.1.13, etc.;
vaults of a bank, PLips.62ii 14 (iv A.D.).
granary, PCair.Zen.232.4 (iii B.C.), Wilcken Chr.385.27 (iii B.C.), 192 (i A.D.), etc.; oi( dhmo/sioi q. PRyl.90.9 (iii A.D.), cf. POxy.2119.3 (iii A.D.).
receptacle for valuables,
safe, casket, Hdt.7.190, 9.106, Ev.Matt.2.11; q. bele/essin, of a quiver, A.Pers.1022 (lyr.).
offertory-box (for its form, v. IG9(2).590), IG7.235.23 (Oropus, iv B.C.), 12(3).443 (Thera, iii B.C.), Jahrb.16.162 note 13 (Rhodes, iii B.C.), Schwyzer89 (Argos, iii B.C.), SIG1015.30 (Halic.), PTeb.6.27 (ii B.C.), IG5(1).1390.89 (Andania, i B.C.); spondei=on h)\ q.
coin-in-the-slot machine which sold holy water, Hero Spir.1.21.
cavern, S.Ichn.276;
subterranean dungeon, Plu.Phil.19.

qhsauro-fu^la^ke/w,
lay by, store up, a)rgu/rion Ph.2.215; mnh/mas Id.1.237:—Pass., ib.338.
to be a treasurer, D.S.19.15.

qhsauro-fu^la^kiko/n or qhsauro-fu^la^ki_tiko/n, to/,
tax levied for the protection of granaries, PTeb.68.89,61（
b).317(ii B.C.).

qhsauro-fu^la/kion [a^], to/,
treasury, Artem. 1.74, Them.Or.7.91d.

qhsauro-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
treasurer, LXXEs.5.14, D.S.18.58, Polyaen.4.9.4, Arr.Ind.12.7 (pl.), Vett.Val.85.23.
guard of the state-granaries, PCair.Zen.292.155(iii B.C.), PTeb.90.40 (i B.C.), POxy.522.9(ii A.D.).

qhsaurw/dhs, es,
filled with treasure, ta/foi Philostr.VA7.23.1.

*qhsei=dai, oi(,
sons of Theseus, i.e. Athenians, S.OC1066 (lyr.).
qhseiomu/zwn, sine expl., Ar.Fr.459 (Et.Gen.).

*qhsei=on, to/,
temple of Theseus, a sanctuary (a)/sulon) for criminals and slaves, Ar.Eq.1312,Fr.567:—also *qhse/on, Pherecr.49 (cf. Et.Gen.). *qhsei=a, ta/,
festival of Theseus, Ar.Pl.627:—also *qhse/a, SIG1029.78 (iv B.C.). qhsei=on, to/,
holewort, Corydalis densiflora, Thphr.HP7.12.3, Plin.HN21.107.

*qhseio/triy, i^bos, o(, (tri/bw)
one who is always in the Theseum, i.e.
a runaway slave, Ar.Fr.458.
qhseu/meqa, Dor. fut. Med. of ti/qhmi.
*qhseu/s, o(, gen. *qhse/ws [trisyll., S.Ph.562, OC1593, 1657, but disyll., ib. 1003, 1103]:—Theseus, Il.1.265, etc.: pl. *qhse/es Pl.Tht. 169b; *qhsei=s Alciphr.2.4.

*qhshi/+s, i/+dos, contr. *qhsh/|s, h=dos, fem. of *qh/seios,
of Theseus, xqw/n A.Eu.1026. Subst., Theseid, a poem on Theseus, Arist.Po. 1451a20, D.L.2.59. name of a mode of hair-cutting, used by Theseus, Plu.Thes.5.
qh=sqai, v. qh=sai.
qhsomu/zein, f.l. for qhseiomu/zwn, EM451.52.

qh=ssa, fem. of qh/s (q.v.). = Lat.
tensa, sacred car, Plu.Cor.25.
qh/sw: h(/sw, ai)th/sw (Boeot.), Hsch.; qhso/menoi: ai)tou/menoi, Id.; qhsa/menoi: ai)thsa/menoi (Cret.), Id. (Prob. forms of qe/ssasqai, q.v.)

qh=ta, to/, indecl.,
the letter *q (Hebr.
[tnull ]êth), Ar.Ec.685, etc.: gen. qh/tatos Democr.20: nom. pl. qh/tates (
tetates) Wessely
Schrifttaf. zur ält. lat. Paläogr.No.8 (ii A.D.); nickname of Aesop (who was a qh/s), Ptol. Heph. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.151 B.
qhtala/: qaumasta/, yeu/desin o(/moia, Hsch.

qht-ei/a, h(, (qhteu/w)
hired service, service, S.OT1029, Isoc.14.48: in pl., ib.11.38, D.H.2.19.
servility, sycophancy, c. gen., q. o)/xlwn h)\ dunastw=n Epicur.Sent.Vat.67.
qht-ei=on, to/,= mi/sqwma, *musta/kou q., title of play by Sopatros, Ath.4.175c, al. (qhti/on codd.).

qht-eu/w,
to be a serf or
labourer, *laome/donti . . qhteu/samen ei)s e)niauto/n Il.21.444, cf. Od.18.357; qhteue/men a)/llw|, a)ndri\ par' a)klh/rw| 11.489, cf. E.Alc.6, Cyc.77 (lyr.), Pl.Euthphr.4c, R.359d, Phld.Piet.63; q. e)pi\ misqw=| para/ tini Hdt.8.137; q. ei)s to\ tei=xos
labour at it, Philostr.Her.12a.3; q. *palla/di kai\ *pafi/h|
serve, AP5.292.12 (Paul. Sil.).

qht-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a hireling, menial, e)/rgon Arist.Rh.1367a31; ba/nausos h)\ q. bi/os Id.Pol.1278a21; -wte/ra rgasi/a ib.1341b14; q. kai\ douliko\n pra/ttein ib.1337b21. to\ q.,= oi( qh=tes,
the class of qh=tes, ib.1274a21,al.; q. telei=n pay
on the assessment of a qh/s at Athens, Id.Ath. 7.4, Lex ap.D.43.54; q. te/los Epigr. ap. Arist.Ath.7.4; to\ q. in an army,
servants, camp-followers, etc., Arr.Tact.2.1.
like a qh/s,
servile, pa/ntes oi( ko/lakes q. Arist.EN1125a2, cf. Luc.Fug.12.
qhto/n: bwmo/n, Hsch. qh=tta, h(, v. qh=ssa.

qhtw/nion, to/, (qh/s, w)=nos)
hire, wages, Suid.:—hence qhtwne/w,
receive wages, prob. in IG22.1013.54.

qh=t-qi^, termin. of the locative case, *)ilio/qi pro/ Il.8.561; h)w=qi pro/ 11.50. termin. of several locative Advs. formed from Substs., Adjs., and Prons., a)gro/qi, oi)/koqi, a)/lloqi, etc., cf. A.D.Adv.205.35, al.
qiagw/n, o/nos, o(, an Aetol. sacrificial cake, Nic.Fr.136, Hsch.
qiakxa/: a)/nqh e)n *sikuw=ni, Hsch. qia/llai: qh=mnes, Id. qia/ratos (i.e. *qea/ratos）: eu)kto/s, Id. qia_ro/s, v. qewro/s. qia/sai: xoreu=sai, Id.

qi^a^s-arxe/w,
to be leader of a qi/asos, OGI529.5 (Sebastopolis,ii A.D.).

qi^a^s-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
leader of a qi/asos, Luc.Peregr.11.

qi^a^s-ei/a, h(, Bacchic
revel, Procl.H.1.21.

qi^a^s-eu/w,
initiate into the qi/asos, Epic.Alex.Adesp. 9i2; o(/s me . . ko/rais e)qia/seus' E.Ion552; q. xoroi=s Id.Ba.379 (lyr.):— Pass., -eu/etai yuxa/n ib.75.
celebrate Bacchic rites, Str.12.4.3.

qi^a^s-i/ths [si_], ou, o(,= qiasw/ths, IG12(5).872.60（Tenos), SIG1108 (Callatis), etc.:—fem. qi^a^s-i=tis, idos, h(, Kastriotis *kata/l. perigrafiko/s, *glupta\ tou= *)eqnikou= *mous. （1908) No.1485 (pl., Nicaea, iii/iv A.D.).

qi^a^s-i_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to a qi/asos, xrh/mata SIG1108.9 (Callatis).

qi^/a^s-os (proparox.), o(,
Bacchic revel, rout, Hdt.4.79, E.Ba. 680, Ar.Ra.156, etc.; q. a)/gein E.Ba.115 (lyr.); tou\s . . q. a)/gwn dia\ tw=n o(dw=n tou\s e)stefanwme/nous tw=| mara/qw| kai\ th=| leu/kh| D.18.260, cf. Ath. 5.185c, 8.362e.
religious guild, confraternity, IG2.986,1663,22.1177, SIG1044.45 (Halic.), etc. generally,
company, troop, used by Trag. in lyr., *kentau/rwn E.IA1059; h(li/kwn Id.IT1146; *mousw=n Ar.Th.41; e)no/plios q., of warriors, E.Ph.796; *kentauriko\s kai\ *saturiko/s Pl.Plt.303d; tou= sou= q. of your
company, X.Mem.2.1.31; *)asianw=n a)kroama/twn q. Plu.Ant.24.
feast, banquet, Id.2.301f, Cleom.34.

qi^a^s-w/dhs, es,
festive, a)mfi/poloi *bromi/ou Nonn.D. 45.270. -w/n, w=nos, o(,
meeting-place of a qi/asos, Hsch.

qi^a^s-w/ths, ou, o(,
member of a qi/asos, Ar.Ra.327 (lyr.), Is.9.30, IG22.1237.95; q. kai\ e)ranistai/ Arist.EN1160a19. c. gen., qiasw=tai tou= qeou= tou/tou (sc. *)/erwtos)
worshippers of Love, X.Smp.8.1; *)afrodi/ths oi( q. IG22.1261.23; o( e)mo\s q. my
fellow-reveller, E.Ba.548 (lyr.); oi( e(autou= q.
fellow-members of his q., IG22.1237.73. of Bacchus,
leader of qi/asoi, AP9.524.9. generally,
follower, disciple, Luc.Fug.4; *pla/twnos Them.Or.2.33c.

qi^a^s-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to a qi/asos, Arist.Oec.1346b15, BCH50.233 (Thasos).
qi^a^s-w=tis, idos, h(, fem. of qiasw/ths, Opp.C.4.298.
qi/beis: gunai=ke/s tines, Hsch.

qi=bis or qi/bis, ews, h(,
basket plaited from papyrus, PPetr.3p.145 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen.69 (iii B.C.), PGrenf.1.14.10 (ii B.C.), LXXEx.2.3,6, Suid.: the form qi/bh given by Hsch., Phot., v.l. in Suid., is false: qh=bis (sic) tw=n a)/rtwn, correction of pro/qesis t. a)/., UPZ149.21 (iii B.C.):—Hsch. also gives qi/bwnos (extra ordinem): kibwto/s (Cypr.), and qi/gwnos: kibwtou=. (Hebr.
tēbhāh, from Egypt.
dbet 'box'.)

qibro/s or qimbro/s (v.l. in Nic. Th.35), a/, o/n,
hot, w)ea\ q. xelu/nhs （e(yhqe/nta e)p' a)nqra/kwn Sch., cf. Hsch.), Nic.Al.555, cf. Th.35.
delicate, dainty, luxurious, *ku/pris Call.Fr.267; q. *semi/ramis Euph. 81.—Only in Alex. poets. [i^ in the Spartan pr. n. *qi/brwn, Philosteph. Com.1.]

qiga/na, h(,
cover, lid, dub. in Schwyzer323 C39 (Delph.).

qigga/nw, fut. pros-qi/ch| prob. for -eis E.Heracl.652: 2 fut. teqi/comai Id.Hipp.1086: aor.2 e)/qi^gon Archil.71, E.Ba.304, etc.; Lacon. inf. sigh=n Ar.Lys.1004:—Pass., aor.qixqh=nai S.E.M.9.258:—
touch, handle: abs., mh\ qi/ggane IG12(3).451 (Thera), etc.: usu. c. gen., oi)/akos A.Ag. 663, etc.; xersi\ or xeri\ q. tino/s, Id.Th.44, E.Ba.1318; di' o(si/wn xeirw=n S.OC470: c. acc., xei=ra (s. v.l.) *neobou/lhs qigei=n Archil. l.c.; xersi\ glauka=s e)lai/as qigou=[s' o)/zon] Limen.6 (dub. l.):—Pass.,
to be touched, Arist.HA495a6.
take hold of, tinos S.Aj.1410 (anap.), etc.; q. w)le/naisin te/knou
embrace, E.Ph.300 (lyr.); q. gunaiko/s
have intercourse with . . , Id.Hipp.1044; q. eu)nh=s ib.885, cf. S.OC329: abs., E.El.51; gli/xetai qigei=n kai\ sunei=nai, of man's aspiration after God, Phld.D. 3.1.
touch, attempt, panto\s . . lo/gou kakou= glw/ssh| q. S.Ph.408; mh/ moi leptw=n qi/ggane mu/qwn E.Fr.924; q. ponhri/as Isyll.5; in hostile sense,
attack, qhro/s E.Ba.1183 (lyr.); sw/matos tou= sou= Id.IA1351 (troch.). metaph., of the feelings,
touch, qigga/nei se/qen to/de; Id.Hipp.310; yuxa=s, frenw=n, Id.Alc.108; polla\ q. pro\s h(=par
reach to the heart, A.Ag.432 (lyr.).
touch upon, in speaking or discussion, Arist.Metaph.988a23,al., Pol.1323b38; also of the mind,
apprehend, nou=s . . qigga/nwn kai\ now=n Id.Metaph.1072b21, al.
reach, win, a)gw/nwn Pi.I.1.18, etc. also c. dat., q. h(suxi/a|, a)retai=s, yeu/dei, Id.P.4.296, 8.24, 9.42;
reach, hit, diabolh\ q. tino/s Plu.Alex.10.—Not found in pure Att. Prose (a(/ptomai being used), but used by X.Cyr.1.3.5,al.: aor. 1 inf. qi/cai v.l. for yau=sai in Suid.s.v. qigei=n, qi=cai v.l. for dei=cai in Arist.EN1111a14.

qi/g-hma [i^], atos, to/,
touch, prob. for filh/mata in AP12.209 (Strat.).
qi/g-ma, atos, to/,= foreg., IGRom.4.503.11 (Pergam.). = mi/asma, Hsch.
qi/g-wnos, v. qi=bis.
qidraki/nh, h(,= qridaki/nh, Hsch.
qi/drac, v. qri/dac.
qih/i+on (qi/k- cod.): qei=on to\ o)rukto/n (Cret.), Hsch. qi/hmi: poiw=, and qih=sai: poih=sai, filh=sai, Id. qike/lion: th\n gogguli/da (Lacon.), Id. qi/la: o( qhmw/n, Id.
qimbro/s, a/, o/n, v. qibro/s.
qini/on [qi_], to/, Dim. of qi/s 1.2, dub. in Phld.D.3.7. coined as etym. of a)kroqi/nion, AB367.

qi=nos, Cret. for qe/i+nos,
sacred, Leg.Gort.10.42, SIG526.29(iii B.C.),al.

qi_nw/dhs, es,
like a sandy beach, sandy, Str.8.3.14; q. a)/gkistron an anchor
on the sand, Trag.Adesp.379.

qi/cis, ews, h(,
touching, Hp.Mul.1.40, Arist.GA751a19, Ph.202a7, Gal.15.45, S.E.P.3.56,al.; a)/xri th=s *)eruqra=s qala/sshs kata\ qi/cin as far as the Red Sea,
which it touches, Vett.Val.12.20, cf. 13.19; o( kata\ qi/cin periskuqismo/s a scalp operation in which the edges of the wound were made to touch, Arch.Pap.4.270 (iii A.D.), cf. Archig. ap. Gal.12.577 (where qh=cin). metaph.,
apprehension of the mind, Plot.5.3.10: pl., Procl.in Prm.p.628S.
qi_po/brwtos, v. qripo/brwtos.

qi/s [i_], qi_no/s : o( Il.23.693, Od.12.45, Ar.V.696, Phld. (v. infr.); h( S.Ant.591, Ph.1124, Arist.HA548b6, Call.Fr.126, D.H.3.44:—
heap,
polu\s o)steo/fin qi/s Od.12.45; qi=nes nekrw=n A.Pers.818: metaph., qi\s phma/twn Lyc.812; esp. of
