sand-banks, qi=nes ya/mmou Hdt.3.26; a)/mmou, gh=s, Plu.Fab.6, Art.18; tou\s e)n a)/mmw| qi=nas Phld.Piet.20; e)n tai=s q. Arist.HA548b6, cf. 537a25; qi=nas kai\ ya/mmous Porph.Abst.4.21; of the
sandy deserts of Libya, A.R.4.1384; *nasamw/nwn au)/lia kai\ dolixa\s q. Call.Fr.126. usu. in Hom., etc.,
beach, shore, freq. in oblique cases, para\ qi=na . . qala/sshs Il.1.34, cf. Od.6.236, etc.; para\ qi=n' a(lo\s a)truge/toio Il.1.316, cf. 350, etc.; alone, e)pi\ qini/ Od.7.290; para\ qi=na 9.46; later qi=n' a(lo/s Ar.V.1521 (parod.); po/ntou S.Ph.1124 (lyr.); qala/ssas E.Andr.109 (eleg.); qalatti/a D.H.3.44.
sand-bank, bar at the mouth of a river, Plb.4.41.6: pl.,
banks of a stream, D.S. 1.30.
sand or
mud at the bottom of the sea, oi)=dma . . kuli/ndei busso/qen kelaina\n qi=na S.Ant.591: metaph., w(/s mou to\n qi=na tara/tteis, i.e. trouble
the very bottom of my heart, Ar.V.696, v. Sch.
shore-weed, qi/n' e)n fukio/enti Il.23.693, cf. Arist.HA598a5; qino\s o)/zein ib.620a15. a)/krhs [po/lios] qi/s
the temple that crowns the Acropolis, dub. in Call.
Fr.anon.332.
qi/sbh: soro/s, Suid. qispw=sai: ei)ka/sai, Hsch.
qiw/ths (sc. a)/rtos?), o(, a kind of food (loaf?), PFay.117.10(ii A.D.).

qla^di/-as, ou, o(,
eunuch, LXXLe.22.24, Ph.2.261.

qla^di-a/w,
make one
an eunuch, Hsch. s.v. fladia=n.

qla/sis [a^], ews, h(, （qla/w)
crushing, bruising, Arist.Mete.386a18, Pr.890a2, Thphr.Lass.18, Dsc.2.170 (pl.), S.E.M.6.40.

qla/sma, atos, to/,
bruise, Arist.Mir.841b11, LXXAm.6.12(11), Ph. 2.488, Dsc.2.170; = koi/lwma a)/neu r(h/cews,
dint, Sor.Fract.9.

qla/spis, ews, Ion. ios, h(, (qla/w)
shepherd's purse, Capsella bursapastoris, Hp.Mul.1.78, al.:—also qla/spi, to/, Dsc.2.156, Plin.HN 27.140:—Dim. qlaspi/dion, to/, Ps.-Dsc.2.156.
qla/st-hs, ou, o(,= e)mbruoqla/sths, Hp. ap. Gal.19.104.

qlast-iko/s, h/, o/n,
able to crush, crushing, Arist.Pr.884b35.

qlast-o/s, h/, o/n,
crushed, bruised, e)la/a Ar.Fr.391, Diph.14.5, cf.PSI5.535.52.
capable of being crushed or
compressed, opp. qrausto/s (q.v.), Arist.HA523b7, cf. Mete.386a25.
qla/ttw, late form of sq., f.l. in Gal.UP10.6, cf. Paul.Aeg.6.91 (Pass.).

qla/w, imper. qlh= Herod. (v. infr.); inf. qla=n Gal.UP13.8; part. qlw=sa ib.13.3: 3sg. impf. e)/qla （sugkat-) Machoap.Ath.8.348f: fut. qla/sw [a^] （e)n-) Hp.Int.44: aor. e)/qla^sa, Ep. qla/ssa (v. infr.):—Pass., fut. qlasqh/somai Gal.UP12.15: aor. e)qla/sqhn Hp.Ulc.6: pf. te/qlasmai （sun-) Alex.270, Ph.1.609, Theoc.22.45:—
crush, bruise, qla/sse de/ oi( kotu/lhn Il.5.307; o)ste/a d' ei)/sw e)/qlasen Od.18.97; ou)/t' e)/rrhce balw\n ou)/t' e)/qlase Hes.Sc.140; [fwnh\n] w(/sper qlw=san [th\n a)koh/n] S.E.M.6.40: sens. obsc., au)to\s ta\ sautou= qlh= Herod.2.83:—Pass., Arist.Pr.890a3, Herod.3.44; teqlasme/nos ou)/ata pugmai=s Theoc. l.c.; r(a/bdos -me/nh LXX 4 Ki.18.21.
overload(?), ta\s a(/lws PFay.112.20 (i A.D.). metaph.,
oppress, LXXJd.10.8,al. (Cf. fla/w.)

qli^b-ero/s, a/, o/n, (qli/bw)
chafing, rubbing, Paul.Aeg.6.106.
oppressive, Just.Nov.135.1.

qli^b-h/, h(,
a rubbing, Gal.18(2).923.
qli^b-i/as, ou, o(,= qladi/as, Str.13.4.1.

qli^/b-w [i_], Ar.Pax1239, etc.: fut. qli/yw （a)po-) E.Cyc.237: aor. e)/qliya Pl.Ti.60c, Call.Del.35: pf. te/qli^fa Crobyl.4 (cj.), Plb.18.24.3:—Med., fut. qli/yomai (v. infr.):—Pass., fut. qli^bh/somai v.l. in Sor.1.33: aor. 1 e)qli/fqhn Pl.Ti.91a, Arist.Pr. 925b20: aor. 2 part. qli^bei/s ib.13, v.l. in Dsc.3.7 (cf. subj. e)kfli^bh=| Hp. Loc.Hom.9): pf. te/qlimmai Arist.Pr.925b14, AP7.472.5 (Leon.):—
squeeze, chafe, qli/bei to\n o)/rron [o( qw/rac] Ar.Pax1239, cf. Lys.314; tou\s o)/feis qli/bwn D.18.260; o(/pou me qli/bei where [the shoe]
pinches, Plu.2.141a: metaph., dou/lhs w)=ta nwqri/h qli/bei Herod.4.53: abs.,
exercise pressure, Plot.3.6.6:—Pass., of a person heavy-laden, w(s qli/bomai! Ar.Ra.5, cf. V.1289:—Med., pollh=|s flih=|si parasta\s qli/yetai (v.l. fli/yetai） w)/mous he
will rub his shoulders against many doorposts, of a beggar, Od.17.221: xei/lea qli/bein, of kissing, Theoc.20.4.
compress, straiten, Pl.Ti.60c;
reduce, compress, ei)s to\ mh\ o)\n ta\ o)/nta qli/bontes Epicur.Ep.1p.16U.:—Pass.,
to be compressed, Pl.Ti.91a; w(/ste e)cwqei=sqai to\ h(=sson qlibo/menon u(po\ tou= ma=llon qlibome/nou Archim. Fluit.1 Prooem.; qlibome/na kalu/ba
a small, close hut, Theoc. 21.18; o(do\s teqlimme/nh, opp. eu)ru/xwros, Ev.Matt.7.14; bi/os teql. a
scanty subsistence, D.H.8.73, cf.AP7.472.5 (Leon.). metaph.,
oppress, afflict, distress, a)na/gkh e)/qliye/ tina Call.Del.35; q. kai\ lumai/nesqai to\ maka/rion Arist.EN1100b28; q. ta\s po/leis toi=s o)ywni/ois SIG 700.25 (Macedonia, ii B.C.);
press hard in battle, Plb.18.24.3:— Pass., q. dia\ to\n po/lemon Arist.Pol.1307a1; u(po/ tinwn SIG685.39 (ii B.C.); u(po\ th=s a)doci/as Phld.Lib.p.61 O.—Once in Hom., never in Trag.

qli^b-w/dhs, es,
oppressive, Aq.Ge.32.7(8).
qlimmo/s, o(,= qli=yis, LXXEx.3.9.

qliptiko/s, h/, o/n,
due to pressure, pa/qhma Gal.8.949. Adv. -kw=s
by pressure, S.E.M.10.83.

qli=yis, ews, h(,
pressure, Arist.Mete.382a13, Pr.890a2; tw=n nefw=n Epicur.Ep.2 P.49 U.; a)nte/reisis kai\ q. Str.1.3.6; of the pulse, Ruf. ap.Orib.8.24.61, cf. Gal.7.306; q. stoma/xou Orib.Fr.42; u(sterikai\ q. Sor.1.42.
crushing, castration, pw/lwn Hippiatr.20. metaph.,
oppression, affliction, LXXGe.35.3, al., BGU1139.4 (i B.C.), Act.Ap.14.22 (pl.), al., Vett.Val.71.16 (pl.), POxy.939.13 (iv A.D.).
qna/|skw, qna_to/s, Dor. for qnh/|skw, qnhto/s.

qnhs-ei/dion, to/,
carcase of an animal, e)sqi/ein kene/breio/n te kai\ q. Ael. NA6.2 (qn. preferred to k. by Phryn.PS p.75 B.); e)sqh=ta a)po\ qnhseidi/wn forei=n Philostr.VA8.7.4; a(/yasqai qnhseidi/wn Porph.Abst.4.16, cf. D.L.8.33:—Aeol. qna_si/dion Schwyzer633.14 (Eresus, ii/i B.C.).
qnhs-i^mai=os, a, on, neut. as Subst. qnhs-ai=on, to/,= foreg., LXX 3 Ki.13.25, al.; tw=n q. ou)x a(/yesqe ib.Le.11.8, cf. Hierocl.in CA26p.480M.

qnh=sis, ews, h(,
mortality, in a plague, Ruf.Fr.69; pollh\ q. ge/gone Stud.Pal.22.338 (i A.D.); nhpi/wn Cat.Cod.Astr.7.126.

qnh/|skw (with i IG2.2477.7, 10,2494, *)arx.*)ef.1910.73; qnei/sk- IG 2.4040b; [a)poqn]h/iskein Pl.Phdr. in PPetr.1p.18 (iii B.C.), but qnh/skw Did. ap. EM452.29, freq. in codd.), Aeol. qnai/skw Hdn.Gr.2.79, Dor. qna/|skw Sammelb.6754.22 (iii B.C.): fut. qa^nou=mai Simon.85.9, S.Ant. 462, etc.; Ep. inf. -e/esqai Il.4.12; later qnh/comai AP9.354 (Leon.), Polyaen.5.2.22 codd.: aor. 2 e)/qa^non, Ep. qa/non Od.11.412, al.; inf. Ep. and Ion. qane/ein, as always in Hom., exc. Il.7.52, qane/men Pi.P.4.72: pf. te/qnhka Il.18.12, etc.; subj. teqnh/kw Th.8.74: plpf. e)teqnh/kein Antipho 5.70, Lys.19.48; 3pl. -h/kesan And.1.52: short forms of pf., 3dual te/qna^ton X.An.4.1.19, 1pl. te/qna^men Pl.Grg.493a, 3pl. teqna=si Il.22.52, etc.; 3pl. plpf. e)te/qna^san Antipho 5.70, And.1.59, X.HG6.4.16; imper. te/qna^qi Il.22.365, teqna/tw 15.496, IG12.10, Pl. Lg.933e, etc.; opt. teqnai/hn Il.18.98, etc.; inf. teqna/nai [a^] Semon. 3, Hdt.1.31, Ar.Ra.1012, Pl.Com.68, Th.8.92, etc., teqna=nai dub.l. in Mimn.2.10, A.Ag.539; Ep. teqna/menai, -a/men, Il.24.225, 15.497, etc.; Aeol. teqna/khn Sapph.2.15; part. teqnew/s Hdt.9.120, Ar.Av. 476, etc., fem. teqnew=sa Lys.31.22, D.40.27 (teqnhkui=a Hippon.29, E. Or.109), neut. teqneo/s Hdt.1.112, Hp.Nat.Mul.32 (teqnhko/s Pl.Phd. 71d, pl. teqnew=ta 72c); gen. teqnew=tos, etc., Hdt.5.68, etc. (once in Hom., dat. teqnew=ti Od.19.331); poet. teqneo/tos Archel. ap. Antig. Mir.89, Q.S.7.65; Dor. teqna^o/ta Pi.N.10.74; Ep. teqnhw/s (v.l. -eiw/s) Il.17.161, -hui=a Od.4.734, (kata-) 11.141; gen. teqnhw=tos Il.9.633, etc.; also teqnho/tos 17.435, Od.15.23, al. [teqnew=ti is trisyll. Od.19.331, teqnew/twn E.Supp.272 (hex.): disyll. forms are written in later Gr., nom. teqnw/s BCH18.438 (Argilus); gen. sg. teqnw=tos SIG799.13 (Cyzicus, i A.D.); dat. sg. teqnw=ti
Papers of the Amer. School 3.334 (Pisid.); fem. teqnw/sh| (and gen. pl. teqnh/twn) Ath.Mitt. 50.134（Macedonia); acc. pl. fem. teqnw/sas Babr.45.9]: from te/qnhka arose fut. teqnh/cw Ar.Ach.325, A.Ag.1279 (censured as archaic by Luc.Sol.7), later teqnh/comai Diogenian.Epicur.1.28, 3.52, Luc.Pisc. 10, Ael.NA2.46; part. teqnhco/menos Lib.Ep.438.7.—The simple Verb is regularly used in early Prose in pf. and plpf.; for pres., fut., and aor. the compd. a)poqnh/|skw is substituted: qnh/|skei v.l. in Hp. Mul.1.9, sa/rkes qnh/|skousi Art.69, e)/qnh|skon Th.2.47, al., qnh|sko/ntwn ib.53, qnh/|skoi Pl.Phd.72d, qnh/|skomen Epicur.Ep.1p.20U.: aor. part. qanw/n, subj. qa/nh|, IG12(5).593.2,20,23 (Iulis, v B.C.), Berl.Sitzb. 1927.166 (Cyrene), Phld.Herc.1649.4: aor. inf. qanei=n ib.1418.13:—in pres. and impf.,
die, as well of natural as of violent death; in aor. and pf.,
to be dead (cf. ti/ tou\s qano(/ntas ou)k e)a=|s teqnhke/nai; Eup.12.3 D.; te/qnhk' e)/gwge pri\n qanei=n kakw=n u(/po E.Hec.431), qanei=n kai\ po/tmon e)pispei=n Il.7.52, etc.; zwo\s h)e\ qanw/n alive or
dead, Od.4.553, cf. 15.350; h)= h)/dh te/qnhke 4.834; w(s a)/meinon ei)/h teqna/nai ma=llon h)\ zw/ein Hdt.1.31, cf. 7.46; teqna/nai krei=tton h)/ . . D.9.65, cf. 10.25; a)/cios teqna/nai Ar.Ra. 1012, etc.; teqna/tw
let him
be put to death, IG12.10.29; a)/timos teq. Lex ap.D.9.44: freq. in part., ne/kuos pe/ri teqnhw=tos Il.18.173; nekro\n . . teqnhw=ta a
dead corpse, Od.12.10; oi( teqnhko/tes, oi( qano/ntes,
the dead, E.Hec.278, Eup. l.c., etc.; ou)/te teqnew=ta ou)/te zw=nta Hdt.4.14; oi)/xetai qanw/n (v. oi)/xomai）; qanw\n frou=dos (v. frou=dos）; qano/nti sunqanei=n S.Tr.798,Fr.953, cf. E.Supp.1007(lyr.); o( qanw/n, opp. o( ktanw/n, S. Ph.336: pres. with pf. sense, qnh/|skousi ga/r, for teqnh/kasi, Id.OT 118, cf. E.Hec.695 (lyr.),Ba.1041 (lyr.), etc. used like a pass. Verb, xersi\n u(p' *ai)/antos qane/ein
to fall by his hand, Il.15.289; q. u(po/ tinos Pl.Ep.329c, Arist.HA625a16; e)/k tinos Pi.P.4.72, S.OT1454; pro/s tinos ib.292, E.Hec.773; qeoi=s te/qnhke S.Aj.970: freq. c. dat. instrumenti, q. xeri/, dori/, Id.OC1388, A.Th.959(lyr.); farma/koisi E. Fk.464; also e)n bro/xw| A.Ch.558; teqna/nai tw=| de/ei, t. tw=| fo/bw|, c. acc.,
to be in mortal fear of, D.4.45, 19.81, cf. Arr.An.7.9.4; prooi/mion skoteino\n kai\ teqnhko\s deili/a| Aeschin.2.34; q. e)pi/ tini
to die leaving one as heir, Luc.DMort.7.1. metaph., of things,
perish, qna/|skei sigaqe\n kalo\n e)/rgon Pi.Fr.121; e)slw=n u(po\ xarma/twn ph=ma qna/|skei . . damasqe/n Id.O.2.19; lo/goi qnh/|skontes ma/thn A.Ch.846; q. pi/stis S. OC611; to\ tru/blion te/qnhke/ moi Ar.Ra.986 (lyr.): in Prose, te/qnhke to\ tou\s a)dikou=ntas misei=n D.19.289; teqnhko/s ti fqe/gcasqai D.C.40.54; teqnhko\s o(ra=n Callistr.Stat.14; to\ teqnhko\s o( li/qos u(pedu/eto ib.2.
qnhta/dios, sine expl., Hdn.Gr.2.924: qnhti/dia,= nekrimai=a, Hsch. (qnit- cod.).

qnhto-ga^mi/a, h(,
marriage with a mortal, Eust.20.17.

qnhto-genh/s, Dor. qna_t-, e/s,
of mortal race, S.Ant.835 (anap.), E.HF799(lyr.).

qnhto-eidh/s, e/s,
of mortal nature, Pl.Phd.86a, Plu.2.1002c, Jul.Or.6.184a, etc.

qnhto/s, h/, o/n, also o/s, o/n E.Ion973,IA901, 1396: Dor. qna_to/s (v. infr.): Aeol. qna=tos Sapph.Supp.13.7: (qnh/|skw):—
liable to death, mortal, opp. a)qa/natos, freq. in Hom., Od.5.213, al.; q. a)/ndres Hes. Th.967; ou)de\n . . qnhto\n e)o/n Hdt.8.98; zw=|a pa/nta q. kai\ futa/ Pl.Sph. 265c: as Subst., qnhtoi/
mortals, Od.19.593, etc.; qnhtai/
mortal women, 5.213; pa/ntwn tw=n q. of all
mortal creatures, Hdt.1.216, 2.68; ei)/ tis fqo/ggos （fqo/ggon cod., but q. is only used of living persons) ei)sakou/etai qnhtw=n par' *(/aidh| E.HF491: Comp., e)n qnhtw=| o)/ntes, e)/ti qnhtote/rous e(autou\s poiou=ntes Porph.Abst.4.20: Sup., qnhto/tatos pa/ntwn Plot.5.1.1. of things,
befitting mortals, human, e)/rgmata E.Ba. 1069; qnata\ qnatoi=si pre/pei Pi.I.5(4).16; qnata\ xrh\ to\n qnato\n . . fronei=n Epich.[263], cf. S.Tr.473; to\ daimo/nion metacu/ e)sti qeou= te kai\ qnhtou= Pl.Smp.202e.

qnhto/ths, htos, h(,
mortality, Diog.Oen.36, Phlp.in APo.400.28.

qnhto/yu_xos, on,
maintaining the mortality of the soul, Tz.H.8.222.

qoa/zw (A), (qoo/s (A)) trans.,
move quickly, ply rapidly, pte/rugas E.
IT1142 (lyr.); ti/s o(/d' a)gw/n . . qoa/zwn se; what task is thus
hurrying thee
on? Id.Or.335; qoa/zw *bromi/w| po/non h(du/n
urge it
on, Id.Ba.65; q. si=ta ge/nusi
dispatch it
quickly, Id.HF382 (lyr.). intr.,
move quickly, rush, dart, qoa/zwn ai)qe/ros a)/nw kapno/s Id.Or.1542; e)n de\ daski/ois o)/resi q. Id.Ba.219; q. dro/mw| Id.Tr.307; kh=tos qoa/zon e)c *)atlantikh=s a(lo/s Id.Fr.145. (Cf. qe/w, qoo/s (A).)

qoa/zw (B), = qa/assw,
sit, sofi/hs e)p' a)/kroisi Emp.4.8; u(p' a)rxa=s ou)/tinos qoa/zwn [*zeu\s] kratu/nei A.Supp.595; ti/nas poq' e(/dras ta/sde moi qoa/zete; why
are ye in this
suppliant posture? S.OT2, cf. Plu.2.22e. (Cf. e)piqoa/zw, qo/wkos, qw=kos; v. qa/ssw.)
qoa/zw (C), v. qw|a/zw.
qo/acos: *)apo/llwn, Hsch.

qoa/s, a/dos, h(, fem. Adj.
fleet, swift, prob. in Pi.Fr.107.7.

qo/asma, atos, to/,
a place for dancing, etc., Orph.H.49.6.
qodra/kion, v. qro/dac.

qoh|ro/s: tetaragme/nos (i.e. qolero/s), Hsch., EM453.20. qoia/, h(,
pair of mules, Hsch., Theognost.Can.20. qoi/hbos, o(,= qau=ma, Cyr.; cf. qh=bos.
qoin-a/zw, rare form for qoina/w, X.Ages.8.7, Ael.Fr.267.

qoi/n-a_ma, atos, to/,
meal, feast, E.Or.814, Ion1495 (both lyr.), Posidon.12 J.

qoin-armo/stria, h(,
mistress of the banquet, cult-title, esp. in the worship of Demeter and Kore, in Laconia and Messenia, IG5(1).584, 1498, etc.: spelt qun- ib.583, seinarmo/strha ib.229.

qoin-a_th/r, h=ros, o(,
one who gives a feast, xalepo\s q.
lord of a horrid
feast, A.Ag. 1502 (anap.).
qoin-a_th/rion, to/, = qoi/nh, E.Rh.515.

qoin-a_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a feast, X.Oec.9.7 (v.l. -htiko/s).

qoin-a/twr [a_], oros, o(,
feaster, E.Ion1206, 1217.

qoin-a/w,
feast on, eat, delfi=nes e)qoi/nwn i)xqu=s dub.l. in Hes.Sc.212. Pass.,
to be feasted upon, i.e.
sacrificed, u(=s te/leos qoinh=tai IG12(1).905 (Rhodes).
feast, entertain, fi/lous E.Ion982; to\ dei=pnon, to/ min e)kei=nos sarci\ tou= paido\s e)qoi/nhse (v.l. -ise) the feast, which he
gave him
upon his son's flesh, Hdt.1.129. more freq. in Med. and Pass., fut. -a/somai E.El.836, Cyc.550, -h/somai （e)k-) A.Pr.1025 codd.: aor. 1 e)qoinh/qhn (v. infr.): aor. 1 Med. -hsa/mhn Nonn.D.5.331, AP9.244 (Apollonid.): pf. teqoi/na_mai E.Cyc.377 (prob.). abs.,
to be feasted, feast, banquet, once in Hom., e)s d' au)tou\s prote/rw a)/ge qoinhqh=nai lead them in
to feast, Od.4.36; para\ klai/ousi qoina=sqai E.Alc.542: q. kalw=s Cratin.164. c. acc.,
feast on, mw=n teqoi/natai e(tai/rous; E.Cyc.377; se\ u(/steron qoina/somai ib.550; q. ta\ zw=|a Porph.Abst.2.2: c. acc. cogn., q. pasth/ria E.El.836: c. gen., a(/lis leo/ntwn e)sti/ moi qoinwme/nw| Id.Cyc.248; qoinh/sato qh/rhs AP9.244 (Apollonid.); of an
eating sore, sa/rka qoina=tai podo/s E.Fr.792, cf. Arist.Po.1458b24:

qoi/n-h, Dor. qoi/na (later qoi=na LXX Wi.12.6, perh. to be read in Epich.148.1), h(,
meal, feast, Hes.Sc.114, Hdt.1.119, 9.82, A.Fr.350.7, etc.: in pl., Id.Pr.530 (lyr.), B.Fr.18; ta\s q. ka\t ta\n w(/ran a)pa/gesqai Michel995D50; qoi/nh|s de\ kai\ ei)lapi/nh|si Thgn. 239; e)k qoi/nas after
dinner, Epich.148.2; ei)s q. kalei=n tina E.Ion 1140; e)pi\ qoi/nhn i)e/nai Pl.Phdr.247a; parakalei=n e)pi\ th\n q. Arist.Fr. 549; skeuazome/nhs q. Pl.Tht.178d, cf. Arist.Pol.1282a22; trape/zas i(era\s prepou/shs q. gemi/zwn OGI383.146 (Commagene, i B.C.); e)n q. le/gein tina/ to count as a guest, and generally to take into account, Pl.Lg.649a: metaph., Id.Sph.251b, Phdr.236e, X.Cyr.4.2.39.
food, ptanoi=s E.Ion 504, cf. Tim.Pers.150; q. pantodaph/ Parth.12.2.
feeding upon, c. gen., tw=n sarkw=n Porph.Abst.2.47. (Cf. qw=sqai.)
qoin-h/twr, oros, o(, = qoina/twr, AP7.241 (Antip.Sid.).
qoin-i/zw, v.l. for qoina/w (q. v.).

qoinodote/w,
entertain at a banquet, Supp.Epigr.3.774 (Crete, i B.C./ i A.D.).
qoi=to, for qei=to, 3 opt. aor. 2 Med. of ti/qhmi.
qolerei=n: taraxi/zesqai, Hsch.

qoler-o/s, a/, o/n, (qolo/s)
muddy, foul, turbid, opp. kaqaro/s or lampro/s, prop. of troubled water, Hdt.4.53, Hp.
Aër.8, Th.2.102; q. kai\ phlw/dhs Pl.Phd.113b: metaph., lampro\n de\ qolerw=| dw=ma summei/cas E. Supp.222; q. ou)=ra Hp.Epid.1.7; a)h/r Pl.Ti.58d (Sup. -w/tatos）; ai(=ma Arist.Somn.Vig.458a14 (Sup.); xumoi/ Thphr.CP6.3.4 (Comp.); nefe/lai AP9.277 (Antiphil.): xrw/s Ael.NA14.9; pli/nqos Theoc.16.62; du/smorfon h( u(=s kai\ qolero/n Plu.2.670a. q. pneu=ma dub. l. in Hp. Prorrh.1.39 (v. qalero/s). metaph.,
troubled by passion or
madness, qoleroi\ lo/goi
troubled words of passion (compared to a torrent), A.Pr.885 (anap.); qolerw=| xeimw=ni nosh/sas with
turbid storm of madness, S.Aj.206 (anap.); qolerw=| kuno/donti with
passionate tooth, Nic.Th.130 codd. (qalerw=| cj. Schneider). Adv. -rw=s dub. in Com.Adesp.865.

qoler-o/ths, htos, h(,
turbidity, Hp.Epid.2.3.11.
qolero/fron: me/ga, Hsch.
qolerw/dhs, es, dub. l. for qolw/dhs, Thphr.Ign.24.

qoli/a (Lacon. sali/a Hsch.), h(, (qo/los)
conical hat with broad brim, or perh.
parasol, Theoc.15.39.
chest with conical lid, Poll.10.138; cf. qaliopoioi/.

qoliko/s, h/, o/n,
with a dome, stoa/ Suid. s.v. *damiano/s.

qolo-eidh/s, e/s,
like a qo/los, Callix.1, Str.4.4.3; of the Roman Pantheon, D.C.53.27. Adv. -dw=s, koilanqei=sa Dsc.4.153, cf. D.L. 2.9.
like a qoli/a, cj. Scal. for qhloeidh= in Thphr.HP3.9.6 (fort. qolioeidh/s).

qolo-mi^gh/s, e/s,
mixed with dirt, Onat. ap. Stob.1.1.39.

qo/los, h(,
round building with conical roof, rotunda, Od.22.442, al., cf. Hsch. at Athens,
the Rotunda, in which the Prytaneis, etc., dined, Pl.Ap.32c, And.1.45, D.19.249, Arist.Ath.43.3, Alexand. Com.9, Paus.1.5.1; a similar building at Epidaurus, Id.2.27.3; at Magnesia on Maeander, SIG589.43 (ii B.C.). qo/los, o(, in public baths,
vaulted vapour-bath, PMagd.33.3 (iii B.C.), Asclep.Myrl. ap.Ath.11.501d, Alciphr.1.23, POxy.2145.6 (ii A.D.), PMag.Osl.1. 75.
bandage for the head, invented by Diocles, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.25 tit.

qol-o/s (A), o(,
mud, dirt, esp. in water, Arist.Fr.311.
menses, Orph.L.490.
ink of the cuttle-fish, Hp.Morb.2.73, Arist. HA524a13, al. (v.l. qoro/n in 544a4).
the vessel in which this ink is retained, Id.PA679a1, 681b26.—On the accent, v. Hdn.Gr.1.154.
qol-o/s (B), h/, o/n, = qolero/s, Ath.10.420d, Olymp.in Mete.127.13, cf. Hsch.

qol-o/w,
make turbid, prop. of water, q. a(/panta, of the cuttle-fish, Antiph.26.2; of fishermen, Arist.Fr.311:—Pass., teqolwme/na u(/data Hp.
Aër.7; teq. a)h/r Philyll.20. metaph., qoloi= de\ kardi/an E.Alc.1067; teqolwme/nos
confounded by joy, Pherecr.115; qolou=sqai/ ti tw=n spla/gxnwn Philostr.VA8.7; ge/nos . . teqolwme/non geito/nhma Procop.Goth.4.19.
soak, spo/ggois dia\ yuxrou= u(/datos . . teqolwme/nois Orib.8.6.36.

qol-w/dhs, es,
muddy, turbid, of water, Hp.
Aër.8 (Sup. -e/statos）; e)n toi=s a)mmw/desi h)\ qolw/desi Arist.HA 620b16; also q. kapno/s Vett.Val.345.21; pu=r lamb.Myst.2.4.

qo/l-wsis, ews, h(,
making turbid, troubling, esp. of water, Arist.PA679a7; also a)e/ros Gal.16.609.

qolwto/s, h/, o/n,
built like a qo/los, tei=xos Procop.Aed.4.11.
qonani/a: o)cei=a, Hsch. (fort. qoh\ a)ni/a).

qoo/s (A), h/, o/n, (qe/w) poet. Adj.
quick, nimble, epith. of Ares and warriors, Il.5.430, 571, 16.422, 494, etc.: c. inf., q. ma/xesqai 5.536; of things, xei/r 12.306; be/los Od.22.83; a(/rma Il.17.458; ma/stic ib. 430; nh=es 14.410, etc.; nhusi\ qoh=|si . . pepoiqo/tes w)kei/h|si Od.7.34; nu/c
swift night, Il.10.394, Od.12.284, Hes.Th.481; qoh\n a)legu/nete dai=ta partake of a
hasty meal, i.e.
in haste, Od.8.38; later, of animals, Pi.P.4.17, E.Ba.977 (lyr.); also ma/xai Pi.P.8.26; glw=ssa Id.N.7.72; qoa\ ba/cis A.Ag.476 (lyr.); q. ei)resi/as zugo/n S.Aj.249 (lyr.), cf. Orph.A.1037; pte/ruc E.Ion123 (lyr.), cf. A.Pr.129 (lyr.); sa/kos A.R.1.743; a)spi/das . . qoo\n e)/xma bola/wn Id.4.201; pnoai/, au)=rai, E. Andr.479 (lyr.), Tr.454 (troch.): used adverbially with Verbs of motion, e)kprolipou=sa qoo\n do/mon
quickly, in haste, Antim.71 (expld. by An.Ox. from ti/qhmi）; qoa\n nu/mfan a)/gages S.Tr.857 (lyr.). Adv. -w=s
quickly, in haste, Il.3.325, B.14.59, A.Pr.1060 (anap.), Pers.398, Hp.Mul.2.132; qow/teron A.R.3.1406;
soon, Od.15.216.

qoo/s (B), h/, o/n,
pointed, sharp, nh=soi, name of certain of the Echinades (acc. to Str.8.3.26), Od.15.299; so later q. go/mfoi, o)do/ntes, pele/keis, A.R.2.79, 3.1281, 4.1683; ci/fos AP9.157; cf. sq.

qoo/w, (qoo/s B)
make sharp or
pointed, Od.9.327; teqowme/nos Nic. Th.228. metaph., in Pass., e)n puri\ fwnh\n teqowme/nos Hermesian. 7.11; lu/ssh| teqowme/nos Opp.H.1.557, 2.525.

qorai=os, a, on, (qoro/s)
containing the semen, phri/n Nic.Th.586; o( qorai=os, epith. of Apollo as
god of growth and increase, Lyc.352.
qora/nas: to\ e)/cw (Paph.), Hsch.
*qora/ths, o(, title of Apollo in Laconia, Hsch. (-tis cod.).
qo/re, qorei=n, v. qrw/|skw.
qorh/, h(, = qoro/s, Hdt.3.101, Alcmaeon Fr.3D.

*qori^ko/nde, Adv.
to Thoricus, h.Cer.126.

qoriko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the semen, po/roi q.
ductus seminales, Arist. GA720b13, al.; [ta\] qorika/
partes seminales, ib.755b20; trofh\ q. Ruf. Sat.Gon.12.
qorineu=sai: o( cifi/as i)xqu/s, Hsch.

qori/skomai, Pass.,
receive semen, dia\ tw=n w)/twn Ant.Lib.29.3.

qo/risma, atos, to/,
bait for fish, Hsch. qo/rnac: u(popo/dion (Cypr.), Id. (metath. of *qro/nac).
qo/rnumai, = qrw/|skw 11, [S.]Fr.1127.9, Nic.Th.130: 3pl. subj., e)pea\n qornu/wntai Hdt.3.109.

qoro/-eis, essa, en,
in embryo, bre/fos q. Opp.C.3.522.
qoro-poio/s, o/n, gloss on qou=ris, EM453.51 (v.l. fqoro-, quro-).

qoro/s, o(,
semen genitale, Hdt.2.93, Hp.Morb.2.51, Arist.HA509b20, Plu.2.637f, Porph.Abst.4.9. qoro/s: a)frodisiasth/s, Hsch.
qo/rrac, v. qw/rac.

qoru^b-a/zomai, Pass.,
to be troubled, Ev.Luc.10.41 (v.l. turba/zh|): Act. in Gramm., Dosith.p.432 K., EM633.34.

qoru^b-e/w,
make a noise, uproar or
disturbance, esp. of crowds, assemblies, etc., Hp.Ep.12, Ar. Eq.666, V.622, etc.; ble/pwn ei)s to\n a)ei\ qorubou=nta to/pon th=s e)kklhsi/as D.21.194.
shout in token of approbation or
the contrary:
cheer, applaud, Isoc.12.264, Pl.Euthd.303b:—Pass., lo/gos teqorubhme/nos a
loudly cheered speech, Isoc.12.233, cf. Arist.Rh.1356b23. more freq.
raise clamour, kai/ moi mh\ qorubh/shte pray
do not
interrupt, Pl.Ap.20e, cf. D.5.15; q. e)f' oi(=s a)\n le/gw Pl.Ap.30c; o( qorubw=n, opp. o( qe/lwn le/gein kai\ a)kou/ein, And.4.7:—Pass.,
have clamours raised against one, u(po\ toiou/twn a)ndrw=n qorubh=| S.Aj.164 (anap.). trans.,
confuse by noise or
tumult, bewilder, Pl.Phdr.245b, Prt.319c, al.;
throw [troops]
into confusion, in battle, Th.3.78; q. pro/s tinas
cause excitement amongst . . , Id.6.61:—Pass.,
to be thrown into disorder, confused, Hdt.3.78, 4.130, Th.4.129, 8.50, Pl Ep.348e, etc.; u(po\ tw=n legome/nwn Id.Ly.210e; tini at a thing, D.18.35; e)pi/ tini Bato 7.2; peri/ ti Th.6.61; pro/s ti Plu.Cam.29.
qoru^/b-hqron, to/, = leontope/talon, Ps.-Dsc.3.96.

qoru^b-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
uproarious, turbulent, Ar. Eq.1380.

qoru^bopoi-e/w,
make an uproar, Cic.Fam.16.23.2, D.S.13.111, App.BC2.74.

qoru^bopoi-o/s, o/n,
making an uproar, turbulent, plh=qos Plu. Mar.28.

qo/ru^b-os, o(,
noise, esp.
the confused noise of a crowded assembly, uproar, clamour, Pi.O.10(11).72, Th.8.92, etc.; qo/rubos boh=s a confused clamour, S.Ph.1263; q. stratiwtw=n Ar.Ach.546; q. *pukni/ths Com.Adesp.45D.; q. pare/xein e)n tai=s boulai=s kai\ e)n tai=s e)kklhsi/ais OGI48.9 (Ptolemais, iii B.C.); less freq. of an individual, E.Or.905;
of animals, qo/rubon d' ou)k e)fi/lhsan o)/nwn Call.Aet.Oxy.2079.30. esp. in token of approbation or the contrary, Pl.R.492b, 492c:
applause, q. *lhnai/+ths Ar.Eq.547; q. kai\ e)/painos Pl.Prt.339d, D.19.195; qo/rubon kai\ kro/ton e)poih/sate Id.21.14.
groans, murmurs, And.2.15; mega/loi qo/ruboi kat e/xous' h(ma=s great
murmurs are abroad among us, S.Aj.142(anap.).
tumult, confusion, q. parasxei=n tini Hdt.7.181; e)s q. a)pike/sqai, katasth=nai, Id.8.56, Th.4.104; e)ge/neto o( q. me/gas, in a battle, ib.14; kraugh\ kai\ q. Phld.Hom.p.22 O.: pl., q. o)xlw/deis kai\ paroini/ai Men.Mon.239.
confusion of mind, qoru/bous e)nqumhmatikou\s kai\ a)pofqegmatikou\s paraskeua/zein Epicur. Nat.14.9; o( para\ kaka\s do/cas q. Phld.Rh.2.31 S., cf. 40S. c. inf., e)s qo/rubon h)/luqon . . leusqh=nai I ran a
risk of being stoned, E. IA1349 (troch.). (Perh. cogn. with tonqoru/zw.)

qoru^b-w/dhs, es,
uproarious, turbulent, Pl.Lg.671a;
clamorous, -w=des fqe/ggesqai Arist. HA632b18; qorubw/dea e)nupnia/zesqai Hp.VM10. Adv. -dw=s Poll. 5.123, Iamb.Myst.3.25 (prob.): Comp. -e/steron, diati/qentai Plu.2.656f.
causing alarm, tw=| i(/ppw| q. mhde\n prosfe/rein X.Eq.9.15.
confusing, do/cai Demetr.Lac.Herc.1696.4.
qorw/dhs, es,= qorai=os, Gal.4.556, al.
qou=, aor. 2 imper. Med. of ti/qhmi.

qour-ai=os, a, on,= qou=ros,
violent, lustful, Hsch.:—fem. qoura/s, a/dos, Nic.Th.131, Lyc.612.

qour-a/w,
rush or
leap upon, c. acc., Id.85:—also qouriw=n: e)nergw=n, Hsch.
qour-h/eis, essa, en,= qourai=os, Id.

qou/r-hs, ou, o(,
male, of animals, Id. (s.v.l.).
qour-htai=s: ai( tw=n zw/|wn mi/ceis, Id.
qou/r-htra: o)xei=a, Id.

*qourio/-mantis, ews, o(,
a Thurian prophet, of the
seer Lampon, Ar. Nu.332 (pl.); v. Sch. ad loc.
*qourio-pe/rsai, oi(, title of play by Metagenes, Ath.6.270a.
qou/rios, a, on, in Trag. (Com. in lyr.),= qou=ros, loxage/tai a)/rxwn, A.Th.42, Pers.73 (lyr.); o)/rnis, to/ca, Id.Ag.112 (lyr.), Eu.627; *ai)/as S.Aj.212 (anap.); lh=ma Ar.Eq.757 (lyr.).
qou=ris, idos, h(, fem. of sq. (q.v.): in pl. qou/rides: nu/mfai, *mou=sai (Maced.), Hsch.

qou=ros, on, (qrw/|skw)
rushing, impetuous, furious, Hom. (only in Il.), as epith. of Ares, 15.127,al. (of the planet Mars, Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr.1.1); *tufw/n A.Pr.356, cf. Fr.199; do/ru E.Rh.492; a)nh\r *gala/ths Eleg.Alex.Adesp.2.14:—fem. qou=ris, i^dos, h(, epith. of a)lkh/, Od.4.527, Il.7.164, al.; q. a)spi/s, prob. the shield
with which one rushes to the fight, 11.32; ai)gi/s 15.308.
qo/sxoinoi: a(/rpages, planh=tes, Hsch.
qo/wkos, o(, Ep. form of qw=kos; v. qa=kos.

qo/wsa, h(, (qoo/s A)
speedy, swift, as pr. n., Od.1.71, Emp.122.3.

qragmo/s, o(,
crackling, kua/mwn e)reikome/nwn S.E.P.1.58; cf. qrau/w.
qra/zw, aor. 1 e)/qra^sa,= qrau/w, Tz.H.9.34.
qrai/ein: loidorei=n (Lacon.), Hsch.
*qra|k-i/as (sc. a)/nemos), o(,= *qraski/as (q.v.). (sc. li/qos) stone said to take fire in water, Dsc.5.129, cf. Plin.HN33.94.

*qra|k-i/zw,
speak Thracian dialect, A.D.Adv.162.4, St.Byz. s.v. *qra/kh.
*qra|k-iko/s, h/, o/n,=sq., Luc.JTr.21.

*qra/|k-ios, a, on, Thracian, Th.5.10, etc.: Ion. *qrhi/+kios, h, on, Il.10.559, Hdt.1.168 codd.:—contr. *qrh/|kios, a, on （-os, on E.Fr.369.4 (lyr.)), A.Ag.654, E.Hec.36:—*sa/mos *qrhi+ki/h,= *samoqra/kh, Il.13.13. [*qrhi^kios Hom.; *qrhi_kios Phanocl.1.1, A.R.4.905.]

*qra|k-isti/, Adv.
in Thracian fashion, ke/karmai Theoc.14.46.
in the Thracian dialect, Str.7.6.1, A.D.Adv.162.4.

*qra|kofoi/ths, ou, o(,
one who keeps going to Thrace, like *(aidofoi/ths, Ar.Fr.149.7.
qraktiko/n: poreuto/n, and qracei=tai: poreu/setai, Hsch.: dial. forms for qrekt-, qrec-. qrambo/n: kapuro/n, Id. qra/mis: krio/s, Id.

qra_neu/omai, Pass. with fut. Med. -eu/somai, （qra=nos)
to be stretched on the tanner's board, tanned, Ar.Eq.369; also,
to be crushed, Hsch., Phot.
qra^ni/as, ou, o(, a kind of fish, cifi/ai qrani/ai te Marcell.SId.29 (cf. qrani/s):—also qrani/ai: qro/mboi, Hsch.
qra_n-i/dion, to/, Dim. of qra=nos, Ar.Fr.399.

qra^ni/s, i/dos, h(,
sword-fish,= cifi/as, Xenocr.17; cf. qrani/as.

qra_n-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, （qra=nos)
rower on the topmost of the three benches in a trireme, Th.6.31, Ar.Ach.162, cf. Sch.Ar.Ra.1106. Adj.
of the topmost bench, skalmo\s q. the
topmost bench, Plb.16.3.4:- fem. qra_ni=tis kw/ph the oar
of a qrani/ths, IG22.1604.52 (pl.), EM454.12 (pl.).

qra_n-i_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of a qrani/ths, kw/ph Callix.1.
qrannome/nh: proorw=sa, Hsch.
qra_nogra/fos [gra^], o(,= toixogra/fos, Plb.15.25.32, Hsch.

qra=nos, o(, (qra/omai)
bench, form, Ar.Pl.545 (gen. qra/nous codd., qra/nou Poll.).
close-stool, Hp. ap. Gal.19.104. Archit.,
wooden beam, o(/sa kate/rrwgen tou= tei/xous e)ndh/sei qra/nois IG22.463.75; qra/nous e)piqh/sei dianekei=s, of
beams supporting floors, ib.1668.81, cf. 1672.208. o( q. tou= new/ the
top course of masonry in a temple, ib.11(2).161A49 (Delos, iii B.C.); q. poiki/los PCair.Zen.445.5(iii B.C.).
qra=nuc, v. qrh=nuc.

qra_nu/ssw,
break in pieces, Lyc.664. (Cf. sunqrano/w, prob. cogn. with qrau/w.)

*qra=|c, *qra|ko/s, o(, Thracian: Ep. and Ion. *qrh/i+c, i+kos [i^, but i_ in Nic.Th.49, Call.Aet.Oxy.2079.13, A.R.1.24,632, etc.], Il.4.533, Hdt.1.28, etc.: Ep. and Trag. contr. *qrh=|c, *qrh|ko/s, Il.24.234, etc., to be read for *qra=|c in E.Hec.428, Fr.360.48; Ion. dat. pl. *qrh/i+cin [^_^] Archil.Supp.4.48:—fem. *qra=|ssa (q.v.).
qra=cai, qra=con, v. qra/ssw.

qra/omai (cf. qra=nos),
to be seated, in Ion. aor. 1 Med. qrh/sasqai, plata/nw| g<r>ai/h| u(/po Philet.14.
qra/sis, ews, h(,= qrau=sis, Hsch. qra/skein: a)namimnh/|skein, Id.

*qraski/as, ou, o(,
the wind from NNW., Arist.Mete.363b29, Mu. 394b30, Thphr.Vent.42, Agathem.2.7, Lyd.Mag.3.32:—written *qra|ki/as, Arist.Vent.973b17, Thphr.Sign.35; *qra_ki/as IG14.1308: —hence qraskiko/s, h/, o/n,
facing NNW., of windows, Zos.Alch. p.141 B.

qra/sos [a^], eos, to/, （qrasu/s） = qa/rsos (q.v.),
courage, Il.14.416, A. Pers.394, E.Med.469, Ar.Lys.545 (lyr.); q. pole/mwn
courage in war, Pi.P.2.63; qra/sei
boldly, B.16.63; but more freq. i)sxu/os q.
confidence in strength, S.Ph.104. in bad sense,
over-boldness, rashness, insolence, e)s tou=to qra/seos (v.l. qa/rseos） a)nh/kei Hdt.7.9.g', cf. A.Pr.42, D.21.194, etc.; pamma/xw| qra/sei bru/wn A.Ag.169(lyr.), cf. Pers.831; proba=s' e)p' e)/sxaton qra/sous S.Ant.853(lyr.); to/lmais kai\ frenw=n qra/sei Id.Aj.46; pepu/rgwsai qra/sei E.Or.1568; panourgi/a| te kai\ qra/sei Ar. Eq.331, cf. 637; qra/sei a)pi/stw| e)pairo/menos Th.1.120; tou= qra/sous e)pisxei=n tina Pl.Hp.Ma.298a; to\ th\n tou= belti/onos do/can mh\ fobei=sqai dia\ qra/sos Id.Lg.701b; a)nai/deia kai\ q. Aeschin.1.189; opp. ai)dw/s, Arist.Cael.291b26; qra/sos me\n ga/r e)stin a)/logos o(rmh/, qa/rsos de\ e)/llogos o(rmh/ Ammon.Diff.p.71 V.; oi(=on pe/ponqe to\ qa/rsos pro\s to\ qra/sos Arist.EE1234b12, cf. Eus.Mynd.56, Luc.Musc.Enc.5.—This distn. holds good in Att. Prose: qa/rsos is not found in Com.; qarsu/nw and qrasu/nw are used indifferently; qrase/w and qarsu/s are not found; cf. qrasu/s fin., qrasu/ths.

*qra=|ssa, h(, Att. *qra=|tta, Trag. *qrh=|ssa, fem. of *qra=|c, S.Ant.589, E.Alc.967 (both lyr.): *qrh/i+ssa la=as,= *qra|ki/as li/qos, Nic.Th.45:— esp. as Subst.,
Thracian slave-girl, Ar.Ach.273, Pl.Tht.174a, etc.: *qra/i+ssa [a^] Theoc.Ep.20.1; Ion. *qre/i+ssa Herod.1.79.

qra/ssw, Att. qra/ttw, pres. part. neut. qra=tton Pl.Phd.86e: aor.1 inf. qra=cai A.Pr.628,E.Fr.600:—
trouble, disquiet, Pi.I.7(6).39,A.l.c., Cratin.363, Pherecr.39, S.Fr.177, Hp.Mul.1.70, E.Rh.863, Pl. l.c., Phdr.242c, etc.:—Pass., u(po\ e)dwdh=s qra/ttesqai Jul.Or.6.192a: aor.1 e)qra/xqh S.Fr.1055.
disturb, destroy, APl.4.255. for pf. te/trhxa, v. tara/ssw 11.

qrasu/-boulos [u^], on,
bold in counsel, Arist.Rh.1400b19.

qrasu-glwssh/s, e/s,
bold of tongue, Man.4.184.

qrasu-glwtti/a, h(,
boldness of tongue, Poll.2.108.

qrasu/-guios, on,
strong of limb, *kleitoma/xoio ni/ka q. Pi.P.8.37.

qrasu/-deilos, o(, h(,
impudent coward, braggart, poltroon, Arist.EN1115b32, Vett.Val.40.14. name of a gem, Ps. Plu. Fluv.17.2.

qrasu-ergo/s, o/n,
bold of deed, Nonn.D.35.365.

qrasu/-qu_mos, on,
bold-hearted, Man.4.529; cf. qrasu/muqos.

qrasu-ka/rdios, on,
bold of heart, Il.10.41, 13.343, Hes.Sc.448, Anacr.1.5, B.19.5.

qrasu-loge/w,
speak boldly, Sch.rec.S.Aj.1258.

qrasu-lo/gos, on,
bold of speech, EM 133.42.

qrasu/-ma^xos, on,
bold in battle, Arist.Rh.1400b20: as pr. n., Thrasymachus:—hence Adj. qrasu-ma/xeios, a, on, e(rmhnei/a style
of T., D.H.Dem.3.

qrasu-me/mnwn, on, gen. onos, (qrasu/s, Skt.
mánma, OIr.
menma 'spirit', cf. *)agame/mnwn)
brave-spirited, epith. of Heracles, Il. 5.639, Od.11.267; of Meleager, B.5.69.

qrasu-mh/dhs, es,
bold of thought or
plan, daring, resolute, Pi.P.4.143, N.9.13, B.15.15:—in Hom. only as pr. n.
qrasu/-mhtis, idos, o(, h(,= foreg., AP6.324 (Leon. Alex.).

qrasu-mh/xa^nos, Dor. qrasu-ma/xa^nos [ma_], on,
bold in contriving, daring in design, *(hrakle/hs Pi.O.6.67; le/ontes Id.N.4.62.

qrasu/-mu_qos, on,
bold of tongue, saucy, Id.O.13.10 (v.l. -qumos).
qra/su^nos [a^],= qrasu/s, EM204.17.

qra^su/nw, (qrasu/s) = qarsu/nw,
embolden, encourage, A.Ag.222(lyr.); plh/qei th\n a)maqi/an qrasu/nontes
lending courage to their ignorance by number, Th.1.142. c. acc.,
boast of, th\n i)shgori/an Plb.4.31.4. Pass. and Med., aor. 1 inf. qrasunqh=nai A.Supp.772; e)qrasuna/mhn Isoc.4.12, Ph.2.557:—
to be bold, confident, take courage, A.Ag.1188, etc.; ou) . . a)lo/gws qrasuno/meqa Th.5.104; pri\n o(/rmw| nau=n qrasunqh=nai before the ship
had got confidence in her moorings, A. Supp.l.c.; e)pi/ ti
make a bold bid for . . , Philostr.VS2.33.2; q. ti pro/s tina
carry out a coup de main against, Aen.Tact.9.1; more freq., in bad sense,
to be over-bold, over-confident, S.Ph.1387, E.Hec.1183, Ar.Ra.846, D.18.136; a)lo/gws Polystr.p.30 W.; e)pi/ tini Ar.Ach. 330; h)|sxu/nonto e)f' oi(=s e)qrasu/nanto Isoc.5.23; pro/s ti Plu.2.794d, Luc.Apol.6; e)/k tinwn Polystr.p.22 W.: c. dat., laimargi/a a)qeo/thti qrasunome/nh Plu.2.1125a.

qra^su-ceni/a, h(,
the boldness of a stranger, Pl.Lg.879e.

qra^su/-ponos, on,
bold or
ready for toil, a)kmai\ i)sxu/os Pi.O.1.96.

qra^su-pto/lemos, on,
bold in war, IG9(1).871 (Corc.).

qra^su/s, ei=a, u/, fem. qrase/a, metri gr., Philem.20 (s.v.l.):—
bold, chiefly of persons, Il.8.89, etc.; also q. po/lemos 6.254, 10.28, Od.4.146; qraseia/wn a)po\ xeirw=n 5.434, Il.17.662, al.; q. kardi/a Pi.P.10.44; pou/s Ar.Ra.330(lyr.); e)n tw=| e)/rgw| e)/rgw| qrasu/s Hdt.7.49; h( e)lpi\s qrasei=a tou= me/llontos
full of confidence, Th.7.77; qrasu\s to\ h)=qos Arist.Pol.1315a11. more freq. in bad sense,
over-bold, rash, su\n d' o( q. ei(/pet' *)odusseu/s Od.10.436 (Sch. propeth/s）; *gorgo/nes Pi.P.12.7;
audacious, arrogant, insolent, A.Pr.180 (lyr.), Ar.Nu.445 (anap.), etc.; *)/arhs . . pro\s a)llh/lous q., of civil war, A.Eu.863; glw/ssh| q. S.Aj.1142; e)n toi=s lo/gois Id.Ph.1307; e)pi\ tw=n lo/gwn D.Prooem.32; a)nomi/a| q. E.IT 275; ponhro\s ei)= kai\ q. Ar.Eq.181; qrasei=s kai\ a)/dikoi kai\ u(bristai/ Pl.Lg. 630b; a)lazw\n o( q. kai\ prospoihtiko\s a)ndrei/as Arist.EN1115b29; [o(/moio/n ti e)/xei] o( q. tw=| qarrale/w| ib.1151b7; to\ mh\ q. modesty, A.Supp.197:
Comp. -u/teros Pl.La.184b, Phld.Lib.p.61 O.: Sup. -u/tatos Isoc.12.133, etc. of things,
to be ventured, c. inf., qrasu/ moi to/d' ei)pei=n this I am
bold to say, Pi.N.7.50; ou)k a)=r' e)kei/nw| g' ou)de\ prosmei=cai qrasu/; S.Ph.106. Adv. -e/ws Ar.V.1031, etc.: Aeol. qrose/ws Jo.Gramm. Comp.2.1: Comp. qrasu/teron
too boldly, Th.8.103; -te/rws Phalar.Ep.34: Sup. qrasu/tata Th.8.84 and (with v.l. -a/tws) D.S.17.44: neut. as Adv., a)naide\s kai\ qrasu\ ble/pein Cratin.24 D. (I.-E.
dhers- in qe/rsos (older than qa/rsos and qra/sos),
dhṛs- in qrasu/s, Skt.
dhṛ[snull ]ṇú- 'bold', cf. Engl.
dare, durst.）

qra^su/splagxnos, on,
bold-hearted, E.Hipp.424. Adv. -ws A.Pr. 730.

qra^sustom-e/w,
to be over-bold of tongue, A.Supp.203, S.Ph.380, E.Hec.1286.

qra^sustom-i/a, h(,
insolence, AP12.141 (Mel.).

qra^su/stom-os, on,
over-bold of tongue, insolent, A.Th.612, Ag.1399, E.Fr.3.

qra^su/ths, htos, h(,
over-boldness, Hp.Lex4, Th.2.61, Lys.3.45; q., = to\ sfo/dra qarrei=n, Arist.Rh.1390a31, cf. EN1108b31: pl., Isoc.4.77; a)ndrei=ai kai\ q. D.Prooem.45.

qra^su/-tolmos [u^], on,
bold, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).212.

qra^su/-frwn, on, gen. onos,
bold of mind, Opp.H.1.112.
qra^su-fwni/a, h(,= qrasustomi/a, Poll.2.112.
qra^su/-fwnos, on,= qrasu/stomos, ibid.

qra^su-xa/rmhs, ou, o(,
bold in fight, Q.S.4.502.

qra^su/-xeir, xeiros, o(, h(,
bold of hand, AP7.234 (Phil.); q. m[a/x]a, of boxing, B.2.4; in bad sense, q. kai\ miai/fonos Id.Scol.Oxy.1361 Fr.5.10,= Scol.Oxy.2081 (
e）10.

qra^su-xeiri/a, h(,
boldness of hand, Poll.2.148.
*qra^sw/, o/os, contr. ou=s, h(, Bold, name of Athena, Lyc.936.

*qra/swn, wnos, o(, a name of a
braggart soldier in New Com.
*qra=|tta, hs, h(, Att. for *qra=|ssa.

qra=|tta, h(,
a small sea-fish, Arist.GA785b23, Antiph.211, Mnesim. 4.41:—Dim. qra|tti/dion, to/, Anaxandr.27.

qra/tths: o( li/qos, u(po\ *qrakw=n, Hsch.; cf. *qraki/as. qra/tton: u(/peron, ko/louron, Id. qra/ttw, Att. for qra/ssw. qrau=los, h, on,
frangible, brittle, Anon. ap. Suid. (Comp.):—also qrau=ros, Hsch.

qrau=ma, atos, to/, (qrau/w)
fragment, A.Pers.425, IG7.3498.23 (Oropus, iii/ii B.C.), D.S.3.12.
breakage, Jul.Or.2.60a.
destruction, e)xqrw=n LXXJu.13.5. metaph., qrau/mat' e)moi\ klu/ein A.Ag.1166(lyr.). (Cf. qrau=sma.)

qrau/palos, o(,
joint fir, Ephedra campulopoda, Thphr.HP3.6.4; h(, ib.4.1.3.

qraupi/s, i/dos, h(,
a small bird, Arist.HA592b30 (v.l. qlupi/s).

qrausa/ntuc, u^gos, o(, h(, (qrau/w)
breaking chariot-
rails, tu/xai Ar. Nu.1264.

qrau=sis, ews, h(, (qrau/w)
comminution, opp. ka/tacis, Arist.Mete. 386a13, 390b7, Placit.3.3.7, Sor.Fract.12.
slaughter, LXX 2 Ki. 17.9;
destruction by plague, ib.24.15, Nu.16.48.
falling off of hair in patches, Gal.19.430. = o)rgh/, plhgh/, sfu=ra h( tou\s bw/lous qrau/ousa, Hsch.

qrau=s-ma, atos, to/,= qrau=ma 1, Agatharch.25, Arist.Mu.394b4, Luc.Hist.Conscr.25. in leprosy,
scab, LXXLe.13.30. the best kind of a)mmwniako/n, Dsc.3.84.
fracture, Hippiatr.74 (pl.).

qraus-mo/s, o(,
breaking, kardi/as LXXNa.2.10(11).

qraus-th/rios, a, on,
capable of dissolving, li/qwn Aët.2.19.

qrau/s-ths, ou, o(,
one who breaks or
crushes, POxy.868.2 (nisi sub qrausto/s ponendum).

qraus-to/s, h/, o/n,
frangible, brittle, Ti.Locr.99c, Thphr.HP5.3.6;
capable of being broken down, pu/rgos D.C.36.18. Asclep. ap. Gal.14.698, S.E.P.3.33.
broken, crushed, Epigr.in PTeb.3.4: qrausto/n, to/,= qrau=sma 111, Plin.HN12.107.

qrau/w, Ep. impf. qrau/eskon Orph.L.140: fut. -sw Ar.Av.466: aor. 1 e)/qrausa S.El.745, E.HF779 (lyr.):—Pass., fut. qrausqh/somai Gal.10.624: aor. e)qrau/sqhn (v. infr.), (kat-) Pl.Ti.56e: pf. te/qrausmai Thphr.Sens.11, (sun-) X.Ages.2.14, (para-) Pl.Lg.757e (v.l. -teqraume/non) :—
break in pieces, shatter, Simon.57, A.Pers.196, 416, Tim. Pers.99, etc.; q. sa/rkas E.Hipp.1239:—Pass., qrauome/nhs th=s pe/trhs
flying into pieces, Hdt.1.174; si/dhron qrausqe/nta kai\ r(age/nta S.Ant. 476; ptera\ qrau/ontai
have their wings
broken, Pl.Phdr.248b. metaph.,
break down, enfeeble, mh\ qrau/sai （-soi codd.) xro/nos o)/lbon Pi.O.6.97, cf. E.HF779 (lyr.); dia/toron sfragi=da q. sto/matos Tim. Pers.160; e)/pos . . , o(/ ti th\n tou/twn qrau/sei yuxh/n Ar.Av.466; q. th\n du/namin Plu.Alc.23; e)lpi/da, etc., Hdn.3.2.2, etc.; q. ti tw=n e)k xro/nou fulassome/nwn dikai/wn Supp.Epigr.1.329.45 (Istrus, i A.D.), cf. Onos. 32.10:—Pass., po/qos qrausqei/s Asp. ap. Ath.5.219e; qrauo/menos to\n logismo/n, Lat.
animo fractus, Plu.Ant.17; qrausqh=nai e)pi/ tina
to be grieved for . . , LXX 1 Ki.20.34.—Rare in Att. Prose.
*qre/i+ssa, h(, Ion. for *qra=|ssa (q. v.).

qrek-tiko/s, h/, o/n, (tre/xw)
able to run, Att. for troxastiko/s, acc. to Moer.p.187 P.: Sup. -w/tatos Hsch.
qrek-to/s, h/, o/n,= troxai=os, qrektoi=si no/mois, f.l. for krekt-, S.Fr.463:—also qrekto/s: dro/mos, Phot.

qre/mm-a, atos, to/, (tre/fw)
nursling, creature, q. *nhrei/+dwn, of dolphins, Arion 1.9; mostly of tame animals, esp. sheep and goats, X. Ages.9.6, Oec.20.23, Plb.2.26.5, Ev.Jo.4.12, etc.; ta\ e)n tai=s a)ge/lais q. Pl.Plt.261d; ta\ a)gelai=a q. ib.264a; u(hna\ q. Id.Lg.819d; of game-cocks and quails, o)rni/qwn q. ib.789b: generally,
animals, toi=s h(me/rois kai\ a)gri/ois . . q. Id.Criti.118b, al. of men, S.OT1143, Ph.243; *xari/twn q. Ar.Ec.973; du/skolon to\ q. a)/nqrwpos Pl.Lg.777b, cf. Tht.174b; esp. of
domestic slaves,= Lat.
verna, to\ *xrusi/ppou q. GDI12321.14 (Delph.), cf. CIG3113 (Teos). generally,
creature, a)/platon q. ka)prosh/goron, of a lion, S.Tr.1093 (cf. Pl.Chrm.155e); of Cerberus, S.Tr.1099; kaka\ q., of
a swarm of gnats, AP5.150 (Mel.); q. *selinou=ntos, of a fish, Archestr.Fr.12; *karu/stou q., comic for a cup made at Carystus, Antiph.182.3; as a term of reproach, qre/mmat' ou)k a)nasxeta/ A.Th.182; w)= qre/mm' a)naide/s S.El.622, cf. Ar.Lys.369; in periphr., u(/dras q., for u(/dra, S.Tr.574; neogenh= pai/dwn qre/mmata Pl. Lg.790d; qre/mmata pallakw=n
kept mistresses, Plu.Sol.7. (Written qe/rmata BGU478.15 (ii A.D.)).

qremm-atiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for cattledealing, e)rgasi/a Judeich
Altertümer von Hierapolis 227b7.

qremm-a/tion, to/, Dim. of qre/mma 2, CIG2733 (Stratonicea), SIG1211 (Calymna, pl.), Keil-Premerstein
Dritter Bericht 151 (ii/iii A.D.).

qremm-a^totrofe/w,
keep cattle, D.S.2.54, Str.15.1.41.
qre/caskon, qre/comai, v. tre/xw.

qre/omai, only in pres.,
cry aloud, shriek, always of women, qre/omai fobera\ mega/l' a)/xh A.Th.78; elsewh. only in part., minura\ qreome/nas Id.Ag.1165; pa/qea me/lea qreome/na Id.Supp.112, cf. E.Hipp.363; au)th\ qreome/nh sauth=| kaka/ Id.Med.51 (trim., elsewh. lyr.).—Act. only in Hsch. (I.-E.
dhreu-, cf. qro-e/w, qru=-los.)
qre/pta, v. qre/ptra, ta/.
qrep-ta/rion, to/,= qremma/tion, CIG(add.)4303h6 (Lycia), PPar. p.422 (ii A.D.).
qre/p-teira, h(, fem. of qrepth/r, E.Tr.195 (lyr.), AP5.105 (Diotim.), 6.51: metaph., *di/kh q. polh/wn Opp.H.2.680.

qrep-te/os, a, on, (tre/fw)
to be fed, nurtured, metaph., gumnastikh=| Pl.R.403c. qrepte/on
one must feed, keep, Id.Ti.19a, X.Lac.9.5. (from Pass.) h)\ e)rgaste/on h)\ a)po\ tw=n ei)rgasme/nwn qrepte/on
one must live on what has been earned, Id.Eq.Mag.8.8.

qrep-th/r, h=ros, o(,
feeder, rearer, of a parent or foster-parent, IG3.1401, JRS2.91 (Antioch in Pisidia), AP12.137 (Mel.): pl., IG14.1722: as Adj., q. a)gosto/s Nonn. D.3.387.

qrep-th/rios, on,
feeding, nourishing, masto/s A.Ch.545. plo/kamos *)ina/xw| q. hair
dedicated as a thank-offering to Inachus, ib. 6. Subst. qrepth/rion, to/,= qrepta/rion, PLond.5.1708.248 (vi A.D.). pl., qrepth/ria, ta/,
reward for rearing, made to nurses by parents, h.Cer.168,223; also,
return made by children for their rearing (Att. trofei=a), Hes.Op.188, Ael.VH2.7.
nourishment, ta\ . . nhdu/os q. S.OC1263.

qrep-th/twr, oros, o(,
nourisher, feeder, penh/twn PMasp.20.11 (pl., vi A.D.).

qrep-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to feed or
rear, tinos Pl.Plt.267b, cf. 276b, 276c;
nourishing, -w/tera mh=la Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.3.82f; -w/tatos oi)=nos Mnesith.ib.1.32d.
of or
promoting growth, h( du/namis th=s yuxh=s q. kai\ gennhtikh/ Arist.de An.416a19; h( q. yuxh/ ib.415a23; to\ q.
the principle of growth, Id.EN1102b11; h( q. kai\ au)chtikh\ zwh/ ib. 1098a1; opp. fqartiko/s, Polystr.p.23 W. Adv. -kw=s Porph.Gaur.1.1.
causing to heal up, e(lkw=n Dsc.1.43.

qrep-to/s, h/, o/n, as Subst., qrepto/s, qrepth/,
slave bred in the house, Lys.Fr.215 S., Pherecr.125, LXXEs.2.7, IPE12.709 (Olbia, ii B.C.), POxy.298.46 (i A.D.), etc.; oi( q. kai\ ai( q. Inscr.Cos131; also of
adopted foundlings, th\n i)di/an q. SIG1210 (Calymna), Plin.
Ep.ad Traj.65, etc.
pupil, Vett.Val.157.29.
qre/p-tra (A), ta/,= qrepth/rios 111.2, ou)de\ tokeu=si q. fi/lois a)pe/dwke Il.4.478, 17.302; qre/pta is dub. in Epigr.Gr.442.4 (ii A.D.), Q.S.11.89, Hsch.

qre/p-tra (B), h(,= qre/pteira,
a nurse, CIG(add.)4300d (Antiphellos).
qresko/s, v. qrh=skos.

qretta^nelo/,
sound imitative of the cithara, Ar.Pl.290.
qre/tte, to/,= to\ qrasu/, ou)k e)/ni moi to\ q., barbarism in Ar.Eq.17.
qreyi/ppas, ou, o(,= i(ppotro/fos, as pr. n. in Apollod.2.7.8.

qre/yis, ews, h(,
nourishing, swma/twn S.E.M.11.97, cf. Alex.Aphr. Pr.2.66, Gal.1.655, etc.
qrhi+kh/: u(podhma/twn ei)=dos *persikw=n, Hsch.

*qrhi+ki/h, *qrhi/+kios, h, on, Ep.and Ion. for *qra/|kios (q. v.). *qrh=i+c, i+kos, o(, Ep. and Ion. for *qra=|c (q. v.). *qrh/i+ssa, h(, poet. for *qra=|ssa (q. v.). *qrh/|kh, h(, *qrh/|khqev, *qrh/|khnde, v. *qra/|kh. *qrh/|kios, v. *qra/kios.

qrh/n-erws, wtos, o(, h(,
a querulous lover, Poll.6.189.
qrhn-eu/w, = qrhne/w, Epigr.Gr.406.9 (Iconium).

qrhn-e/w, fut. -h/sw A.Ag.1541 (anap.), S.Aj.632 (lyr.): aor. 1 -hsa E.Tr.[111]:—Med. (v. infr. 2): impers. in pf. Pass. (v. infr.): (qrh=nos):—
sing a dirge, wail, *mou=sai d' e)nne/a pa=sai a)meibo/menai o)pi\ kalh=| qrh/neon Od.24.61; ti/s o( qrhnh/swn; A.Ag. l.c.; ti/s . . e)/sq' o( qrhnw=n; Ar.Nu.1260; q. pro\s tu/mbon A.Ch.926; q. kai\ o)du/resqai Pl.Ap.38d; pro\s sfa=s au)tou/s Isoc.8.128: c.acc.cogn., stono/essan a)oidh
 . . e)qrh/neon
were singing a doleful dirge, Il.24.7221; go/on q. A.Fr.291; o)cuto/nous w)|da/s S.Aj.l.c.; e)pw|da/s ib.582; u(/mnous, of the nightingale, Ar.Av.211 (lyr.); fqo/ggous a)lu/rous Alex.162.7:—Pass., a(/lis moi teqrh/nhtai go/ois S.Ph.1401; i(kanw=s teqrh/nhtai Luc.Cat. 20. c.acc.,
bewail, q. po/nous A.Pr.615; to
 qa/naton Pl.Phd.85a; o(/sa to
 . . e)mo
 qrhnw= pate/ra S.El.94 (anap.), cf. 530, Ev.Luc.23.27, etc.; to
 fu/nta E.Fr.449:—so also Med., a)/kos ga ou)de
 to/nde qrhnei=sqai A.Pr.43:—Pass.,
to be lamented, S.Aj.852, Fr.653.

qrh/n-hma, atos, to/,
lament, dirge, E.Or.132, Hel.174 (lyr.), etc.

qrhn-h/simos,
flebilis, Gloss.

qrhn-hte/on,
one must lament, Apollon. ap. Stob.4.56.35, Jul.Or.8.246b.

qrhn-hth/r, h=ros, o(,
mourner, wailer, A.Pers.938 (lyr.).
qrhn-hth/rios, on,= qrhnhtiko/s, w)|dai\ q. Eust.1372.26.
qrhn-hth/s, ou=, o(,= qrhnhth/r, A.Ag.1075, BGU34 iv 4 (iii A.D.).

qrhn-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to lament, querulous, Arist.EN1171b10.
of or
for a dirge, au)/lhma, mo/naulos, Poll.4.73,75; to\ q.
matter for lament, Plu. 2.623a. Adv. -kw=s Poll.6.202.
qrhn-h/tria, h(, fem. of qrhnhth/r, Sch.E.Ph.1489.
qrhn-h/twr, oros, o(,= qrhnhth/r, Man.4.190.

qrhno-la/los [a^], on,
uttering laments, *seirh=nes IG12(8).445.5 (Thasos).

qrhno-loge/w,
bewail, tina IPE2.197 (Panticapaeum).

qrhno-poio/s,
luctificus, Gloss.

qrh=nos, o(, (qre/omai)
dirge, lament, Il.24.721, Sapph.136, Pi.I.8(7).64, Hdt.2.79,85, etc.; q. ou(mo/s
for me, A.Pr.390; ei)pei=n . . q. qe/lw e)mo\n to\n au)th=s Id.Ag.1322.
complaint, sad strain, h.Pan.18; *torgo/nwn ou)/lion q. Pi.P.12.8; qrh=noi kai\ o)durmoi/ Pl.R.398d, etc.: pl.,
lamentations, qrh/nwn w)|da/s S.El.88 (lyr.), etc.; title of poems by Pindar, Stob.4.39.6, etc. (Distd. fr. e)pikh/deion by Trypho ap.Ammon. Diff.p.54 V. (cf. Ptol.Asc.p.404H.), e)pikh/deion to\ e)pi\ tw=| kh/dei, q. de\ e)n w(|dh/pote xro/nw|.)
qrh=nuc, ukos, o(,= sq., Euph.39; Boeot. qra=nuc Corinn.38.

qrh=nus, uos, o(, (qra/omai)
footstool, u(po\ de\ qrh=nun posi\n h(/sei Il.14.240, cf. Od.19.57. q. e(ptapo/dhs the seven-foot
bench, perh.
helmsman's bench or
bridge, Il.15.729.

qrhnw|d-e/w,
sing a dirge over, tina E.IA1176.

qrhnw/|d-hma, atos, to/,
dirge, lament, Sch.S.El.92 (ed. T. Johnson, Oxon. 1705).

qrhnw/|d-hs, es,
like a dirge, fit for a dirge, a(rmoni/ai Pl.R.398e, 411a; o)durmo/s Tim. Pers.113; fqo/ggos, me/los, Plu.Sull.7, Hdn.4.2.5; to\ q. th=s yuxh=s
mournful mood, Plu.2.822c. = qrhnhtiko/s, of persons, Pl.Lg. 792b; to\ q. Id.R.606b.

qrhnw|d-i/a, h(,
lamentation, ib.604d, Plu.2.657a.

qrhnw|d-iko/s, h/, o/n,
appropriate to a dirge, a(rmoni/a ib.1136e.

qrhnw|d-o/s, o(, h(,
one who sings a dirge, mourner, Alciphr.1.36, Ptol.Tetr.180, Anon.Oxy.864, cf. Poll.6.202.
qrh/nwma, atos, to/,= qrh=nos, ei)s to\n *)osi=rin PTeb.140 (pl., i B.C.).
*qrh=|c, h|ko/s, o(, Ion. for *qra=|c (q. v.); fem. *qrh=|ssa, h( (q. v.).
qrh/sasqai, v. qra/omai.

qrhsk-ei/a, Ion. qrhsk-ei/h, h(, (qrhskeu/w)
religious worship, cult, ritual, h( peri\ ta\ i(ra\ q. Hdt.2.18, IG12(5).141.5 (Paros, iii B.C.), J.AJ17.9.3, etc.; tou= *)apo/llwnos SIG801 D (Delph., i A.D.); h( peri/ tinos q. ib. 867.48 (Ephesus, ii A.D.): pl.,
rites, Hdt.2.37, D.H.2.63, PGnom. 185 (ii A.D.), Wilcken Chr.72 (iii A.D.).
religion, service of God, LXX Wi.14.18, Act.Ap.26.5, Ep.Jac.1.26; q. tou= qeou= mi/a e)sti/, mh\ ei)=nai kako/n Corp.Herm.12 fin.; e(kate/ra q., i.e. Christianity and Paganism, Them.Or.5.69c; q. tw=n a)gge/lwn
worshipping of angels, Ep.Col.2.18. in bad sense,
religious formalism, a)nti\ o(sio/thtos Ph.1.195; q. biwtikh/ vulgar
superstition, Sor.1.4.

qrh/sk-euma, atos, to/,
religious worship, IG22.1099.29 (Plotina), Just.Nov.103.2 (pl.).
qrh/sk-eusis ews, h(,= foreg., Phint. ap. Stob.4.23.61a (pl.).

qrhsk-euth/rion, to/,
place of worship, Sch.Pi.O.7.33.

qrhsk-euth/s, ou=, o(,
worshipper, BCH 37.94 (Thessalonica), Ptol.Tetr.159, Sch.Pi.O.3.28.

qrhsk-eu/w,
perform religious observances, Hdt.2.64, Sammelb.991 (iii A.D.). c. acc.,
worship, qeou/s D.H.2.23, IG5(2).268.42 (Mantinea), Porph. Abst.4.9, Hdn.1.11.1:—Pass., Dinon 17, LXX Wi.14.16, Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.11: impers., ei)/ ti a)/llo -eu/esqai no/mimon h)=n D.H.1.76.
to be a devotee, Plu.Alex.2.

qrh/sk-ia, ta/,
religious observances, OGI 210.9 (Nubia, iii A.D.).

qrh=sk-os, on,
religious, Ep.Jac.1.26; in bad sense,
superstitious, Hsch. (Hsch. has also qresko/s.）
qrhsk-w/dhs, es,= foreg., Vett.Val.104.14.
*qrh=|ssa, h(, Ion. for *qra=|ssa.
qrh/ttanon: th=s a(ma/chs e)f' w(=| ta\ a)go/mena e)piti/qetai, Hsch.

*qri=a, h(, Thria, name of an Attic deme, St.Byz., etc.: *qri/a|
at Thria, IG12.329, but *qria=si X.HG5.4.21, Is.11.42: *qriw=ze
to Thria, Th.1.114, BCH50.529 (ii A.D.): *qriw=qen
from Thria, IG22.1672.109:—Adj. *qria/sios, a, on, pedi/on Hdt.8.65, etc.; pu/lai Plu. Per.30.

qri_a/zw, (qriai/)
to be rapt, possessed, S.Fr.466, E.Fr.478; also glossed by fullologei=n (as if from qri=on), Hsch., EM455.45:—also qria/omai, = manteu/omai, AB265; cf. sq.

qri_ai/, w=n, ai(,
pebbles used in divination, Philoch.196, Call.Ap.45, cf. Sch. ad loc., EM455.34. personified as nymphs of Parnassus, Philoch. l.c., Sch.Call.l.c., dub. cj. in h.Merc.552.

qri^amb-euth/s, ou=, o(,
one who enjoys a triumph, Suid.
qri^amb-eutiko/s, h/, o/n, v.l. for qriambiko/s, Plu.Cat.Ma.24.

qri^amb-eu/w, pf. teqria/mbeuka Id.Ant.34: (qri/ambos):—
triumph, Plb.6.53.7, Posidon.1 J., Plu. Pomp.45, etc.; a)po/ tinos
triumph over, Id.Rom.25, App.Gall.1; kata\ th=s patri/dos Plu.Cor.35, cf. App.BC1.80; e)pi/ tini ib.4.31; also q. e)pi\ ni/kh| Hdn.3.9.1; a)po\ ma/xhs Plu.Publ.9: c. acc. cogn., q. ni/khn a)/dakrun Id.2.318b; deu/teron qri/ambon Id.Fab.23.
lead in triumph, of conquered enemies, tina Id.Comp.Thes.Rom.4, Ep.Col.2.15:—Pass., -eu/esqai u(po/ tinos Plu.Cor.35; mhd' e)n e)moi\ perii/dh|s -eu/omenon seauto/n Id.Ant.84.
lead in triumph, as a general does his army, metaph., h(ma=s e)n *xristw=| 2 Ep.Cor.2.14.
divulge, noise abroad, Phot., cf. Suid. s.v. e)cefoi/ta.

qri^amb-iko/s, h/, o/n,
triumphal, e)sqh/s D.H.5.35, J.BJ7.5.4; ko/smos Str.5.2.2; pomph/, timai/, Plu.Aem. 30, Sert.18; khdeu/mata connexions
with triumphal families, Id.Cat. Ma.24 (v.l. -eutikw=n）; a)/ndres q., Lat.
viri triumphales, Id.Cam.21, cf. Crass.1. Adv. -kw=s, h)mfiesme/nos App.BC2.106.
qri^amb-i/s, i/dos, pecul. fem. of qriambiko/s, stolh/ Anon. ap. Suid.
qri^ambodi_qu/rambos [u^], on, epith. of Bacchus, Pratin.Lyr.1.16.

qri/ambos [i^], o(,
hymn to Dionysus, sung in festal processions to his honour, Cratin.36. epith. of Dionysus, Trag.Adesp.140, D.S. 4.5, Ath.1.30b, Plu.Marc.22, Arr.An.6.28.2. metaph.,
scandal, dediw\s to\n e)k lo/gwn q. Conon 31.1. = Lat.
triumphus (which is borrowed fr. q. through Etruscan), Plb.6.15.8, D.S.12.64,
Mon. Anc.Gr.2.20, SIG804.9 (Cos, i A.D.), Plu.Publ.20, etc.; o( me/gas q. the
triumph, opp. o( e)la/ttwn q.
ovatio, Id.Marc.22, cf. D.H.8.67; o( pezo\s q.,=
ovatio, Id.9.36. (For the termination perh. cf. i)/ambos, diqu/rambos, but the origin of qri- is unknown.)

qri/a^sis [qri_], ews, h(, （qria/zw)
poetic rapture. Suid. s.v. qri/ambos.

qri_asth/s, ou=, o(, (qri=on)
planter of fig-trees, Poll.7.140.
qria/tion: a(palwte/ra trofh/, Hsch.
qriggi/on, qri^amb-go/s, qri^amb-go/w, later forms for qrigki/on, etc.
qrigk-i/on, to/, Dim. of sq., Luc.Gall.22, App.Mith.71, Just.Nov. 133.1.

qrigk-o/s, o(,
topmost course of stones in a wall, cornice, coping, mostly in pl., Od.17.267, S.Fr.506, Arist.Ph.246a18, IG7.3073.68 (Lebad.); of the row of slabs behind the frieze, SIG244ii61 (Delph., iv B.C.); dw=ma perifere\s qrigkoi=s E.Hel.430: sg., Id.IT47.
frieze, q. kua/noio Od.7.87; xrusou=s D.S.18.26. metaph.,
coping-stone, last finish, q. a)qli/wn kakw=n E.Tr.489; dokei= w(/sper q. toi=s maqh/masin h( dialektikh\ . . e)pa/nw kei=sqai Pl.R.534e.
wall, fence of any sort, E.Ion1321, Ar.Th.58 (anap.), Paus.1.42.7, Plu.2.85f.
row, o)do/ntwn Hp.Ep.23.—Later forms are qriggo/s v.l. in Plu. l.c.; qrigxo/s v.l. in Dsc.4.85; trigxo/s, Sch.Il.11.774, Eust.1570.17, SIG 1231.6 (Nicomedia, iii/iv A.D.).

qrigk-o/w,
surround with a qrigko/s, [au)lh\n] e)qri/gkwsen a)xe/rdw|
fenced it with thorn-bushes, Od.14.10, dub. in IG12.111.
build even to the coping-stone: metaph.,
complete, make an end of, a)/tas ta/sde qrigkw/swn fi/lois A.Ag.1283; dw=ma -w=sai kakoi=s
to bring the house
to the height of misery, E.HF 1280; qrigkoume/nh . . oi)ki/a Arist.Ph.246a19.

qrigk-w/dhs, es,
like a coping, Hsch. s.v. ai(masiai/.

qri/gk-wma, atos, to/,
coping, cornice, cj. for trixw/masin, J.AJ15.11.3: metaph., q. th=s trofh=s, of salt, Plu.2.685b.

qri^da^k-hi/+s, i/+dos, fem. Adj.,
of the lettuce, xai/th Nic.Th.838.
qri^da^k-i/as, ou, o(,= mandrago/ras qh=lus, Dsc.4.75.

qri^da^k-i/nh [ki_], h(, Att. form of Ion. and Dor. qri/dac (Ath.2.68f):—
lettuce, Cratin.330, Hp.Mul.2.136, Amphis 20, Eub.14, Thphr.HP1.12.2; q. h(/meros ib.7.6.2.
wild lettuce, Lactuca Scariola, Id.l.c.; h( pikra\ q. ib.9.11.10; in this signf., opp. qri/dac, Gal.13.387, Hellad. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.532B.
sea-lettuce, a kind of sea-weed, Aët.12.42 (pl.). fem. Adj. (sc. ma=za), a kind of
cake, Luc.Lex.3, Ath.3.114f, Hellad.l.c.
qri^da^k-i_ni/s, i/dos, h(,= foreg., Stratt.66.6 (lyr.).
qri^da^/k-ion, to/, Dim. of qri/dac, Plu.2.349a (pl.).
qri^da^k-i/ska, a(, Lacon. for qridaki/nh, Alcm.20.

qri^da^k-w/dhs, es,
lettuce-like, Dsc.2.132 (Comp.).

qri/dac (Cypr. qro/dac, q.v.), a^kos, h(, Ion. and Dor. for qridaki/nh,
lettuce, Epich.158, Hdt.3.32, Hp.Mul.1.78, Thphr.HP7.2.4, BGU 1118.13 (i B.C.), IG4.955.8 (Epid.), etc.:—also qru/dac, POxy.1212 (ii A.D.); qi/drac, Hsch. s.v. qidraki/nh. [i^, Epich. l.c., AP9.412 (Phld.), 11.295 (Lucill.), 413 (Ammian.), cf. qridakhi/+s, -i/nh, -ini/s: the accentuation qri=dac lacks authority.]
qri/zw, poet. syncop. for qeri/zw, A.Ag.536. qrih/looi: i(erei=s, Hsch.
qrih=sai: kapri/sai, Hsch. qrilhdei=n: qrullei=n, Id. (prob. qruli/ddhn). qrimmo/s: goggusmo/s, Id.
qri^na/kh,= qri=nac. Call.Fr.46P. (nisi leg. qri/nak' h)/n).

*qri_na^ki/h, h(, (qri=nac) a legendary island, Od.11.107, etc.: afterwards identified with Sicily and written *trinakri/a (from trei=s, a)/krai) (q. v.); cf. *trinaxi/a:—also *qri_naki/s, i/dos, h(, Str.6.2.1:—Adj. *qri_na/kios, a, on, Sicilian, r(i/za Nic.Th.529.

qr<*>=nac, a^kos, h(,
trident, three-pronged fork, used to stir grain, etc., Ar.Pax567, Nic.Th.114, PFay.120.3 (i/ii A.D.); as a signet, Tab.Heracl.1.5. [i_: later i^, AP6.95 codd. (Antiphil.).]
qrini/a: a)/mpelos e)n *krh/th|, Hsch.

qri/c, h(, gen. tri^xo/s, dat. pl. qrici/ （tri/xesin J.AJ16.7.3 is f.l. for tru/x-): -
hair, Hom. only in pl., o)rqai\ tri/xes e)/stan e)ni\ . . me/lessi Il. 24.359; mostly,
hair of the head, 22.77, Od.13.431; ai( e)n th=| kefalh=| tri/xes Th.1.6; sheep's
wool, Il.3.273, Hes.Op.517; pig's
bristles, Il.19.254, Od.10.239; tri/xes a)/krai ou)rai=ai, of a horse's tail, Il.23.519; a)na/stasis tw=n trixw=n, of a lark's
crest, Gal.12.361. later in sg. collectively, A.Th.535, Ag.562, S.El.451; trixo\s plo/kamos, bo/struxos, A.Th.564 (lyr.), Ch.229; genei/on qri/c Id.Pers.1056; ko/mh qri/c LXXNu.6.6; *)epafro/diton . . th\n paidikh\n tri/xa *(ugi/a| (sc. a)ne/qhken) IG12(5).173 (Paros, i A.D.); of a horse's
mane, S.Fr.475; of dogs, X.Cyn.4.8 (sg. and pl.).
a single hair, ou)de\ tri/x[a] Alc. Supp.14.10: prov., qri\c a)na\ me/sson
only a hair's breadth wanting, Theoc.14.9, cf. X.Smp.6.2; a)/cion trixo/s, i.e. good for nothing, Ar. Ra.614; ou)d' a)\n trixo\s priai/mhn Eup.7.18D.; e)k trixo\s kre/masqai to hang by
a hair, Aristaenet.2.1, Zen.3.47; a)po\ t. h)erth=sqai AP5.229 (Paul. Sil.); e)pi\ trixo\s h)=n h( swthri/a Procop.Aed.6.6; ei)s i(erh\n tri/xa e)lqei=n, i.e. to come to life's end, v.l. in AP7.164 (Antip. Sid.), but cf. Epigr.Gr.248.13; mo/non ou)xi\ tw=n t., fasi/, lamba/netai 'saute aux yeux', S.E.M.7.257. Medic.,
vein on the right lobe of the liver, Hp.Mul.1.43 (v.l. h( su=rigc), Gal.19.104.
*qrica/llios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Lamia, IG9(2).74.

qri_obo/los, o(, (qriai/)
one who throws pebbles into the divining-urn, soothsayer, Epic. ap. St.Byz. s.v. *qri=a, Suid.

qri=on, to/,
fig-leaf, Ar.Ec.707, Sotad.Com.1.27: generally,
leaf, Nic.Al.55;
petal, ib.407. prov., qri/ou yo/fos, of empty threats, Ar.V.436.
mixture of eggs, milk, lard, flour, honey, cheese, etc., wrapped in fig-leaves, q. tari/xous, dhmou=, Id.Ach.1101, 1102; dhmou= boei/ou qri=on Id.Eq.954; e)gkefa/lou qri/w du/o (a pun on the figleaf-like hemispheres of the brain) Id.Ra.134, cf. Sch. ll. cc. [i_, Ar. Eq.954, al., Men.518.11; qri^a, qri^on are ff. ll. for qru/a, qru/on in Theoc. 13.40, AP9.723 (Antip. Sid.); cf. lepto/qri^os.]

qri_ph/destos, on, (qri/y, e)dh/desmai)
worm-eaten, r(i/zai Thphr.HP 9.14.3, cf. IG22.1628.163, al., 1672.306; kerai=ai qriph/destai ib.1628.205, but -oi 1629.328. sfragi/dia q. seals
made of worm-eaten wood, Ar.Th.427, cf. Sch. metaph.,= diefqarme/nh, Hyp.Fr. 82. (Freq. corrupted to -e/statos, as in Ar.Th.l.c. (ap. Suid.), Hyp. l.c. (v.l.), Luc.Lex.13 (v.l.), cf. Paus.Gr.Fr.205, but a Sup. is never necessary exc. in Thphr.HP3.8.5 (v. qripw/dhs).)
qri_po/-brwtos, on, (bibrw/skw) = foreg., Philosteph. ap. Hsch., Lyc. 508:—a form qipo/brwtos (dissim.) is condemned by Hsch.

qri_po-fa/gos [fa^], on,
eating wood-worms, Arist.HA616b29.

qri_pw/dhs, es,
full of wood-worms, in Sup. -e/staton, cu/lon Thphr. HP3.8.5 vulg.; qriphde/staton cod. Urb. (v. qriph/destos).
qri/skein: to\n qrou=n, Hsch.

qri/ssa, Att. qri/tta, h(,
a fish,= trixi/as, Anaxandr.41.52, Ephipp. 12.5, Arist.HA621b16, PCair.Zen.40(iii B.C.), al., Gp.20.7.1: qrei/ssa, BGU816.20 (iii A.D.): qri/ssos, o(, is v.l. in AP6.304 (Phan.).

qriss-e/mporos, o(,
dealer in qri/ssai, PCair.Zen.261 (iii B.C.).
qriss-i/on, to/, Dim. of qri/ssa, POxy.1923.9 (v/vi A.D.).
qri/ssw,= to\ kata\ yuxh\n e)ci/stasqai, Ar.Byz.(?) ap.Erot.; Ion.acc. to Greg.Cor.p.571 S.
qri/tte,= qre/tte, Hsch.

qri/y, gen. qri_po/s, o( (not h(, v.l. in Men.540.5),
wood-worm, Thphr. HP5.4.4, AP12.190 (Strat.); o( q. to\ cu/lon (sc. lumai/netai) Men. l.c. metaph.,
skinflint, miser, Hsch. (Perh. connected with tri/bw.)
*qriw/: li/pos: e(orth\ *)apo/llwnos, kai\ h( su/ntrofos au)tou=, Hsch. qro/dac, Cypr. for qri/dac, Id.:—Dim. qodra/kion, to/, Choerob. in An.Ox. 2.218 (sic cod.).

qroe/w, aor. e)qro/hsa, poet. qro- B.3.9, S.Aj.947, (di-) Th.6.46:— Med. and Pass. (v. infr.): (qro/os):—
cry aloud, B. l.c., S.El.1410; para\ nou=n q. Id.Ph.1195 (lyr.); pa=sin to all, Id.Aj.67, cf. Tr.531;
speak, say, A.Pr.608 (lyr.); qro/ei, ti/s . . ; E.Or.187(lyr.): c. acc. cogn., q. au)da/n A.Ch.829(lyr.), E.Or.1248 (lyr.); lo/gon S.Ant.1287 (lyr.); polla/ Id.Aj.592; eu)/fhma, yeudh=, E.IA143 (lyr.), 1345 (troch.):—Med., tou=t' e)/pos -ou/menos A.Eu.510(lyr.). c. acc.,
tell out, utter aloud, tou)mo\n pa/qos Id.Ag.1137 (lyr.); no/mon a)/nomon ib. 1141 (lyr.), cf. 104; pa=s tou=to/ g' *(ellh/nwn qroei= S.OC597; qa/nato/n tini q. ib.1425.—Rare. exc. in Trag.; in late Prose, J.AJ18.6.10, 19.1.16. causal,
scare, terrify, Sch.E.Hec.180, al.:—Pass.,
to be stirred. moved, of joy, h( koili/a mou e)qroh/qh e)p' au)to/n LXX Ca.5.4; of fear, mh\ qroei=sqe Ev.Matt.24.6, cf. 2 Ep.Thess.2.2.
qromb-ei=on, Ion. qromb-h/i+on, to/, Dim. of qro/mbos, Nic.Al.295:—also qromb-i/on, to/, Dsc.Alex.25.

qrombo-eidh/s, e/s,
full of clots or
lumps, Hp.Mul.1.11,38.

qrombo/-omai, Pass.,
to become clotted, curdled, of blood, Nic.Al.315, Gal.18(1).33; of honey, Id.14.22.
contain clots, h)\n qrombwqe/wsin ai( mh=trai Hp.Mul.2.165; of the breasts, Dsc.Eup.1.128:—Act.,
cause to coagulate, only as v.l. in Sch.Nic.Th.709.

qro/mb-os, o(, (tre/fw, te/trofa)
lump, Hdt.1.179;
clot of blood, A. Ch.533, al., Pl.Criti.120a, etc.; xolh=s Hp.Morb.2.75; of milk,
curd, ai)gw=n a)po/rrous q. Antiph.52.8; qro/mboi a(lw=n
coarse salt, Suid.
drop, qro/mboi ai(/matos katabai/nontes . . Ev.Luc.22.44.
nipple, PLond.1821.42. q.: u(yhlo\s to/pos, Hsch.
qromb-w/dhs, es,= qromboeidh/s, ou)=ra Hp.Aph.4.69; a)froi/ S.Tr.702; spe/rmata Arist.HA582a31.

qro/mb-wsis, ews, h(,
becoming curdled, ai(/matos kai\ ga/laktos Dsc.5.13; ai(/matos Antyll. ap. Orib.7.7.9, cf. Gal.8.408, Lyd.Mens.4.116.
blocked vein, thrombosis, Cael.Aur.TP4.40.

qron-i/zomai, Pass.,
to be enthroned, LXXEs.1.2.
to be initiated, consecrated, tisi PMag.Lond.121.747.
qro/n-ion, to/, Dim. of qro/nos, EM456.28. part of the constellation Cassiopea, Ptol. Alm.8.2.
qron-i/s, i/dos, h(,= foreg.1, Them.Or.31.353d.

qron-ismo/s, o(,
enthronement, D.Chr.12.33, Man.4.104 (pl.).

qron-isth/s, ou=, o(,
enthroner, POxy.1380.251 (ii A.D.).

qron-i_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
throne-shaped, sunye/lion TAM2(1).210 (Sidyma).
qroni/tis: prw/tistos, Hsch.

qro/non, to/, only in pl. qro/na,
flowers embroidered on cloth, e)n de\ qro/na poiki/l' e)/passe Il.22.441, cf. Sch.Theoc.2.59, and v. tro/na.
herbs used as drugs and charms, Theoc.2.59, Nic.Th.493,936, Lyc. 674, Aglaïas7; used in sacrificial offering, UPZ96.4 (ii B.C.).

qronopoio/s, o/n,
making thrones or
seats, Poll.7.182.

qro/nos, o(,
seat, chair, Od.1.145, Ath.5.192e, PMasp.6 ii 63 (vi A.D.), etc.
throne, chair of state, q. basilh/i+os Hdt.1.14, cf. X. HG1.5.3, etc.; *zhno\s e)pi\ qro/non Theoc.7.93: metaph., Pl.R.553c: pl., e)n qro/nois h(/menoi A.Ch.975; e)k turanni/dos qro/nwn t' a)/i+ston e)kbalei=n Id.Pr.910; *dio\s qro/noi S.Ant.1041, cf. Ar.Av.1732;
king's estate or
dignity, skh=ptra kai\ qro/nous S.OC425, cf.448; [gh=s] kra/th te kai\ qro/nous ne/mw Id.OT237, cf. Ant.166, etc.; in the Prytaneum, tw=| [*)apo/llwni] q. e)celei=n IG12.78.
oracular seat of Apollo, E.IT1254, 1282 (both lyr.); mantikoi\ q. A.Eu.616, etc.
chair of a teacher, Pl. Prt.315c, Philostr.VS2.2, Lib.Ep.819, AP9.174（Pall.).
judge's bench, Plu.2.807b, Him.Ecl.10.9, 13.16. Astrol.,= u(/ywma, PMich. in Class.Phil.22.22(pl.).
favourable combination of planetary positions, Ptol.Tetr.51. a kind of
bread, Neanth.1 J. name of a lozenge, Paul.Aeg.3.42,7.12.

qro/nwsis, ews, h(,= qronismo/s,
enthronement of the newly initiated, at the mysteries of the Corybantes, Pl.Euthd.277d.

qro/os, Att. qrou=s, o(, (qre/omai)
noise as of many voices, ou) ga\r pa/ntwn h)=en o(mo\s q. Il.4.437; poet. of musical sounds, polu/fatos q. u(/mnwn Pi.N.7.81; q. au)lw=n Epic. ap. Plu.2.654f.
murmur of a crowd or assembly, Th.4.66, 8.79, D.H.6.57, etc.
report, rumour, X.Cyr.6.1.37, Plu.Galb.26, D.C.44.18.
qrose/ws, v. qrasu/s.
qru^all-i/dion, to/, Dim. of sq., Luc.Tim.14.

qru^all-i/s, i/dos, h(,
plantain, Plantago crassifolia, used for making wicks, Thphr.HP7.11.2, Nic.Th.899, BGU1118.15 (i B.C.).
wick, Ar.Ach.874,al., Philyll.26. khri/nh q. wax-
candle, Archipp.3D. = flo/mos, Ps.-Dsc.4.103, Plin.HN25.121.

qru/allon, to/,
shower of smuts from a distant bonfire, Vett.Val. 345.22.
qruari/s: yiasqh/s, Hsch. qruasmo/s: fwnh/, Id. (fort. qrulismo/s).
qru/bw, late form,= qru/ptw, Mich.in PN14.16.

qru_gona/w,
tap at, th\n qu/ran Ar.Ec.34 (v.l.trugon-, trugan-); perh. to be read in Pherecr.10: cf. qrugana=: kna=tai, cu/ei, Hsch., qrugona=n to\ cu/ein Theognost.Can.20.

qru/-i+nos [u^], h, on, （qru/on)
rushy, Anon. ap. Suid., dub. in PFlor. 383.28 (iii A.D.).

qru-i=tis, idos, h(,
planted with rush, gh= PFlor.64.22 (iv A.D.), etc.

qru_l-e/w, (qru=los)
make a confused noise, chatter, babble, th\n nu/kta qrulw=n kai\ lalw=n Ar.Eq.348; qrule/oimi trisyll., Theoc.2.142. c. acc.,
repeat over and over, qrulou=s' a(/ g' ei)pei=n h)/qelon E.El.910; ta\ toiau=ta oi( poihtai\ h(mi=n a)ei\ -ou=sin, o(/ti . . Pl.Phd.65b; ta\ muqw/dh . . , a\\ pa/ntes -ou=sin Isoc.12.237; o(\ pa/ntes e)qru/loun te/ws, dei=n . . D.1.7, cf. 19.156; [th\n trih/rh] qrulh/sei
will keep talking of it, Id.21.160: abs., kaqa/per pa/lai qrulw= Epicur.Nat.109 G.; peri\ a)gaqou= q. Id.Fr.423: c. inf., PSI5.452.20 (iv A.D.):—Pass.,
to be common talk, to\ -ou/menon, to\ . . pantaxou= q. E.Fr.285.1, cf. Isoc.Ep.6.7, Theopomp.Com.35, Antiph.246.2; to\ q. pote a)po/rrhton D.2.6; h( u(po\ pa/ntwn qruloume/nh ei)rh/nh Id.19.273; ta\ me\n palaia\ kai\ q. Anaxipp.1.4; peri\ teqrulhme/nou polloi=s Arist.Rh.1415a3; ai( teqr. kai\ koinai\ gnw=mai ib.1395a10; ta\ q. peri\ to\n ba/traxon Id.HA620b11; tinw=n lo/gwn u(po\ th=s mhtro/s mou qrulhsqe/ntwn (sic) UPZ144.45 (ii B.C.).

qru_/l-hma, atos, to/,
common talk, by-word, LXXJb.17.6.

qru_l-hth/s, ou=, o(,
babbler, Gloss.

qru_l-hto/s, h/, o/n,
generally talked of, Tz.H.12.36.

qru/l-igma [u_], atos, to/,
fragment, Lyc.880.

qrul-igmo/s or qrul-ismo/s, o(,
unmusical sound, false note, D.H.Comp.11; o(/tan au)lhth\s mh\ pie/sas to\ sto/ma qrulismo\n h)\ e)kmele/s ti au)lh/sh| Porph.in Harm. p.204 W.

qrul-i/zw,
make a false note, h.Merc.488 (qrual- codd.).

qru_li/ssw,
crush, shiver, smash, qruli/cas Lyc.487:—Pass., qruli/xqh de\ me/twpon Il.23.396.

qru=los, o(,
noise as of many voices, murmur, Batr.135, Orph.Fr. 286 (pl.,= Cat.Cod.Astr.2.199), Demetr.Lac.Herc.1786.1 F., Anon. ap.Suid.—This word and its cognates are written with one l in Papyri and best codd. (cf. Eust.1307.42), with ll (as Batr.l.c.) in inferior codd., also in PLips.40 ii 10 (iv A.D.).
qrumi/s: i)xqu\s poio/s, Hsch.

qru/mma, atos, to/, (qru/ptw)
that which is broken off, bit, Hp.Mul. 1.75, Ar.Fr.160, Aglaïas 20, Gal.6.343; r(oih=s qru/mmata AP6.232 (Crin.).

qrumma^ti/s, i/dos, h(,
a sort of cake, Antiph.183.4, Philox.2.18, Luc. Lex.6.
qrumneu/etai (qrhmn- cod.): u(perhfaneu/etai, Hsch.; cf. qru/ptw 11.2.

qru^o/-eis, essa, en,
rushy, Nic.Th.200.
qru^o-ka/la^mos [ka^], o(,= qru/on 1, BGU890 i 20.

qru^o-kope/w,
cut rushes, PLond.1.131.80 (i A.D.), POxy.910.40 (ii A.D., Pass.).

qru^o-kopi/a, h(,
cutting of rushes, PLond. 3.1171.58 (i B.C.), POxy.1628.18 (i B.C.).

qru/on [u^], to/,
reed, rush, Il.21.351, Hp.Steril.246, Thphr.HP4.11.12, Arist.Mir.844a27: in sg. collectively, e)/pleken Call.Aet.3.1.24, cf. D.S.3.10, Theoc.13.40 (pl.), AP9.723 (Antip. Sid.); [gh=n] kaqara\n a)po\ qru/ou (Pap. qroi/ou) PTeb.105.26 (ii B.C.), POxy.910.41 (ii A.D.): pl. written qroi/a UPZ98.12 (ii B.C.). = stru/xnon maniko/n,
thornapple, Datura Stramonium, Orph.A.916, Thphr.HP9.11.6 (qru/oron, bru/oron codd.), Dsc.4.73.

qru^o-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
rush-seller, PLond.1.125.39 (iv A.D.).

qru^o-pw/lion, to/,
rush-seller's shop, UPZ12.13 (ii B.C.).

qru^o-ti/llw,
pluck rushes, PLond.1.131.80 (i A.D., an incorrect formation).
qru/ptakon: kla/sma a)/rtou (Cret.), Hsch.

qrupte/on,
one must crumble, Aët.9.12 (s.v.l.).

qruptiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to break or
crush, li/qwn Dsc.1.121, cf. Gal.8.409. Pass.,
easily broken: metaph.,
delicate, effeminate, X. Cyr.8.8.15 (Comp.), Mem.1.2.5; sw/mata cj. in Max.Tyr.10.2; q. ti prosfqe/ggesqai D.C.51.12. Adv. -kw=s Ael.NA2.11, Poll.6.185.
saucy, pro\s tou\s e)rasta/s Ael.VH3.12.

qru/ptw, aor. 1 e)/qruya （e)n-) Hp.Mul.1.75:—Pass. and Med., fut. qrufqh/somai Arr.An.4.19.2; qru/yomai Ar. (v. infr. 11.2c), Luc.Symp. 4: aor. 1 e)qru/fqhn Arist. de An.419b26, (u(p-) dub. in AP5.293.15 (Agath.): aor. 2 e)tru/fhn [u^] （di-) Il.3.363, e)qru/bhn Dsc.5.123: pf. te/qrummai Hp.Vict.2.48: (akin to qrau/w):—
break in pieces, break small, Pl.Cra.426e, A.Ag.1595; *nei=los bw/laka q. Theoc.17.80:—Pass.,
to be broken small, qru/ptesqai kermatizo/menon a)na/gkh pa=n to\ o)/n Pl. Prm.165b, cf. AP12.61; xio/nos ta\ ma/lista qrufqhso/mena Arr.l.c.; of dried leguminous seeds,
split, Thphr.HP8.11.3, cf. Sens.51; of air,
to be dispersed, Arist.de An.l.c., Theo Sm.p.50 H.: the literal sense is more common in compds. a)po-, diaqru/ptw, etc. metaph. in moral sense,
enfeeble, esp. by debauchery and luxury, q. ta\n yuxa/n Ti.Locr.103b;
corrupt, [tina] Pl.Lg.778a, Phld.Mus.p.79K.; q. ta\s yuxa\s kai\ ta\ sw/mata Jul.Or.1.10c; [oi( ko/lakes] a)poknai/ousi tw=n kolakeuome/nwn ta\ w)=ta qru/ptontes Ph.1.453; q. e(auto/n,= qru/ptesqai (v. infr.), Ael.Ep.9. more freq. in Pass., with fut. Med.,
to be enervated, unmanned, malaki/a| qru/ptesqai X.Smp.8.8; a(palo/s te kai\ teqrumme/nos Luc.Charid.4; qru/ptetai h( o)/yis
is enfeebled, Plu.2.936f; oi( teqrumme/noi ta\s o)/yeis
weak-sighted people, A.D.Synt.199.5.
wanton, riot, o(/lhn e)kei/nhn eu)fro/nhn e)qru/pteto f.l. in [S.]Fr.1127.9, cf. Luc.Pisc.31, Anach.29;
display moral weakness, POxy.471.80 (ii A.D.); h(donai=s a)na/ndrois q. Plu.2.751b; e)pi\ tw=| ka/llei Phld.Hom.p.55 O.; o)/mma qrupto/menon a
languishing eye, AP5.286.8 (Agath.).
to be coy and prudish, bridle up, esp. when asked a favour, qru/yomai Ar.Eq.1163; w(ra|zome/nh kai\ qruptome/nh Eup.358; a(bra\ kai\ q. Charito 5.3; e)qru/pteto w(s ou)k e)piqumw=n le/gein Pl.Phdr.228c, cf. 236c, X.Smp.8.4; or when one
pretends to decline an offer, Plu.Mar.14, Ant.12; qru/ptesqai pro/s tina
give oneself airs to ward him, Id.Flam.
18, Luc.DMeretr.12.1.
grow conceited, tini
in or
of a thing, AP 7.218.2 (Antip. Sid.); e)sqh=ti polutelei= Ael.VH1.19, etc.;
brag, Hld. 2.10.
qruse/linon, to/, an umbelliferous plant, Plin.HN25.141.
qru/sios, o(,= qru/on, EM 456.31:—written qru/sis, Sch.D Il.21.351. qru/ska, ta/, glossed by a)/gria la/xana, Hsch.

qru/yis, ews, h(,
breaking in small pieces, ou)/te . . ei)/h a)\n a)/peiros h( q. Arist.GC316b30;
dispersion, h( q. tou= a)e/ros Id.de An.419b23; coupled with dia/lusis, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.173.
softness, weakness, sw/matos Plu.Dem.4: esp. metaph.,
debauchery, X.Cyr.8.8.16, Plu.Lyc. 14: pl., Id.2.732e.
daintiness, ko/mhs ib.693b; q. (cj. for tri/yis） e)pikrati/dwn Hp.Praec.10.
qru/yixos, = qruptiko/s, Theognost.Can.20, Hsch.

qruyi/xrws, wtos, o(, h(,
of delicate skin, Hsch.

qru^w/dhs, es, (qru/on)
full of rushes, rushy, Str.8.3.24, Sch.Il.11.155.
qrw=nac, akos, o(, Lacon. for khfh/n, Hsch. qrw/ptei: skw/ptei, Id

qrw=sis, ews, h(,
cord, line, Theognost.Can.20, Hsch.

qrw/|skw (so in Alc.Supp.12.9, but qrw/skw Did. ap. Hdn.Gr.2.522), Il.13.589, A.Ch.846, Eu.660: Ep. impf. qrw=|skon Il.15.314: fut. qorou=mai, Ion. 3pl. qore/ontai （u(per-) 8.179, cf. A.Supp.873 (lyr.): aor. e)/qoron （e)k-) Il.7.182, etc., Ep. qo/ron Il. (v. infr. 2), Hes.Sc.321, subj. qo/rw Od. 22.303; inf. qorei=n （a)na-) X.Lac.2.3, Ion. qore/ein （u(per-) Il.12.53; later e)/qrwca （a)n-) Opp.H.3.293: pf. part. fem. teqorui/hs prob. in Antim.65: (cf. qoro/s: for the form cf. blw/skw):—poet. Verb,
leap, spring, xama=ze qorw/n Il.10.528; e)k di/froio 8.320; a)po\ le/ktroio Od.23.32; i)xqu\s qrw/|skwn kata\ ku=ma Il.21.126; of arrows, a)po\ neurh=fi d' o)i+stoi\ qrw=|skon 15.314, cf. 470, 16.773; of beans
tossed from the winnowing shovel, a)po\ ptuo/fin qrw/|skwsin ku/amoi 13.589; of the oar, S.OC718 (lyr.). folld. by Prep.,
leap upon, assault, e)pi\ *trw/essi qo/ron Il.8.252, cf. 15.380; ei)/s tina A.R.1.1296; plhsi/on tino/s E.Or.257 (in this sense Hom. always uses aor.); of a recurring illness,
attack, S.Tr.1028 (lyr.).
rush, dart, Pi.P.9.119; pedi/on
over the plain, E.Ba.873 (lyr.); do/mous
to the house, S.Tr.58: metaph., lo/goi peda/rsioi qrw/|skousi
leap up into air, i.e.
melt away, A.Ch.846. trans.,= qo/rnumai,
mount, impregnate, knw/dala Id.Fr.15; o( qrw/|skwn
the sire, Id.Eu.660; cf. qoro/s, qorh/.

qrwsmo/s ( qrw|smo/s Apollon. ap. Hdn.Gr.2.522), o(,
springing; of
ground rising from the plain, e)pi\ qrwsmw=| pedi/oio Il. -0.160, 11.56; potamoi=o A.R.2.823 (pl.).
qrw/ssei: genna=|, fobei=tai, Hsch.
qu/a, h(,= qu/on 1, Thphr.HP5.3.7.

qua/ktas, a, o(,
sacrificing priest, IG4.757 B (Troezen, ii B.C.).
qua/lhma, v. quh/lhma. qualo/n: to\ qutoi=s dialabei=n, qumia=sai, Hsch. qua/mata: to\ qu/mon, kai\ qumia/mata, Id.
quani/a, h(, prob. f.l. for u(ani/a, Dor. for u(hn-, Epich.148.
quw/nhn (q. v.), e)sti\ de\ pe/mma a)nti\ boo/s, Hsch.
qu/aros, o(,= ai)=ra 11, Ps.-Dsc.2.100.
qu^a/<r>pac, a^gos, o(, h(,= i(ero/sulos, Hsch.

qua/s, a/dos, h(, （qu/w） = quia/s (q. v.).
attack, pleurwni/as Mich. in PN30.20. qu/as: phdh/sas, Hsch.; cf. qu/asse: e)ph/dhse, Cyr.

qu^afo/ros, o(,
thurifer, SIG1025.52 (Cos, iv/iii B.C.).

qua/w,
rut, of swine, Arist.HA546a27, 573b7.
*qubria/s, a/dos, h(,= *qumbria/s, IG14.1389i1.
qu^ga^terei/+s, i/dos, h(,= qugatridh=, Inscr.Magn.196.9.

qu^ga/thr [a^], h(, gen. quga^te/ros contr. qugatro/s; dat. quga^te/ri, qugatri/; acc. quga^te/ra Ep. qu/gatra Il.1.13; voc. qu/ga^ter: nom. pl. qugate/res, Ep. and lyr. qu/gatres 9.144, Sapph.Supp.20a.16: gen. pl. -te/rwn IG22.832.19, Pl.R.461c, poet. -trw=n: dat. pl. -tra/si Ep. -te/ressi Il.15.197; both sets of forms are found in poetry, qugatro/s, -tri/, -tra/si are used in Prose:—
daughter, Il.9.148,290, Od.4.4, etc.; qu/gatres i(/ppwn, of mules, Simon.7; q. tau/rwn, of bees, Philo Tars. ap. Gal.13.269: metaph., *moisa=n qugate/res, of Odes, Pi.N.4.3; pla/stigc h( xalkou= q. Critias 1.9D.; q. *seilhnou=, of the vine, Jul. Caes.25; yh/fou sumbolikh=s q., of a la/gunos, AP6.248 (Marc. Arg.); of villages dependent on a city, LXXJd.1.27, 1 Ma.5.8. later,
maidservant, slave, Phalar.Ep.142.3. [u_ in Ep. in the longer forms, metri gr.] (Cf. Skt.
duhitár-, Engl.
daughter, etc.)

qu^gatr-i^dh=, h(,
daughter's daughter, granddaughter, And.1.128, Lys.32.2, D.H.Lys.21: uncontr. nom. pl. qu^gatr-de/ai Euph.94.2.

qu^gatr-i^dou=s, ou=, o(,
daughter's son, grandson, Is.8.17, Arist.Fr.473, Ph.2.82,425, OGI529.23 (Sebastopolis): acc. -dh=, as though from nom. -deu/s, ib. 377.5 (Smyrna, i A.D.):—Ion. qu^gatr-ide/os Hdt.5.67, 69.

qu^gatr-i/zw,
call one daughter, Araros 7.

qu^ga/tr-ion, to/, Dim. of quga/thr,
little daughter or
girl, Stratt.63, Men.428, PPetr.3p.155 (iii B.C.), Macho ap.Ath.13.581c, Com.Adesp.14.19 D., SIG364.55 (Ephesus, iii B.C.), Plu.Ant. 33, Jul.Or.7.226b.

qu^gatro/-ga^mos, on,
married to one's own daughter, Nonn.D. 12.73.

qu^gatro-go/nos, on,
begetting or
bearing daughters, ib.7.212, al.

qu^gatro-qete/w,
adopt as daughter, Tz.ad Lyc.183 (Pass.).

qu^gatro-mici/a, h(,
incest with a daughter, POxy.237 vii 26 (ii A.D.).

qu^gatro-poii/a, h(,
adoption of a daughter, GDI3706 vi 61 (Cos):—written qu^gatro-poi/a, IG 12(1).818 (Rhodes).

qu^gatro-poio/s, o/n,
begetting daughters, of Lot, Ph.1.382.

qu^gatro/-teknon, to/,
a daughter's child, Tz.H.1.595.

qu^ei/a, Ion. qu^gatro-ei/h Nic.Th.91: h(:—
mortar, Ar.Nu.676, Ra.124, al., Lys.Fr.62a.
cup of the cottabus, Pl.Com.46.3.—Later qui/a, qui/+a, Ph.Bel.88.49, Dsc.2.76.3 and 4; in the sense of
oil-press, PFay.42（
a） i 10(ii A.D.): qui/h [i^], Androm. ap. Gal.14.41: quei=on, to/, PLond.2.193.23 (ii A.D.). qu/eia, v. qui/a 1.
qu^ei/dion, to/, Dim. of quei/a, Ar.Pl.710; wrongly written qui/+dion in cod. Rav., as in Damocr. ap. Gal.14.118.

qu/ell-a [u^], h(, （qu/w, cf. a)/ella from a)/hmi)
hurricane, squall (cf. Arist.Mu.395a6), kakh\ a)ne/moio Il.6.346, al.; misgome/nwn a)ne/mwn . . q. Od.5.317; puro/s t' o)looi=o qu/ellai, prob.
thunderstorms, 12.68; kou/ras a)ne/lonto q. 20.66; tou\s d' ai)=y' a(rpa/casa fe/ren po/ntonde q. 10.48, cf. S.El.1151; ponti/a q. Id.OC1660; in similes, flogi\ i)=soi h)e\ que/llh| Il. 13.39; i)/keloi puri\ h)e\ q. Hes.Sc.345: metaph., a)/ths qu/ellai (nisi leg. quhlai/, q. v.) A.Ag.819; o)xlikh\ q. Phld.Rh.1.184S.
que/ll-eios, a, on,= sq., strofa/ligges Orac. ap. Suid.s.v. *)iouliano/s.

quell-h/eis, essa, en,
stormy, Nonn.D.1.22, 2.532.
quell-i/zw, pf. part. Pass. -isme/non （-qulliame/non cod.): tetaragme/non, Hsch.

qu^ello/-pous, o(, h(, gen. podos,
storm-footed, storm-swift, Nonn.D. 37.441.

qu^ello-to/kos, on,
producing storms, ib.28.277.

qu^ello-fore/omai, Pass.,
to be carried by a storm, D.S.16.80.

qu^ellw/dhs, es,
stormy, Sch.S.Ant.418.

*qu^e/steios, a, on,
of Thyestes, r(a/kh Ar.Ach.433; dei=pnon Porph.Chr. 69.

qu^e/sths, ou, o(,
pestle, Dionys.Trag.12.

qu/-eston, to/,
drink made from bruised spices, Hsch.:
qu-euto/s: o( e)c o)/mbrwn potamo/s, dub. l. in Theognost.Can.20.

qu^-h/eis, essa, en, (qu/os)
smoking with incense, fragrant, Ep. epith. of bwmo/s, Il.8.48, Od.8.363, Hes.Th.557; spa/rgana h.Merc.237.
qu^-hko/os, o(,= quosko/os, Hsch.; cf. quhxo/os.
qu^-hle/omai, = qule/omai, prob. in Poll.1.27.

qu^-hlh/, h(, (qu/w)
part of a victim offered in burntsacrifice, usu. in pl., o( d' e)n puri\ ba/lle quhla/s Il.9.220, cf. Philoch.172, Nic.Fr.62, Ath.13.566a: generally,
sacrifice, a)/neu quhlw=n Ar.Av.1520; quhlai\ a)nai/maktoi AP6.324.3 (Leon. Alex.); qusi/ai kai\ q. D.S.3.62, Porph.Abst.2.59: metaph., quhlh\ *)/areos
an offering to Ares, i.e. the blood of the slain, S.El.1423; a)/ths quhlai/ cj. Herm. for qu/ellai, A. Ag.819; cf. qua/lhma, qu/lhma.

qu^-h/lhma, atos, to/,
sacrificial offering, Thphr.Char.10.13:—Ion. qualh/mata SIG57.38 (Milet., v B.C.); cf. qu/lhma.
qu^/-hma, atos, to/, (qu/w) = foreg., in pl., Tim.Lex.:= a)rw/mata, Hp. ap. Erot.

qu^hpol-e/w,
perform sacrifices, A.Ag.262, E.Tr.330 (lyr.), Pl.R. 364e, Polystr.p.9 W.; qeoi=s E.El.665. trans.,
sacrifice, ge/ras bro/teion tw=| *kro/nw| q. S.Fr.126, cf. 522, Maiist.13:—Pass., quhpolei=tai d' a)/stu ma/ntewn u(/po
is filled with sacrifices by them, E.Heracl. 401.

qu^hpol-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
sacrificing, A.R.1.1124, AP5.16 (Gaet.), D.H.1.21, Hld.3.2, prob. in Puchstein Epigr.Gr.36 (pl., Nubia): generally,
mystic rites, Orph.A.470.

qu^hpol-iko/s, h/, o/n,
sacrificial, pu=r, me/ros, Iamb.Myst.5.11,18; qesmo/s Zos.4.59.

qu^hpo/l-ion, to/,
altar, Dorieus ap.Ath.10.413a:—also qu^hpol-ei=on, to/, Rev.Ét.Gr.19.234 (Aphrodisias).

qu^hpo/los, on, also h, on Suid., (tele/w, te/llw)
performing sacrifices, sacrificial, xei/r A.Pers.202: Subst.,
diviner, soothsayer, E.IA746, Ar.Pax1124;
priest, *eu)mo/lpoio IG3.1337.9, cf. Phld.D.1.4; ai( q. parqe/noi, of the Vestal Virgins, D.H.2.64, al.

qu/[h]sis [u^], ews, h(,
sacrifice, IG5(2).514 (Lycosura, nisi leg. qu/[w]sis).

quhta/ [u^], ta/,
fumigations, Aret.CD1.4, CA2.10.

qu^h-fa/gos [a^], on,
devouring offerings, flo/c A.Ag.597.
qu^h-xo/os, contr. qu^h-xou=s, o(,= quhko/os, IG12.372.203, 3.244, Eust.1601.3.

qui/a, h(,
odorous cedar, Juniperus foetidissima, Thphr.HP1.9.3, 4.1.3; or qu/eia, ib.3.4.2,6. = qu/on 1 (q. v.), Dsc.1.26. v. quei/a.
*qui=a, ta/, (qu/w) festival of Dionysus at Elis, Paus.6.26.1.
*qui=ai, ai(,= *quia/des, Str.10.3.10, prob. l. for *quia/sin, S.Ant.1151 (lyr.).

quia/s, a/dos, h(:—written qua/s Tim.Fr.3, A.Th.498 cod. Med.: (qu/w):—
inspired, possessed woman, esp. Bacchante, ll. cc., cf. A.Th. 836, Supp.564 (both lyr.), Plu.2.293f, etc.; cf. foreg. fem. Adj.,
frantic, mad for love, Lyc.143.
qui/+di^on, v. quei/dion.
qui+o/en: plh=res, and qui+o/entes: a)nqou=ntes, Hsch.

qui=on, to/,
resin, Thphr.HP5.2.1.

*qui=os, o( (sc. mh/n), name of a month in Thessaly and Boeotia, IG 9(2).109b57 (Halus), 7.341, etc.; in Naupactus, ib.9(1).357:—also *qu=os, ib.9(2).515.3 (Larissa), al.:—Boeot. *qou/ios or *qiou/ios, ib.7.517,3172.116.
quio/w, aor. part. Pass. quiwqei/s: manei/s, o(rmh/sas, Hsch.
qu^i/+s, i=dos （-i/+dos codd.), h(,= quei/a, Damocr. ap. Gal.14.130.

qu^i/+skh, h(,
censer, LXX 1 Ma.1.22, al., J.AJ3.6.8, 3.8.10:—qu^i/+skos, o(, v.l., ib.3.6.8:—also qu/skh, POxy.1657.13 (iii A.D.), Suid., EM 458.53: qu/skos, ib.52 (qu/kos cod.).

qu^i/+ths [i_] (sc. li/qos), ou, o(,
an Ethiopian stone, Dsc.5.136, Gal. 12.198.

qui/w, = qu/w,
to be inspired, subj. qui/wsi h.Merc.560. = qu/w (B), Hes.Th.131 (Pap.), v.l. in A.R.3.755, Nic.Th.129.

qu_la/k-h [a^], h(,=
scrotum, Hippiatr.50.

qu_lak-i/zw,
collect scraps
in a wallet: hence, at Tarentum,
beg, Hsch.

qu_la/k-ion, to/, Dim. of qu/lakos, Hdt.3.105, Ar.V.314, Ra.1203 codd., PLille 10ii 14 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen.69.6 (iii B.C.).
seed-capsule, Sch.Nic. Th.852.
qu_lak-i/s, i/dos, h(, Dim. of qu/lakos,= qula/kion 11, Ael.NA6.43, Nic.Th.852.

qu_lak-i/skos, o(,= qula/kion 1,
bread-basket, Ar.Fr.545, Crates Com.14. = qula/kion 11, Dsc.2.106.

qu_lak-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,= sq., only fem. qulaki=tis mh/kwn the
common poppy (cf. qulaki/s), Dsc.4.64; q. na/rdos,= o)reinh\ n., Id.1.9.

qu_la^ko/-bolon,
verrutum Gloss.

qu_la^ko-eidh/s, e/s,
like a bag, Arist. HA543b13.
qu_la^ko/-eis, essa, en,= foreg., Nic.Al.403.

qu_la^ko/-omai, Pass.,
become a bag, Sch.Ar.Pax198.

qu/la^kos [u_], o(,
