sack, esp. to carry meal in, Hdt.3.46; a)/lfit' ou)k e)/nestin e)n tw=| qula/kw| Ar.Pl.763; q. dorkade/wn a)straga/lwn PCair.Zen. 69.18 (iii B.C.); derw= se qu/lakon I'll make
a bag of your skin, Ar.Eq. 370; contemptuous word for a garment, o( *thlau/gous q. prob. in Aeschin.Socr.42: metaph., of a person, q. tis lo/gwn 'wind-bag', Pl.Tht.161a; th=| xeiri\ dei=n spei/rein, a)lla\ mh\ o(/lw| tw=| q. Corinn. ap. Plu. 2.348a.
sack in which the eggs of the tunny are enveloped, Arist. HA571a14, cf. 552b19. in pl., slang term for the
loose trousers of Persians and other Orientals, E.Cyc.182, Ar.V.1087.
ball used for physical exercise, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.32.12.

qu_la^ko-trw/c, w=gos, o(, h(,
gnawing sacks, Hsch., Hdn.Gr.2.37.

qu_la^ko-fore/w,
carry a sack or
pouch, Ar.Fr.789.

qu_la^ko-fo/ros, on,
carrying a bag, name for prospectors, Hsch., Phot.
qu_la^kw/dhs, es,= qulakoeidh/s, Thphr.HP3.7.3, Dsc.1.90, Mnesith. Cyz. ap. Orib.inc.15.8.
qu=lac, a^kos, o(,= qu/lakos, Arcesil.Com.1 D., Aesop.15;= proskefa/laion, Hsch.; cited fr. Hom. by Poll.10.172; cj. in Sor.1.57.
qu_la/s, a/dos, h(,= foreg., v. ou)la/s.

qu_l-e/omai,
offer in sacrifice, a)lfi/twn o)li/gas dra/kas Porph.Abst.2.17; quhlh/sasqai shd. be read in Poll.1.27.

qu_/l-hma, atos, to/,
that which is offered: mostly in pl., qulh/mata,
cakes, incense, etc., Ar.Pax 1040, Thphr.Fr.97.3, Pherecr.23.6, Telecl.33, Porph.Abst.2.6, 29; cf. qua/lhma, quh/lhma. (Cf. qu/os, qu/w (A), Lett.
dūlēt 'smoke (bees)', Lat.
fuligo.) [u_, Pherecr. l.c.]
qu/lla: kla/dous h)\ fu/lla, h)\ e(orth\ *)afrodi/ths, Hsch.:—hence *qullofo/ros, title of Dionysus at Cos, SIG1012.7 (ii/i B.C.).
qulli/s, i/dos, h(, -qu/lakos, Hdn.Gr.1.89, Hsch. qu/lon: o)le/qrion (leg. ou)=lon), Id.

qu=ma, atos, to/, (qu/w A)
victim, sacrifice, SIG56.31 (Argos, v B.C.), A. Ag.1310, S.Ph.8,Ar.Av.901, Wilcken Chr.1 iii 3 (iii B.C.), etc.; to\ q. tou= *)apo/llwnos Th.5.53; q. qu/ein, qu/sasqai, Pl.Plt.290e, R.378a, etc.; usu. of animals, but pa/gkarpa q.
offerings of all fruits, S.El.634; <a(gna\> q., opp. i(erei=a, expld. by Sch. as
cakes in the form of animals, Th.1.126, cf. Pl.Lg.782c, Poll.1.26: prov., q. *delfo/n 'Barmecide's feast', Call.Iamb.1.98. pl., of
animals slaughtered for food, LXX Ge.43.16. metaph., of persons, q. leu/simon, prob. of Clytemnestra, A.Ag.1118 (lyr.); pro/keisqe qu/mata th=s h(mete/ras e)cousi/as Hdn.2.13.5.
act of sacrifice, w(=d' h)=n ta\ kei/nhs q. S.El.573. [qu^ma only Supp.Epigr.2.518 (Rome, iv A.D.), cf. Hdn.Gr.2.15.]

qu_ma/groikos, on,
of clownish spirit, Ar.Fr.790.
qumade/wn, Dor. for -hde/wn,= a)qumw=n (scr. eu)q-), Hsch.

qu_m-ai/nw, Ep.impf. qumai/neskon A.R.3.1326: (qumo/s):—
to bewroth, angry, Hes.Sc.262, Ar.Nu.610; tini
at one, ib.1478, Eup.191.

qu_m-algh/s, e/s, (a)lge/w)
heart-grieving, xo/los Il.4.513; lw/bh 9.387, Od.20.285; mu=qos, e)/pos, 8.272, 16.69, Hdt.1.129; me/rmhrai IG14.1942.11. Pass.,
inly grieving, [kardi/a] A.Ag.1031 (lyr.).
qu^mali/s, v.l. for tiqu/mallos in Nic.Th.617.

qu/mallos, o(, an unknown
fish, Ael.NA14.22.

qu_ma/lwy [a^], wpos, o(,
piece of burning wood or
charcoal, Ar.Ach.321, Th.729, Stratt.55, Luc.Lex.24. (tu/fw: for the termin., cf. ai(ma/lwy.)

qumamorga/s: h( no/sos (Eretr.), Hsch. qu_mantiko/s, h/, o/n,=
animosus, Gloss.:
qu_m-a/ntria, h(, dub. sens., fasga/nwn q. PMag.Par.1.2267.
quma/restos, gloss on qumarh/s, Apollon.Lex.

qu_ma_r-e/w,
to be well-pleased, Theoc.26.9.

qu_ma_r-h/s, e/s, (qumo/s, a)rari/skw)
suiting the heart, i.e.
well-pleasing, delightful, a)/loxon qumare/a Il. 9.336, Od.23.232; skh=ptron q. e)/dwken 17.199: irreg. acc. quma/rhn o)/lbon IG14.433 (Tauromenium):—also qumh/rhs, es (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.2.65, al.), Hom. only in neut. as Adv., qumh=res kera/sasa Od.10.362: as Adj., e)/pos A.R.1.705; e(tai=rai Mosch.2.29: also in later Prose, Luc.Am.43, Hdn.8.5.9: Comp., LXXWi.3.14: Sup., Ph.2.36, Sch.Nic.Al.577, and in form qumere/statos (sic) BCH27.330（Bithynia). Adv. -h/rws Heph.Astr.3.11.
qu_ma/rmenos, on,= foreg., te/ras B.16.71, cf. Nic.Al.577, Call.Dian. 167.
qu/marnon, to/,= i(ppoma/raqon, Ps.-Dsc.3.71.
qu_ma/tion, to/, Dim. of qu=ma, Gloss.
qumati=tis, idos, h(,= penta/fullon, v.l. in Ps.-Dsc.4.42.

qu/mbra, h(, (perh. from tu/fw)
savory, Satureia Thymbra, Eup.14.5, Thphr.CP3.1.4, Dsc.3.37, Plin.HN19.165:—also qumbrai/a, h(, Hp. ap.Gal.19.104 (but qu/mbrh or -i/hn Nat.Mul.32 codd.).

qumbrepi/deipnos, on,
supping on bitter herbs, i.e.
living poorly, Ar. Nu.421.

*qu/mbris, idos, h(, name of several rivers, esp.
the Tiber, AP9.352 (Leon. Alex.), D.P.352 sq.; cf. *qubria/s.

qumbri/ths [i_] oi)=nos, o(, wine
flavoured with savory, Dsc.5.50.
qu/mbron, to/,= qu/mbra, Thphr.HP7.1.2, Sch.Ar.Ach.253.

qumbrofa/gos [a^], on,
eating savory, qumbrofa/gon ble/pein to look
as if one had eaten savory, 'make a
verjuice face', Ar.Ach.254.

qumbrw/dhs, es,
like savory, Thphr.HP6.7.5.

qu^melai/a, h(, prob.
spurge-flax, Daphne Cnidium, Dsc.4.172, Plin. HN13.114:—hence qu_ma_r-ai/+ths [i_] oi)=nos, o(, wine
flavoured with qumelai/a, Dsc.5.68.

qu^me/l-h, h(, (qu/w A) prop.
place of burning, hearth, qume/lai oi)/kwn E.Rh. 234 (lyr.), cf. A.Supp.669 (lyr.); *kuklw/pwn qume/lai E.IA152 (anap.); but usu. of
sacrificial hearths or
altars, deci/puroi qew=n q. Id.Supp.64 (lyr.); a( *foi/bou q. Id.Ion114 (lyr.), cf. 46, al.; *(esti/a, di/dou . . a)mfi\ sa\n q. xoreu/ein Aristonous 2.17; also of
braziers, qume/lai e)pi/tnanto xrush/latoi E.El.713 (lyr.); h( q. tou= bwmou= the surface on which fire was kindled, IG11(2).161A95 (Delos, iii B.C.). esp. of the
altar of Dionysus which stood in the orchestra of the theatre, *dionusia\s q. Pratin.Lyr.1.2, cf.EM743.37, etc.: hence in later writers, the
orchestra, Phryn. 142, Sch.AristId.p.536 D.: hence of the chorus, opp. actors, qume/lh|si kai\ e)n skhnh=|si teqhlw/s, of Sophocles, AP7.21 (Simm.); cf. sq. the
stage, Phryn.PSp.74 B., EM653.8, etc. (hence generally,
platform, stage, Plu.Alex.67); so o( a)po\ th=s q., of a dramatic poet, Id.Demetr. 12, etc.; w(/sper e)k q., i.e. theatrical, Id.2.405d; actuarii thymelae equorumque currulium, Cod.Theod.8.7.21. ai( e)th/sioi q. annual
stage-performances, Alciphr.2.3, cf. POxy.1143.3 (i A.D.), IG 14.2342. of the qo/los at Epidaurus (containing a
hearth or
altar), ib.4.1485B162. = qulh/mata, Pherecr.214.

qu^mel-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
belonging to the thymele, theatrical, qe/ai, a)/nqrwpoi, Plu.Fab.4, Sull.36; q. e)/ris Com.Adesp.57; to\ q.
theatrical, vulgar style, Plu.2.853b; of performances of music, dancing, etc.,
in the orchestra (cf. foreg. 11.b); q. a)gw/n SIG457.1 (Thespiae, iii B.C.), cf. D.S.4.5, CIG 3493.11（Thyatira), etc.; q. a)kroa/mata Corn.ND30; oi( q.
the musicians, opp. oi( skhnikoi/, the actors, Plu.Cat.Mi.46; opp. u(pokritai/, Ptol. Tetr.180 (but later of
actors, Jul.Ep.89b, Cod.Just.1.4.14); h( q. su/nodos the company of q., IG22.1350, OGI713, etc.

qu^melo-poioi/, oi(,
board of curators of the qume/lh 111 at Epidaurus, IG4.1485B142: also dat. pl. -poi/ais (from qu^melo-poi/hs) ib.134, 139.

qu_m-hgere/wn, (qumo/s, a)gei/rw)
gathering breath, collecting oneself, Od. 7.283.

qu_m-hde/w, Dor. qu_m-a_de/w (q.v.),
to be glad-hearted, Semon.7.103; e)pi/ tini Hld.10.3.

qu_m-hdh/s, e/s, (h)=dos)
well-pleasing, dear, xrh/mata Od.16.389; no/stoio te/los A.R.1.249; ta\ lw=|sta kai\ ta\ -e/stata A.Supp.962; pai=das Epigr.Gr.403.7 (Sebastopolis); q. a)naqumia/seis cj. for qumw/deis in Herod.Med. ap. Orib.10.40.1. -hdi/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
gladness of heart, rejoicing, Eup.161, Call.Fr.2 P., Plu.2.713d, Aret. SD1.5, Chor.in Rev.Phil.1.225: pl., Ph.2.548, Luc.Abd.5, D.C.47.1.
qu_m-h/rhs, v. qumarh/s.
qu_mi/a, Ion. -ih, h(,= qumi/ama, -i/h|si kakw/desi Aret.SD2.11.
qu_mi-a/zw,= -ia/w, Gp.12.8.8.
qu_mi-ai/nw,= -ia/w, Gloss.

qu_mi/-a_ma, Ion. qu_mi/-hma, atos, to/,
incense, Hdt.1.198, Amphis 27, PTeb.112.22 (ii B.C.), Phld.Vit.p.37J.; name of a particular kind (perh.= a)mmwniako/n), Edict.Diocl, in *)aqhna= 18.6 (Tegea): usu. in pl.,
fragrant stuffs for burning, Hdt.2.130, 7.54, S.OT4, Ar.Av.1716, Pl.R.373c, IG5(2).514 (Lycosura), Apoc.5.8; -ia/mata e(rpetw=n
fumigations, Philum.Ven. 6 tit.
stuff for embalming, Hdt.2.86, 4.71.

qu_mi/-a_sis, ews, h(,
fumigating, Dsc.1.98, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.19.1.
passing off in fumes, Arist.Mete.387a30; tw=n a)po\ gh=s Porph.Abst.2.5.

qu_mi-a_te/on,
one must fumigate, Gp.6.10, Paul.Aeg.6.75.

qu_mi-a_teu/w,
fumigate, th\n e)kklhsi/an Sch.Aeschin.1.23.

qu_mi-a_th/rion, Ion. qumiht-, to/,
censer, Hdt. 4.162, Th.6.46, And.4.29, POxy.521.19 (ii A.D.), etc.
vessel for fumigation, Aë.9.41. name of the constellation Ara, Eudox. ap.Hipparch.1.11.6, Ptol.Tetr.28, etc.

qu_mi-a_ti/zw,= qumia/w, Gp.6.13.3:—Med., ib.6.12.1 qu_mi-a_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
good for burning as incense, sw/mata Pl.Ti.61c.
qu_mi-a_tri/s, i/dos, h(,= qumiath/rion, Dam.Isid.188.
qu_mi/-atron, to/, = foreg., SIG577.31 (Milet., iii/ii B.C.).

qu_mi-a/w, Ion.aor. e)qumi/hsa Hippon.92, Hdt.6.97:—Med., Ion.fut. -h/somai Hp.Mul.2.126: aor. e)qumihsa/mhn ib.146, Nat.Mul.7 (but -asa/mhn Morb.2.27):—Pass., fut. -a_qh/somai Dsc.1.68.6: aor. e)qumia/qhn ib.5:—
burn so as to produce smoke, q. th\n stu/raka Hdt.3.107; libanwtou= trihko/sia ta/lanta Id.6.97; qumih/mata Id.8.99; liba/nou da/krua Pi.Fr.122.4: abs.,
burn incense, Hermipp.8, Men.Sam.264, LXX 4 Ki.22.17, al., OGI352.37 (ii B.C.), etc.; tini in honour of any one, Ath.7.289f:—Med., Ael. VH12.51:—Pass.,
to be burnt, [to\ spe/rma th=s kanna/bios] qumia=tai (v.l. -h=tai) Hdt.4.75; li/qos . . tequmiame/nos Ar.Fr.635;
pass off in fumes, Arist.Mete.362a11; qumiwme/nwn tinw=n Pl.Ti.66d.
smoke, fumigate, ti/ tini PMag.Par.1.2970:—Med., Hp.ll.cc.:—Pass., qumiw/menai me/lissai Arist.HA623b20. intr.,
smoke, a)/nqrakes qumiw=ntes Thphr.Ign.75.
qu_mi/dion, to/, Dim. of qumo/s, Ar.V.878.

qu^mi/zw,
taste of thyme, Archig. ap. Orib.8.1.32:—Pass.,
to be embittered, qumixqei/s: pikranqei/s, Hsch.

qu_miko/s, h/, o/n, (qumo/s)
high-spirited, of the dog, Arist.HA488b21: to\ a)/rren -w/teron Id.PA661b33: Sup., D.C.49.36. = qumoeidh/s 3, Pl.Def.415e, Arist.de An.432a25, Phld.Oec.p.33 J., Hierocl.in CA26p.480M.
irascible, Ath.2.38b; q. kai\ o)cu/qumoi oi( ne/oi Arist.Rh. 1389a9. Adv. -kw=s Plb.18.37.12: Comp. -w/teron Id.7.13.3, Cic.Att.10.11.5.

qu/minon [u^], to/ (sc. me/li),
honey made from thyme, Colum.6.33, Gloss., Apul.Herb.p.294 H.-S.

qu/mion, to/,= smi=lac, Dsc.Alex.12.
large wart, Hp.Ulc.14, Dsc.5.1, Plin.HN32.128.

qu^mi/ths [i_], ou, o(, （qu/mon)
flavoured with thyme, a(/les Ar.Ach.1099; oi)=nos Dsc.5.49.

qu_mo-ba^rh/s, e/s,
heavy at heart, AP7.146 (Antip. Sid.):—fem. qu_mo-ba/reia EM458.24.

qu_mo-bore/w,
gnaw, vex the heart, Hes.Op. 799.

qu_mo-bo/ros, on, (bibrw/skw, bora/)
eating the heart, qumobo/rw| e)/ridi Il.19.58, al.; lu/a Alc.Supp.23.10; *kh=res A.R.4.1666; th=s qumobo/rou fre/na lu/phs cj. for qumofqo/ron in A.Ag.103 (anap.).

qu_mo-da^kh/s, e/s,
biting the heart, q. ga\r mu=qos Od.8.185; za/lou ke/ntron AP9.77 (Antip. Thess.): in late Prose, mu=qoi Aret.CA1.1, cf. Jul.Or.2.
96a.

qu_mo-eidh/s, e/s,
high-spirited, to\ q. Hp.
Aër.12; opp. a)/qumos, Pl. R.456a; opp. o)rgi/los, ib.411c.
passionate, hot-tempered, opp. prau/+s, ib.375c. of horses,
mettled, X.Mem.4.1.3; opp. eu)peiqe/statos, Id.Smp.2.10: Comp., opp. blakwde/steros, Id.Eq.9.1. Philos., to\ q.
spirit, passion, opp. to\ logistiko/n, to\ e)piqumhtiko/n, Pl. R.440e, al., cf. D.L.3.67. Adv. -dw=s Hdn.4.3.3.

qu^mo/eis, essa, en,
thymy, Choeril.8.

qu_mo-katoxe/w,
nurse anger, cj. for qumw katoxounta in Epicur. Sent.Vat.62 (Rh.Mus.61.421).

qu_mo-ka/toxos, on,
restraining anger: neut. as Subst.,
spell for this purpose, PMag.Lond.121.941,
PMag. Osl.1.35. PMag.Par.1.467,831; q. pro\s basile/as PMag.Leid.W.6.38.
qu_mo-le/aina, h(, fem. of qumole/wn, AP5.299 (Paul. Sil.).

qu_mo-leontofqo/ros, on,
bold enough to slay a lion, PMasp.2iii22 (vi A.D.).

qu_mo-le/wn, ontos, o(,
lion-hearted, of Achilles, Il.7.228, Hes.Th.1007; of Ulysses, po/sin a)pw/lesa q. Od.4.724; of Hercules, 11.267, cf. Ar.Ra.1041 (anap.).
qu_mo-li^ph/s, e/s, （lei/pw） = lipo/qumos, Call.Fr.1.55P., Nonn.D. 37.540.

qu_mo/-mantis, ews, o(, h(,
prophesying from one's own soul, A.Pers. 224 (troch.); cf. qumo/sofos.

qu_mo-ma^xe/w,
to be angry, Plb.9.40.4; e)pi/ tini Id.27.8.4; pro/s tinas Plu.Demetr.22; tisi Act.Ap.12.20.
fight desperately, D.S.17.33;
contend obstinately, tini D.H.5.11.

qu_mo-ma^xi/a, h(,
desperate fight, Polyaen.2.1.19.

qu/mon [u^], to/, Arist.HA626b21, Pr.925a9, Thphr.HP6.2.3.: dual qu/mw Pherecr.167: pl., qu/ma Eup.14.5, Antiph.179.4: gen. qu/mwn Ar.Pl.283; qume/wn AP9.226.2 (Zonas):—also qu/mos, o(, Dsc.3.36:—
Cretan thyme, Thymbra capitata, ll.cc., Hp.Vict.2.54, al.; to\ mu/ron fa/skein ou)de\n tou= q. h(/dion o)/zein Thphr.Char.4.1. a marine plant, Id.HP4.7.2.
mixture of thyme with honey and vinegar, eaten by the poor of Attica, Ar.Pl.253, cf. 283, Antiph.226.7, Luc.Fug.14, Hsch.

qu^m-oc-a/lmh, h(,
drink of thyme, vinegar, and brine, Dsc.5.16.

qu_mo-plhqh/s, e/s,
wrathful, A.Th.686(lyr.).

qu_mo-poie/w,
hearten, encourage, to\ plh=qos Satyr.Vit.Eur.Fr.39iv31.

qu_mo-ra^i+sth/s, ou=, o(, (r(ai/w)
life-destroying, qa/natos Il.13.544, 16.414; dhi/+wn u(/po qumorai+ste/wn ib.591. (qu_mo-rrai/sths Glauc. ap. Sch.B Il.16.414.)
qu/mos (A), o(, v. qu/mon.

qu/mos [perh. u^] (B), o(,
warty excrescence, Hp.Alim.17, Dsc.2.28, Paul.Aeg.6.71; esp. in the anal or genital regions, Gal.7.731.
the thymus gland in the neck or breast of young animals, Ruf.Onom. 168, Gal.UP6.4.

qu_mo/s, o(,
soul, spirit, as
the principle of life, feeling and thought, esp.
of strong feeling and passion (rightly derived from qu/w (B) by Pl.Cra. 419e a)po\ th=s qu/sews kai\ ze/sews th=s yuxh=s): in physical sense,
breath, life, q. a)phu/ra, a)fele/sqai, e)cai/nusqai, o)le/sai, freq. in Hom., Il.6.17, 5.852, 155, 1.205: c. dupl. acc., a)/mfw q. a)phu/ra 6.17; e)pei/ ke . . r(eqe/wn e)k q. e(/lhtai 22.68; li/pe d' o)ste/a q. 12.386; a)po\ d' e)/ptato q. Od.10.163; o)li/gos d' e)/ti q. e)nh=en Il.1.593; mo/gis d' e)sagei/reto qumo/n 21.417; a)/yorro/n oi( q. e)ni\ sth/qessin a)ge/rqh 4.152; qumou= kai\ yuxh=s kekadw/n 11.334; of animals, 3.294, 12.150, etc.: less freq. in Trag., A. Ag.1388, E.Ba.620 (troch.).
spirit, strength, tei/reto d' a)ndrw=n q. u(p' ei)resi/hs Od.10.78; e)n de/ te q. tei/req' o(mou= kama/tw| te kai\ i(drw=| Il.17.744. pa/tasse de\ q. e(ka/stou each man's
heart beat high, 23.370, cf. 7.216.
soul, as shown by the feelings and passions; and so,
desire or
inclination, esp. desire for meat and drink,
appetite, pie/ein o(/te q. a)nw/goi Il.4.263; plhsa/menos . . qumo\n e)dhtu/os h)de\ poth=tos Od.17.603: generally, ta/ me q. e)ni\ sth/qessi keleu/ei Il.7.68; bale/ein de/ e( i(/eto q. 8.301; ai)\ ga/r me me/nos kai\ q. a)nei/h 22.346; q. e)potru/nh| [tina/] Od.9.139; q. e)pe/ssutai/ tini, e)forma=tai, Il.1.173, 13.73; h)/qele qumw=| he wished
in his heart or
with all his heart, 16.255, 21.65; i(/eto qumw=| 2.589; so later qumw=| boulo/menoi wishing
with all their heart, Hdt. 5.49; [o)/ssa v] oi q. ke qe/lh| ge/nesqai Sapph.Supp.1.3; qumo\s w(/rma Pi. O.3.25, cf. 38; qumo\s h(donh\n fe/rei S.El.286; w(=n e)ra=| qumo/s Herod.7.61; tw=n sfi q. h)=n ma/lista Hdt.1.1; a)/llws sfi q. e)ge/neto qeh/sasqai to\n po/lemon Id.8.116, etc.: with Verb omitted, se\ ga/r moi qu=mos u)/mnhn Alc. 5; a)/rx' au)to\s w(/s soi q. S.El.1319; o(/pou u(mi=n q. X.Cyr.3.1.37; bh=cai qumo/s e)ggi/netai Hp.Prog.8.
mind, temper, will, q. pro/frwn, i(/laos, Il. 8.39, 9.639; q. u(perfi/alos kai\ a)phnh/s, nhle/a q. e)/xontas, sidh/reos q., 15.94, 19.229, Od.5.191; e(/na q. e)/xein to be of one
mind, Il.15.710, etc.; ou)de\ lu/koi te kai\ a)/rnes o(mo/frona q. e)/xousin 22.263; e(/teros de/ me q. e)/ruke Od.9.302; e)mo\n q. e)/peiqen ib.33; qwpei/as kolakika/s, ai(\ . . tou\s q. poiou=sin khri/nous Pl.Lg.633d.
spirit, courage, me/nos kai\ q. Il.20.174; q. e)ni\ sth/qessi labei=n Od.10.461; pa=sin de\ parai\ posi\ ka/ppese q. Il.15.280; yu=xros e)/gento q., of doves, Sapph.16; q. e)/xein a)gaqo/n Hdt.1.120; q. ou)k a)pw/lesen S.El.26; o( qumo\s eu)qu\s h)=n *)amuni/as Ar.Eq.570; i)/wmen r(w/mh| kai\ qumw=| e)pi/ . . X.Cyr.4.2.21; fronh/mato/s te kai\ qumou= e)mpi/plasqai Pl.R.411c: so in Philos., opp. lo/gos, e)piqumi/a, ib.440b, al., cf. Arist.Pol.1328a7, 1327b24, Phld.Mus.p.26K., etc.; personified,
Passion, Emotion, opp. *logismo/s, Cleanth.Stoic.1.129.
the seat of anger, xwo/menon kata\ qumo/n Il.1.429; nemesize/sqw e)ni\ qumw=| 17.254; qumo\n e)xw/sato 16.616, etc.: hence,
anger, wrath, da/mason qumo/n 9.496; ei)/cas w(=| qumw=| ib.598; qumo\s me/gas e)sti\ . . basilh/wn 2.196; q. o)cu/s S.OC 1193; q. krei/sswn tw=n e)mw=n bouleuma/twn E.Med.1079, etc.; qumw=| f.l. for qumou= in S.Ant.718; oi( tw=| q. praxqe/ntes fo/noi Pl.Lg.867b; opp. logismo/s, Th.2.11, etc.; e)pana/gein to\n q. Hdt.7.160; e)ktei/nein And.3.31; kataqe/sqai Ar.V.567; dakei=n Id.Nu.1369; qumw=| xra=sqai Hdt.1.137, al.; o)rgh=s kai\ qumou= mestoi/ Isoc.12.81 (so th\n o)rgh\n kai\ to\n q., i.e. the outward manifestation of o)., Phld.Ir.p.90W.); of horses, X.Eq. 9.2: pl. (not earlier than Pl., f.l. in S.Aj.718 (lyr.)),
fits of anger, passions, peri\ fo/bwn te kai\ qumw=n Pl.Phlb.40e; oi(/ te q. kai\ ai( kola/seis Id.Prt.323e, cf. Arist.Rh.1390a11.
the heart, as the seat of the emotions, esp. joy or grief, xai=re, gh/qhse de\ qumw=|, Il.14.156, 7.189; q. e)ni\ sth/qessi gegh/qei 13.494; min a)/xos kradi/hn kai\ q. i(/kanen 2.171; a)/xnuto q. 14.39, etc.; do/khse d' a)/ra sfi/si q. w(\s e)/men w(s ei) . . they felt as glad at
heart as if . . , Od.10.415; mhd' o)ni/aisi da/mna . . q. Sapph.1.4; of fear, de/os e)/mpese qumw=| Il.17.625, cf. 8.138; of love, th\n e)k qumou= fi/leon 9.343; e)k qumou= ste/rgoisa Theoc.17.130; e)mw=| kexarisme/ne qumw=| my
heart's beloved, Il.5.243; reversely, a)po\ q. ma=llon e)moi\ e)/seai wilt be alien from my
heart, 1.562; e)k q. pese/ein, i.e. to lose thy favour, 23.595; e)/rwti qumo\n e)kplagei=sa E.Med.8; e)k q. klau=sai Philet. 11.
mind, soul, as the seat of thought, tau=q' w(/rmaine kata\ fre/na kai\ kata\ q. Il.1.193, etc.; h)/|dee ga\r kata\ q. 2.409, cf. 4.163, etc.; fra/zeto qumw=| 16.646; e)n q. e)ba/lonto e)/pos 15.566; tou\s lo/gous qumw=| ba/le A.Pr.706; ei)s q. balei=n ti S.OT975; ou)k e)s q. fe/rw I bring him not into my
mind or
thoughts, Id.El.1347.

qu_mo-sofiko/s, h/, o/n,
clever, Ar.V.1280 (Sup.).

qu_mo/-sofos, on,
wise from one's own soul, i.e.
naturally clever, Id.Nu.877, Plu.Art.17; of animals, Arr.Ind.14.4, Ael.NA16.15; o)/rneon -w/teron ib.3; to\ q. Plu. 2.970e.

qu_mo-fqore/w,
to be tormented in soul, S.Tr.142.

qu_mo-fqo/ros, on,
destroying the soul, life-destroying, fa/rmaka Od.2.329 (so, metaph. gra/yas e)n pi/naki qumofqo/ra polla/ Il.6.169); i)o/s Nic.Th.140 (v.l. guiofq-).
heart-breaking, th\n d' a)/xos a)mfexu/qh q. Od.4.716; ka/matos 10.363; peni/h Hes.Op.717; of persons,
troublesome, annoying, Od.19.323; cf. qumobo/ros.

qu_mofone/w,
to be in the death-agony, gloss on bebruxo/tes, Hsch.

qu^mofo/ros, on,
bearing thyme, Eust.ad D.P.791; q. h( *)attikh/ Sch. Ar.Pl.283.
qumoxeu/wn, = qumo\n a)xeu/wn (v. a)xeu/w), Et.Gud.267.34.

qu_mo/w,
make angry, provoke, LXX Ho.12.14(15): once in Trag., w(/ste qumw=sai fre/nas E.Supp.581. Med. and Pass., 2sg. qumoi= Ar.Ra.584: fut. -w/somai A.Ag.1069, -wqh/somai LXXJb.21.4, Phld.Ir. p.89W.: aor. e)qumwsa/mhn E.Hel.1343(lyr.), more freq. e)qumw/qhn Hdt.3.1, al.; part. -qei/s E.Ph.461, Pl.Lg.931b: pf. inf. tequmw=sqai Hdt.3.52, A.Fr.478, Pl.Ep.346a:—
to be wroth or
angry, abs., Hdt. 3.1, A.Ag.l.c., Sor.1.88, etc.; qumou= di' o)rgh=s h(/tis a)griwta/th S.OT 344; ei)s e)/rin q. Id.Aj.1018; of animals,
to be wild, restive, Id.Ant. 477, X.Eq.1.10; qumou=sqai ei)s ke/ras
vent fury with the horns, Virgil's
irasci in cornua, E.Ba.743; cf. a)oido\s e)s ke/ras tequ/mwtai Call.Iamb. 1.321; to\ qumou/menon
passion, Antipho 2.3.3, Th.7.68; qumou=sqai/ tini
to be angry with one, A.Eu.733, S.Tr.543, 1230, Pl.Prt.324a; e)/s tina Hdt.3.52; peri/ tinos A.Ag.1368 (prob. for muqou=sqai）; bou=s pro\s to\n e)lau/nonta -wqei/s Plu.Dio38; soi qugate/ros -ou/menos E.Or.751 (troch.): c. dat. rei, th=| cuntuxi/a| Ar.Ra.1006.

qu_mw/dhs, es,= qu_moeidh/s 2, Arist.Rh.1389a26, EN1149b14, Plu.2.462a; of animals,
fierce, Arist.HA488b14; q. to\ h)=qos Id.PA650b34; = a\ndrei=oi, opp. o)cu/qumoi and o)rgi/loi, Gal.17(1).188: Sup. -e/statos Ael.NA3.2. Adv. -dw=s, f.l. for muq-, Aristeas 168.

qu^mw/dhs, es,
like thyme, Thphr.HP6.7.2.

qu/m-wma [u_], atos, to/,
wrath, passion, A.Eu.860(pl.); q. to\ po/ntou Epigr.Gr.339.6 (Cyzicus).

qu/m-wsis, ews, h(,
ebullition of anger, Cic. Tusc.4.9.21.
qu_narmo/stria, = qoin- (q.v.).
quna/sai: a)polau=sai, e)nqousia/sai, Hsch.

qu_ne/w,= qu/nw, only impf.,
dart along, delfi=nes th=| kai\ th=| e)qu/neon Hes Sc.[210]; e)n d' *)/eris, e)n de\ *kudoimo\s e)q. ib.156, cf. 257; nw=q' i(/ppwn e)piba/ntes e)qu/neon ib.286, cf. eund.Cat.Oxy.1358Fr.2.20. (Cf. Skt.
dhūnoti 'shake', past part.
dhūtás.）

qu/nn-a, hs, h(,
female tunny, qu/nnan f.l. in Hippon.35.2: qu/nnhs Antiph.129.4, Archestr.Fr.37.1.

qunn-a/zw,
spear a tunny-fish, strike with a harpoon, metaph., e)s tou\s qula/kous Ar.V.1087.

qunn-ai=os, a, on,= qu/nneios, to\ q.
an offering of the first tunny-fish caught, Antig. Car. ap. Ath.7.297e.
qu/nn-ac, a_kos, o(, Dim. of qu/nnos, Eriph.3.
qunn-a/s, a/dos, h(, Dim. of qu/nna, Antiph.181.

qu/nn-eios, a, on,
of the tunny-fish, tari/xh q. pickled
tunny, Hices. ap. Ath.3.116e; to\ q. (sc. kre/as) Clearch.65; ta\ q. (sc. kre/a) Ar.Eq.354. qunnei=on, to/,
tunny-fishery, IG4.752.7 (Troezen, pl.).

qunn-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
for tunny-fishing, sagh/nh Luc.Sat.24.
qunn-i/zw,= qunna/zw, Suid.

qunn-i/s, i/dos, h(,
young female tunny, prob. l. in Hippon.35.2, Epich.74, Cratin. 161, Stratt.12, Archestr.Fr.37.1, Arist.HA543a9, al.

qunn-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
tunny-fisher, Rev.Arch.28(1928).393 (Varna, qunei=tai lapis).

qunno-qh/ras, ou, o(,
tunny-fisher, title of Mime by Sophron, Ath.7.303c, 306d, Ael.NA15.6.

qunno-ke/fa^los, o(,
with the head of a tunny-fish, Luc.VH1.35.

qunno-loge/w,
speak of the tunny-fish, Eust.994.47.

qu/nnos, o(,
tunny-fish, Orac. ap. Hdt.1.62, A.Pers.424, Arist.HA 571a12, al., Ath.7.301e sqq.; qhreu/ein qu/nnon Phld.Rh.1.251S. (The connexion with qu/nw, suggested by the line qu/nnoi me\n qu/nontes, e)n i)xqu/sin e)/coxoi o(rmh/n Opp.H.1.181, is dub.)

qunnoskop-ei=on, to/,
look-out to watch for shoals of tunnies, Str.5.2.6.

qunnoskop-e/w,
watch for tunnies, metaph., tou\s fo/rous q. Ar.Eq. 313.

qunnoskop-i/a, h(,
watch for tunnies, Str.17.3.16 (s.v.l.).

qunno/skop-os, on,
watcher for tunnies, Arist.HA537a19, Plu.2.980a.

qunnw/dhs, es,
like a tunny-fish, i.e.
stupid, Luc.JTr.25.
qu=nos: po/lemos, o(rmh/, dro/mos, Hsch.: quno/s acc. to Hdn.Gr.2.938.

qu/nw [u_], only pres. and impf.,= qune/w,
rush, dart along, qu=ne dia\ proma/xwn Il.5.250, etc.; pa/nth| qu=ne su\n e)/gxei+ 20.493; a)n' u(lh=en w)ku\s e)/qunen o)/ros AP6.217.8 ([Simon.]): c. part., basilh=es qu=non kri/nontes they
flitted to and fro ordering the ranks, Il.2.446; mnhsth=ras o)ri/nwn qu=ne kata\ me/garon Od.24.449: c. acc. cogn., q. a)trapo\n i)qei=an Nic.Th. 264: metaph., e)p' a)/llot' a)/llon w(/te me/lissa qu/nei lo/gon
flits from one tale to another, Pi.P.10.54 (qu/nwn: o(rmw=n, Erot. is not in our text of Hp.). = qu/w (B), *trw/wn kai\ *)axaiw=n qu=ne meshgu\ i(sta/menos
raged, Il.11.570; oi( de\ lu/koi w(\s qu=non ib.73; qu=ne ga\r a)\m pedi/on potamw=| plh/qonti e)oikw/s 5.87.

qu^o-do/kos, on, (qu/os)
receiving incense, full thereof, of the Delphic temple, E.Ion511, 1549; a)nakto/rwn Id.Andr.1157, cf. Hsch.

qu^o/-eis, essa, en, (qu/os)
laden with incense, fragrant, ne/fos Il.15.153; epith. of Eleusis, h.Cer.97, 318; a)/steos o)mfalo/s, of an altar, Pi.Fr.75.3; bwmo/s Id.Pae.3.8, E.Tr.1061 (lyr.); *)asteri/h Call.Del.300; a)na/ktoron AP6.277 (Damag.).
quoko/xqeis: ma/nteis, Hsch.

qu/on [u^], to/, （qu/w A)
thyine-wood, citron-wood, Callitris quadrivalvis, Od.5.60, Thphr.HP5.3.7, BCH6.26(Delos, ii B.C.), Moschio ap.Ath. 5.207e, Plin.HN13.100, Ael.VH5.6; cf. qui/a, qu/a. = qu/os, in pl. qu/a, ta/,
burnt-offerings or
incense, Sapph.Supp.8.2, prob. in IG5(1). p.vii (Delos, v B.C.), Pi.Fr.129.7 (qu/mata codd. Plu.), BCH37.195 (Chios, iv B.C.), SIG1003.10(Priene, ii B.C.), D.P.936, EM457.6.

qu/os [u^], eos, to/, （qu/w A)
burnt sacrifice, A.Ag.1409; qu/os o(/tti pa/xiston Call.Aet.Oxy.2079.23: but usu. in pl., su\n que/essi Il.6.270, cf. 9.499; spondh=|si qu/essi/ te i(la/skesqai Hes.Op.338, cf. Maiist.11; li/ssom' u(pe\r que/wn Od.15.261; qu/h pro\ pai/dwn A.Eu.835, cf. IG12(5).593.17 (Iulis, V B.C.), Berl.Sitzb.1927.170 (Cyrene); nin e)k que/wn katadh/somai Theoc.2.10, cf. Euph.129. later in pl.,= qumia/mata, Hp. ap. Gal.19.104.
a cake, qu/h pe/ttein Eup.108.

qu^oske/w,
make burnt-offerings, Hsch.; peri/pempta quoskei=s prob. in A.Ag.87 (quoskinei=s codd.). (For quo-skoe/w, cf. sq.)

quo-sko/os, ou, o(,
sacrificing priest, Od.21.145, 22.318,321, E.Rh.68; ma/nties q. distd. from i(erh=es, Il.24.221: fem., *maina/des q. E.Ba.224: neut., q. i(ra/
sacrificial implements, IG14.1389i2. pl.,= Lat.
haruspices, D.H.1.30. (qu/os, s-kov-, cf. koe/w,
caveo: the initial s- is found in OE.
scéawian, OHG.
scauwôn 'look at'.)

quo-skopi/a, h(,=
haruspicina, used as etym. of *qou=skos, Lyd.Mag.Prooem.

quo-sko/pos, ou, o(,
inspecting the entrails, Hsch., Phot., v.l. in E.Rh.68.

qu^o/w, (qu/os)
fill with sweet smells: pf. part. Pass. e)/laion tequwme/non
fragrant oil, Il.14.172; ei(/mata teq. Cypria Fr.4, cj. in h.Ap.184; teq. a)/lsos Call.Lav.Pall.63: aor. part. quwqe/n Hedyl. ap. Ath.11.486b.— Ep. word.
qu/pths: o( turo/s, Hsch.; cf. xqu/pths.

qu/ra [u^], Ion. qu/rh, h(, Ion. gen. pl. qure/wn Archil.127, Hdt.1.9:—
door, Il.24.317, etc.: freq. in pl. of
double or
folding doors, q. dikli/des Od.17.267; q. faeinai/ 6.19, al.; qurw=n zeu=gos kainw=n IG12.313.123, cf. 4.1488.25(Epid.); h( decia\ q. the right
valve, ib.22.1457.16; q. mono/quros ib.1627.418; qu/rai li/qinai (including the framework) ib. 12.372.195; qu/rai au)/leiai, v. au)/leios; h( q. h( ei)s to\n kh=pon fe/ronsa D. 47.53, cf. khpai=os 11; rarely for pu/lai,
gates, Plu.Cat.Mi.65; of the
carceres in the Roman circus,
barriers, Tab.Defix.Aud.187.59. —Phrases: prosqei=nai ta\s q., prostiqe/nai th\n q., Hdt.3.78, Lys.1.13; e)pispa/sai X.HG6.4.36; klei/ein Aristopho 7, Pl.Prt.314d; e)fe/lkesqai Luc.Am.16; th\n q. balanou=n, moxlou=n, bar
the door, Ar. Fr.251, 369; qu/ran ko/ptein, pata/ssein, krou/ein, knock, rap at
the door, Id.Nu.132, Ra.38, Pl.Prt.310b; a)ra/ttein, e)para/cai, Ar.Ec. 977, Pl.Prt.314d; th\n q. a)noignu/nai open it, v. a)noi/gnumi; w)=sai push
it open, Lys.1.24; mikro\n e)ndou=nai open
it a little, Plu.2.597d; do/mou e)n prw/th|si qu/rh|si sth=nai Od.1.255; i(=ze d' e)pi\ . . ou)dou= e)/ntosqe qura/wn 17.339; qurw=n e)/ndon S.El.78; pro\ qurw=n ib.109(anap.); e)pi/ or para\ *pria/moio qu/rh|si at Priam's
door, i.e. before his dwelling, Il.2.788, 7.346: metaph., e)pi\ tai=s qu/rais th=s *(ella/dos ei)=nai X. An.6.5.23, cf. D.10.34; th=s patri/dos Plu.Sull.29, Arat.37; e)pi\ qu/rais th=s *pi/shs Philostr.VA8.15; puretou= peri\ qu/ras o)/ntos being
at the door, Plu.2.128f (but xeimw=nos e)pi\ qu/rais o)/ntos Phlp.in Mete.130.25). esp. of kings and potentates, oi( tw=n a)ri/stwn *persw=n pai=des e)pi\ tai=s ba<*>sile/ws qu/rais paideu/ontai are educated at
court, X.An.1.9.3; gunh\ foitw=sa e)pi\ ta\s qu/ras tou= basile/os, of a petitioner, Hdt.3.119, cf. X.An.2.1.8; ai( e)pi\ ta\s q. foith/seis dangling after
the court, Id.HG1.6.7; e)pi\ tai=s tw=n plousi/wn q. diatri/bein Arist. Rh.1391a12; peri\ qu/ras diatri/bein Id.Pol.1313b7, Theopomp.Hist. 121; applied also to lovers, clients, disciples, etc., e)pi\ th\n qu/ran (or ta\s qu/ras） tino\s badi/zein, i)e/nai, etc., Ar.Pl.1007, Pl.R.364b, cf. Phdr. 233e, etc.; e)pi\ tai=si qu/rais a)ei\ kaqh=sqai Ar.Nu.467: metaph., *mousw=n e)pi\ poihtika\s q. a)fike/sqai Pl.Phdr.245a. prov., glw/ssh| qu/rai ou)k e)pi/keintai Thgn.421; ou)de/pot' i)/sxei q., of admirers of the Demos, Eup.265; e)pi\ qu/rais th\n u(dri/an to break the pitcher
at the very
door, 'there's many a slip 'twixt cup and lip', Arist.Rh. 1363a7; ti/s a)\n qu/ras a(ma/rtoi; Id.Metaph.993b5; lo/gos dikasthri/ou h)\ a)gora=s ou)de\ qu/ras i)dw/n D.H.Dem.23; to\ kata\ qu/ran terpno/n
vulgar pleasures, Eun.VSp.496 B.; para\ qu/ran plana=sqai S.E.M.1.43; e)k qurw=n eu)qe/ws th=s . . a)kroa/sews at the very
beginning, Olymp.in Mete. 2.1.
shutter of a window, ta\s q. ta\s e)pi\ tw=n quri/dwn IG12(5).872.37（Tenos), cf. 22.1668.60. pl.,
door of a chariot, X.Cyr. 6.4.9. pl.,
axle-trees, Poll.1.146（v.l. eu(rai/). qu/rh katapakth/ trap-
door, Hdt.5.16.
frame of planks, raft, Id.2.96; fraca/menoi th\n a)kro/polin qu/rh|si/ te kai\ cu/loisi with
hurdles and logs, Id.8.51, cf. Th.6.101. in war,
fenced works to obstruct landingparties, in pl., Ph.Bel.94.37, 100.7. generally,
entrance, as to a grotto, in pl., Od.9.243, al.
sluice-gate, PPetr.3p.134: pl., ib.2p.41 (iii B.C.). metaph., senses, as
the entrances to the soul, to\ sw=ma pollai=s quri/si kai\ qu/rais a)noi/gontes Seren. ap. Stob.3.6.17; e)ggu\s tou= sto/matos h( kardi/a, h( de\ yuxh\ tw=n q. Aristaenet.2.7. (I.-E.
dhur-, cf. Lat.
foras, fores, OE.
duru 'door', etc.)

qu^raba/qra, h(,
companion-ladder in a ship,PLond.3.1164h9(iii A.D.).
qu^ra/gmata, ta/, （qura/zw）=a)fodeu/mata, Hsch.

qu/r-aze [u^], Adv., for qu/rasde,
to the door, and so,
out of doors, e)k de\ q. e)/dramon Il.18.29, cf. 416, Od.15.62; do/mwn e)ch=ge q. ib.465. generally,
out, Il.5.694, Od.15.451, etc.; e)/kbasis . . a(lo\s polioi=o q. a way of getting
out of the sea, 5.410; i)xqu\n e)k po/ntoio q. [e(/lkein] Il. 16.408, cf. 21.237; e)pi\ pru/mnh|sin e)ei/leon ou)de\ q. ei)/wn e)cie/nai 18.447; e)cenegkw\n q. Ar.Ach.359; e)ce/lkein tina\ q. Id.Eq.365; q. e)cie/nai Id.V. 70; e)kxei=n q. empty
outside, Id.Fr.306; kardi/an q. e)/xein E.Fr.1063.12; ta\ q.
outside, opp. ta\ e)/ndon, Id.Or.604; q. zw|otokei=n or w)|otokei=n, Arist.GA718b32, 719b19; r(ei= dia\ tw= sw/matos e)/cw q. ta\ pneu/mata Ti. Locr.102a. c. gen., q. tw=n no/mwn
without the law, E.Ba.331; q. *)attikw=s, e)/cw *(ellhnikw=s Moer.p.185 P.

qur-a/zw, aor. inf. qura/cai,
thrust out of doors, Hsch.

qu/r-a_qen, Adv.
from outside the door: and generally,
from without, ai( q. ei)/sodoi E.Andr.952; q. ei)ka/sai Id.HF 713; q. e)peisie/nai Arist.GA736b28.
outside the door, outside, h( q. h(donh/ E.Fr.1063.4; o( a)h\r o( q. Arist.Resp.480a30, cf. PA642b1, oi( q.
foreigners, the enemy, A.Th.68, 193. metaph., opp. e)/ndoqen (q.v.), S.Tr.1021(hex.).

qu/r-a_qi, Adv.
at the door, EM25.17:—Ep. qu/rhqi,
outside, ma/la d' w)=ka qu/rhq' e)/a I was soon
out(of the sea), Od.14.352.

qur-ai=os, a, on, also os, on S.El.313, E.Alc.805, Plu.(ll.cc.infr.): Aeol. qu/raos IG12(2).14 (Mytil.): (qu/ra):—
at the door or
just outside the door, A.Ag.1055, S.Aj.793; q. oi)xnei=n to go
to the
door, go
out, Id.El.313; to/nde ble/pw q. h)/dh Id.Tr.595; q. sti/bos, opp. e)/naulos, Id.Ph.158 (lyr.); q. e)/stw po/lemos A.Eu.864: metaph., q. a)mfi\ mhro/n round the
exposed, naked thigh, S.Fr.872 (lyr.); q. do/ca Plu.Cat.Ma. 18; q. u(poyi/ai Id.2.38c.
absent, abroad, A.Ag.1608, Ch.115; q. e)lqei=n to come
from abroad, E.Ion702(lyr.); tou\s d' e)n qurai/ois in
the public eye, opp. tou\s me\n o)mma/twn a)/po, Id.Med.217.
from out of doors, from abroad, a)/ndres q.
strangers, Id.Hipp.409; qurai=a fronh/mat' a)ndrw=n the thoughts
of strangers, ib.395. = a)llo/trios, o)/lbos q. the luck
of others, A.Ag.837; ph=ma E.Alc.778; xei/r Id.Ph.848; pai=des, i.e.
adoptive, Id.Fr.491.
containing a door, q. toi=xos
entrance-wall, IG11(2).165.6(Delos, iii B.C.), 12 l.c.(pl.), Milet.7.56 (Didyma). qurai/a, h(,
doorway, opening, Men.389, IG22.1668.61 (pl.).

qu^ra_ma/xos [ma^], on,
assaulting doors, kw=moi prob. l. in Pratin.Lyr. 1.8.

qu^ra^noi/kths, ou, o(,
door-opener, A.D.Synt.324.8.
qu/rac: pu/rgos, xitw/n, Hsch.(cf. qw/rac).

qu/ra_si, qu/r-sin [u^], Adv., (qu/ra)
at the door, without, Ar.V.891,Pax 942, 1023,al.
abroad (written qu/raisi in codd.), E.El.1074, S. OC401.

qu^raul-e/w, (au)lh/)
live in the open air, camp out, Pl.Plt.272a,Lg. 695a, X.Oec.7.30, Isoc.6.76, etc.; esp. in war,
keep the field, Arist.Pol. 1319a24, D.H.9.15, Plu.Caes.17, etc.
wait at another's door, of visitors, POxy.471.72 (ii A.D.); freq. of lovers waiting on their mistresses, Plu.2.759b, Ph.1.306, etc.; o( quraulw=n *)/erws Plot.6.5.10.

qu^raul-i/a, h(,
living out of doors, camping out, Ti.Locr.103b(pl.), etc.; of soldiers, Plu.2.498c; of wild animals, Arist.GA783a19.
waiting at the door, of lovers, in pl., Ph.1.155, Philostr. Ep.29: sg., Luc.Merc.Cond.10.

qu^/raul-os (proparox.), on,
living out of doors, of shepherds, Hsch.

qu^ra^wro/s, o/n,
warder of the gate, v.l. for pulawro/s, Il.22.69(pl.); cf. qurwro/s.
qurgana=n: kri/nein (fort. qrugana=n: krou/ein), Hsch.
qu/rda, Arc. for qu/raze,= e)/cw, Hsch.

qu^rea_ma^xi/a, h(,
contest in which shields were borne, SIG1061.12 (Samos, ii B.C.).

qu^re/aspis, idos, h(,
large shield, AP6.131 (Leon.).

qurea_tikoi\ ste/fanoi wreaths
worn to commemorate the victory at Thyrea, Sosib.5.
qu^rea_fo/ros, on,= qureofo/ros, Supp.Epigr.3.351 (Thisbe, iii B.C.), Plb.5.53.8, Plu.Aem.19, Arr.Tact.4.4.
qu/reqra: qu/rai, Hsch.

qu^reo-eidh/s, e/s,
shield-shaped: xo/ndros qureoeidh/s (male quroeidh/s) the
thyroid cartilage (in the larynx), Gal.2.839, UP7.11, al.; nh=sos q. Str.17.2.2; q. to/pos prob. for quro- in Hippiatr.40.

qu^reo-koili/ths [i_], ou, o(,
soldier armed with hollow qureo/s, IPE12.687 (Olbia).

qu^reo/s, o(, (qu/ra)
stone put against a door to keep it shut, Od.9.240, 313.
oblong shield (shaped like a door), PSI4.428.36 (iii B.C.), Inscr. ap. Plu.Pyrrh.26, Callix.2; hence, of the Roman
scutum (opp. a)spi/s,=
clipeus), Plb.2.30.3, 6.23.2, D.H.4.16, cf.Ep.Eph.6.16, Apollod. Poliorc.163.2, Arr.Tact.3.2, etc.
disk forming part of kaqeth/r, IG11(2).287 B68 (Delos, iii B.C.). Math.,
oval, Procl.in Euc.1 Deff.3,8.

qu^reofor-e/w,
to be armed with the oblong shield, Plb.10.13.2.

qu^reo/for-os, on,
armed with such a shield, LXX 1 Ch.12.24, Plb.10.29.6, Ascl.Tact. 1.3, Plu.Crass.25; cf. qureafo/ros.

qureo/w,
cover with a shield, Aq.Is.31.5.

qu^repa^noi/kths, ou, o(,
door-opener, of the philosopher Crates,
for whom all doors were open, Plu.2.632e; or,
who forced all doors, D.L. 6.86: pl.,
burglars, Vett.Val.202.6; cf. quranoi/kths.

qu/retr-a [u^], ta/,= qu/ra,
door, in pl., Il.2.415, Od.18.385, 21.49, Pi.I.7(6).6, E.Ba.448, Or.1474 (lyr.), Call.Ap.3, etc.; prop. the
door-casing,frame, IG11(2).161A66(Delos, iii B.C.); qu/rais a(rmozoi/sais toi=s qure/troisi ib.12(2).14.7; q. marma/rina ib.6: so in sg., ib.4.1484.30(Epid.), BCH6.24 (Delos, ii B.C.), Plb.30.18.5, AP5.293.7 (Agath.), Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.4:—hence quretr-ea=s: flia=s, Hsch.

quretr-iko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to a door-frame, ph=gma BCH1.82 (Chios).

qureuth/s, ou=, o(,
door-keeper, Gloss. (dub.).
qu/rh, qu/rhqi, Ion. and Ep. for qu/ra, qu/raqi.
qu^rh-bo/lion: th\n e)p' a)grw=| oi)/khsin, Hsch.;= e)/paulis, EM459.13:
qu^rh-bo/los: te/ktwn, Suid.

qu/rhfi [u^], Ep. dat. of qu/ra, used as Adv.,
outside, Od.9.238, Hp. Superf.2, etc.; ta\ q., opp. ta\ e)/ndoqi, Od.22.220; to\ or ta\ q., Hes.Op. 365, Naumach. ap. Stob.4.23.7.

qu^ri^deu/s, e/ws, o(,
window-frame, Inscr.Délos 290.212 (iii B.C.).
qu^ri/dion, to/, Dim. of qu/ra, Gp.15.6.2.

qu^ri^d-o/w,
make a window, PTheb.Bank11.10 (ii B.C.):—Pass., oi)ki/a tequridwme/nh
furnished with windows, BGU 1116.15 (i B.C.).

qu^ri^d-wto/s, h/, o/n,
having apertures, kibwto/s Demioprat. ap. Poll.10.137; katapa/lths IG22.1487.89.
qu^riobo/los, o(, dub. sens. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).126.

qu/rion [u^] (not quri/on, Eust.268.9), to/, Dim. of qu/ra,
little door, wicket, Ar.Nu.92, Th.26, IG11(2).154A26 (Delos, iii B.C.), Plu. Cleom.8, Alciphr.3.30: metaph., to\ tou= lo/gou q. parabalou= close
the door of discourse, Plu.2.94of, cf. 965b.
small sluice, PLond. 3.1177.243 (ii A.D.).

qu^ri/s, i/dos, h(, Dim. of qu/ra,
window, Praxill.5, Ar.V.379, Th.797, Pl.R.359d, Arist. de An.404a4, Ath.50.2, IG11(2).161D101 (Delos, iii B.C.), BGU1116.23 (i B.C.), Plu.2.273b;
window-frame, e)narmo/sai ei)s e(ka/sthn th\n q. (
opening) xalka=s q. (
frames) IG22.1668.37.
audience-window of the king or high officials in Egypt, UPZ15.7, 16.20, 53.5 (ii B.C.), Heraclid.Cum.4.
opening at each end of a bee's cell, Arist.HA624a7.
valve of a bivalve fish, ib.529b7. in pl.,
embrasures in battlements, IG22.463.55, al.; for artillery, D.S.20.91, D.C.74.10. in pl.,
planks, boards, Heraclid. Pont. ap. Ath.12.521f;
tablets, Hsch.
cell of wasps, Arist. HA628a20, 629a30.

quriw/ths, ou, o(,
one found at the door, Suid.
qurceu/s, e/ws, o(, title of Apollo in Achaea, Paus.7.21.13.

qu^roeidh/s, e/s,
like a door, to/pos dub. in Hippiatr.40 (v. qureoeidh/s）; to\ q. trh=ma
the opening in the os pubis, Gal.2.414.

qu^roigo/s, o(, (oi)/gnumi)
door-keeper, Hsch.

qu^rokigkli/des, i/dwn, ai(,
latticed doors, IG22.1672.168.

qu^rokop-e/w,
knock at the door, break it open, esp. as a drunken feat, a)po\ ga\r oi)/nou gi/gnetai kai\ qurokoph=sai ktl. Ar.V.1254; qurokopw=n w)=flen di)khn Antiph.239, cf. Chor.inHermes17.232. metaph.,
knock as at a door, q. th=| xeiri\ th\n pleura/n [tinos] Plu.2.503a; o( limo\s th\n gaste/ra q. Alciphr.3.70.

qu^rokop-i/a, h(,
knocking at the door, Diph. 128, Lib.Or.11.47.

qu^rokop-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
like qurokopi/a: qurokopiko/n, to/,
tune played on the flute( = krousi/quron), Trypho ap.Ath.14.618c:— also qu^rokop-istiko/n, to/, Hsch.

qu^ro/kop-os (parox.), on,
knocking at the door, begging, yeudo/mantis A.Ag.1195.

qu^rokrousti/a, h(,
knocking at a door, dub. in Sammelb.4425 ii 24 (ii A.D.).
qurouro/s, o(, v. qurwro/s.

qu^ro-phgi/a, h(,
making of doors, Thphr.HP5.7.6.

qu^ro-poio/s, o(,
door-maker, Poll.7.111; nickname of the Comic poet Aristomenes, Hsch., Suid.
quroullei=n, written for quraulei=n, Hsch.

qu^rofu/lac [fu^], a^kos, o(,
door-keeper, Sch.Il.22.69, prob. in Fronto Epig.Gr.5.1.

qu^ro/w, (qu/ra)
furnish with doors, i(ero/n IG12.24.7; pro/pulon ib.22.1046.16; new\s . . qurw=sai xrusai=si qu/rais Ar.Av.614 (anap.): metaph., blefa/rois qurw=sai th\n o)/yin X.Mem.1.4.6:—Pass., stego/mena kai\ tequrwme/na roofed and
furnished with doors, Tab.Heracl.1.142, cf. IG 11(2).287 A 172 (Delos, iii B.C.), PAmh.2.51.14, 24(i B.C.);
furnished with apertures, pi/nac JHS41.195 (Delos, ii B.C.); pollai=s e)co/dois tequrw=sqai
to be furnished with many outlets, Luc.Hipp.8.

qurs-a/zw,
bear or
brandish the thyrsus, qursaddwa=n Lacon. part. gen. pl. fem. for qursazousw=n, Ar.Lys.1313.

qurs-a/rion, to/, Dim. of qu/rsos, Plu.2.614a:—of vegetables,
head, Orib.Fr.55.

qurs-exqh/s, e/s, of Bacchus, prob. f.l. for qurs-egxh/s,
with thyrsus-spear, Orph.H.45.5 (Ruhnk.).
qurs-i/ambos [i^], o(, coined as etym. of qri/ambos, Lyd. Mens.1.2.
qurs-i/nh,= o)roba/gxh, Dsc.2.142 (nisi leg. qursi=tin, cf. qursi/ths).
qu/rs-ion, to/,= qu/mon, Ps.-Dsc.3.36; also,= katana/gkh, ib.4.131; symbolic of Aquarius, Herm.Trism. in Rev.Phil.32.274. qursi/on, Dim. of qu/rsos, Hero Spir.2.9.
qurs-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,= w)kimoeide/s, Ps.-Dsc.4.28 (with v.l. -i=tis).

qursi/wn, wnos, o(, part of a fish, Ath.7.310e; Lat.
tursio (v.l.
thurs-),= a dolphin-like fish, Plin.HN9.34.

qurso-eidh/s, e/s,
thyrsus-like, Dsc.3.17.

qurso-ko/mos, o(,
thyrsuskeeper, a play of Lysippus, Suid.

qurso/-logxos, o(,
thyrsus-lance, Callix. 2. as Adj., q. o(/pla
thyrsus-like arms, Str.1.2.8.

qurso-ma^nh/s, e/s,
he who raves with the thyrsus, epith. of Bacchus, E.Ph.792 (lyr.), Orph.H.50.8.

qurso-plh/c, h=gos, o(, h(,
thyrsus-stricken, frantic, [e(smo\s] texnitw=n Limen.19, cf. Hsch.

qu/rsos, o(, in late Poets with heterocl. pl. qu/rsa AP6.158 (Sabin.): —
wand wreathed in ivy and vine-leaves with a pine-cone at the top, carried by the devotees of Dionysus, E.Ba.80 (lyr.), SIG1109.138, Hero Spir.2.9, etc.; also of the
devotees themselves, Sch.E.Hec. 261. = kla/dos, r(a/bdos, Hsch. (Prob. a loan-word.)

qurso-ti^na/kths, ou, o(,
thyrsus-shaker, of Bacchus, Orph.H.52.4.

qurso-fore/w,
bear the thyrsus, D.S.4.3. q. qia/sous
assemble or
lead companies
with the thyrsus, E.Ba.557 (lyr.).

qurso-fori/a, h(,
bearing of the thyrsus, Plu.2.671e.

qurso-fo/ros, on,
thyrsus-bearing, *ba/kxai E.Cyc.64 (lyr.), cf.AP9.524.9.

qurso-xa^rh/s, e/s,
delighting in the thyrsus, Inscr.Magn.215a.23, AP3.1 (Inscr. Cyzic.).

qurso/w,
make into thyrsi, lo/gxai tequrswme/nai D.S.4.4.

qu/r-wma [u^], atos, to/,
doorway (including posts, sill, and lintel), IG12.372.78, 11(2).287 A 77 (Delos, iii B.C.), Thphr.HP3.14.1, Callix. 2, Hsch. s.v. qu/retra; to\ me/ga q. OGI193.10 (Branchidae); to\ pro/pulon kai\ to\ q. ib.734 (Egypt, ii B.C.); dica\ q. Hdt.2.169: pl., also in Th.3.68, Lys.19.31, Pl.Plt.280d, D.21.167; ta\ q. a)pospa/sas Id.29.3.
panel, tablet, Diotog. ap. Stob.4.1.96; to\n no/mon ou)k e)n oi)kh/masi kai\ qurw/masi e)nh=men dei=, a)ll' e)n toi=s h)/qesi Archyt. ap. eund. 4.1.138. in pl.,
planks, boards, D.S.20.86.
window, LXX3 Ki.7.42(5) (pl.).

qur-w/n, w=nos, o(,
hall, antechamber, S.El.328, OT1242, Fr.649.23, IG11(2).158 A 57 (Delos, iii B.C.), Plu.Pyrrh. 34, etc.

qu^rwr-ei=on, to/,
porter's lodge, Vitr.6.7.1 (dub.).

qu^rwr-e/w,
to be a àoor-keeper, Plu.2.830b.

qu^rwr-o/s, Cypr. quravwro/s dub. in Inscr.Cypr. 215H., Ep. qurawro/s (q.v.), o(, h(:—
door-keeper, porter, Sapph.98, Hdt.1.120, A.Ch.565, Pl.Phlb.62c, Ev.Marc.13.34, BGU1061.10 (i A.D.), Luc.Vit.Auct.7, etc.:—also qurouro/s PCair.Zen.292.76 (iii B.C.), PRyl.136.6 (i A.D.), IG3.1137 (ii A.D.), PFlor.71.380 (iv A.D.). (From qura-
horvos, cf. ou)=ros, e)ru/w (B): connected with w)re/w by Corn. ND1.)

qu/r-wsis [u^], ews, h(,
furnishing with a door, tou= e)rgasthri/ou IG4.1484.38 (Epid.).

qur-wto/s, o/n,
with a door or
aperture, sth/qh Babr.59.11: neut. as Subst., qur-wto/n, to/,
doorway, IG4.1484.304 (Epid., dual).
qu=sai, w=n, ai(, like quia/des, Bacchantes, Lyc.106; v.l. qu/sth|sin, cf. qusta/s, qu/sths.

qu^sa^nhdo/n, Adv.
fringe-like, Ael.NA16.11.

qu^sa^no-eidh/s, e/s,
fringed: to\ tw=n strwma/twn q. Eun.Hist.p.239 D.

qu^sa^no/-eis, Ep. qussano/eis, essa, en,
tasseled, fringed, Hom. (only in Il.), ai)gi/da qussano/essan 15.229, 17.593, al.; a)spi/da (v.l. ai)gi/da） q. 21.400.

qu/sa^nos [u^], o(,
tassel: mostly in pl.,
tassels, fringe, Hom. (only in Il.), of the
tassels of the ai)gi/s, 2.448; zw/nh| e(kato\n qusa/nois a)rarui/h| 14.181, cf. Hes.Sc.225, Hdt.4.189; oi( th=s o)qo/nhs q. Ach.Tat.5.24; pe/plos a)/xri tw=n q. pepoikilme/nos Them.Or.18.222c; of the
tufts of the golden fleece, Pi.P.4.231; of the
long arms of the cuttle fish, Opp.H.3.178; diktuwto\s q. D.S.18.26. (Possibly connected with qu/ssomai, qu/w.)

qu^sa/n-ouros [a^], on, （ou)ra/)
with a ragged tail, Hsch.

qu^san-w/dhs, es, = qusano/eis,
tassel-like, bunched, r(i/za Thphr.HP1.6.4.
qu^san-wto/s, h/, o/n,= qusano/eis, kiqw/n, ai)ge/h, Hdt.2.81,4.189; e)/nduma J.BJ5.5.7.
qu_sei/w, Desiderat. of qu/w, Hdn.Epim.249.

qu/sqen, Adv. for qu/rqen,= qu/raqen,
outside, ta=s keleu/qw IG5(2).3.23 (Tegea, iv B.C.).

qu/sqla, wn, ta/, (qu/w)
sacred implements of Bacchic orgies, Il.6.134; qu/sqlois paiome/nous Jul.Or.7.209d.
the Bacchic festival itself, Opp.C.1.26: also in sg., Plu.2.501f. generally,
sacrifice, q. katai/qein Lyc.459, cf. 720,929, Orph.A.904, etc.

qu^si/-a, Ion. -ih, h(, (qu/w) prop.
burnt-offering, sacrifice, mostly in pl., v.l. in Batr.176, cf. Emp.128.6, etc.; e)n qusi/hsi ei)=nai Hdt.8.99; qusi/aisi de/kesqai/ tina Pi.P.5.86, cf. I.5(4).30; qusi/h|si i(la/skesqai to\n qeo/n Hdt.1.50, cf. 6.105; qusi/as e)/rdein, e)pitele/ein, a)na/gein, Id.1.131, 2.63,60: also in sg., qusi/an poiei=sqai, qu/ein, Pl.Smp.174c, R.362c; a)/gein Id.Alc.2.148e; q. swthri/ou, ai)ne/sews, th=s teleiw/sews, LXXLe.3.1, 7.2, Ex.29.34; of the gods, qusi/an de/xesqai A.Th.701 (lyr.).
mode of sacrifice, q. h( au)th\ pa=si kate/sthke Hdt.4.60, cf. 2.39.
festival, at which sacrifices were offered, Pl.Phd.61b, Ti.26e, al.; q. kai\ diagwgai\ tou= suzh=n Arist.Pol.1280b37, cf. EN1160a20; peri\ tw=n e)n *(ro/dw| q., title of work by Theognis Hist. generally,
rite, ceremony, Plu.2.693f, Thes.20.
victim, offering, Plu.2.184f, Luc. Sacr.12.

qu^si-a/zw,
sacrifice, mh=la Strato Com.1.21; qusi/an, qusi/asma, LXX 2 Ch.7.5, 2 Es.6.3; u(pe/r tinos dub. l. in Lys.6.4; u(pe\r tou= dh/mou OGI339.36 (Sestos, ii B.C.); tw=| *dii\ u(pe\r tw=n ploi+zome/nwn ib.199.36 (Adule); q. tw=| qew=| kai\ bakxeu/ein D.S.4.3: abs., LXX 1 Ch.21.28, al., IG3.74.16, etc.: qusia/zousai, ai(, title of mime by Herodas.

qu^si-a/s, a/dos,
frenzied, fwnh/ Hsch.: pl. as Subst.,= quia/des, Id.
qu^si/-asma, atos, to/,= qusi/a 11, LXXEx.29.18 (v.l. qumi/ama), 2 Es.6.3.

qu^si-asth/rion, to/,
altar, ib.Ex.27.1, al., Ev.Matt.23.18, J.AJ8.4.1, Cod.Just.1.12.3.2.

qu^si-asth/rios, a, on,
sacrificial, [u(/mnos] Timae.154.

qu^si-asth/s, ou=, o(,
a sacrificer, Sch.E.Hec.224.

qu/si^mos [u^], on, （qu/w A)
fit for sacrifice, kth/nea Hdt.1.50, cf. Ar. Ach.784; to\ q. Plu.2.437a, cf. Porph.Abst.2.14.

qu^si^ourgo/s, o(,
sacrificer, slaughterer, Ptol.Tetr.179.

qu/sis or qu=sis, ews, h(, (qu/w B)
raging, a)po\ th=s q. kai\ ze/sews th=s yuxh=s Pl.Cra.419e.
qu/ska: ku/ria, Hsch. quska/rion, to/, Dim. of sq., EM458.53 (cod. Voss.). qu/skh, qu/skos, v. qui/+skh.

qusmiko/s, h/, o/n,
sacrificial, e)/tos IG12(5).141 (Paros), 903 (Tenos).
quspoli/ai: quhpoli/ai, Hsch.
qussa^no/eis, Ep. for qusan-.
qussa/s, a/dos, o(,= quia/s, epith. of Bacchus, IG12(5).972 (Tenos).
qu/ssomai,= tina/ssomai, Hsch.

qusta/s, a/dos, h(, (qu/w A)
sacrificial, q. boh/ the cry
uttered in sacrificing, A.Th.269; q. litai/ the prayers
accompanying a sacrifice, S. Ant.1019. as Subst.,= quth/r, Sch.Opp.H.5.417;= quia/s, Hsch.
sacrificial robe, E.Fr.1101.

qusth/rion: o(rmhth/rion, Suid.; but qusthri/ois: qumiathri/ois, Hsch. qusth/rios, o(, epith. of Dionysus, EM455.31. qu/sths, ou, Dor. qu^/si-tas, a, o(,
sacrificing priest (Cret.), Hsch. qu/stinon: tri/xinon, oi( de\ mesotribh=, Id. qu/stra, ta/,= qu/mata, SIG1026.24 (Cos).

qu^t-ei=on, to/, (qu/w A)
place for sacrificing, Aeschin.3.122.

qu^t-e/on,
one must sacrifice, Ar.Av.1237, Pl.R.365e, Porph.Abst.2.13; th=| a)lhqei/a| Luc.Hist.Conscr.39.

qu^t-h/r, h=ros, o(,
sacrificer, slayer, A.Ag. 224,240 (both lyr.), S.Tr.613, al.: coupled with ma/ntis, Call.Iamb.1.221.
qu^t-h/rion, to/,= qu=ma, E.IT243. = qusiasth/rion, as name of the constellation Ara, Arat.403, Q.S.4.554. = qumiath/rion, Phot.

qu^/t-hs, ou, o(,
sacrificer or
diviner, SIG589.18 (Magn. Mae., ii B. C.), D.S.17.17, Onos.10.25, Arr.Epict.1.17.18, IG14.617.6 (Rhegium), App.Hisp.85, Hdn.4.12.3: Thess. qu/tas IG9(2).1234 (Phalanna).

qu^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for sacrifice, maxairi/dion Luc.Pisc.45: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), the
art of the diviner, Ph.2.221, Onos.10.28, Ath.14.659d, Hdn.8.3.7, Porph.Abst.2.53; to\ q. Placit.5.1.3; q. mantei/a Sch. rec.A.Pr.496.
given to sacrificing, Str.3.3.6.
qu^/t-is, idos, fem. of qu/ths, Hsch. s.v. i(rh/teira:
qu^/t-ria, fem. of quth/r, Suid. s.v. i(e/reia.
qu=yai, qu/yw, v. tu/fw.

qu=yis, ews, h(, (tu/fw)
burning, Suid.s.v. quma/lwpes (= Sch.Ar.Ach. 320).

qu/w (A), impf. e)/quon, Ep. qu=on Od.15.222, Ion. qu/eskon Hippon. 37: fut. qu/sw [u_] E.El.1141, Pl.Lg.909d, Henioch.5.10, Dor. qusw= Theoc. 2.33; 3pl. quse/onti IG12(3).452 (Thera): aor. e)/qu_sa Od.9.231, etc., Ep. qu=sa 14.446: pf. te/qu^ka Ar.Lys.1062, Pl.R.328c:—Med., fut. qu/somai E.Heracl.340 (as Pass., Hdt.7.197): aor. e)qusa/mhn Th.4.92, (e)k-) Hdt.6.91, etc.:—Pass., fut. tu^qh/somai D.S.16.91, Luc. DDeor.4.2: aor. e)tu/qhn [u^] Hdt.1.216, A.Ch.242, Philem.155.2 (part. written quqe/n Men.Sam.185, cf. th\n bou=n th\n quqei=san IG12(7).241 (Amorgos, iii B.C.), etc.): pf. te/qu^mai A.Eu.341 (lyr.), Ar.Av.1034, X. HG3.5.5 (in med. sense, 5.1.18, An.7.8.21): plpf. e)te/qu^to Id.HG3.1.23. [u_ in fut. and aor., u^ in pf. Act. and Pass., and aor. Pass.; u_ generally in pres. and impf., exc. in trisyll. cases of part., qu^onta Od.15.260, qu/^ontes h.Ap.491, but qu/^eske Hippon. 37; e)/qu/^e, qu/^wn, Pi. O.10(11).57,13.69; qu/^ein, at the end of a line, E.El.1141 (s.v. l., fort. qu/h), Cyc.334, Ar.Ach.792 (spoken by a Megarian); qu/^eis, qu/^w, Strato Com.1.19, 20; qu/^wnti 3pl. pres. subj., Theoc.4.21.] Act.,
offer by burning meat or drink to the gods (to\ qu/ein dwrei=sqai/ e)sti toi=s qeoi=s Pl.Euthphr.14c), qeoi=si de\ qu=sai a)nw/gei *pa/troklon . . , o( d' e)n puri\ ba/lle quhla/s Il.9.219, cf. Aristarch. ap. Sch.adloc., Com.Adesp.7D. (ap. Phryn.PSp.74 B.); h)= r(a kai\ a)/r gmata qu=se qeoi=s, of a drink-offering, Od.14.446, cf. 15.260; so e)/nqa de\ pu=r kh/antes e)qu/samen (sc. tw=n turw=n)
made an offering of cheese, 9.231; q. a)kro/qina Pi.O.10(11).57; pe/lanon, dei=pna, A.Pers.204, Eu.109; purou/s, nastou/s, Ar.Av.565, 567: c. dat. rei, q. tou/tw| o(/ ti e)/xoi e(/kastos (with v.l. tou=to) Hdt.1.50.
sacrifice, slay a victim, [tw=| h(li/w|] q. i(/ppous (v.l. i(/ppoisi) ib. 216; tau=ron Pi.O.13.69; au(tou= pai=da A.Ag.1417, cf. S.El.532, etc.; i(ra/ Hdt.1.59; i(erei=a Th.1.126, etc.; q. qu=ma, qusi/an, Pl.Plt.290e, R. 362c, etc.; q. diabath/ria, e)pini/kia, etc., Plu.Luc.24, Pl.Smp.173a, etc.:—Pass., ta\ tequme/na
the flesh of the victim, X.HG4.3.14, etc.; ta\ teq. i(era/ ib.3.5.5; ta\ quo/mena Id.Lac.15.3. simply,
slaughter, Hdt.1.126, Ar.Lys.1062, LXXIs.22.13. abs.,
offer sacrifice, Hdt.1.31.al., A.Ag.594, Fr.161.2, S.OC1159; toi=si qeoi=si q. Pherecr. 23, cf. Hdt.4.60, 8.138; qew=n e(/neka Men.129.1.
celebrate with offerings or sacrifices, sw=stra q. Hdt.1.118; gene/qlia Pl.Alc.1.121c; *lu/kaia, *(hra/kleia X.An.1.2.10, D.19.86; e)leuqe/ria Henioch.5.10; ga/mous Plu.Pomp.55. c. dupl.acc., eu)agge/lia q. e(kato\n bou=s
sacrifice a hundred oxen
for the good news, Ar.Eq.656. *(esti/a| qu/ein, prov. of niggards, because sacrifices to Hestia admitted no one to share the offering, Theopomp.Com.28. Med.,
cause a victim
to be offered, tw=n quma/twn w(=n dei= qu/esqai kai\ pari/stasqai IG5(1).1390.65 (Andania, i B.C.), etc.: hence freq. abs.,
consult the gods, Hdt.7.189, E.Heracl.340; e)pi\ *kro/twna, e)pi\ tw=| *pe/rsh|, i.e. on marching
against . . , Hdt.5.44, 9.10, cf. X.An.7.8.21; qu/esqai e)p' e)co/dw| ib. 6.4.9; u(pe\r th=s monh=s ib.5.6.27: c. inf., q. i)e/nai
offer sacrifice [to learn] whether to go or not, ib.2.2.3; also e)quo/mhn ei) be/ltion ei)/h ib.6.1.31 (so in Act., e)/que (v.l. e)qu/eto） tw=| *dii/ . . po/tera/ oi( lw=|on kai\ a)/meinon ei)/h . . ib.7.6.44); diabath/ria qu/esqai, as in Act., Th.5.54. metaph.,
tear in pieces, of wild beasts, A.Ag.137 (lyr.). (Hence qumo/s, cf. Skt.
dhūmás, Lat.
fumus 'smoke', qumia/w, qu/os, quh/lhma, tu/fw, perh. qei=on (A), Lat.
suffire; cf. sq.)

qu/w (B) [u_], aor. e)/qu_sa Call.Fr.82:—
rage, seethe, a)/nemos me\n e)pau/sato lai/lapi qu/wn Od.12.400; *ze/furos mega/lh| su\n lai/lapi qu/wn ib. 408, cf. Hes.Op.621, Th.874; of a swollen river, o( d' e)pe/ssuto oi)/dmati qu/wn
seething, Il.21.234; u(yo/se qu/wn ib.324; of a wind-swept sea, o( d' e)/stenen oi)/dmati qu/wn 23.230, cf. Hes.Th.109,131; of the wake of a ship, ku=ma d' o)/pisqe porfu/reon me/ga qu=e Od.13.85; da/pedon d' a(/pan ai(/mati qu=en the ground
seethed with blood, 11.420, 22.309; of persons,
storm, rage, h)= ga\r o(/ g' o)loih=|si fresi\ qu/ei Il.1.342; e)/gxei+ qu=en 11.180; kasignh/ta me/nei qu/oisa Pi.P.3.33; qu/ousan *(/aidou mhte/ra A.Ag. 1235; pukna\ de/ oi( kradi/h e)/ntosqen e)/quen A.R.3.755 (v.l. e)/quien): c.inf.,
desire eagerly, e)nispei=n ib.685; of a horse, Call.Fr.82; of a serpent, Nic.Th.129 (v.l. qui/h|si). [u_ always: for qu/menos [u^] is f.l. for su/menos in Pratin.Lyr.1.4.] qui/w (q. v.) should perh. be preferred in later Ep., and is cj. in Pi.l.c. (Cf. Lett.
dusmas (pl.) 'anger',
dusēt 'puff', 'pant', Lat.
f[ucaron]ro (fr.
dh[ucaron]s-), qu/ella, qui/w, quia/s (orig.
madwoman); prob. cogn. with foreg.)

qu^-w/dhs, es, (qu/os, o)/d-wda, cf. eu)w/dhs, dusw/dhs)
smelling of incense, fragrant, ei(/mata . . quw/dea Od.5.264; qala/moio quw/deos 4.121; bwmo/s h.Ap.87; nho/s h.Ven.59; naoi/ Theoc.17.123; *ou)/lumpos h.Merc.322; li/banos Emp.128.6; kapno/s E.Andr.1026 (lyr.): Comp. -e/steros, te/rminqos Thphr.HP3.15.3. (qu/on 1)
belonging to the tree qu/on, ib. 5.4.2.
qu^-w/eis, essa, en,= quo/eis, Hsch.

qu^/-wma, atos, to/,
that which
is burnt as incense: pl.,
spices, Heraclit.67, Semon.16, Hdt.2.40,86, Luc.Syr.D.20.

*qu^w/nh, h(, (qu/w B) epith. of Semele, h.Hom.1.21, Sapph.Supp. 6.10, Pi.P.3.99, D.S.3.62, etc.:—Adj. *quwnai=os *dio/nusos Opp.C. 1.27. qu^w/nh, Dor. qu^/-a_, h(,
portion of sacrifice, acc. pl. -as
Abh. Berl.Akad. 1928(6).12 (Cos); cf. Hsch. s.v. qu/anon.
qu^wr-ei=sqai: quwqei=sqai, eu)wxei=sqai, Hsch.

qu^wr-i/s (sc. tra/peza), i/dos, h(,
a table for offerings, Poll.4.123; cf. quwro/s.

qu^wr-i/ths: trapezi/ths, Hsch.: metaph., q. ka/llous
an examiner of beauty, of Paris, Lyc.93; expld. by a)rgurognw/mwn, EM457.50.

qu^wr-o/s, o/n, (qu/os)
taking care of offerings: as Subst. (sc. tra/peza),= quwri/s, Call.Dian.134, BCH 11.161 (Lagina); oi( qeoi\ th\n tra/pezan quwro\n kalou=sin Pherecyd.Syr. 12. (qu/os)
perfumer, Nic.Th.103.
qw/, o(, apocop. for qw/rac, AP6.85 (Pall.).

qwa/zw, Elean qwa/ddw, (qwh/)
pay the penalty, boi/+ Schwyzer 412.1 (Elis): qwa/w,
penalize, fine, IG12.4.7,12:—Delph. qwe/w Michel995 D19:—Cret. qwai/w GDI4977 (Gortyn):—Pass., diplei/w| qwih/stw (imper.), IG9(1).333.9 (Locr., v B.C.).

qwh/, h(,
penalty, qwh\n e)piqh/somen Od.2.192; qwh\n a)le/einen *)axaiw=n a
penalty imposed by them, Il.13.669:—Att. qwa/, h(, IG12.114.42:— Ion. also qwi+h/ Archil.109, BCH50.214 (Thasos, V B.C.), prob. l. in Democr.262: qwiih/, SIG58.12(Milet., V B.C.): Att. gen. pl. qw|w=n with i acc. to Choerob.in Theod.1.405, but v. supr. and cf. qwa/w. (I.-E.
dhō-, in OE.
dóm 'doom', cf.
dhē- in ti/qhmi.)

qwi/asis, ews, h(,
infliction of penalty, Michel995D 23 (Delph.).

qwke/w, Ion. and Dor. for qa_ke/w. qwki/zw,
establish, settle, Hsch. qw=kos, Ion. for qa=kos. qw=ma, qwma/zw, qwma/sios, Ion. for qaum-, Hdt. qw=mai, v. qw=sqai.

qwmeu/w, (qwmo/s)
heap up, Hsch.

qwmi/zw (also qu^wr-i/ssw, Hsch.),
whip, scourge, nw=ton ma/stigi qwmixqei/s Anacr.21.10, cf. EM459.54:—also,
bind, Hsch., Suid.
qw/misson: to\n misqo/n, Hsch. (leg. qw)/misson: to\ h(/misson).

qwmo/s, o(,
heap, A.Ag.295, Ar.Lys.973, Thphr.HP8.11.4, AP6.299 (Phan.): metaph., q. yhfisma/twn Ar.Fr.217. (Like qhmw/n, fr. I.-E.
dhē-, ti/-qhmi.)

qwo/s, o(, a kind of
bird, Hsch.

qwp-ei/a, h(,
flattery, E.Or.670, Jul.Or.3.102c, etc.: pl., Ar.Eq. 890; qwpei=ai lo/gwn Pl.Lg.906b; q. kolakikai/ ib.633d.

qw/p-euma, atos, to/,
piece of flattery, Ar.V.563: in pl.,
endearments, E.Supp.1103;
flatteries, Pl.R.590c, Plu.2.823c:—Dim. qwp-euma/tia, ta/,
bits of flattery, Ar.Eq.788.

qwp-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
disposed to flatter, fuwning, of dogs, Arist.HA488b21; ta\ qwpeutika/
flattery, Pl.Lg.634a. Adv. qwp-kw=s D.C.69.6, Gal.14.600.

qwp-eu/w, (qw/y)
flatter, wheedle, tina S.OC 1003, 1336, E.Heracl.983, Ar.Ach.657, Eq.48; su\ tau=ta qw/peu'
be it thine to
flatter thus, S.El.397; q. to\n despo/thn lo/gw| Pl.Tht.173a; to\n dh=mon Aeschin.3.226; ta\s po/leis Phld.Rh.2.170S.; kairo\n q.
to be a time-
server, Ps.-Phoc.93; i(/na mh\ a)/llous qwpeu/wmen sou= u(giai/nontos
serve others (in good sense), PSI5.525.16 (iii B.C.); of dogs,
fawn, Arist.Phgn.811b38;
caress, pat a horse, X.Eq.10.13, Cyn.6.21; of disease,
soothe, th\n xolh/n Sever.Clyst.p.37 D.:—Pass., Ar. Eq.1116.
qwp-iko/s, h/, o/n, （qw/y） = qwpeutiko/s, Id.Lys.1037, Max.Tyr. 9.7. Adv. -kw=s Suid.
qw/p-tw,= qwpeu/w, c.acc., qw=pte to\n kratou=nt' a)ei/ A.Pr.937: fut. qw/yeis Id.Fr.234.

qwra_k-ei=on, to/,= qwra/kion 11,
breastwork, parapet, or
dwarf-wall of an enclosure, A.Th.32, IG22.463.86, IGRom.4.293ai39 (Pergam., ii B.C.), 1465,1474 (Smyrna), D.S.17.44 (v.l. -i/ois); the
breast-high part of a wall-surface, i(/na grafh=| . . q. o)roboeide/s PCair.Zen.445 (iii B.C.).
gunwale of a trireme, IG22.1604.31.
cuirass, PCair. Zen.14.12 (iii B.C.).

qwra_k-i/zw, prose form of qwrh/ssw,
arm with a breastplate or
corslet, qwraki/sas au)tou\s kai\ i(/ppous X.Cyr.8.8.22:—Med.,
put on one's breastplate, Id.An.2.2.14:—Pass., qwrakisqei/s ib.3.4.35; teqwrakisme/noi
cuirassiers, Th.2.100, X.An.2.5.35; a)/galma teq. OGI332.7 (Elaea, ii B.C.). generally,
cover with defensive armour, tou\s h(nio/xous e)qwra/kise plh\n tw=n o)fqalmw=n X.Cyr.6.1.29; o)/gkw| . . xlani/dos eu)= teqwrakisme/nos Ephipp.14.10: metaph., q. e(autou/s, of wild boars,
to sheathe themselves
in mud, preparatory to fighting, Arist. HA571b16; of the ichneumon, qwrakisqei\s phlw=| Str.17.1.39.

qwra_k-iko/s, h/, o/n
suffering in the chest, Aët.8.63. -ika/, ta/, with or without mo/ria,
region of the thorax, Pall.in Hp.2.97, 102 D.
qwra_k-i/s, = qw/rac, Gloss.

qwra_k-ismo/s, o(,
arming with breastplates, LXX 2 Ma.5.3.

qwra_k-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
soldier with breast-armour only, Plb.10.29.6, al.:—fem. qwra_k-i=tis, as Adj., zw/nh
cuirass-belt, prob. in PPetr.3p.12 (iii B.C.).

qwra_ko-eidh/s, e/s,
breastplate-shaped, u(/fasma Ph.2.226.

qwra_ko-zw/nh, h(,
cuirass-belt, Sch.Il.11.234.

qwra_ko-poio/s, o(,
maker of breastplates, X. Mem.3.10.9, IG22.1261.3, PTeb.278i8 (i A.D.).

qwra_ko-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in breastplates, Ar.Pax in Ind. personarum.
qwra_ko-fo/ros, Ion.

qwrhk-, on,
wearing a breastplate, cuirassier, Hdt.7.89,92, 8.113, X. Cyr.5.3.36, Jul.Or.2.63c; to\ q. D.C.47.43.

qw/rac, a_kos, Ep. and Ion. qw/rhc, hkos, Aeol. qo/rrac Alc.15 (codd. Ath.), o(:—
corslet, q. xa/lkeos Il.23.560; panai/olos 11.374; poludai/dalos 4.136, cf. 11.19, etc.; deka/mnoun qw/rhkos ku/tos Ar.Pax1224; e)/caire pai= qw/raka . . to\n xoa= Id.Ach.1133; q . . . gua/loisin a)rhrw/s Il.15.529 (gu/ala expld. as front- and back-piece fastened with pero/nai, Paus.10.26.5); qw/rhkos gu/alon Il.5.99; o(/qi diplo/os h)/nteto q. 4.133; kata\ zw/nhn qw/rhkos e)/nerqe 11.234; linen
jerkin (not worn by Homeric Greeks acc. to Sch.Il.2.529, but cf. linoqw/rhc）, qo/rrakes ne/w li/nw Alc. l.c., cf. Hdt.2.182, 3.47, Chron.Lind.C.36, Paus.6.19.7.
coat of mail, scale armour, q. xru/seos lepidwto/s Hdt.9.22, cf. 74; folidwto/s Posidipp.26.7, cf. Paus.1.21.6; of chain mail, v. a(lusidwto/s.
slough of a serpent, kaqa/per o)/fis palaio\n a)podu/etai q. Porph.Chr.88.
part covered by the qw/rac 1,
trunk, Hp.de Arte10, E.HF1095, Arist.HA493a5; kefalh=s kai\ qw/rakos kai\ th=s ka/tw koili/as Id.Pr.962a34; sts. taken as extending below the midriff, Pl.Ti.69e; a)p' au)xe/nos me/xri ai)doi/wn Arist.HA491a30, cf. PA686b5, e)n tw=| ka/tw qw/rakos xwri/w|, of the abdominal cavity, Gal.16.448; but also of the
chest, thorax, Arist.HA493a17:—there is a play on signfs. 1 and 11 in Ar.V.1194 sq.
thorax of crustaceans, Arist. HA601a13, al.
bandage for the chest, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.48 tit., Sor.Fasc.33, cf. Gal.18(1).817. = qwra/kion 11, Hdt.1.181, D.C.74.10.
qwrhkofo/ros, on, Ion. for qwrakofo/ros.

qwrhkth/s, ou=, o(, (qwrh/ssw)
armed with q<*>/rac, *)argei/oisi qwrhkth=|si Il.21.429; *luki/wn, *trw/wn pu/ka qwrhkta/wn
armed with stout
cuirass, 12.317,15.689.
qw/rhc, hkos, o(, Ion. and Ep. for qw/rac.

qw/rhcis, ews, h(,
drinking to intoxication, Hp.Aph.2.21, 7.48, Gal. 17(2).498, 18(1).154, Aret.SD2.6: pl., Hp.Morb.2.66.

qwrh/ssw, Ep. aor. qw/rhca, subj. qwrh/comen (for -wmen) Il.2.72:—
arm with a qw/rac: generally,
arm, qwrh=cai/ e( ke/leue . . *)axaiou/s Il. 2.11; *murmido/nas . . qw/rhcen *)axilleu/s 16.155:—more freq. in Med. and Pass., qwrh/ssomai, fut. -comai: aor. e)qwrh/xqhn:—
arm oneself, put one's harness on, au)ti/ka qwrh/ssonto Il.19.352; su\n teu/xesi qwrhxqe/ntes 8.530, etc.; e)s po/lemon a(/ma law=| qwrhxqh=nai 1.226; teu/xe' e)nei/kw qwrhxqh=nai I will bring you arms
to arm yourselves withal, Od.22.139; e)qwrh/ssonto de\ xalkw=| 23.369; e)n tw=|de (sc. qw/raki） pro\s tou\s polemi/ous qwrh/comai Ar.Ach.1134; to which Dicaeopolis replies, e)n tw=|de (sc. xoi\+） pro\s tou\s sumpo/tas q., with reference to signf. 11.
fortify with drink, Hp.Epid.2.5.10; potw=| fre/na qwrhxqe/ntes Nic.Al. 32; teqwrhgme/nos Ruf. ap. Orib.6.38.23;
make drunk, intoxicate, Thgn.842:—Med. and Pass.,
get drunk, oi)/nw| Id.470: abs., Id.413, Pi.Fr.72; qwrhxqei\s u(po\ oi)/nou Hp.Morb.4.56, cf. Duris 27 J. Med. in causal sense, to\n me\n . . ne/ktari qwrh/caio Nic.Al.225.

qw/s, qwo/s, o(, also h(, prob.
jackal, Canis aureus, *trw=es e(/ponq' w(s ei)/ te dafoinoi\ qw=es . . a)mf' e)/lafon Il.11.474, cf. Arist.HA610a14, 630a9; qw/wn pardali/wn te lu/kwn t' h)/i+a Il.13.103; q. kai\ pa/nqhres Hdt.4.192; e)/xei o( q. pa/nta ta\ e)nto\s o(/moia lu/kw| Arist.HA507b17; a large kind in India, Arr.Ind.15.3: pl., qw/antes IG14.1302 (mosaic at Praeneste).
hunting dog, Lycaon pictus, Opp.C.3.338, al.
panther, Cyr.

qw=sqai, = dai/nusqai, eu)wxei=sqai (Dor.), A.Fr.49, EM461.1; cf. qw=tai: eu)qhnei=tai, qoina=tai, and qw=ntai: qoinw=ntai ktl., Hsch.: fut. qwsou/meqa Epich.139: aor. 1 inf. qw/sasqai: eu)wxhqh=nai, Hsch.:— Pass., qwqh=nai: fagei=n, geu/sasqai, Id.
*qw/ssw, = qwrh/ssw 11, aor. 1 qw=cai, Dor. qa=cai Hsch.: aor. Pass. part. qwxqei/s S.Fr.173, Dor. inf. qaxqh=men Hsch.
qwsth/rion, to/,= eu)wxhth/rion, e(orth/, Alcm.23.81, Hsch. (pl.).
qwta/zw, = twqa/zw, Hsch.

qwu+kth/r, h=ros, o(,
barker, roarer, APl.4.91.
qwu=ma, qwuma/zw, etc., less correct forms for qw=ma, qwma/zw, v. qaum-.

qwu/+ssw, of a dog,
bark, bay, Hom.Fr.25; of a gnat,
buzz, A.Ag. 893: generally,
cry aloud, shout, S.Aj.308, E.Tr.153 (anap.), Or. 168 (lyr.): c. acc. cogn., to/nd' e)qw/u+cas lo/gon A.Pr.395; ta/sd' a)ggeli/as e)qw/u+cen ib.1041 (anap.); th/nde qwu/+ssei boh/n S.Aj.335. c. acc. pers.,
call on, call, fqe/gma . . tino\s qw/u+cen au)to/n Id.OC1624: c. dat., q. kusi/
shout to dogs, E.Hipp.219 (anap.), cf.Ba.871 (lyr.).
lament, bewail, dub. in IG12(3).9 (Syme).

qw/y, gen. qwpo/s, o(,
flatterer, false friend, Hdt.3.80; q. plou/tou Antipho Soph.65, cf. Them.Or.20.237d. as Adj., qw=pes lo/goi
fawning speeches, Trag.Adesp.24, Pl.Tht.175e, Ph.2.52 (cf. te/-qhpa, qa/mbos).
